Culbertson Sr. of Topsfield, Mass. The Rev. Alice King, a Unitarian Universalist minister, officiated at Woodlawn, a historic home in Alexandria, Va.

title: Lexie Komisar, Jonathan Kurland
description: Alexandra Komisar and Jonathan Kurland were married June 3 at the Weylin, an event space in the former Williamsburg Savings Bank building in Brooklyn. Rabbi Ammiel Hirsch officiated.

title: Nathalia Londono, Justin Rodriguez
description: Nathalia Londono and Justin Victor Rodriguez were married May 30 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Angel L. Lopez, a staff member in the New York City Clerks Office, officiated.

title: Megha Patel, Shamil Kotecha
description: Megha Chandresh Patel, the daughter of Bhavana C. Patel and Chandresh J. Patel of Newtown, Pa., was married June 2 to Shamil Pratap Kotecha, the son of Daxa Kotecha and Pratap G. Kotecha of Royal Palm Beach, Fla. Pandit Prabhakar Sharma, a Hindu priest, officiated at Cipriani 42nd Street in New York.

title: Lisa Jiang, Tristan Smith
description: Lisa Jiang and Tristan Gracey Smith were married June 2 at the Storm King Art Center in New Windsor, N.Y. Dana Smith, the sister of the groom, who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: London Attacked Again: Pictures From the Scene
description: London was stunned Saturday night by attacks that killed seven people  in the center of the capital. A van ran down pedestrians on London Bridge, then continued to nearby Borough Market, where three attackers emerged and began stabbing people, the police said. Armed officers responded and killed the assailants, who were wearing fake explosive vests, the police said.

title: While Nashville Parties, the Predators Cut Loose
description: NASHVILLE  The denizens of Smashville donned gold boas and gold caps and gold T-shirts that said Hockey-Tonk and sauntered down Lower Broadway. Men with I Need Tickets signs around their necks meandered through bachelorette parties quaffing from plastic cups and taking selfies outside Bridgestone Arena, where a junked car adorned with the Pittsburgh Penguins logo awaited sledgehammering. Families toting camping chairs weaved through the crowd, staking out territory for the Alan Jackson concert, or the Game 3 viewing party, or both.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Megyn Kelly Moves to NBC, and The Leftovers Ends
description: Megyn Kelly, who left Fox News two weeks before the inauguration of President Trump, settles into the anchor seat of her new NBC show. The Leftovers ends its run  and leaves questions unanswered. And some cut-ups try to crack the 1970s comedy scene.

title: Right and Left React to the Paris Climate Agreement News
description: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. Thats why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.

title: Manila Casino Attacker Was a Gambling Addict, the Philippine Police Say
description: MANILA  The man who set fire to a Manila casino last week, killing 37 people, was not a terrorist but a heavy gambler who was deep in debt and had lost his job, the police and relatives of the man said Sunday.

title: After London Attack, Prime Minister Says, Enough Is Enough
description: LONDON  Declaring enough is enough, Prime Minister Theresa May vowed on Sunday to conduct a sweeping review of Britains counterterrorism strategy after three knife-wielding assailants unleashed an assault late Saturday night, the third major terrorist attack in the country in three months.

title: Making a Living by Jumping Off a Cliff
description: On sea cliffs in Lima, Peru, Fernando Canchari Vsquez jumps into the Pacific Ocean to solicit money, and support his family. He dresses up as a friar to embody a local legend and entertain tourists.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $600,000
description: 1300 Hudson Street, No. 5B, Hoboken

title: Rwandas Soccer Sisterhood
description: Gloria Nibagwire, 22, is one of Rwandas best soccer players. She is part of a group of women who have used the sport to reclaim their lives and re-establish a sense of community two decades on from genocide.

title: Watch the Veuve Clicquot Polo Classic
description: Liberty State Park, N.J.  On June 3, 2017, Veuve Clicquot celebrated the 10th Anniversary of the Polo Classic.

title: London, Trump, Paris: Your Weekend Briefing
Prime Minister Theresa May's Statement
description: The British leader vowed a sweeping review of the nations counterterrorism strategy after the late-night assault, the third in less than three months.

title: Trumps Off-the-Cuff Tweets Strain Foreign Ties
description: WASHINGTON  On one level, President Trump reacted to Saturday nights terrorist attack in London much as his predecessors might have. He expressed solidarity and telephoned Britains prime minister to offer condolences. WE ARE WITH YOU, he wrote to Britons.

title: The Empathetic Dog
description: Benjamin Stepp, an Iraq war veteran, sat in his graduate school course trying to focus on the lecture. Neither his classmates nor his professor knew he was silently seething.

title: All Our Best Advice on Deciding Whether to Rent or Buy a Home
description: For more personal finance tips, sign up for the Your Money newsletter here.

title: New York Police Officer in Critical Condition After Being Dragged by Car
description: A police officer was in critical condition Sunday morning after being dragged by a car for more than two blocks while responding to a report of shots fired in Brooklyn, the authorities said.

title: Upsets Mean French Open Womens Trophy Will Be Hoisted Over a First-Timer
description: PARIS  With the four remaining Grand Slam winners all falling in their fourth-round matches Sunday at the French Open, there will be a new womens major champion crowned Saturday at Roland Garros.

title: Benjy Melendezs Legacy: Peace and Hope in the Bronx
description: Benjamin Melendez arrived in New York from Puerto Rico as an 8-year-old at the dawn of the tumultuous 1960s. He came of age in the South Bronx, where by decades end he helped start the Ghetto Brothers, one of the many street gangs that arose amid the boroughs devastation. It was also where his father, Juan, ran two bodegas and never turned away anyone who was hungry, but broke. Benjy, as he preferred to be called, took notice.

title: The Triumph of Wonder Woman
description: The box office has made its ruling, and the verdict is clear. You cant keep a wonderful woman down.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Jean Sammet, Co-Designer of a Pioneering Computer Language, Dies at 89
description: Jean E. Sammet, an early software engineer and a designer of COBOL, a programming language that brought computing into the business mainstream, died on May 20 in Maryland. She was 89.

title: Embracing Whats Natural
description: This week were turning over the Race/Related newsletter to participants in The New York Times Student Journalism Institute.

title: From the Cradle of Innovation Comes a Self-Driving Team
description: The Golden State Warriors are the N.B.A.s driverless car.

title: Jimmy Piersall, Whose Mental Illness Was Portrayed in Fear Strikes Out, Dies at 87
description: Jimmy Piersall, the often outrageous outfielder and broadcaster whose emotional breakdown while a rookie with the Boston Red Sox was portrayed in the 1957 movie Fear Strikes Out, a rare glimpse, for its time, at an athletes mental illness, died on Saturday in Wheaton, Ill. He was 87.

title: New York Police Officer in Critical Condition After Being Dragged by Car
description: A New York City police officer was fighting for his life after he was injured late Saturday when he was dragged by a stolen car in Brooklyn, Mayor Bill de Blasio said on Sunday.

title: Portland Killings Dredge Up Legacy of Racist Laws in Oregon
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  The fatal stabbing of two good Samaritans who intervened when a man on a commuter train shouted slurs at two women  both African-American, one in Muslim dress  has reawakened bitter memories of this states past and revived a debate over what people here call the two Oregons, where islands of tolerance abut places awash in frustration and rage.

title: Chinese City With a Russian Past Struggles to Preserve Its Legacy
description: HARBIN, China  When he first arrived in the northeastern Chinese city of Harbin in 1984 to attend university, Bu Chong was stunned to see an imposing, European-style building on campus with tall columns, arched doors and elaborate reliefs. Im from the countryside, he said, and Id never seen anything like this.

title: A Second Hamptons Art Fair Is Canceled
description: Art Southampton has canceled its 2017 season, becoming the second major fine arts fair on the East End of Long Island to suspend programming for the coming season. Art Hamptons, the regions first art fair, canceled its season in February, leaving the once growing Hamptons market with one fair, Market Art + Design.

title: Warship Named for Giffords Is Close to Being Ready for Sea
description: WASHINGTON  In January 2012, Representative Gabrielle Giffords, Democrat of Arizona, decided to resign her seat, a sad coda to the assassination attempt she had miraculously survived, but which left her badly disabled.

title: Turning Against Trump: How the Chinese Covered the Climate Pact Exit
description: BEIJING  President Trumps decision to withdraw the United States from the Paris climate change accord drew criticism from leaders around the world. In China, the government seized the moment to cast doubt on American democracy and promote an image of China as a responsible superpower. Heres how the state-controlled news media covered Mr. Trumps decision and what the portrayal suggests about Chinas efforts to extend influence across the globe.

title: Celebrities Flock to Warriors. And Were Talking About Practice.
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  It is basketball by invitation only, and if you are lucky enough to receive one, you get to watch Stephen Curry and Klay Thompson hoist 3-pointers or gawk as Kevin Durant extends his impossibly long frame and soars to the basket. You also get to take in the rest of the Golden State Warriors, the most dazzling team in the N.B.A.

title: What to Expect as Bill Cosbys Sex Assault Trial Begins
description: Read live updates of Day 4 of the Bill Cosby trial.

title: National Politics Hang Over Tuesdays New Jersey Primary
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  The African-American heritage parade on Saturday here drew to a momentary standstill. Philip D. Murphy, a Democratic candidate for governor, was darting back and forth across the street, responding to endless calls for handshakes, hugs and selfies.

title: Pamplona Is Canceled After Stacy Keach Falls Ill
description: The Goodman Theater in Chicago will cancel the remaining performances of Pamplona, a world-premiere play by Jim McGrath starring the veteran actor Stacy Keach as Ernest Hemingway.

title: Filipinos Flee Dutertes Violent Drug Crackdown
description: MANILA  Every morning before dawn, Rosario Perez checks to make sure her sons are still alive. The three brothers, all in their 20s, sleep at the houses of friends and relatives, moving regularly, hoping that whoever may have been assigned to kill them wont catch up with them.

title: Mary Barra on Engineering
description: It gives you a great foundation for continues learning, Ms Barra says.

title: Mary Barra on Need for Technology Backgrounds
description: Technology is impacting every part of our business, Ms. Barra says.

title: Sugar Talks May Hint at Trump Approach to U.S.-Mexico Trade
description: MEXICO CITY  The sugar barons of Florida, Alfonso and Jos Fanjul, have been equal-opportunity political donors for decades, showering largess on the campaigns of Democrats and Republicans alike to ensure that lawmakers will protect the American sugar industry.

title: A Very British Response to Terror
description: LONDON  The first thing that popped up on my Twitter feed in the aftermath of the terror attack in London on Saturday night was a photo of the evacuation.

title: Outcry Over EpiPen Prices Hasnt Made Them Lower
description: A few weeks ago, after some particularly incompetent parenting on my part (nuts in the dessert, a rushed trip to an emergency room after my childs allergic reaction), I visited the local pharmacy to fill an EpiPen prescription.

title: London, Narendra Modi, James Mattis: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Ariana Grande Brings Message of Defiance to Concert for Manchester Victims
description: GREATER MANCHESTER, England  The message onstage and in the crowd at One Love Manchester, a benefit concert for victims of the Manchester attack that was hosted by the pop star Ariana Grande, was one of defiance.

title: From Maine, a Call for a More Measured Take on Health Care
description: BANGOR, Me.  Hundreds of miles from the health care debate that will begin again this week in Congress, lobstermen here are out in force, bees are furiously pollinating the states famous blueberries and part-time workers are preparing for another summer tourist season.

title: 16 Years Later, Bushs Climate Pact Exit Holds Lessons for Trump
description: WASHINGTON  The new president decided that the international climate change agreement negotiated by his predecessor was a job killer that sacrificed American sovereignty. So he pulled the United States out while much of the world jeered.

title: Against Terror, Is London Pride Enough?
description: LONDON  One of the most tweeted pictures from last nights terror attack on London Bridge shows a group of people running away from the scene of the killings. The runners are led by a man who is carefully balancing a half-full beer glass in his hand, as if even the threat of sudden, savage death isnt reason enough to part a Brit from the pleasure of his pint.

title: Gaza Dating Site Matches Widows to Men Seeking 2nd (or 3rd) Wife
description: GAZA CITY  He was looking for a woman with particular attributes, hopefully a widow of a man killed in the struggle against Israel, without children, between 25 and 30, from southern Gaza. Her requirement was no less important: She was looking for a married man.

title: India, Pakistan and Something Deeper Than Cricket
description: BIRMINGHAM, England  Any spare tickets for sale?

title: New Life for a 125-Year-Old Literary Journal
description: Adam Ross was more than 100 pages into a new novel about a child actor in 1970s New York when a rare opportunity came up. The Sewanee Review, a 125-year-old literary journal that published some of the 20th centurys greatest American writers, was seeking a new editor.

title: Review: Boris Eifman, the Sensationalist of Russian Ballet
description: Did the choreographer Boris Eifman watch too many Ken Russell movies at a formative age? As Russell was, Mr. Eifman is drawn to tales of trauma and martyrdom in period costumes. His protagonists tend to be women or artists or both  the sculptor Camille Claudel, the composer Tchaikovsky, the ballerinas Olga Spessivtseva and Tanaquil Le Clercq, and (not artists but ah, what sufferers) good old Tatiana and Anna Karenina from the classics of Russian literature. Mr. Eifman dramatizes their miseries and throws in splashes of historical color amid the anguish.

title: Review: Tom Z Brings Brazilian Songs With Breezy Tunes and Sly Jokes to BAM
description: The comedy began when Tom Z strolled onstage at the Brooklyn Academy of Music on Saturday night, an elfin figure dressed in a white shirt and blue-jean overalls. Finally, I am here, said Mr. Z, a Brazilian songwriter who last performed in New York City in 2011.

title: Wonder Woman Deflects Doubt to Win Battle at the Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES  Patty Jenkins and Wonder Woman just broke Hollywoods superhero glass ceiling.

title: What Was Bill Mahers Big Mistake?
description: I know what he meant. Lots of people know what he meant. Nonetheless, the thing about some jokes is that theyre open to interpretation, and the interpretation isnt up to him.

title: Review: If Youre Not in the Obit, Eat Breakfast Finds Vigor After 90
description: In this era full of baby boomers caring for frail parents, weve seen plenty of documentaries, plays and memoirs about dementia, infirmity, loss. But in the HBO documentary If Youre Not in the Obit, Eat Breakfast, Carl Reiner and friends take up another side of the phenomenon of longer life spans: the many people in their later years who are still sharp and vigorous and engaged.

title: G.M. Wants to Drive the Future of Cars That Drive Themselves
description: DETROIT  The chief executive of General Motors, an automaker synonymous with Detroit, saw the future of driving not in the Motor City but on the streets of San Francisco.

title: Bad Thing to Blow
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  For a Monday puzzle, Paul Coulters New York Times Crossword debut packed quite an Aha! moment for me. I didnt immediately recognize what the circled squares were meant to be, but it was a pleasant surprise when the theme drove itself into my brain.

title: 10,000 New Yorkers. 2 Decades. A Data Trove About Everything.
description: Your phone, in all likelihood, knows more about you than your doctor. Your credit card company knows your likes and dislikes better than your closest friend. Google knows your thoughts, and even completes your sentences. Your telephone service provider knows where you are at all times. Facebook, for many, knows more than the rest combined.

title: Cambodias Buddhist Monks Find a Second Calling: Political Correspondent
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia  Wearing an orange robe and speaking calmly into his smartphone, the Venerable Luon Sovath eased his way through the throngs of people gathered outside Polling Station 867 in Phnom Penh, the Cambodian capital.

title: The Digital Bystander
description: Live-streaming apps like Facebook Live and Periscope give us a voyeuristic peek into the lives of others. But what is our obligation when we encounter digital violence?

title: What the Kitty Genovese Killing Can Teach Todays Digital Bystanders
description: The rape itself was horrific enough. In March, half a dozen boys and young men lured a 15-year-old girl to a house in Chicago and sexually assaulted her there, brutally and repeatedly. But what made this episode singularly appalling was the attackers streaming their crime on Facebook Live. From a count posted with the video, investigators deduced that about 40 people watched in real time. Yet not one of the viewers bothered to summon the authorities.

title: Steve Kerr Returns to Coach Warriors in Game 2 of the N.B.A. Finals
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  After a six-week absence, Steve Kerr, the coach of the Golden State Warriors, was back on the bench at Oracle Arena on Sunday for Game 2 of the N.B.A. finals. When his face appeared on the arenas giant video boards a few minutes before the opening tipoff, the crowd stood and roared.

title: Ad Campaigns Tag Along as Men Embrace Different Paths
description: It wasnt that long ago that commercials for the body spray Axe spoke to a certain type of male fantasy: Guys used the product and women who looked like supermodels flocked to them.

title: Ballet Dancer Leaps Onto Subway Tracks and Lifts Man to Safety
description: After a 58-year-old man fell onto subway tracks Saturday night in Manhattan, a ballet dancer, who had just watched his wife perform with American Ballet Theater at the Metropolitan Opera House, leapt down after him. With a lift that they do not teach in dance school, he moved him to safety.

title: Another Terrorist Attack, and More Agony, in Britain
description: These are trying times for Britain. Two grotesque terror attacks within two weeks. An important and unexpectedly close election Thursday on how to exit Europe. The issues involved  stopping terrorism without sacrificing democratic values, ending a long relationship with the least damage to both sides  would be enough for any nation, much less one as emotionally battered as this one.

title: Climate Science Meets a Stubborn Obstacle: Students
description: WELLSTON, Ohio  To Gwen Beatty, a junior at the high school in this proud, struggling, Trump-supporting town, the new science teachers lessons on climate change seemed explicitly designed to provoke her.

title: Wonder Woman Could Be the Superhero Women in Hollywood Need
description: Something huge happened at the box office over the weekend.

title: Wendell Burton, Actor and Megachurch Minister, Dies at 69
description: Wendell Burton, whose promising Hollywood career began with a starring role opposite Liza Minnelli in the 1969 film The Sterile Cuckoo but fizzled before he turned to ministerial work for the megachurch preacher Joel Osteen, died on Tuesday in Houston. He was 69.

title: Trump, Who Pledged to Overhaul Nuclear Arsenal, Now Faces Increased Costs
description: WASHINGTON  When President Barack Obamas term ended in January, he left a momentous decision to the Trump administration: whether to continue a 30-year, $1 trillion program to remake Americas atomic weapons, as well as its bombers, submarines and land-based missiles.

title: Oculus Founder Plots a Comeback With a Virtual Border Wall
description: Palmer Freeman Luckey was the kind of wunderkind Silicon Valley venerates. When he was just 21, he made an overnight fortune selling his start-up, a company called Oculus VR that made virtual-reality gear, to Facebook for $2 billion in 2014.

title: Inner Peace Gets a Test
description: Dear Diary:

title: Question in Battle Over Diller Island: Which Billionaire Blinks First?
description: The billionaire slugfest over a planned $250 million performance center on a new pier in the Hudson River in Manhattan continues unabated.

title: Justin Smoak Gets Latest Word in Rivalry With Yanks Luis Severino
description: TORONTO  The last time Yankees pitcher Luis Severino faced Toronto first baseman Justin Smoak under the Rogers Centre roof, Severino delivered a message: a blistering fastball to Smoaks thigh that set off a bench-clearing fracas late last September.

title: Terrorist Attacks in Britain: A Short History
description: The attack that killed seven people on Saturday in London was the third act of terrorism in Britain in the past three months. But the country has long struggled against terrorism and political violence within its borders. Here is a brief history of fatal terrorist attacks in Britain in recent years.

title: Sinclair Broadcasting Said to Be in Talks With Ex-Sony TV Chief Steve Mosko
description: LOS ANGELES  Now that Sinclair Broadcast Group has reached a deal to acquire Tribune Media and create a local television giant with 223 stations, it is talking to one of Hollywoods most seasoned small-screen executives about joining the company to expand its programming.

title: Rebuking Congress, Cuomo Plans to Keep State Health Care Plans Intact
description: ALBANY  Striking pre-emptively at an increasingly frequent foil, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo plans to announce a series of steps on Monday to safeguard insurance coverage against a possible repeal of all or parts of the Affordable Care Act in Washington.

title: In Rout by Pirates, Even Seventh-Inning Stretch Goes Badly for Mets
description: The most compelling moment of the Mets sloppy 11-1 loss to the Pittsburgh Pirates on Sunday occurred with the outcome of the game nearly decided. In an odd way, it exemplified the Mets topsy-turvy season.

title: Bank at Center of U.S. Inquiry Projects Russian Soft Power
description: It has offices in a sleek Manhattan skyscraper. Its bonds are accessible to millions of American investors. And it holds ties to some of New Yorks biggest banks.

title: In Mexican Election, Governing Party Is Poised for a Narrow Win
description: TOLUCA, Mexico  The candidate from Mexicos governing party appeared to be heading toward an extremely narrow victory in the fiercely fought election for governor of the countrys most populous state, electoral officials said late Sunday, citing early official returns.

title: In Its Series Finale, The Leftovers Crosses Beautifully to the Other Side of Grief
description: The Leftovers cycled through several theme songs in its final season. In its wonderful series finale, The Book of Nora, it returned to Let the Mystery Be, by Iris DeMent, whose lyrics begin:

title: The Leftovers Series Finale Recap: Over There
description: The showrunner for The Leftovers, Damon Lindelof, has never made any secret of his intention to baffle. Before the first season debuted, he said hed follow the lead of the titular novel by Tom Perrotta and wouldnt explain why or how 140 million people disappeared from Earth in what came to be known as the Sudden Departure. But the very fact of the event established a supernatural backdrop to this drama. And as the man who helped bring Lost into the world, Lindelof knows how to milk the fantastical for every spine-tingling, pulse-pounding moment ... even if his ultimate goal is to keep our feet firmly planted on the ground.

title: Damon Lindelof on the Leftovers Finale, Mark Linn-Baker and Preserving the Mystery
description: Its been seven years since Lost departed from television, but its co-creator Damon Lindelof knows that many people will still assess Sundays conclusion of The Leftovers through the prism of his most famous project, which disappointed some fans with its ending.

title: Warriors Handily Defeat the Cavaliers in Game 2
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  If welcoming back Steve Kerr, their ailing coach, were not enough to inspire the Golden State Warriors on Sunday night, Klay Thompson timed the return of his missing shooting touch for the occasion of a 132-113 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers and a two-games-to-none lead in the N.B.A. finals.

title: On Mosuls Front Line: A Grueling Battle on Civilian Streets
description: MOSUL, Iraq  The Islamic States grip on Mosul has shrunk to a tighter circle of neighborhoods in the western part of the city. But many civilians are still trapped in those areas, and the militants are giving no ground easily.

title: Drug Deaths in America Are Rising Faster Than Ever
description: New data compiled from hundreds of health agencies reveals the extent of the drug overdose epidemic last year. Our estimates show deaths rising faster than ever  up about 19 percent in 2016, and all evidence suggests they will rise again in 2017.

title: London, Ariana Grande, Juventus: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Whats on TV Monday: The Bachelorette and If Youre Not in the Obit, Eat Breakfast
description: Rachel Lindsay continues her quest to ride off in the sunset on The Bachelorette. Carl Reiner talks with some nonagenarians about the secret to longevity. And TCM devotes Mondays in June to Audrey Hepburn.

title: Twin Peaks Season 3, Episode 5 Recap: Vegas Baby
description: Its hard to say exactly why Showtime made four hours of Twin Peaks available online two weeks ago and then made us wait so long to see more, but the networks strategy may have benefited the series fifth chapter, which is by far the most disconnected to date. By now, anyone who cares about Twin Peaks has had time to digest the mysteries, absurdities, and brain-busting oddities of parts one through four, which may make the heres a bunch of new scenes approach of this weeks episode easier to process.

title: Looking Like the Enemy: The Color Gold Saturates the N.B.A. and N.H.L. Finals
description: NASHVILLE  Fans attending Games 1 and 2 of the Stanley Cup finals in Pittsburgh received gold giveaway T-shirts. So did those attending Games 1 and 2 of the N.B.A. finals at the Golden State Warriors arena in Oakland, Calif. So did everyone who showed up in Nashville on Saturday for Game 3 of the N.H.L.s title showdown.

title: Black Soldiers Double War
description: A book documents the complex history of black soldiers, illuminating their triumphs and challenges.

title: Kick This Rock: Climate Change and Our Common Reality
description: The 18th-century critic, Samuel Johnson, once tried to refute the Irish philosopher George Berkeleys view that nothing is material by kicking a rock. Thus I refute him! he reportedly declared. For a long time, I thought this proved that Johnson should have kept to literary criticism and left philosophy to the professionals. Berkeleys view, after all, was that everything we perceive is an idea  rocks (and rock-kicking) sensations included.

title: Is There an Emerging Democratic Agenda?
description: While Donald Trump and his Congressional majority continue to push a harsh, hard-right ideology, so far theyve been a legislative failure. And for good reason: For years, all they did was oppose Barack Obama and the Democrats, without bothering to develop an actual governing agenda of their own. Democrats must not make the same mistake. Playing defense is necessary, but it is not sufficient.

title: Dorm Troopers: Life as a College Security Guard
description: Canterbury, England  A wallet soaked in urine with nothing inside except a drivers license from Bermuda. Thats probably the weirdest thing Ive had to file in the lost and found, the handling of which I help oversee as a security guard at Canterbury Christ Church University in England.

title: Undoing All the Good Work on Cuba
description: To the long list of Barack Obamas major initiatives that President Trump is obsessed with reversing, we may soon be able to add Cuba. In 2014, Mr. Obama opened a dialogue with Cuba after more than a half-century of unyielding hostility, leading to an easing of sanctions. Mr. Trump promised in his campaign to return to a more hard-line approach. If he does, as seems likely, he will further isolate America, hurt American business interests and, quite possibly, impede the push for greater democracy on the Caribbean island.

title: New York City Should Grade Buildings on Energy Efficiency
description: As President Trump retreats from his predecessors efforts to tackle climate change, it is more important than ever that our cities and states develop tools to reduce the greenhouse gas emissions responsible for the planets warming. In New York City, this means first and foremost cutting energy use in buildings, which accounts for over two-thirds of the citys emissions.

title: Uncompromising Music Survives on the Brooklyn Waterfront
description: There is so much new life and affluence crowding the Brooklyn waterfront that traditionalists like Mark Peskanov, the master violinist who runs the Bargemusic concerts of chamber music aboard a handsomely converted coal barge, hard by the Brooklyn Bridge, might be tempted to move. Which he has no intention of doing.

title: Trumps Incredible Shrinking America
description: My whole life I have taken for granted Americas leadership in the world. Americas might and majesty were cornerstones of international relations, cooperation and diplomacy. We were a beacon and balance to the world. America has been imperfect  sometimes disastrously so  but it always seemed to me bent toward the belief that America and the world could be made more perfect.

title: Making Ignorance Great Again
description: Donald Trump just took us out of the Paris climate accord for no good reason. I dont mean that his decision was wrong. I mean, literally, that he didnt offer any substantive justification for that decision. Oh, he threw around a few numbers about supposed job losses, but nobody believes that he knows or cares where those numbers came from. It was just what he felt like doing.

title: On the Other Side of Terrors Boom
description: The terror attack in London on Saturday night  the third in as many months, the second in as many weeks  demonstrated the persistence of the threat we face and the ease with which terrorists can carry out their schemes. Three men, with nothing more than a rental van, knives and fake bomb vests intended to keep both regular citizens and law enforcement at bay, killed at least seven and wounded a couple dozen more. This was a terrifying event for which ISIS has now claimed responsibility, but it was hardly a sophisticated act: a vehicle, some knives and ruthless determination.

title: Black Soldiers: Fighting Americas Enemies Abroad and Racism at Home
description: After visiting Fort Hood Army base in Texas, the journalist Ray Suarez observed that as much as it represented a separate military culture, with distinct rules and protocols, it was also a microcosm of the nation. One of the most attractive aspects of the people I met at Fort Hood was their very ordinariness, Mr. Suarez wrote in 2010. They are tall, short, men, women, rural, urban, skinny, buffed, chubby, provincial, worldly, with accents and life experience from every corner of the country.

title: 5 Arab Nations Move to Isolate Qatar, Putting the U.S. in a Bind
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  For years, the tiny, energy-rich country of Qatar has carved out a niche in the Arab world by trying to be everything to everyone. It housed an American military base and flooded the regions airwaves with its influential media, all while keeping close ties to Iran and a wide selection of Islamist movements.

title: Forced From Their Village by Violence
description: In northwest Central African Republic, an armed rebel group has burned villages to the ground, displacing thousands. Listen to the voices of those who fled the violence.

title: In Tears, First Trial Witness Says Cosby Drugged and Assaulted Her
description: Prosecutors, in opening remarks, said that Bill Cosbys own words would help convict the once-popular comedian and actor of drugging and sexually assaulting a Temple University employee at his nearby home in 2004.

title: For Undocumented Mom, Somewhere to Shelter, but Nowhere to Run
description: Ingrid Encalada Latorre, 33, spent the last six months living in a red brick Quaker meetinghouse in Denver, one of hundreds of religious communities in the United States offering refuge or other help to immigrants facing deportation. Supporters of these churches say they keep families together. Opponents say they harbor criminals at the expense of citizen parishioners who could use their aid.

title: Running With the Herd
description: It was already dark when the first vans full of Amish runners pulled into my driveway. Id tied up the donkeys right next to the parking spot, which was probably my second mistake. The first was thinking it would be fun to take our pet donkeys out for a moonlight run with Vella Shpringa, our local Amish running club.

If you live here, you can really see it, he says, referring to his neck of Louisiana. The bayou is so much more serene than a river: Its a tidal stream, it goes both ways.

description: Moon was having eating issues, familiar ones to many cat owners: He batted food out of his bowl before he would eat it. Some days he seemed terrified even to approach his feeding dish.

Teaching hospitals, affiliated with medical schools, are the training grounds for the next generation of physicians. They cost more. The debate is over whether their increased cost is accompanied by better patient outcomes.

title: Can Britain Really Do Much More to Tighten Security?
description: LONDON  British police and security services already have some of the most powerful surveillance laws in the world, with weak judicial oversight and little criticism on privacy issues from a public that generally trusts its government and Civil Service.

description: Five people at a business near Orlando, Fla., were fatally shot by a former employee who went through a warehouse singling out his victims before killing himself, the Orange County Sheriffs Department said on Monday.

Putin, Ms. Kelly didnt seem to be able to rile him into saying anything more than his usual party line.

title: At Least One London Assailant Was on Police Radar, Exposing Gaps
description: LONDON  Britain on Monday identified two of the three suspects in the weekends terrorist assault in London, including one who not only was well-known to the police but had a cameo in a television documentary on homegrown violent jihadists.

title: Divided by Victory, Israelis Still Grapple With 1967 War
description: JERUSALEM  The six days of the 1967 war were the most important  triumphant, even  in modern Israeli history. But after 50 years, Israel is still struggling with them.

description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court agreed on Monday to decide whether the government needs a warrant to obtain information from cellphone companies showing their customers locations.

description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court dealt North Carolina a setback on Monday in a voting rights case for the third time in recent weeks, affirming a decision that struck down many state legislative districts for relying too heavily on race.

description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

description: For a long time I could not bring myself to write about the British election. Trump-coddling, self-important, flip-flopping Theresa May, ensconced at 10 Downing Street without ever being elected prime minister, was going to sweep to her hard-Brexit victory and take the country down her little England rabbit hole.

description: Q. How can the famous English gardens grow so well with the cloud cover that always seems to be hanging over them?

title: The London Attack Victims: What We Know
description: LONDON  Here is what we know so far about the eight people killed in an attack in London on Saturday night, when three men in a van drove into pedestrians on London Bridge before stabbing several people in nearby Borough Market.

title: Bob Dylan Delivers His Nobel Prize Lecture, Just in Time
description: After Bob Dylan was named the winner of the Nobel Prize in Literature last October, the literary commentariat wrestled with a fundamental question: Can song lyrics be literature? For some, the thought carried an unkind implication: Does something from the galaxy of pop music belong anywhere near the almighty pantheon of Great Lit?

title: Street Style: Governors Ball
description: Music fans showed off their festival style in the rain and sun at the Governors Ball on Randalls Island this weekend.

title: How Cold Brew Changed the Coffee Business
description: Summer officially starts this year on June 21, but thats only the solstice, the day when the sun reaches its highest position in the sky. Down on street level, summer really begins on the first humid, sun-streaked day, when even the thought of sipping a hot cup of coffee is too much to bear. Its as if, just as birds know instinctively when to migrate, we wake up one bright morning and agree that its iced coffee season.

title: In London: We Wont Be Intimidated
description: To the Editor:

title: An Amaro From Galliano Makes Its American Debut
description: Galliano, the Italian liqueur in the tall, slender bottle, is best known as a sweet golden quaff with a glint of chartreuse. But there are variations, including Galliano Ristretto, infused with strong coffee, and an amaro, Galliano LAperitivo, which has been available in Europe since the fall. It has just been introduced in the United States, hitching onto a newfound appreciation of amaro drinks. It is ruby-colored, bittersweet and good in a Negroni or mixed with prosecco: $16.99 for 375 milliliters, drinkupny.com.

title: Ask the Sketch Guy: Should I Finally Buy Some Bitcoin?
description: Last week, I announced the beginning of a semiregular Ask the Sketch Guy service. Send me your questions, but not just any questions. I want to explore the deep, dark conversations that we dont hear on the financial pornography network, like how we feel about money and how money makes us feel.

title: Governor Struggles to Lead as Texas Republicans Splinter Into Factions
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  When he took office two years ago, Gov. Greg Abbott represented a series of firsts for Texas.

title: Bryson Tiller Earns His First No. 1 Album With True to Self
description: Another surprise release has debuted at the top of the Billboard album chart.

title: Modis Push for a Hindu Revival Imperils Indias Meat Industry
description: MEERUT, India  When Uttar Pradeshs state government began a crackdown on unlicensed slaughterhouses in March, Sanjay Chaturvedi, a local veterinary inspector, celebrated. For years, Mr. Chaturvedi said, the government had protected the lucrative, predominantly Muslim-owned buffalo meat business, making it difficult for him to enforce environmental codes.

title: Satay Bar Opens at Gansevoort Market
description: A signature dish at the Chinese restaurants Jue Lan Club, Mr. Chow and Philippe is a satay skewer, usually chicken, served with a creamy peanut sauce. The chicken is a bright neon-orange. These satays are now in the spotlight at a new stand in the Gansevoort Market owned by Jesse Baer, and operated by Stratis Morfogen, an owner of the Jue Lan Club who had been involved with Philippe. The skewers are also made with seared beef, tempura shrimp, lobster, tofu or vegetables. Salad bowls and fried chicken nuggets on a stick are other options. All come in creative boxes and containers. Branches are also coming to the Queens Center and the Dumbo Market at Empire Stores: Skinnys Satay Bar, Gansevoort Market, 353 West 14th Street, 646-678-3231, skinnyssatay.com.

title: Trump Will Not Block Comey From Testifying, White House Says
description: WASHINGTON  White House officials said on Monday that President Trump would not invoke executive privilege to try to block James B. Comey, the F.B.I. director he fired, from testifying before Congress this week, clearing the way for a hearing that may be the most anticipated in Washington in months, if not years.

title: A Dilemma for Diabetes Patients: How Low to Push Blood Sugar, and How to Do It?
description: Heart disease is the leading cause of death for people with Type 2 diabetes. Surely, then, the way to dodge this bullet is to treat the disease and lower blood sugar.

title: Tahini Is at the Heart of These Vibrant Spreads
description: Gadi Friedman, an Israeli entrepreneur in Colorado, produces colorful tahini spreads flavored with fruits and vegetables, mostly from the Mediterranean. These sesame dips are definitely a change of pace from Nutella and peanut butter. The seeds are stone-ground, and the spreads are flavored with beet, carob-chocolate, date, fig, pomegranate or strawberry: Sesame Kingdom Tahini Spreads, $13 for nine ounces, $78 for all six flavors, 800-460-3037, sesamekingdom.com.

description: Now that the internet has turned us all into middle-school kids shooting Snapchat spitballs and gossiping in homeroom about the burning issues of the day  How come Melania pulled the got to fix my hair trick to get out of holding Donalds hand in Rome? Was that moony look Justin gave Emmanuel at the G7 summit in Sicily proof the Canadian prime minister is crushing on his French counterpart? title: House of Cards Season 5: Watched It All? Lets Discuss

Netflixs House of Cards has always distinguished itself among political thrillers by a worldview so cynical its practically cartoonish, but the shows fifth season was perhaps its darkest yet. Now that weve watched all 13 episodes, its time to assess the damage.

title: One Guantanamo, Two Worlds

title: Mr. Trump: Stop Tweeting and Go Back to Bed
description: Its no secret that President Trump prefers tweeting over talking to the public  particularly when nearly everyone else in the country is fast asleep. Monday mornings are bad enough for everyone; pity the administration lawyers and aides who woke up today to find that their boss had undone months of their efforts to get his executive order barring travel to the United States from a number of Muslim-majority countries through the Supreme Court.

title: How Frdric Malle Makes a New Perfume
description: If there were fragrance royalty, Frdric Malle, the founder of Editions de Parfums Frdric  Malle, would have a title. His grandfather Serge Heftler-Louiche founded Parfums Christian Dior, and his mother, Marie-Christine Sayn-Wittgenstein, worked at Dior for 47 years and helped create Eau Sauvage. But it took Mr. Malle quite some time, with detours into art dealing and advertising, before he claimed his sweetly scented birthright. After learning the trade at the perfume house Roure Bertrand Dupont, he struck out on his own in 2000. His brand is based on a unique model: It functions like a publishing house, with Mr. Malle, 54, as the editor and the perfumers the authors. This month he is introducing his first mens grooming products, a shaving cream ($80) and an after-shave balm ($120), both made in his Vetiver Extraordinaire scent. He spoke with Mens Style at his Madison Avenue office in Manhattan.

title: Whats in Your Attic? Baseball Cards May Help a Collection Fetch Nearly $1 Million
description: A collection of 1948 baseball cards discovered in an attic in unopened packs, and in exceptional condition, are part of a trove of sports trading cards that an auction house said could fetch nearly $1 million.

title: Learn to Make Pies With Former Gourmet Editors
description: As tempting as an apricot-raspberry pie, a tomato-corn biscuit pie, a wineberry mascarpone pie or a zucchini-Cheddar puff pie may be, they taste even better when baked in a farmhouse kitchen with seasonal bounty from nearby orchards and fields. At the Farm Cooking School, on the Roots to River Organic Farm in New Jersey, monthly hands-on pie-making classes are taught by Ian Knauer and Shelley Wiseman, former Gourmet magazine editors. The types of pies vary according to the harvest, and each class includes instruction in making different kinds of pastry. The school offers other classes, including five-day and weekend sessions: Pies, June 16, July 7, Aug. 12, each from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m., $95, the Farm Cooking School, 67 Pleasant Valley Road, Titusville, N.J., thefarmcookingschool.com.

title: London Attack Suspect Known as Abs Appeared in Film About Extremists
description: LONDON  Everyone called him Abs. He gave out Halloween candy to children and taught them how to play Ping-Pong. He invited his neighbors to barbecue.

title: London, Qatar, Theresa May: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Solidarity at an All-Female Screening of Wonder Woman
description: One woman said she came to feel a sisterhood. Another said she was there because in her years as a comic book geek, she had only ever watched superhero movies surrounded by guys. Yet another came because she didnt want to overhear fanboys cracking wise about Gal Gadots physique, or, for that matter, that of any other woman onscreen.

title: What We Lose by Barring Refugees
description: President Trumps eruption of tweets in response to the London terror attacks doubled down on his self-described travel ban: We need the courts to give us back our rights. We need the travel ban as an extra level of safety!

title: Cocktail Stirrer Celebrates Signature Move of Bartender
description: Gary Regan, the cocktail writer, bartender and bitters maker known as Gaz, once had to stir Negronis for 20 people, and to speed things up, he used his finger for the task. The crowd loved it, and it became his signature. Now, Cocktail Kingdom, a bar tool company, sells a 13-inch stainless-steel bar spoon made with a cast of Mr. Regans index finger at one end and his rooster logo on the other: Gaz Regan Negroni Finger Stirrer, $26.99, Cocktail Kingdom, cocktailkingdom.com.

title: The Chef George Mendes Offers His Egg Tarts to Go
description: You could call pasteis de nata the national pastry of Portugal. The tidy little tarts made of flaky pastry and filled with custard are sold and served all over the country. In Lisbon, traditional bakeries sell them in clever geometric boxes. The chef George Mendes serves them at his Portuguese restaurant, Lupulo. He has had the distinctive boxes made for the restaurant and is selling the tarts to take away. The boxes are decorated with the pattern on the restaurants wall tiles: Pasteis de Nata, $5 for two, $15 for six, Lupulo, 835 Avenue of the Americas (29th Street), 212-290-7600, lupulonyc.com.

title: Review: Les Indes Galantes, a Baroque View of Colonial Relations
description: Rameaus Les Indes Galantes contains one of the great hits of French Baroque music, the Dance of the Peace Pipe, so catchy and spry as to make grown men want to skip. This rondeau made a welcome appearance on Friday, toward the end of Opera Lafayettes performance of Les Sauvages, the fourth and final part of this opra-ballet, at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. But it did little to redeem a flat-footed production.

title: Arundhati Roys Long-Awaited Novel Is an Ambitious Look at Turmoil in India
description: THE MINISTRY OF UTMOST HAPPINESSBy Arundhati Roy449 pages. Alfred A. Knopf. $28.95.

title: 17 Years Later, The Man Who Killed Don Quixote Completes Shooting
description: It wasnt clear whether the windmill would ever turn into a giant, but after almost two decades, the director Terry Gilliam has finally finished shooting The Man Who Killed Don Quixote. The film had experienced so many stops and starts that there was even a documentary, Lost in La Mancha (2002), about its struggles to get made.

title: Asias Illegal Wildlife Trade Makes Tigers a Farm-to-Table Meal
description: BOKEO PROVINCE, Laos  The tiger paced back and forth in its cage, groaning mournfully. A second big cat slept soundly in the corner, while a third stared blankly at the bars.

title: Mickey Drexler Steps Down as Chief of J. Crew, Ending an Era
description: At J. Crew, the other ballet flat has dropped.

title: Dakota People Are Debating Whether to Burn Scaffold Fragments
description: The four-day public dismantling of Sam Durants sculpture Scaffold, overseen by Dakota traditional and spiritual leaders, is nearly complete in the Minneapolis Sculpture Garden, after a week of protests, apologies and mediation involving the artist, the Walker Art Center and the Dakota people. But in an interview on Monday, the Walkers executive director, Olga Viso, said the Dakota were debating whether the wood fragments would indeed be burned, as previously announced.

title: Governors Balls 10 Best Sets: Gospel-Rap, Kiss-Off Pop and More
description: The Governors Ball Music Festival, which took over Randalls Island for three days last weekend, sets itself modest goals: just enough headliners, just enough variety, plenty of beer. Instead of tough choices, it puts on only two acts at a time; anyone truly torn can sample both in close proximity. Its lineup is, by and large, a straightforward assortment of whats current, overground and generally full of positive thinking: pop, hip-hop, electronic dance music and rock, along with a handful of performers who got their start back in the 20th century. And it does have the ultimate New York City asset: location, just across the East River from Manhattan, as close as many performers on this summers festival circuit will be.

title: Kushner Companies Seeking $250 Million to Pay Off Chinese Backers
description: The real estate company owned by the family of Jared Kushner, son-in-law and senior adviser to President Trump, is seeking $250 million to pay off its partners and lenders in a Jersey City apartment tower financed by Chinese investors through a program criticized as offering United States visas for sale.

title: Its Groundhog Day! Time to Put on That Costume (Again)
description: Things are pretty hectic backstage at Groundhog Day, the Tony Award-nominated musical based on the 1993 hit movie. After all, the show depends on its characters reliving the same day over and over, and that means getting in and out of the same costumes.

title: Trump Backs Air Traffic Control Privatization
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump endorsed a proposal on Monday to privatize air traffic control, seizing on a decades-old idea as proof that he is advancing the ambitious infrastructure rebuilding plan he promised during his campaign but is still months from delivering.

title: Trump Organization to Go Budget Friendly With American Idea Hotel Chain
description: On the campaign trail, President Trumps children rolled through dozens of small towns across the country, reveling in the adoration of the crowds. But they were less enamored of the budget-friendly hotels along the way, an assortment of run-of-the-mill offerings that were barely distinguishable from one another.

title: Breitbart News Editor Says She Was Fired After Anti-Muslim Tweets
description: A Breitbart News editor said on Monday that she had been fired from the conservative news site for the anti-Muslim tweets she sent after a terrorist attack in London on Saturday.

title: Apple, Comey, London: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: An Upstate Lifeblood, Ruled and Disputed From Afar
description: HANCOCK, N.Y.  The cold water that flows out of the reservoirs just north of here does more than chill the muck-sopped waders of fly fishermen. Once strictly reserved for the taps of New York City and neighboring states, the cold flow gives life to a biomass of insects and trout that has turned the region into one of the premier fly-fishing locales in the country.

title: Al Franken Cancels Appearance on Real Time With Bill Maher
description: Senator Al Franken, Democrat of Minnesota, said on Monday that he was canceling a guest appearance, scheduled for Friday, on the HBO late-night show Real Time With Bill Maher after an incident last Friday in which Mr. Maher used a racial epithet during an interview with Senator Ben Sasse, Republican of Nebraska.

title: Canadian Womens Hockey League to Add a Team From China
description: The Canadian Womens Hockey League announced on Monday that it would expand to China, beginning next season, becoming one of the first North American professional sports leagues to field a team in Asia.

title: Director of Ukrainian Library in Moscow Receives Suspended Term
description: MOSCOW  A Russian court on Monday sentenced a former director of the Library of Ukrainian Literature in Moscow to a four-year suspended prison term for inciting hatred toward Russians and embezzling public funds, in a case that her lawyers described as an attack on cultural figures with ties to Ukraine.

title: Corrections: June 6, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Jack ONeill, Surfer Who Made the Wetsuit Famous, Dies at 94
description: Jack ONeill, who popularized the neoprene wetsuits that defied the cold, the calendar and the continents to create an endless summer for surfers around the world, died on Friday at his home in Santa Cruz, Calif. He was 94.

title: Neil Gordon, Academic and Author of Cerebral Political Novels, Dies at 59
description: Neil Gordon, whose cerebral novels about radical politics, most famously The Company You Keep, challenged readers with biblical parables and ethical dilemmas, died on May 19 in Manhattan. He was 59.

title: Las Vegas Police Officer Charged in Death of Man Put in Chokehold
description: A Las Vegas police officer has been charged in the death of a man whom he chased last month from a hotel, shocked with a stun gun seven times and held for more than a minute in an unauthorized chokehold, the authorities said on Monday.

title: Western Nations Worry That Children Wont Be Better Off
description: The present is getting better. The future, not at all.

title: Economy Candy Endures
description: Dear Diary:

title: If Wonder Woman Can Do It, She Can Too
description: Shes so strong, the little girl seated next to me at a Brooklyn screening of Wonder Woman kept repeating to her mother, occasionally shielding her eyes. It was the first fight scene of the movie, and I was trying not to sob.

title: ISIS Says Its Behind Hostage Siege and Killing in Australia
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The Australian authorities are treating an abduction and a killing here in Melbourne on Monday, which ended with the gunman dead, as a terrorist attack.

title: A Jilted Paris Has Pined for the Olympics, but the Long Wait May End in 2024
description: PARIS  On a warm and sunny day at the French Open, Tony Estanguet was shivering.

title: Student Opinions on Climate Change? Unpredictable
description: When I arranged to visit Wellston High School for a story about how the culture war over climate change was erupting in science classrooms, I had a pretty good idea of what I would find.

title: China Looks to Capitalize on Clean Energy as U.S. Retreats
description: LIULONG, China  Chinas devastating pollution problems began here, in coal country, where legions of workers toiled and often died to exhume the rich deposits that fueled the countrys sooty rise to economic power.

title: Led by Rachel Maddow, MSNBC Surges to Unfamiliar Spot: No. 1 in Prime Time
description: The last time that MSNBC was No. 1 in prime-time cable news, Bill Clinton was president, Madonna led the Billboard charts and Friends still ran new episodes on TV.

title: Pain Lingers as Lake George Boater Is Sentenced for Killing a Girl
description: QUEENSBURY, N.Y.  There are the physical scars from the horrific collision on Lake George: a permanent bruise and indentation on Courtney McCues thigh, where her 8-year-old daughter Charlotte was resting her head.

title: White House Turmoil Makes It Harder to Stay Focused, Trump Aide Says
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps point man on Capitol Hill conceded on Monday that controversy over the firing of James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director, and open investigations into Russian election meddling made it harder to stay focused on ambitious Republican tax cut and health care plans.

title: Reality Leigh Winner Criminal Complaint
description: Reality Leigh Winner, an intelligence contractor, was charged with sending a classified report about Russias interference in the 2016 election to the news media, the Justice Department announced Monday, the first criminal leak case under President Trump.

title: Intelligence Contractor Is Charged in First Leak Case Under Trump
description: WASHINGTON  An intelligence contractor was charged with sending a classified report about Russias interference in the 2016 election to the news media, the Justice Department announced Monday, the first criminal leak case under President Trump.

title: Some U.S. Diplomats Stage Quiet Revolt Amid Tensions With Trump
description: WASHINGTON  As President Trump strains alliances and relationships around the world, some of the nations top career diplomats are breaking publicly with him, in what amounts to a quiet revolt by a cadre of public servants known for their professional discretion.

title: Trump Grows Discontented With Attorney General Jeff Sessions
description: WASHINGTON  Few Republicans were quicker to embrace President Trumps campaign last year than Jeff Sessions, and his reward was one of the most prestigious jobs in America. But more than four months into his presidency, Mr. Trump has grown sour on Mr. Sessions, now his attorney general, blaming him for various troubles that have plagued the White House.

title: P.R.I. Closes In on Narrow Victory in State of Mexico Governors Race
description: MEXICO CITY  Mexicos most powerful political party was on the verge of a clear victory in the closely fought race for the governorship of the nations most populous state, according to a nearly completed preliminary vote count on Monday night.

title: Trumps Lawyer, Marc Kasowitz: The Toughest of the Tough Guys
description: When James B. Comey, the former director of the F.B.I., testifies in front of the Senate Intelligence Committee on Thursday about his ousting by President Trump, one man is likely to be watching perhaps even more intently than the president  and taking notes on a legal pad.

title: Dueling Frenchwomen Show Signs of a Thaw After a Chilly Match
description: PARIS  A cool breeze blew north to south across Court Philippe Chatrier throughout its final match Monday, complicating an already chilly meeting.

title: Torontos Kevin Pillar Is Using an Ugly Word as a Catalyst for Change
description: TORONTO  Baseball teams have long used the ceremonial first pitch to celebrate a player from their past, or a current cause. So the Toronto Blue Jays commemorated the start of pride month in the city by inviting Michelle Cherny, the treasurer of Pride Toronto, a gay-rights advocacy group, to throw out the first pitch last Thursday.

title: U.S. Wants Inquiry Into Deaths of U.N. Investigators in Congo
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United States on Monday called for an international inquiry into the gruesome murders of two United Nations investigators in the Democratic Republic of Congo in mid-March.

title: No. 1 Hit
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  If you are just joining us, The New York Times is celebrating the 75th anniversary of its crossword puzzle and, as part of that celebration, Will Shortz is periodically running collaborations between celebrities who have never made a crossword and veteran puzzle constructors throughout the year.

title: Lisa Loeb Hears Music in the Creation of a Crossword Puzzle
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  For the singer Lisa Loeb, an exposure to crossword puzzles came from her older brother, Ben. As her brother zipped through them, Ms. Loebs curiosity  and perhaps a bit of sibling rivalry  got the better of her, and a love of crossword solving was born.

title: Review: In Matthew Perrys First Play, a Chandler Gone to Seed
description: Matthew Perry, the author and star of The End of Longing, doesnt list Friends in his program bio, but he doesnt need to. That hit television series, on which he played the wiseacre Chandler Bing for 10 seasons, sticks to him like a sweaty shirt.

title: Boy Is Critically Wounded on His 5th Birthday by a Stray Bullet in the Bronx
description: A 5-year-old boy celebrating his birthday with his father in the Bronx was critically injured on Monday after he was struck in the head by a stray bullet, the police said.

title: Quotation of the Day London Rampage Shows the Flaws In Stopping Plots
description: Whats got through is just the tip of the iceberg, and its an enormous iceberg.

title: Actually, de Blasio Says, He Fought Against Puerto Rican Parade Honor
description: For weeks, Mayor Bill de Blasio was unwavering in his public statements: He would march in the Puerto Rican Day Parade in New York on June 11 even though it was giving a heros honor to a former leader of a bomb-planting Puerto Rican nationalist group.

title: A Record-Setting Climb Up El Capitan, Without Ropes
description: On Saturday, the professional climber Alex Honnold became the first to climb the nearly 3,000-foot El Capitan, Yosemites iconic granite wall, without ropes, called free soloing.

title: Better Call Saul Season 3, Episode 8: What Have I Done?
description: Well, this is the darnedest thing. On some psychic level, Jimmy and Chuck appear to be trading places. Jimmy used to be the life-loving extrovert. Chuck was the bitter shut-in. Now, look at them.

title: In Killing by Police, a Jury Sees What the Dash Camera Saw
description: ST. PAUL  The fatal shooting of a black motorist by a police officer just outside this city drew national attention last summer largely because the drivers girlfriend began livestreaming the graphic scene on Facebook moments after it happened. On Monday, as prosecutors began outlining their case against the officer, they presented a different video for the first time in public: dashboard camera footage of the shooting itself.

title: What if Your Environmentally Correct Shoes Were Also Cute?
description: While waiting to board a flight from Los Angeles to San Francisco, Dr. Karli Cleary was approached by two 20-something women. They wanted to know, needed to know, where her pointy-toe red camo flats came from.

title: Mourners Gather at London Bridge
description: Hundreds came out to honor the victims of Saturdays terror attacks at London Bridge and Borough Market. Stand among them in 360 video.

title: London, Qatar, Donald Trump: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Word + Quiz: benison
Wonder Woman
Are You Being Raised to Pursue Your Dreams?
description: Are boys and girls raised differently?

title: Where Are the United States Attorneys?
description: Three months after President Trump abruptly fired half of the nations 93 United States attorneys, following the resignations of the other half, he has yet to replace a single one.

title: Selling Doctors on Cutting Drug Costs
description: As a drug salesman, Mike Courtney worked hard to make health care expensive. He wined and dined doctors, golfed with them and bought lunch for their entire staffs  all to promote pills often costing thousands of dollars a year.

title: The Secret to My Success? Antidepressants
description: A few months ago, I gave a reading at a local bookstore. A small but enthusiastic crowd attended, and I confessed to the audience filled with emerging writers that I had, in my 20s and early 30s, stopped writing for eight years, and that I had accepted Id never write again. Then someone asked, How did you return to writing?

title: The Polar Bear in the Room
description: Bret Stephens: Gail, the choice of topic belongs to you this time. Not to coin a phrase or anything, but  well always have Paris.

title: The Unexpected Afterlife of American Communism
description: The Communist, in the American imagination, has always been the ultimate outside agitator.

title: The Women Who Fought for Hanoi
description: Thirty-six years after she last took aim with her AK-47 assault rifle, Ngo Thi Thuongs phone rang.

title: The Lawless Presidency
description: Democracy isnt possible without the rule of law  the idea that consistent principles, rather than a rulers whims, govern society.

title: Help Poor New Yorkers Buy Transit Passes
description: The City Council of New York spoke to an urgent problem with its recent proposal to subsidize transit fares for low-income workers who now must choose between putting food on the table and spending $121 on monthly transit passes.

title: Giving Away Your Billion
description: Recently Ive been reading the Giving Pledge letters. These are the letters that rich people write when they join Warren Buffetts Giving Pledge campaign. They take the pledge, promising to give away most of their wealth during their lifetime, and then they write letters describing their giving philosophy.

title: Questions for: Climate Science Meets a Stubborn Obstacle: Students
description: Article: Climate Science Meets a Stubborn Obstacle: Students

title: Australian Politics Is Open to Foreign Cash, and China Has Much to Gain
description: SYDNEY, Australia  As the United States investigates Russias efforts to sway last years presidential election, Australia is engaged in a heated debate over how vulnerable its own political system is to foreign influence  and whether China is already meddling in it.

title: Dear Match Book: What Novels Can Help Me Prepare for Motherhood?
description: Dear Match Book,

title: How Did Witch Hunt Become the Complaint of the Powerful?
description: Enemies are useful: We all know the sweet, full-bodied relief of having someone else to blame for our problems. Why did the crops fail? It could be that you are an inept farmer. It could be that everything is up to chance. Or it could be that your neighbor, who has always been jealous of you, is doing something sinister to your crops.

title: The Pastoral Isles of Lake Champlain
description: This weeks U.S. Islands special package celebrates the charming, often dreamy life to be found off American coasts and within its lakes. Below, Suzanne Carmick writes about the islands of Lake Champlain, in Vermont, filled with history and legend. Kim Severson writes about Cumberland Island, Ga., full of charm but not easy to get to. Jordan Breal writes about the soft sand and seclusion of Padre Island, in Texas. Robert Lillegard takes us to Wisconsins Apostle Islands, in Lake Superior, which offer stunning sea caves and plenty of creature comforts.

title: Just Another Nutty June Weekend in the Rockaways
description: SWELLBy Jill Eisenstadt264 pp. A Lee Boudreaux Book/Little, Brown & Company. $26.

title: Obamacare Didnt Destroy Insurance Markets, but It Also Didnt Fix Them
description: A New York Times analysis of insurance market data.

title: What You Need to Know About Your Passport
description: Last year, more than 72 million Americans traveled abroad, according to the National Travel and Tourism Office. Yet many international travelers are turned away at the airport because even though they have a valid passport, its expiration date does not extend long enough to meet the rules of the country they plan to visit.

title: New Sentences: From The World to Come, by Jim Shepard
description: This sentence occurs in the middle of a short story but is basically its own little devastating poem: the ecology of an estranged marriage. The narrator is a 19th-century farmers wife who has fallen in love with another farmers wife  a love that is brutally denied by the men involved. Her sentence feels, in its elemental simplicity, like something from feudal Japan. Its opening clause posits an almost mathematical balance between the social and the natural world  my heart : him :: pond : crane. And yet that precision describes a situation of deep, unsolvable human sadness. The narrators heart-pond is destined to remain terminally neglected, its depths unexplored, its most precious resources unconsumed.

title: The Teenage Life, Streamed Live and for Profit
description: On a recent afternoon in Los Angeles, 15-year-old Bryce Xavier went to the Olive Garden with his mom, pulled out his phone and broadcast lunch. Across the country, teenagers phones lit up with a push notification: Bryce was live.

title: Bill Cosby Trial Day 2: Jurors Hear Andrea Constand Say I Trusted Him
description: On the second day of the criminal trial of Bill Cosby, the complainant, Andrea Constand, a former Temple University employee, testifed tearfully about the night in 2004 when she says he drugged and sexually assaulted her at his home outside Philadelphia.

title: Are Pets the New Probiotic?
description: Scientists are paying increasing attention to the indoor microbiome, the billions of bacteria, viruses and fungi that we share our homes and offices with. But not all those micro-organisms are bad for us, experts note. And exposure to a rich array of indoor germs may actually be salutary, helping stave off a variety of illnesses.

title: Aid Coordinator in Yemen Had Secret Job Overseeing U.S. Commando Shipments
description: WASHINGTON  An American kidnapped two years ago in Yemen while helping coordinate aid for Unicef and the Red Cross also had a second, secret role: He was shipping materials for elite military commandos under a clandestine contract his employer had with the Pentagon. The arrangement with Special Operations forces has never been made public.

title: On Padre in Texas, Soft Sand, Shells and Seclusion
description: This weeks U.S. Islands special package celebrates the charming, often dreamy life to be found off American coasts and within its lakes. Below, Jordan Breal writes about the soft sand and seclusion of Padre Island, in Texas. Kim Severson writes about Cumberland Island, Ga., full of charm but not easy to get to. The islands of Lake Champlain, in Vermont, are filled with history and legend. Wisconsins Apostle Islands, in Lake Superior, offer stunning sea caves and plenty of creature comforts.

title: The Internet Is Where We Share  and Steal  the Best Ideas
description: In April, a photograph of Rihanna and Lupita Nyongo taken at a Miu Miu fashion show three years ago began recirculating online. Their friendly body language and chic clothes (Rihanna wore thigh-highs, fur and leather; Lupita a plum jacket with a jeweled collar) caught the imagination of the internet. A Twitter user named @1800SADGAL suggested that Rihanna looks like she scams rich white men and Lupita is the computer-smart best friend that helps plan the scams. People began talking about an Oceans 11-type film written by and starring black women. Issa Rae was nominated to write the script and Ava DuVernay to direct. All four women chimed in on Twitter, announcing their support, though what that meant seemed unclear. Like any other online frenzy, it disappeared after a few days.

title: How Did the Subway Get So Bad? Look to the C Train
description: More than half a century ago, a 20-piece marching band in green and gold uniforms assembled near Track 37 at Grand Central Terminal to herald the arrival of what was hailed as an engineering marvel: the citys first stainless-steel subway cars, known as Brightliners.

title: Shes Accused of Texting Him to Suicide. Is That Enough to Convict?
description: TAUNTON, Mass.  The teenagers shared mundane text messages  about a walk and a trip to get ice cream. But there were darker ones, too.

title: A New History Recalibrates the Villains of the Russian Revolution
description: THE RUSSIAN REVOLUTION A New History By Sean McMeekin Basic Books. $30. Illustrated. 445 pp.

title: On Wisconsin Islands, a Warm Welcome and Brisk Waters
description: This weeks U.S. Islands special package celebrates the charming, often dreamy life to be found off American coasts and within its lakes. Below, Robert Lillegard writes about Wisconsins Apostle Islands, in Lake Superior, which offer stunning sea caves and plenty of creature comforts. Kim Severson writes about Cumberland Island, Ga., full of charm but not easy to get to. The islands of Lake Champlain, in Vermont, are filled with history and legend. Jordan Breal writes about the soft sand and seclusion of Padre Island, in Texas.

title: Americas Hidden H.I.V. Epidemic
description: Early on a balmy morning last October, Cedric Sturdevant began his rounds along the bumpy streets and back roads of Jackson, Miss. Sturdevant, 52, has racked up nearly 300,000 miles driving in loops and widening circles around Jackson in his improvised role of visiting nurse, motivational coach and father figure to a growing number of young gay men and transgender women suffering from H.I.V. and AIDS. Sturdevant is a project coordinator at My Brothers Keeper, a local social-services nonprofit. If he doesnt make these rounds, he has learned, many of these patients will not get to the doctors appointments, pharmacies, food banks and counseling sessions that can make the difference between life and death.

title: Apple Needs to Reinvent Itself. It Just Might Be Doing So.
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.  One of Apples greatest strengths is timing. The company thats hailed for innovation does not often invent things first  it didnt create the first personal computer, the first digital music player or the first smartphone. Instead, Apple reinvents, slipping in and producing something more original than what we used to use.

title: Sure, Hes Good at Basketball, but How Are His Twitter Skills?
description: The tweets of Pau Gasol, an N.B.A. center, used to ricochet between the email inboxes of Alan Yang, a co-creator of the Netflix show Master of None, and Chelsea Peretti, a comedian and cast regular of Foxs Brooklyn Nine-Nine.

title: For Officers in Fatal Shootings, an Unseen Grieving Process
description: CHICAGO  There is a grim routine to the police shootings that have divided this country in recent years. First, we learn the names and ages of the deceased. We see them smiling in old family photos. We watch as their names trend on Twitter: Michael Brown, Philando Castile, Tamir Rice.

title: On a Georgia Island, a Lot of Good Food and Plenty of Nothing
description: This weeks U.S. Islands special package celebrates the charming, often dreamy life to be found off American coasts and within its lakes. Below, Kim Severson writes about Cumberland Island, Ga., full of charm but not easy to get to. Padre Island, in Texas, offers soft sand and seclusion. The islands of Lake Champlain, in Vermont, are filled with history and legend. Wisconsins Apostle Islands, in Lake Superior, offer stunning sea caves and plenty of creature comforts.

title: The Silicon Valley Billionaires Remaking Americas Schools
description: In San Franciscos public schools, Marc Benioff, the chief executive of Salesforce, is giving middle school principals $100,000 innovation grants and encouraging them to behave more like start-up founders and less like bureaucrats.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Trevor Noah Thinks Trump Should Ease Up on Londons Mayor
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: Morning Agenda: Mickey Drexler to Resign as J. Crew C.E.O.
description: Its the end of an era in the world of fashion: Millard Drexler is stepping down as J. Crews chief executive.

description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher
