description: Updated, 6:44 a.m.

title: The Vegan Dog
description: Kery Shaw is one of many dog owners aligning their pets lifestyles with their own.

title: Movers: G.M. Shareholders Reject Einhorn
description: Were following major market developments throughout the day.

title: Death Toll in Kabul Bombing Has Hit 150, Afghan President Says
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Afghan president said that over 150 people were killed and more than 300 were wounded by the truck bombing outside the German Embassy last week, making it possibly the deadliest such attack since the American-led invasion in 2001.

title: Questions on U.K. Policing Mount as 3rd London Attacker Is Identified
description: LONDON  Questions about whether the British government could have done more to prevent the terrorist attack in London over the weekend mounted on Tuesday, two days before a national election, as new details emerged about the three men who carried out the deadly assault.

title: Britains Voyage to Inglorious Isolation
description: WASHINGTON  First there was the Brexit drama. Now comes the farce. Almost a year after a narrow majority of Britons voted to pull out of the European Union, British voters face a general election on Thursday that was as unwanted as it was unexpected.

title: Playing Catch-Up to Uber on Self-Driving, Lyft Teams Up With Partners
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Uber is spending millions of dollars to make self-driving cars on its ride-hailing network a reality. Now Lyft, one of Ubers biggest competitors, is striking a series of partnerships to do the same.

title: Runners-Up From Our Fourth Annual Student Editorial Contest
description: How do you choose 10 winning editorials from the almost 8,000 entries we received in our 2017 Student Editorial Contest? The answer is: with quite a bit of difficulty. The 15 runners-up in this years contest made it through the first three rounds of judging and were selected as top picks by multiple judges.

title: California Today: An Incomprehensible Climb in Yosemite
description: Good morning.

title: What a Bipartisan Paid Leave Plan Might Look Like
description: Paid parental leave seems as if it has at least a chance of becoming reality in the United States for the first time. But agreeing on the policys details would require many compromises from all involved.

title: Live From Mosul: A Photographers Perspective
description: One way to photograph the battle to retake Mosul from the Islamic State is to embed with Iraqi forces there. And so, with a driver, fixer and security adviser, I headed to west Mosul, where the four of us spent nearly three weeks with a troop of Iraqs counterterrorism special forces.

title: Patient Voices: Parkinson's Disease
description: Potentially debilitating symptoms, invasive treatments and hopes for a cure: Men and women with Parkinsons disease speak.

title: As Trump Steps Back, Jerry Brown Talks Climate Change in China
description: BEIJING  Gov. Jerry Brown of California should be fading quietly into the final days of his career. After 40 years in public life, Mr. Brown, 79, a Democrat, is in the final stretch as the states chief executive. He has been talking about the Colusa County family ranch where he wants to retire. And a battery of younger politicians is already battling to succeed him.

title: On the London Attack
description: Britain observed a moment of silence at 11 a.m. on Tuesday to remember the victims of the attack.

title: U.S. Presses China to Free Activists Scrutinizing Ivanka Trump Shoe Factory
description: SHANGHAI  China faces growing pressure to release three labor activists detained for investigating conditions at factories that make Ivanka Trumps shoe brand, as experts warned that the detentions could make it more difficult for other Western companies to take a clear look at the practices of their Chinese suppliers.

title: G.M. and Tesla Shareholders Rebuff Dissidents Proposals
description: DETROIT  General Motors and Tesla are automakers of different vintages but increasingly mutual aspirations. They found another bit of common ground on Tuesday as both beat back proposals from dissident investors to shake up their ways of doing business.

title: Immigrants Triumph at the Oscars of American Fashion
description: This year, its been even harder to separate fashion from politics, said the comedian Seth Meyers, modeling an ankle-baring Thom Browne tuxedo without socks, as he pointed out, Monday night. Mr. Meyers was not starting his late-night monologue, but introducing the annual Council of Fashion Designers of America Awards at the Hammerstein Ballroom in New York, and that comment pretty much framed the evening.

title: In Geneva Speeches, Nikki Haley Casts U.S. as Rights Champion
description: GENEVA  The American ambassador to the United Nations, Nikki R. Haley, took a swipe on Tuesday at Saudi Arabias human rights record, criticized the United Nations for what she called its anti-Israel bias and insisted that the Trump administration would champion human rights.

title: Trump Defends Twitter Use as Aides Urge Him to Cut Back
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump  under pressure to cut back on 140-character cannonades  shot back Tuesday morning with two tweets defending his use of social media and slamming fake news organizations for trying to deny him his political sword and shield.

title: Nicole Kidman, Janelle Mone and Raf Simons at CFDA Awards
description: Inside the annual Council of Fashion Designers of America awards.

title: To Save Its Cliffside Towns, Italy Revives the Art of Terracing
description: VERNAZZA, Italy  The teenagers panted heavily as they climbed up the steep slope in the early morning, the Mediterranean sun glittering on the sea far below. Along the way, they stopped to survey the stone walls bordering the winding roads, carefully taking measurements.

title: U.S.-Backed Forces Begin Assault on Raqqa, ISIS Stronghold in Syria
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Forces backed by the United States said on Tuesday that they had begun a long-anticipated offensive against Islamic State militants in the northern Syrian city of Raqqa, the groups self-proclaimed capital.

title: Police Shoot Attacker Outside Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris
description: PARIS  A police officer shot and wounded an assailant armed with a hammer and kitchen knives on the square outside Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris on Tuesday afternoon, according to the authorities.

title: Attempted Murder Charge in Bronx Shooting of Boy on His 5th Birthday
description: As the 5-year-old boys family waited for word early Tuesday about his grave head wound, investigators scoured a Bronx public housing project just 300 feet from where the child had been shot.

title: Does Your Pet Need an Eye Doctor?
description: When Kathy Ouelettes 98-pound Rottweiler, Bear, began bumping into things (even into me, Mrs. Ouelette said), she knew something was wrong. Her veterinarian referred her to Dr. Daniel Priehs, an eye-disease specialist at Animal Eye Associates in nearby Maitland, Fla.

title: Controlling Notifications in Windows 10
description: Q.  How do I get apps to give me notifications when Im using Windows 10 on a desktop computer?

title: With 843 Acres Buffed, Central Park Leader Will Step Down
description: It is easy to forget what Central Park looked like in the 1980s. But Douglas Blonsky, president of the Central Park Conservancy, can see past the lush meadows and fresh streams to a time when the 843-acre park was more beaten-down wasteland than urban Eden.

title: Nicole Kidman, Janelle Mone and Raf Simons at CFDA Awards
description: The red carpet had been unfurled outside the Hammerstein Ballroom on West 34th Street, and stars like Nicole Kidman and Diane Kruger were on parade.

title: A Take-Charge Bachelorette Sends the Boys Home
description: Another season of The Bachelorette is underway, and unlike DeMario (and possibly Eric), The New York Times is still here for the right reasons. Our resident obsessives are following Rachel Lindsays love journey while steering clear of the mud-wrestling ring. Can we steal you for a sec?

title: Terrorists Deliver Their Message With Lethal Simplicity
description: WASHINGTON  In the months after the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks, Western officials worried about additional attacks, possibly using weapons of mass destruction, that could kill thousands. The United States invested heavily in biological and nuclear detectors and other high-tech gear. Jihadist terrorism seemed a menace that would unnerve entire countries and might last for a generation.

title: Daily Report: Apple Shifts Its Tech Priorities to Reinvent Itself
description: Apple unveiled the HomePod, its version of a smart-connected speaker, at its annual developer conference on Monday. Many people took this as a sign that Apple was simply a follower, since the company will be behind Amazon and Google in releasing a speaker product.

title: Trump Takes Credit for Saudi Move Against Qatar, a U.S. Military Partner
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump thrust himself into a bitter Persian Gulf dispute on Tuesday, taking credit for Saudi Arabias move to isolate its smaller neighbor, Qatar, and rattling his national security staff by upending a critical American strategic relationship.

title: Why Regulators Are Needed to Handle Failed Banks
description: One of the major reforms to avoid the recurrence of the severity of the financial crisis was a set of mechanisms by which the regulators could wind down failed banks or restructure them if they were still viable.

title: What 7 People Wore on Their Helicopter Ride to the Hamptons
description: Why sit in traffic for five hours when you can spend 45 minutes in the air? For a certain set of well-heeled New Yorkers fleeing to the Hamptons and elsewhere for Memorial Day weekend, there was no debate. Under clear skies, these people made their way to the East 34th Street lounge of Blade, the helicopter-hailing app, which offered Friday afternoon flights to East Hampton (fares starting at $595). While some Wall Streeters opted for discretion, a handful of gentlemen talked about what they wore and their weekend plans.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: Beauty and the Beast and The American Epic Sessions
description: Prepare to be enchanted by the revival of Beauty and Beast, starring Emma Watson and Dan Stevens. Or listen to contemporary musicians as they might have sounded nearly a century ago in The American Epic Sessions.

title: In Washington, Trump Is Roasted. At His Charlottesville Winery, Hes Toasted.
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va.  At the White House, protesters scream at the gates. At the Trump International Hotel in Washington, they project anti-Trump messages on the outside walls. In Virginia, they paddle up to the Trump golf course in kayaks, waving signs: Resist!

title: Jeffrey Tate, Conductor Whose Life Was a Worldwide Whirlwind, Dies at 74
description: Jeffrey Tate, an English conductor whose precise, incisive interpretations of the German repertory and inspired work with singers made him a constant presence at concert halls and opera houses around the world, died on Friday in Bergamo, Italy. He was 74.

description: A judge in Michigan ordered arrest warrants on Tuesday for three Michigan State football players who were accused of sexually assaulting a woman in an on-campus apartment.

For 20 years, though, he and his wife, Mina, have deferred that dream, living in a Philadelphia suburb to raise their two children in a 3,500-square-foot home.

description: Peter Sallis, a British actor who brought genial eccentricity to the voice of the cheese-loving Wallace in the Wallace & Gromit Claymation stop-motion animated films, died on Friday in London. He was 96.

title: When You Know Its Love: The Joys of Reinvention
description: How do you know when you are in love? No 1-800-line psychic will tell you. No notice will be sent by registered mail. Not even a ping from your iPhone. But there are a million ways of figuring it out, and weve asked some people when they knew. Here is one way:

title: Uber Fires 20 Amid Investigation Into Workplace Culture
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Uber has fired 20 employees over harassment, discrimination and inappropriate behavior, as the ride-hailing company tries to contain the fallout from a series of toxic revelations about its workplace.

description: The chef, based in Atlanta, returns to Kerala to draw attention to the regions cuisine.

title: A Chefs Quest in India: Win Respect for Its Cooking
description: MUNNAR, India  In the shade of a cardamom patch on a South Indian mountainside, Asha Gomez leaned against a tree and began to cry.

title: Bernie Madoff of Landlords Pleads Guilty to Fraud
description: Steven Croman has been so loathed as a landlord that his tenants started a website against him. When he was charged in May 2016 with 20 felonies punishable by up to 25 years in prison, the attorney general described him as the Bernie Madoff of landlords. The night of his arrest, a pizza joint in the East Village offered free ros wine to anyone who mentioned his name.

title: Behind Wonder Woman Is a Great Man
description: It doesnt take long for Capt. Steve Trevor to discover hes the sidekick.

title: Pets Mini Puzzle
description: Test your pets know-how with this special crossword puzzle.

title: Anthem Will Exit Health Insurance Exchange in Ohio
description: Anthem, one of the nations largest insurers and a major player in the individual insurance market created by the federal health care law, announced Tuesday that it would stop offering policies in the Ohio marketplace next year.

title: Trump Picks Former OneWest Chief to Oversee Banks
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump plans to nominate Joseph Otting, who ran the California lender OneWest, to oversee some of the nations largest banks.

title: Twitter Users Blocked by Trump Seek Reprieve, Citing First Amendment
description: WASHINGTON  Lawyers for Twitter users blocked by President Trump after they criticized or mocked him are asking him to reverse the moves, arguing that the Constitution bars him from blocking people on the social media service.

title: Roger Smith, 77 Sunset Strip Actor and Manager of Ann-Margret, Dies at 84
description: Roger Smith, an actor remembered for his leading role in the ABC private detective show 77 Sunset Strip, who shifted his career to manage that of his wife, the actress Ann-Margret, died on Sunday in Los Angeles. He was 84.

title: In Rainy Paris, Ostapenko and Bacsinszky Advance to French Open Semifinals
description: PARIS  After the rain clouds were at last replaced by the sun on Tuesday, it eventually became clear: There will be at least one first-time major finalist at the French Open, with Timea Bacsinszky and Jelena Ostapenko advancing to face each other in a semifinal at Roland Garros.

title: Cyndi Lauper Is to Write the Music for the Broadway-Bound Working Girl
description: As Kinky Boots continues its high-kicking run on Broadway, its composer, Cyndi Lauper, has announced her next project: a stage adaptation of the 1988 film Working Girl.

title: A Hot Mess for F-Train Subway Riders Trapped in Cars
description: The videos have a dramatic, B-horror-movie appearance: Fingers poked between the closed subway doors, as people stuck in the F train car tried to claw the doors apart. On a steamed-up window, a passenger scrawled the words, I Will Survive.

title: Cote, an Upscale Korean Barbecue Steak House, Opens in the Flatiron District
description: COTE Simon Kim, an owner of Piora in the West Village, is opening an updated, high-style version of a Korean barbecue steakhouse in a couple of subdued gray and black rooms. Its more appealing to both non-Koreans and Koreans with a finer experience, good service and wines, he said. Japanese gas grills have been fitted into the sleek matte soapstone surface of every table, where customers will cook their own meat. There are 24 grills, each costing $4,000, and as Mr. Kims director of operations, Thomas Brown, pointed out, they are smokeless. The menus focal point is the butchers feast, at $45 per person. It includes assorted cuts of beef, condiments, salads, stews, other accompaniments and dessert.  la carte appetizers, meats, fish and side dishes are also served. The chef, David Shim, worked at M. Wells, and Victoria James, who is also at Piora, is in charge of wines. Theres a lounge area at the entrance and a marble-topped bar in the center, dividing the space into two dining rooms. (Opens Thursday): 16 West 22nd Street, 212-401-7986, cotenyc.com.

title: Syrian Boy Who Became Image of Civil War Reappears
description: A young Syrian boy who captured the worlds attention last year when images of his blood- and dust-covered face spread across the internet has been recast this week to bolster the Syrian governments cause in a series of television interviews.

title: Two Paths Arise for Democrats in Race for Virginias Governor
description: LEESBURG, Va.  Tom Perriello acknowledges that he is running the most progressive campaign for governor in modern Virginia history. He speaks stirringly about undocumented immigrants who fear deportation and transgender teenagers who face a bullier in chief, while vowing to put community policing ahead of paramilitary policing and to confront the states utility giant.

title: The President of the Calder Foundation Shares His Collection
description: The grandson of Alexander Calder works in the company of his furniture, art and design.

description: Alexander S. C. Rower

description: In this traditional video, we do not, in fact, see for three-hundred and sixty degrees.

title: In Britain, Fissures That Cant Be Blamed on Brexit
description: LONDON  With fond memories of his time in Italy as a student, Ted Bainsfair voted for Britain to remain in the European Union in last Junes referendum, and was disappointed to find himself on the losing side. But that was then.

title: Adnan Khashoggi, High-Living Saudi Arms Trader, Dies at 81
description: Adnan Khashoggi, the flamboyant Saudi arms trader who rose to spectacular wealth in the 1970s and 1980s while treating the world to displays of decadence breathtaking even by the standards of that era, died on Tuesday in London. He was 81.

title: Victory Over Einhorn Provides Little Solace to General Motors
description: David Einhorns financial engineering effort has hit a dead end at General Motors.

title: Soul of a Scrapyard
description: Sam Sambucci would prefer you not bulldoze his neighborhood.

title: Five Killed as Indian Farmers Clash With Police at a Protest
description: NEW DELHI  Five people were killed Tuesday at a protest in central India, as the police battled with farmers demanding debt relief.

title: Official in Flint Who Used a Racial Slur Against Black Residents Resigns
description: An official in Flint, Mich., who was recorded using a racial slur and insulting residents of the city during a private conversation, resigned on Monday.

title: Soul of a Scrapyard
description: Across the street from Citi Field in Queens there is a hidden corner of New York known as the Iron Triangle. Its a shantytown of scrap yards and auto body shops, flanked by three intersecting streets that form a triangle. In the morning hours, as people convene on the dirt roads while sea gulls flock overhead, the neighborhood of Willets Point seems a world away from what many of us think of New York City, with its upswell of luxury apartments and gentrification.

title: Richard Rhodes, on Indias Nuclear Power
description: To the Editor:

title: Ruling May Be Death Knell for $3 Billion Queens Development
description: The grand plan hinged on a barren patch of asphalt used to park cars during Mets games. But on Tuesday, the New York State Court of Appeals ruled that the lot  actually a city-owned piece of Flushing Meadows Park  could not be taken for development, dealing a potentially fatal blow to a nearly two-decade old project to turn a run-down area of Queens into a supermall, hotel and, eventually, housing.

title: A Fauxdega Where the Real Bodegas Have Been Priced Out
description: Todays public art demands research. You dont show in an old sugar factory without studying plantation labor. You dont install in an abandoned prison without reading up on inmates lives. When the British artist Lucy Sparrow was preparing for her first New York installation, 8 Till Late, a mock convenience store that just opened in a storefront beside the Standard, High Line, hotel in New York, she spent days exploring how the American version of Spam came in such un-British flavors as teriyaki and hickory smoke; how corner stores in the United States sell hot dogs and pizza as well as groceries; how such businesses do not include Marmite and Digestive biscuits.

title: China on the Rise, While America Pulls Back
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: Good morning.

title: An Ingredient Yotam Ottolenghi Cant Do Without
description: There are 10 or so things in my kitchen that I cant do without. Olive oil and lemons. Red wine vinegar and tomatoes, when theyre in season. Coffee to start the day. Wine, bread, cheese and chocolate to end it. Tahini is there, too, ready to be drizzled on toast or whisked into a sauce or dressing.

title: Go Ahead. Eat Pink Slime.
description: Of all the gross-out stories about food that have broken the Internet in recent years  maggots in mushrooms, wood chips in shredded cheese, bug bits in chocolate bars  nothing has captured the public imagination more than pink slime.

title: 6 Cabana Shirts With Throwback Appeal
description: Just in time for summer, the vintage-inspired cabana shirt is upgraded in subdued solids and muted prints. And theres not a kitschy poolside motif in sight.

title: Police Are Less Respectful Toward Black Drivers, Report Finds
description: Police officers are significantly less respectful and consistently ruder toward black motorists during routine traffic stops than they are toward white drivers, a paper released this week found.

title: Scuff, Patter, Chug, Poke, Swim: Expanding Definitions of Dance
description: Anyone who thinks that Irish dance is a necessarily rigid form, defined by a stiff upper body and dancers moving in militaristic unison, should spend some time watching Colin Dunne. New Yorkers had the chance to do so when the singular Mr. Dunne, who has long moved past his flashier days as a star of Riverdance, appeared on the small, no-frills stage of Irish Arts Center last weekend with the fiddler Tola Custy, the harpist Maeve Gilchrist and the piper David Power.

title: An Intimate Duet for Not-Quite-Retired Ballerinas (and Friends)
description: Youre a choreographer. You have access to two of the worlds most ravishing dancers. And though both had recently retired as principals at major ballet companies, they were back in the studio.

title: Soft Children Confront a Hard World in Maile Meloys New Novel
description: DO NOT BECOME ALARMEDBy Maile Meloy342 pages. Riverhead Books. $27.

title: Review: Maps for a War Tourist, Rewritten by a Real Tragedy
description: Maps for a War Tourist, presented by the experimental company Sister Sylvester at Dixon Place, is an atlas with half its pages blank, a diagram of a play youll never see. The piece originated with the troupes interest in Ayse Deniz Karacagil, a young Turkish woman arrested during the 2013 Gezi Park protests in Istanbul and charged with membership in a terrorist organization, an allegation largely based on the color of her scarf.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: London, Qatar, Saudi Arabia: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: As Many as 4 Are Dead in Drug Overdoses in Georgia
description: A wave of drug overdoses in Georgia has killed as many as four people and hospitalized dozens over two days, health officials said on Tuesday.

title: Would You Buy a Plastic Suit From Stella McCartney?
description: The newest luxury material to hit high-fashion rails has nothing to do with centuries of artisanal tradition or rare and exotic animals, and everything to do with ... garbage. And it is coming soon to a Stella McCartney store near you.

title: The Taliban Still Control Large Parts of Afghanistan and ISIS Has Established a Foothold
description: Afghanistan continues to struggle to maintain security in the face of the Taliban insurgency and a growing Islamic State presence.

title: Oskar Eustis: The First Time I Burned Money (and Found My Calling)
description: One evening in May 1975, I stood outside a bank in Ann Arbor, Mich., and lit every dollar in my wallet on fire. As the bills burned, I held them up to the sky, tears streaming down my face.

title: How Bots Are Inflating Instagram Egos
description: I posted a picture in March of the New York Times headquarters looking serene before a snowstorm to my Instagram account. The photo attracted 11 comments, all from strangers. Very nice! a monthly cocktail delivery company in San Francisco wrote. A cosmetic tattoo artist in Vancouver, British Columbia, posted three fire symbol emojis, and a vintage furniture seller in San Jose, Calif., left an emoji of a heart with a bow around it.

title: Review: Ascent of Mount Fuji, Guided by Over 4,000 Images
description: I have only seen Mount Fuji from the window of a train traveling from Tokyo to Kyoto. Its instantly recognizable silhouette conveys a feeling not just of majesty, but also of stillness. It is therefore apt that Ascent, written, directed and partly narrated by Fiona Tan, is announced as a photo film. All the images in this 80-minute feature are still. They are largely photographs of the mountain itself: in broad daylight, in the dark, covered in snow, in the background of bright panoramas of sunflowers or cherry blossoms.

title: An Emissary From the Golden Age of Tango
description: PHILADELPHIA  By common consent, Argentine tango had a golden age from the 1930s to the 1950s. New music (Juan dArienzo, Osvaldo Pugliese and other composers) inspired dancers to new peaks of brilliantly rhythmic elegance. Innumerable classic audio recordings remain. But whats left of the dance?

title: Corrections: June 7, 2017
description: NATIONAL

title: Public-Private Projects Where the Public Pays and Pays
description: Faster, better, cheaper.

title: London Attackers: What We Know
description: Khuram Shazad Butt, Rachid Redouane and Youssef Zaghba killed seven and left scores injured on Saturday night. Two of them had been flagged by the authorities and one had even appeared in a TV documentary about Muslim extremism in Britain.

title: Without Obama as a Unifier, Republicans Are Fragmented
description: WASHINGTON  A Republican-only attempt in the Senate to repeal the health care law is limping along, hobbled by giant divisions within the party over how to deal with Medicaid, among other issues.

title: De Blasio and Council Agree, and Disagree, on Immigrants
description: With a handshake last week and then a vote on Tuesday, the New York City Council passed an $85.2 billion city budget. But one glaring issue remains undecided.

title: Inside the Comey Memos: A Plea for Protection From Trump
description: Michael S. Schmidt reports on new revelations about James B. Comey's appeal to Attorney General Jeff Sessions to ward off pressure from the White House.

title: Comey Told Sessions: Dont Leave Me Alone With Trump
description: WASHINGTON  The day after President Trump asked James B. Comey, the F.B.I. director, to end an investigation into his former national security adviser, Mr. Comey confronted Attorney General Jeff Sessions and said he did not want to be left alone again with the president, according to current and former law enforcement officials.

title: Donald J. Vidrine, Supervisor on Ill-Fated Deepwater Horizon Rig, Dies at 69
description: Donald J. Vidrine, who faced prosecution as one of two BP supervisors on the Deepwater Horizon oil drilling rig that exploded in the Gulf of Mexico in 2010, died on Saturday at his home in Baton Rouge, La. He was 69.

title: Texas Governor Revives Stalled Transgender Bathroom Bill
description: HOUSTON  Gov. Greg Abbott reignited one of the most divisive issues in Texas politics on Tuesday, calling lawmakers back to the Capitol for a special session of the Legislature in part to consider a bill that would reinforce the states effort to regulate bathroom use by transgender people in public buildings.

title: Ponzi Scheme Meets Ransomware for a Doubly Malicious Attack
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The first message to pop up on the computer screen let the victims know they had been hacked. The second message gave them a way out.

title: Quotation of the Day: Service Lets Riders Share (Yes, Share) a Cab
description: Its a way to meet people. You might even meet the love of your life in a taxi, you never know.

title: Sergei Vikharev, Russian Ballet Master Who Revived the Past, Dies at 55
description: Sergei Vikharev, a Russian ballet master and former dancer in the Mariinsky Ballet who sparked a continuing debate over how to stage 19th-century works when he stunned international audiences with a four-hour spectacular production of The Sleeping Beauty in 1999, died on Friday in St. Petersburg. He was 55.

title: In a Hurry, Maybe
description: Dear Diary:

title: In Court, Diamond Reynolds Recounts Moments Before a Police Shooting
description: ST. PAUL  Last summer, only seconds after watching a Minnesota police officer shoot her boyfriend during a traffic stop, Diamond Reynolds pulled out her phone and started recording.

title: Mexico Agrees to Sugar Trade Deal, but U.S. Refiners Remain Unhappy
description: MEXICO CITY  Mexico agreed to demands from the United States to cut exports of refined sugar, striking a deal on Tuesday in a contentious trade negotiation that was closely watched as a prologue to talks on renegotiating the North American Free Trade Agreement.

title: Masahiro Tanaka Struggles in an Ominous Sign for the Yankees
description: The promise of summer heat is a beacon for teams without power. They can always tell themselves that the home runs will fly just as soon as this cold, rotten weather disappears.

title: Justice Department Weighs In Against Wells Fargo in a Whistle-Blower Suit
description: Fresh woes for Wells Fargo and a victory for two of its whistle-blowers occurred late Tuesday when the Justice Department filed a friend-of-the-court brief in a lawsuit brought against the bank by two former employees, who were fired after they tried to report misdeeds they had observed to their supervisors.

title: Sessions Is Said to Have Offered to Resign
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General Jeff Sessions offered to resign in recent weeks as he told President Trump he needed the freedom to do his job, according to two people who were briefed on the discussion.

title: In Trump Country, Renewable Energy Is Thriving
description: Two years ago, Kansas repealed a law requiring that 20 percent of the states electric power come from renewable sources by 2020, seemingly a step backward on energy in a deeply conservative state.

title: What You Get (and What You Dont) From a $50 Amazon Fire
description: What can $50 buy? An inexpensive pair of sneakers, maybe dinner for two in San Francisco or a couple of tickets to the ballgame. But few ever imagined that it could also buy a tablet computer capable of running apps and streaming Netflix.

title: Phil Murphy and Kim Guadagno Win Primaries in New Jersey Governors Race
description: NEWARK  Philip D. Murphy, a former Goldman Sachs executive, cruised to the Democratic nomination for New Jersey governor on Tuesday while Kim Guadagno, the states lieutenant governor, easily turned away a spirited challenge to claim the Republican nomination, setting the stage for a November battle to replace Chris Christie, the deeply unpopular incumbent.

title: After Reality Winners Arrest, Media Asks: Did Intercept Expose a Source?
description: Journalism in the Trump era has featured a staggering number of leaks from sources across the federal government, providing bombshell revelations about everything from clandestine meetings with Russian officials to petty infighting at the White House.

title: How the Cavaliers Might Scrape Together a Win in the Finals
description: CLEVELAND  The Cleveland Cavaliers are in trouble. Overwhelming, intimidating trouble. Even LeBron James, whose vast postseason repertory includes some previous escape acts, does not dispute that fact.

title: Reality Winner, N.S.A. Contractor Accused of Leak, Was Undone by Trail of Clues
description: WASHINGTON  In the months after President Trump was elected, Reality Leigh Winner frequently expressed outraged political views about him on social media, in between photos of her cats and favorite quotations. But on the afternoon of May 9, she posted an unusually anodyne message on Facebook, noting that she would be teaching two yoga classes that evening.

title: Meet the Former Extremist Who Flagged a London Attacker in 2015
description: Jesse Morton, a former Al Qaeda recruiter who became an informer, knew the London attacker Khuram Shazad Butt and flagged him to the F.B.I. in a report in 2015.

title: London Attackers Slipped By Despite an Avalanche of Warnings
description: LONDON  Islamic State propaganda had been found in the bag of one attacker while he was trying to board a flight in Italy. An F.B.I. informant said he had raised alarms about the second attacker two years ago. The third attacker, denied asylum in Britain, appeared to have sneaked in from Ireland.

title: Alois Mock, Austrian Who Helped Tear Down Iron Curtain (Literally), Dies at 82
description: Alois Mock, the longtime Austrian foreign minister who snipped open the Iron Curtain with a wire cutter months before the Berlin Wall fell in 1989, died last Thursday. He was 82.

title: Safely Running Down the Clock
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  What is going on in the field of crossword construction these days? Over the weekend, we had a diagramless crossword by Brendan Emmett Quigley where the theme involved shattering someones face. Today, Timothy Polin returns to thematically beat the tar out of us.

title: Review: A Virtuoso of Depression Broods Again in Animal
description: When Rebecca Hall is depressed, attention must be paid. In recent years, this British-American actress has become one of our foremost interpreters of the mood abject, bringing a stinging brightness to pitch-black corners of despair.

title: Ossoff and Handel Joust Over Health Care and Whos the Real Georgian
description: The special election for Georgias Sixth Congressional District feels like it has been going on forever, which might explain why both candidates know their rehearsed lines so well.

title: Pinterest Raises Valuation to $12.3 Billion With New Funding
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Pinterest, the digital scrapbook company, has raised $150 million in a funding that raises its valuation to $12.3 billion.

title: Cuomo Assails Six New York Congressional Republicans
description: ALBANY  During his once-occasional but now overt flirtation with national politics, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has been careful in his choice of targets: Washingtonian dysfunction, for example, or federal meddling in his states affairs. He rarely mentions President Trumps name but can get cantankerous with the White House or the administration.

title: Canada Will Pursue a More Robust Global Role, Minister Says
description: OTTAWA  Canada will increase its military spending and its activities in international organizations as the United States seems to be stepping back from its international role, the countrys foreign affairs minister said on Tuesday.

title: Long-Awaited Plan for Integrating Schools Proves Mostly Small-Bore
description: For months, New York City had promised to deliver what Mayor Bill de Blasio called a bigger vision for integrating the citys racially divided public schools. Activists pressed their ideas. Students rallied on the steps of City Hall to demand a voice.

title: Deadline for States to Meet Obama-Era Emissions Rule Is Extended
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration will extend by one year a deadline for states to comply with a major Obama-era regulation on emissions of a smog-causing pollutant that spews from tailpipes and smokestacks.

title: With Injured Starters Returning, Mets Contemplate 6-Man Rotation
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  A frustrated Jacob deGrom sat in the visitors dugout at Globe Life Park on Tuesday evening, appearing close to tears as Terry Collins, his manager, draped his arm over his shoulder and provided encouragement after his second ragged start in a row.

title: Scooter Gennett Hits Four Home Runs, Joining an Exclusive Club
description: It is accurate to say that Scooter Gennett was unlikely to hit four home runs in a game. His team, the Cincinnati Reds, claimed him off waivers in March. Before Tuesday, he had 38 homers in five seasons. He takes his name from the Muppets character.

title: Inside a Renovated Midcentury Masterpiece
description: Trina Turk, a designer of clothing and home goods, gives a tour of her recently renovated midcentury home, in the hills of Echo Park in Los Angeles. Step inside in 360 degrees.

title: Can a Fake Tan Make You Look Thinner?
description: Rather than roast in the sun, and in all likelihood bring on sun damage, sun spots and other hot weather woes, self-tanner has become a reliable solution for faking a bronzed glow. The formulas have been improved so much  less streaky! less orange!  that, with some practice, you can use them to contour.

title: A Lost John Lautner House Is Found and Restored
description: LOS ANGELES  Three years ago, Trina Turk, a fashion and housewares designer who channels the sunny optimism of California, logged onto the real estate website Curbed.com and felt her blood pressure spike. On that day, the site ran an item about a house designed by the late midcentury architect John Lautner that had mysteriously slipped off the radar for 65 years.

title: Pet Insurance Is the Latest Work Perk
description: Jessica Parsons, an intensive-care nurse in Indianapolis, had given little thought to pet insurance. But when her employer, Indiana University Health, offered it as part of the companys regular benefits package several years ago, she signed up, the $40 monthly premium coming out of her paycheck automatically.

title: Word + Quiz: ambience
Qatar, Theresa May, Paris: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Struggles of Yankees Masahiro Tanaka Deepen Against Red Sox
description: If beating the surging Boston Red Sox were not difficult enough these days, the Yankees tried to do it Tuesday night with one arm seemingly tied behind their back  the one belonging to their putative ace, Masahiro Tanaka.

title: Auction of Rockefeller Art Is to Benefit Charities
description: The personal art collection of Peggy and David Rockefeller will end up at Christies  no surprise, given the return to that auction house from Sothebys of Marc Porter, who has a long working relationship with the Rockefellers.

title: Jack Trout, Who Fought for Consumers Minds and Money, Dies at 82
description: Jack Trout, a marketing strategist who viewed business as a Clausewitzian battlefield in which companies outflank their rivals in part by embedding their messages in consumers minds through a concept known as positioning, died on Sunday in Greenwich, Conn. He was 82.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Queen Sugar and the CMT Music Awards
description: Catch up on Queen Sugar, Oprah Winfrey and Ava DuVernays sexy, sudsy drama, before the second season arrives on OWN. And listen to the Gregg Allman tribute at the CMT Music Awards.

title: A Comic Take on the News
description: Last weekend, The Times Magazine published its first-ever all-comics issue, with 12 tales of the city based on stories from The Timess Metro desk.

title: Right and Left Respond to Trumps Remarks on the London Attacks
description: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. Thats why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and the left that you might not have seen.

title: Questions for: The Empathetic Dog
description: Article: The Empathetic Dog

title: How Do You Photograph Lions? Be as Boring as Possible.
description: Michael Nick Nichols has been photographing wildlife for four decades.

title: I Lost My Voice, but Help Others Find Theirs
description: NASHVILLE  I can tell you the exact moment I realized my voice was broken.

title: Indias Battered Free Press
description: Press freedom in India suffered a fresh blow on Monday when the countrys main investigative agency raided homes and offices connected to the founders of NDTV, Indias oldest television news station. The raids mark an alarming new level of intimidation of Indias news media under Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Yoga Teachers Need a Code of Ethics
description: I was relieved when Bikram Choudhury, the 73-year-old founder of Bikram yoga, was finally served a warrant for his arrest late last month, after failing to pay nearly $7 million in legal fees he owes for a sexual harassment lawsuit. Many in the yoga world had been waiting for that moment, after years of rape and assault claims against Mr. Choudhury, the millionaire creator of a 26-posture hot yoga sequence and studio system. But the news brought only a grim satisfaction; many of us wish hed been arrested for the assault claims themselves.

title: Privacy in the Cellphone Age
description: Odds are you need to use that phone in your pocket many times a day  and doing so leaves you no choice but to constantly relay data revealing your location and movements to Verizon, AT&T or whatever cellphone company you pay for the service. For most people, most of the time, thats not a concern, if theyre aware of it at all. But how easy should it be for the government to get its hands on that data?

title: Donald Trump Is Never to Blame
description: Poor Donald Trump, so late to the lesson that so many plutocrats before him learned: You cant find good help.

title: Trump Lies. China Thrives.
description: One of the many dangers posed to our society by having a president whos a serial liar  and who doesnt behave like an adult, let alone a president  is that we more easily ignore him even if he happens to say something true.

title: A Very British Radical
description: The next Donald Trump  the next populist insurgent, the next outsider riding a wave of anti-establishment discontent, the next dangerous extremist with a chance to grab the reins of state  was supposed to be Marine Le Pen. In the Western press and Western capitals, there was a summons to the barricade when Le Pen reached the French presidential runoff. The liberal order was in the balance, the whiff of fascism was in the air, the entire French political system was expected to do its duty and keep her out of power.

title: States and Cities Compensate for Mr. Trumps Climate Stupidity
description: President Trumps decision to withdraw from the Paris compact on climate change was barely four days old when more than 1,200 governors, mayors and businesses promised to do whatever they could to help the United States meet the climate goals President Barack Obama had committed to in the agreement. In a letter, titled We Are Still In, they declared that global warming imposes real and rising costs, while the clean energy economy to which the Paris agreement aspires presents enormous opportunities for American businesses and workers.

title: Who Is Dangerous, and Who Dies?
description: The death penalty, like abortion, is one of those hot-button topics that keeps popping up into the public consciousness, a roach motel for meretricious ideas and bad public policy  including racism. I would bet that if it involved putting white people to death for killing black people, it would have been abolished years ago. Still, it persists. Except our society  until recently  has come to believe that overt expressions of racism might not be a good thing. Better to keep a fig leaf over it than to explore its underbelly.

title: Congress Must Reauthorize Foreign Surveillance
description: WASHINGTON  Congress will hear testimony on Wednesday on the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act, part of which is set to expire at the end of the year. It will be debating the fate of an authority  the FISA Amendments Act  that has helped thwart terrorist attacks around the world.

title: How Do You Photograph Wild Lions? Be as Boring as Possible.
description: Michael Nick Nichols has been photographing wildlife for four decades, mostly for National Geographic. Now, Aperture Foundation has published A Wild Life: A Visual Biography of Photographer Michael Nichols by Melissa Harris. Mr. Nichols spoke with James Estrin about his life with gorillas, elephants and lions. Their conversation has been edited for brevity and clarity.

title: North Korea Fires More Missiles as Seoul Puts Off U.S. Defense System
description: TOKYO  North Korea fired several cruise missiles from its east coast on Thursday, the South Korean military said. It was the countrys fourth missile test in four weeks, and it occurred just a day after South Koreas new president said his government was suspending the deployment of an American antimissile system.

title: What Song Lyrics Do You Consider Literature?
description: Can song lyrics be literature? Thats the question many asked after Bob Dylan was named the winner of the Nobel Prize in Literature last October, receiving the same award previously given to literary greats like T. S. Eliot, Gabriel Garca Mrquez, Toni Morrison and Samuel Beckett.

title: Murder Victims Earliest Arrests in New Jersey
description: In one of her earliest arrests known to the state police, a woman identifying herself as Evelyn Moore was charged with embezzlement in Atlantic County, N.J. That name, and others the woman used in later arrests, would form the trail of breadcrumbs that led to her likely true identity and background far from where she was killed in New York.

title: Praise for Fingerprint Find in Unsolved Murder
description: In a thank-you letter, a police captain commended a medical examiner's techniques in lifting usable fingerprints from a decomposed body in the 1970 investigation of a Jane Doe murdered in upstate New York.

title: Santander Rescues Troubled Rival in Test of Europes New Rules
description: After the global financial crisis, Europe built a system designed to contain the collateral damage from failing banks. That new system appeared to pass its first test on Wednesday, as authorities efficiently dispatched a troubled Spanish lender.

title: This Is Still All About Brexit: Readers on the British Election
description: On June 8, Britain goes to the polls in a snap election unexpectedly called by Prime Minister Theresa May. Originally predicted to be a landslide victory for the Conservative Party, polls show the Labour Party, under Jeremy Corbyn, closing the gap. Could there be an electoral upset of Trump-like proportions?

title: 1968 Arrest in Harlem in Unsolved Murder Case
description: A woman using the name Fannie Hill was arrested in 1968 in Harlem when she was caught carrying a loaded pistol. The name and others the suspect used over the years would help lead to the likely true identity of a 1970 murder victim found in the woods in upstate New York.

title: Arrest Report Offers Names of Murder Victim's Associates
description: The woman who gave various names when she was arrested offered another one in this 1969 drug case in Harlem  one that belonged to someone close to her. The name of a companion in the vehicle that day has been partially redacted by The New York Times at his request, as the murder of the arrested woman remains unsolved.

title: 1938 Map of Birthplace of Murder Victim
description: A map of Orangeburg County, S.C., in 1938, with what was then called Old Reevesville Road highlighted. The road has since been moved in places and renamed, and gone are any trace of the houses on its north end in 1940, when a census worker visited. Among those living there was a 4-month-old named Evelyn Moore.

title: 1940 Census Report With Moore Family
description: A 1940 census report in Orangeburg County, S.C., listed Fanny Moore, a first and last name used in previous arrest reports, and Elvin Moore as 4 months old  corresponding to the date of birth of Dec. 3, 1939, that was given by the woman arrested in 1968. The report also detailed pay history for families.

title: In a New Crime Lineup, a Supine Swede and Private Eyes With Bad Habits
description: Mycroft Holmes, Sherlocks older, fatter, smarter brother, was renowned for solving mysteries without leaving his armchair at the Diogenes Club. In Josephine Teys The Daughter of Time, Inspector Alan Grant of Scotland Yard was confined to a hospital bed when he tackled the historical crime of the murdered princes in the Tower. And Rex Stouts corpulent genius, Nero Wolfe, investigated criminal cases without budging from his elegant Manhattan townhouse.

title: In Washington, a New Appreciation of American Gardens
description: The United States has a rich yet relatively unknown tradition of beautiful gardens, said Cindy Brown, the education and collections manager at the Smithsonian Gardens in Washington. Gardens in this country date back to the 17th century and continue to be an attraction today, she said, but most people arent aware of how many of them there are and dont necessarily think of them as destinations.

title: Marc Maron Is Coming Around to Being Famous
description: Youve been hosting your interview podcast for eight years. How has it changed you? It has helped me become a more fully realized adult. Talking to other people so often, for such a long time, in such a relatively deep way, has taught me how to be a lot more reconnected with my empathy and not be so self-involved.

title: How Russian Propaganda Spread From a Parody Website to Fox News
description: A false report claiming a Russian warplane took out the communications systems of an American warship spread with alarming ease.

title: She Had Never Suffered From Anxiety. Was She Having Her First Panic Attack?
description: She didnt have any urgent medical problems, the woman told Dr. Lori Bigi. She was there because she had moved to Pittsburgh and needed a primary-care doctor.

title: Your Guide to All the Comey News Heading Into His Testimony
description: James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director, is set to testify in front of the Senate Intelligence Committee on Thursday, starting at 10 a.m. Watch Mr. Comeys testimony and follow live coverage and analysis throughout the day.

title: Even After Landslides, You Can Still Visit Big Sur
description: Following a series of landslides and a bridge collapse in early February, which led to the temporary closing of many hotels and restaurants and put tourism to the region at a standstill, much of Big Sur in California is once again welcoming travelers.

title: Feminism Takes Form in Essays, Questions and Manifestos
description: DEAR IJEAWELE, Or, A Feminist Manifesto in Fifteen Suggestions By Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie 63 pp. Knopf, $15.

title: Does My Ex Owe Something to Our Grown Children?
description: After 25 years of marriage and three children, my husband and I divorced. He was a former seminarian and a pro-life Catholic when we married. He insisted on no birth control. When we divorced, he was a lawyer and vice president of a Fortune 500 company. I did not receive any spousal support, but he promised he would always be there for the children. I worked hard and was always able to take care of myself. I felt guilty about the divorce and never asked for more.

title: Can a New Generation in the Banlieues Change French Politics?
description: On Feb. 2, around a quarter to 5 in the afternoon, just as the day began to darken, police officers approached four young men outside a recording studio in the Rose des Vents, an agglomeration of chalky cits, or public-housing projects, that covers a remote expanse of the northeast Paris suburb Aulnay-sous-Bois. The police asked to see one mans identity papers. Within minutes, another was on his stomach. The officers put handcuffs on the 21-year-old, whose family, of Congolese origin, lived nearby. When they arrived at the station, staff members noticed that he was in a lot of pain. He was rushed to a hospital, where an examination revealed a 10-centimeter tear in his rectum. It had been caused by a police baton.

title: How Student Loan Forgiveness Changed Graduates Paths
description: For Dr. Charles Phillips, the governments public service loan forgiveness program meant he could spend his days researching childhood cancer, rather than starting a lucrative pediatrics practice.

title: Robot Cars Cant Count on Us in an Emergency
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Three years ago, Googles self-driving car project abruptly shifted from designing a vehicle that would drive autonomously most of the time while occasionally requiring human oversight, to a slow-speed robot without a brake pedal, accelerator or steering wheel. In other words, human driving was no longer permitted.

title: At Bill Cosby Trial, Andrea Constand Battles Defense Lawyers
description: Andrea Constand completed her second and final day of testimony after nearly five more hours of questioning by an attorney for Bill Cosby, who challenged her account that Mr. Cosby drugged and sexually assaulted her at his home outside Philadelphia in 2004.

title: Edgewater, N.J.: A Riverside Borough, With Quirks
description: Hugging the Hudson River, Edgewater is home to a colony of Quaker parrots, an exotic Japanese food hall and a swamped historic ferryboat.

title: Clues to a Jane Does Beginning 30 Years Before Her Violent End
description: BOWMAN, S.C.  Weathers Farms grows corn, cotton, soybeans and peanuts off a dirt road called Wayside Drive. I stood at a gate alongside the property, peering past trees toward where a house once would have stood, teeming with three generations of a family now long gone.

title: Edgewater, N.J.: A Riverside Borough, With Quirks
description: Five years ago, Aline and Jack Tabibian moved from Tenafly, N.J., to Edgewater, a borough in Bergen County that is proportioned like a rasher of bacon. Three and a half miles long, and a few blocks wide at its broadest, Edgewater skims the west side of the Hudson River, from North Bergen to Fort Lee.

title: Solved: The 47-Year Mystery of a Murder Victims Many Identities
description: She was buried Nov. 7, 1970, in plot No. 537 of a potters field in Middletown, N.Y. In the cemeterys record book, where her name should have been, someone wrote a single word.

title: Reality Winner, Accused of Leaks, Becomes a Late-Night Sensation
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: At Least 12 Killed in Pair of Terrorist Attacks in Iran
description: Armed assailants, including some disguised as women, stunned Iran on Wednesday with brazen attacks on the Parliament building and the tomb of its revolutionary founder, the worst terrorist strike to hit the Islamic republic in years.

title: James Comey, Iran, Scooter Gennett: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Democrats Keep Losing, but They May Be on Track to Win
description: The presidents approval ratings are stuck in the upper 30s, and the party out of power typically does well in off-year elections. But so far, Democrats dont have any big wins to show for it.

title: Morning Agenda: A Spanish Banking Rescue
description: Santander, the largest bank in Spain, has said that it will acquire its Spanish rival Banco Popular, after the European Central Bank determined that the smaller lender was failing or likely to fail.

title: The Daily: The View From Kabul
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Why Running May Be Good for Your Back
description: People who regularly run or walk briskly appear to have healthier discs in their spines than people who do not exercise, according to one of the first studies to closely examine links between movement and disc health.

title: Yoga With Cats
description: They yowl. They attack ponytails. They scamper urgently across the room in pursuit of things we cannot see.

title: The Telltale Data That Can Identify College Students at Risk
description: WASHINGTON  Administrators at the University of Kansas knew they had a problem: Many of their most vulnerable students  largely low income and often the first in their families to go to college  were not graduating. The administrators needed to figure out why students like this were struggling. So they did something that those in higher education rarely do: They looked to a competitor for help.

title: Helping Students Avoid the Trap of College Costs
description: Student loan debt is the second-fastest growing type of debt in the United States, behind only home mortgages. After more than doubling in a decade, it now exceeds $1.2 trillion, with the average borrower owing about $30,000, according to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. More than a quarter of student loan borrowers are delinquent or in default.

title: Preparing Emerging Adults for College and Beyond
description: Rachel Ginsberg is a clinical psychologist at the NewYork-Presbyterian Youth Anxiety Center, a research and clinical program that brings together experts from NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital, Columbia University Medical Center and Weill Cornell Medicine. She is part of its Launching Emerging Adults Program aimed at teenagers and young adults.

title: At Ithaca College, a President Focused on Diversity
description: Students at Ithaca College who sign up for intergroup dialogues in the coming semesters may have some interesting classmates: their professors.

title: Honing a Vision for Higher Education
description: Some of the nations most influential leaders in higher education met last week at the Higher Ed Leaders Forum hosted by The New York Times. They discussed an array of issues facing colleges and universities today, including high costs, free speech, addressing the skills gap, using big data and leading in a time of crisis. The excerpts below have been edited. Videos of the full sessions can be found online at www.nythigheredleaders.com.

title: Where to Turn to When Youre First in the Family to Go to College
description: Dennis Di Lorenzos parents never went to college. They were blue-collar people who believed in hard work but not necessarily the hard work of higher education.

title: Higher Education Seeks Answers to Leaner Years
description: With an important source of revenue down and the flow of customers flattening out, one of the biggest businesses in Georgia  its public university system  is turning to a strategy of consolidations and mergers to improve efficiency and cut costs.

title: Colleges Get Proactive in Addressing Depression on Campus
description: Hailey Kim, who came from South Korea to study pharmacy at Rutgers Universitys campus in New Brunswick, found herself at the entrance of the schools mental health center, terrified of going in or walking away.

title: With Innovation, Colleges Fill the Skills Gap
description: How large is the so-called skills gap?

title: Germany to Withdraw Forces From Incirlik Base in Turkey
description: BERLIN  Germany said on Wednesday that it would withdraw its forces from a military base in southern Turkey after the government of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan refused to guarantee visits to forces there by German lawmakers, deepening a rift between the NATO allies.

title: New York Today: Meet Our N.B.A. Dancers
description: Updated, 8:36 a.m.

title: A Climb Out of Depression, Doubt and Academic Failure
description: Varsha Srivastava, 20, appeared to have the perfect college experience at Boston University. She was in the College of Communication, worked on a campus podcast, was a swim instructor and played club water polo. But emotionally, she was falling apart. Her story has been edited and condensed.

title: Movers: R.B.S. May Avoid Trial and a Spanish Banking Takeover
description: Were following major market developments throughout the day.

title: Wreckage of Missing Myanmar Military Plane Is Found
description: YANGON, Myanmar  Searchers found bodies and debris on Thursday from a military transport plane that disappeared with 122 people on board shortly after taking off Wednesday afternoon from an air base in southern Myanmar, military officials said.

title: Trump Picks Christopher Wray to Be F.B.I. Director
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump on Wednesday announced that he had selected Christopher A. Wray to be his F.B.I. director, turning to a former federal prosecutor who recently defended Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey in the so-called Bridgegate scandal to lead an agency under a harsh political spotlight.

title: Year-End Roundup, 2016-17 | All Our Lesson Plans, All in One Place
description: Happy June! At the end of every academic year, we collect all the lesson plans weve published and list them in a directory of sorts for teachers.

title: Take a Lap in the Worlds Most Dangerous Race
description: The Isle of Man TT motorcycle race has claimed the lives of 146 riders since 1907. Here are the deadly turns, colorful characters and rich history along the course.

title: Indonesias Pluralists Made Her a Hero, but Spotlight Brings Suspicion
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Just a few weeks ago she was a shy, bookish high school student from a small town in the Indonesian province of East Java who liked to raid her local library and pull books randomly from the shelves.

title: Backing Up Your Backup Drive
description: Q. I keep my photos, videos and other multimedia files stored on an external USB drive to save space on my computers main hard drive, and I also back up vital folders there. But how do I back up the external drive in case it goes south?

title: California Today: A C.E.O.s Challenge: Adopt a School
description: Good morning.

title: Facebooks Role in European Elections Under Scrutiny
description: Lawrence Dodd lives in one of Britains most fiercely fought voting districts, and he has been peppered almost daily with ads from the countrys major political parties on Facebook. About a month ago, he tried to find out why.

title: How the Iran Terror Attacks Unfolded at Two Sites
description: Suicide bombers and gunmen wielding assault rifles attacked Irans Parliament building and the mausoleum of the countrys founder on Wednesday in a bloody siege that left at least a dozen people dead.

title: Hungry and Rising, Dominic Thiem Ousts Novak Djokovic at French Open
description: PARIS  Sitting courtside at the French Open on Wednesday, close enough to hear the ball bouncing off the damp red clay, you were also close enough to sense the hunger gap.

title: A Human Rights Defender, Facing the Death Penalty
description: Dr. Mudawi Ibrahim is a globally renowned human rights defender, risking his life to protest killings in Darfur and to ease the suffering of others around Sudan. Now he is in prison in Sudan, facing charges that could lead to the death penalty. Here, his family speaks out.

title: A Guide to Challenges Facing Self-Driving Car Technologists
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In the minds of many in Silicon Valley and in the auto industry, it is inevitable that cars will eventually drive themselves. It is simply a matter of how long it will take for the technology to be reliably safe.

title: What You Get for $800,000
description: A Greek Revival-style house in Canaan, N.H., a midcentury modern home in Seattle and a 1747 house in Philadelphia.

title: $800,000 Homes in New Hampshire, Washington and Pennsylvania
A Penthouse in Stockholms Ostermalm District
description: Once an attic, the 2,500-square-foot space features crisp white walls, sloping ceilings and a terrace.

title: House Hunting in  Sweden
description: AN ATTIC APARTMENT NEAR THE CENTER OF STOCKHOLM

title: Brownback Tax Cuts Set Off a Revolt by Kansas Republicans
description: Gov. Sam Brownbacks leadership of Kansas came to be synonymous with a single, unyielding philosophy: Cut taxes, cut the size of government, and the state will thrive.

title: New York Times Co. Promotes Executive to Chief Operating Officer
description: The New York Times announced on Wednesday that it had promoted Meredith Kopit Levien, who had been its chief revenue officer since 2015, to executive vice president and chief operating officer, as part of a restructuring of The Timess digital departments.

title: Vibrant and Seductive Seville, Easy on the Wallet
description: I watched the dancer, Yasaray Rodrguez, seated on stage perfectly upright and immaculately dressed, listening to the accompanying guitar player. A vocalist began to cry out a song of pain or lost love  folk melodies in harsh quarter-tones, like a muezzin issuing a call to prayer at a mosque.

title: Top U.S. Security Officials Testify Amid Furor Over Russian Meddling
description: Four top national security officials testified on Capitol Hill on Wednesday amid a swirl of developments in the Trump administration.

title: How to Keep Your College Admission Offer: Start With Digital Literacy
description: Harvard has rescinded acceptance offers to at least 10 incoming freshmen who posted offensive jokes about school shootings, the Holocaust, bestiality and the death of children and minorities  among other obscene topics  to a private Facebook group.

title: In World Cup Qualifiers, U.S. Soccer Team Faces an Old Foe: Altitude
description: Herculez Gomez had been playing professional soccer in Mexico for several years when he arrived with the United States national team for a vital World Cup qualifier at Azteca Stadium in 2013.

title: The Comey Testimony: When, Where and How to Follow
description: WASHINGTON  James B. Comey, the former director of the F.B.I., will be testifying in front of the Senate Intelligence Committee on Thursday. Here is a quick breakdown of how you can follow along.

title: Freestyle Fried Rice
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: The Mayors of Pittsburgh and Paris: We Have Our Own Climate Deal
description: Last week, President Donald Trump tried to pit our two cities against each other when he announced, in pulling out of the Paris Agreement on Climate Change, I was elected to represent the citizens of Pittsburgh, not Paris. As the mayors of Pittsburgh and Paris, were here to say that were more united than ever.

title: Two-Tone Timepieces are a Hit with Young Watch Buyers
description: As a sports superstar andfashion avatar, David Beckham has done his part to infuse newsboy caps, fauxhawk haircuts, neck tattoos and overtight underwear with an air of cool. Can he do the same for two-tone watches?

title: Why Car Companies Are Hiring Computer Security Experts
description: It started about seven years ago. Irans top nuclear scientists were being assassinated in a string of similar attacks: Assailants on motorcycles were pulling up to their moving cars, attaching magnetic bombs and detonating them after the motorcyclists had fled the scene.

title: A U-Boat Strikes and Terror Follows on the High Seas
description: If you envisioned World War I, your minds eye probably conjured the stinking trenches of the Western Front, where a perennially stalemated war of attrition was waged, or the unforgiving Atlantic Ocean, where German submarines struck suddenly and decisively against Allied shipping.

title: Daily Report: When Robots Cant Trust Humans
description: One thing about being a technology pioneer is that you get to discover problems before anyone else. So it was with Google and its self-driving car project.

title: River to River Festival Puts Dance in Unexpected Places
description: A moat on Governors Island, a Wall Street intersection and a South Street Seaport Museum gallery are among the places where dance can be found in this years River to River Festival. Presented by the Lower Manhattan Cultural Council and opening on Wednesday, June 14, the festival plants existing work in unexpected contexts and commissions new site-specific pieces. Even if it werent free (it is), the lineup would still be enticing. The first week brings remixes of modern classics by Netta Yerushalmy, who will deconstruct Martha Grahams Night Journey and Alvin Aileys Revelations at the National Museum of the American Indian. Jodi Melnick unveils an outdoor work at Fort Jay on Governors Island, and Beth Gills haunting Catacomb, created last year for the Chocolate Factory Theater, finds a new home in Federal Hall. Also look out for Faye Driscoll and Maria Hassabi. (Through June 25; lmcc.net.)

title: Feist and Nick Cave Exorcise Different Kinds of Demons
description: The pain and sorrow are unambiguous on Feists new album, Pleasure, a set of lo-fi songs that confront and seek to exorcise heartache, loneliness, betrayal and despair. Her melodies are still gracefully idiosyncratic, but she places them in settings far less glossy than her previous recordings. Some are raucous, some desolate, and live performance could make them cathartic. (Saturday, June 10, through Monday, Town Hall; bowerypresents.com.)

title: The Tunnel Returns to PBS, With New Helpings of Noir Shadows
description: For fans of the The Bridge, the Scandinavian noir with the captivatingly oddball detective Saga Noren at its dark heart, The Tunnel sounded like another loop on the thrill ride: It co-opted the originals premise  a body positioned on the international border of the Oresund Bridge linking Sweden and Denmark  and transported it to the Channel Tunnel between France and Britain. In its first season, it echoed The Bridge  a bummer, given its top-notch stars (Clmence Posy and Stephen Dillane) and a sinister port setting on the Strait of Dover.

title: Theresa May Stumbles Awkwardly to Election Day
description: BATH, England  The British prime ministers blue battle bus had just arrived for a campaign stop at a factory when the booing started.

title: Black Queer Brooklyn on Film Focuses on Diverse Voices
description: For those with a limited attention span or little time, short films can offer something appealing: brevity without necessarily sacrificing quality. Some short productions can peel back layers of emotion, stoke a discussion or propel the career of a budding director.

title: A Mens Label, Born on Instagram
description: Two men  one in Miami, the other in New York, both passionate about suits  stumble upon each other on Instagram. They feel a connection. Mutual respect on social media turns into real-life camaraderie. They meet, they click, they draw up a plan.

title: Birth of the Hot: Salsa in New York
description: Just as New Orleans gave birth to jazz around the turn of the 20th century, New York gave birth to a new sound in the 60s and 70s. It was music for dancing, a delirious blend of African and Caribbean sounds, peppered with polyrhythm. Its pioneers, mostly of Puerto Rican and Cuban descent, took those influences and created something new: salsa. (Thats right, this stuff was made in New York City!)

title: Lobbyists, Industry Lawyers Were Granted Ethics Waivers to Work in Trump Administration
description: WASHINGTON  Lance Leggitt helped collect $400,000 in fees last year while working as a lobbyist to try to influence Medicare policy at the Department of Health and Human Services  an agency where he now serves as chief of staff.

title: Cristiano Ronaldos New Denim Line (and Other Must-Haves for Summer)
description: I have a tried-and-true uniform that I can throw on when I wake up and wear all day without trying too hard, said the designerJeff Halmos, whom fashion fans know as a founder of the much-missed mens wear brands Trovata and Shipley & Halmos.

title: On Wonder Woman
description: To the Editor:

title: Defying Trump, Hawaii Becomes First State to Pass Law Committing to Paris Climate Accord
description: Hawaii on Tuesday became the first state to pass a law committing to the goals and limits of the Paris climate accord, defying President Trump, who announced last week that he would withdraw the United States from the historic agreement.

title: Who is Christopher Wray? Trumps F.B.I. Pick Is Said to Be Low-Key and Principled
description: WASHINGTON  Christopher A. Wray was the governments top criminal prosecutor in 2004 when the F.B.I. director, Robert S. Mueller III, and the deputy attorney general, James B. Comey, threatened to quit the Bush administration over a controversial surveillance program. He offered to join their protest.

title: Oldest Fossils of Homo Sapiens Found in Morocco, Altering History of Our Species
description: Fossils discovered in Morocco are the oldest known remains of Homo sapiens, scientists reported on Wednesday, a finding that rewrites the story of mankinds origins and suggests that our species evolved in multiple locations across the African continent.

title: Five Big Tech Stocks Build Market Euphoria, and Jitters
description: Facebook. Amazon. Apple. Netflix. Google.

title: The Democrats and Labor
description: To the Editor:

title: The Handmaids Tale Season 1, Episode 9: Hes Coming for Me
description: The character of Janine has grated on me from the beginning. Would commanders really be O.K. with a handmaid who had obvious mental health issues that could easily be passed along to any of her children? It seemed like an extension of a troubling occurrence Ive recognized throughout the television landscape  using mental illness as a plot device but rarely portraying it with any nuance. Madeline Brewers nervy, childlike performance also left me confused as to whether Janine was meant to be an object of empathy or pity. But this weeks episode, the penultimate of this first season, explores Janines precarious place within Gilead with emotional depth.

title: The Met Orchestra Aids and Abets Operatic Dabblers
description: Mahler, Schumann, Sibelius: All three dabbled in opera, but none produced a stage work that has come anywhere near the standard repertory. So for the Met Orchestra, these composers styles are relatively unfamiliar.

title: The U.S. Wont Actually Leave the Paris Climate Deal Anytime Soon
description: Last week, President Trump announced that the United States would withdraw from the Paris climate agreement. But it will take more than one speech to pull out: Under the rules of the deal, which the White House says it will follow, the earliest any country can leave is Nov. 4, 2020. That means the United States will remain a party to the accord for nearly all of Mr. Trumps current term, and it could still try to influence the climate talks during that span.

title: Preventing School Abuse
description: To the Editor:

title: The Secret Social Media Lives of Teenagers
description: Earlier this week, Harvard University revealed that it had rescinded admissions offers to at least 10 students who shared offensive images within what they thought was a private Facebook group chat. The students posted memes and images that mocked minority groups, child abuse, sexual assault and the Holocaust, among other things.

title: The Antithesis of Amazons Retail Shop
description: To the Editor:

title: An Impartial Supreme Court
description: To the Editor:

title: The Artificial Jungle, in the Ridiculous Spirit of Charles Ludlam
description: Charles Ludlam, who founded the Ridiculous Theatrical Company (more absurd than absurdist theater), died too young in 1987, but his influence lives on in performers like Charles Busch and Penny Arcade  and, of course, Everett Quinton.

title: How to Be Mindful With a Barking Dog
description: Dogs have two ways of communicating; body language and barking, says Joanne Ometz, founder of Mindfulness For Dogs. Barking can be disconcerting to humans, especially when it seems to go on forever, and can bring up feelings of frustration and even anger. Approaching barking with mindfulness can help transform it from a source of agitation to an opportunity for practice.

title: Media Criticism From a Proud Deplorable
description: To the Editor:

title: A Special Performance by Alicia Keys
description: Alicia Keys performs at the Veuve Clicquot Polo Classic 10th Anniversary.

title: The Eventologists
description: Is the polo field up to snuff? Neil Patrick Harris and Lucy Hale investigate.

title: A Really Cool Gig: Playing Piano for Bob Dylans Nobel Lecture
description: When Bob Dylans Nobel lecture was released on Monday, the transcript was accompanied by an audio recording of Mr. Dylan reading his speech with an unusual sonic touch: jazzy piano chords floating in the background.

title: Read James Comeys Prepared Remarks for Testimony
description: The former F.B.I. director is scheduled to testify before the Senate Intelligence Committee on Thursday. Following are his prepared remarks to open the public hearing.

title: Comey Says Trump Pressured Him to Lift the Cloud of Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  From his first days in office, President Trump repeatedly put pressure on his F.B.I. director, James B. Comey. He demanded loyalty. He asked that an investigation into an adviser be dropped. And he implored Mr. Comey to publicly clear his name.

title: Texas Teacher Who Gave Student Most Likely to Become a Terrorist Award Is Out of a Job
description: A teacher at a Texas middle school is out of a job after she gave mock awards to students that included designations like most likely to become a terrorist and most likely to blend in with white people, the school district and local media reports said.

title: The Dysfunction Surrounding Trump
description: To the Editor:

title: Tech Roundup: Remember Chain Letters? Hackers Do
description: Ransomware, a form of malicious software, has been making headlines in recent weeks. A particularly nasty strain of it took over hundreds of thousands of computers in 74 countries in about a day.

title: Creative Time Director Is Stepping Down
description: Creative Time is once again seeking a leader. Katie Hollander, who was appointed executive director of the prominent New York nonprofit arts organization in January 2016, will step down. Alyssa Nitchun, the current deputy director, will serve as acting director while a search committee looks for a replacement.

title: Ideas Sparked by the Ebbs and Flows of Twitter Conversations
description: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Jenna Wortham, a staff writer for The New York Times Magazine and co-host of the Still Processing podcast, discussed the tech she is using.

title: How Much Did That Zipper Cost? With Transparency Pricing, You Know Everything
