description: The lawsuit filed by victims of the Pulse nightclub shooting against the G4S, the security firm that employed the gunman, Omar Mateen.

title: Trump Commits United States to Defending NATO Nations
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump on Friday reaffirmed the longstanding United States commitment to come to the defense of any NATO members that are attacked, more than two weeks after his refusal to do so during a trip to Europe stirred resentment among Americas traditional allies.

title: Glass Eels: See-Through, Slippery and Guided by Magnetism and Tides
description: European eels are born and die in the North Atlantic Ocean, but spend most of their lives in rivers or estuaries across Europe and North Africa.

title: Success Academy Wins Round in Fight Over Preschool Oversight
description: Success Academy and other charter schools won a victory in a long-running dispute with New York City when a state appeals court ruled on Thursday that the city cannot regulate a charter schools prekindergarten programs.

title: Review: Kafka With Puppets, Ghost Light and Shadows
description: If youve ever seen a performance presented by the Tank, youll recognize the distinctive preshow patter: a request for cash, immediately followed by an endearing offer of help. If youre too broke to donate to the organizations members, they say, youre probably an artist. Maybe you could use some of their free rehearsal and performance space?

title: Cosby Trial Is a Big Deal in a Small Town, but Hardly a Media Circus
description: NORRISTOWN, Pa.  The coffee was just about pouring itself on Monday at the Sessano Cafe here, across the street from the Montgomery County Courthouse, where one of the most high-profile celebrity trials in decades is taking place. Pot after pot emptied  five times the usual amount  as television crews jockeyed to position their trucks outside.

title: Vaqueras collection inspired by The Handmaids Tale
description: Looks from the collection sponsored by Hulu

title: The Handmaids Tale Goes High Fashion
description: Beneath the soaring ceilings of a restored neo-Gothic synagogue on the Lower East Side, models stomped heavily across a lit stage, wearing outfits in white and red, and shoes with elongated toes as eerie, jarring music blasted from the speakers.

title: Corrections: June 10, 2017
description: NEW YORK

title: Isabelle Rapin, Who Advanced Concept of an Autism Spectrum, Dies at 89
description: Isabelle Rapin, a Swiss-born child neurologist who helped establish autisms biological underpinnings and advanced the idea that autism was part of a broad spectrum of disorders, died on May 24 in Rhinebeck, N.Y. She was 89.

title: The Rays Are Playing a Traditional Doubleheader. By Choice.
description: MINNEAPOLIS  In September, when the Tampa Bay Rays announced their 2017 home schedule, it included something so unusual that some of their players didnt quite grasp the concept. There would be, on Saturday, June 10, an old-fashioned, conventional doubleheader, two games for a single-admission price.

title: Drivers Head Into Summer With a Gift at the Gas Pump
description: HOUSTON  Looking for an excuse to pack up the car for a road trip this weekend?

title: A War of Their Own
description: In the spring of 1967, I was a 22-year-old Special Forces lieutenant at a hilltop base in Vietnam near the Cambodian border. My soldiers were Montagnards, people native to the highlands and ethnically distinct from the lowland Vietnamese, whom they saw as colonialists intent on taking their land and changing their way of life. They were almost all members of a rebel organization called Fulro, a French acronym for the United Liberation Front for the Oppressed Races, dedicated to driving the Vietnamese from the highlands. Its base was somewhere beyond the border, beyond the ancient Angkor road, beyond the rivers that all ran west, glinting beneath the haze.

title: Pandora, Faded Star of Online Music, Gets Cash Infusion From Sirius XM
description: Pandora was early to the online music business, introducing a free internet radio service just a few years after Apple started iTunes and enjoying a successful debut as a public company.

title: The British Election: What Happened and Whats Next?
description: Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain suffered a humiliating setback in the 2017 general election. Her opponent Jeremy Corbyn, the Labour leader, re-energized his party and altered the landscape of British politics. So what's next?

title: Opposition Leader Tests Public Support for Bid to Topple Putin
description: MOSCOW  It would be three days before the fierce Kremlin critic Aleksei A. Navalny would bring his against-all-odds presidential campaign to the provincial city of Vladimir, but officials at the local university were taking no chances. About 100 students were ordered into the main auditorium to watch two short films attacking the opposition leader as both a United States State Department stooge and a would-be Nazi-saluting Hitler.

title: Nero Rock Opera Is a Burning Issue in Rome
description: ROME  The emperor Nero and the city of Rome have always had a strained history. So it should come as no surprise that a recent attempt to resurrect that tyrant through a song-and-dance extravaganza titled Divo Nerone  Opera Rock provoked a fiery debate here after state culture officials allowed the construction of a sizable theater for it smack in the middle of Romes main archaeological site.

title: I Had No Choice, Minnesota Officer Testifies on Shooting
description: ST. PAUL  When the world glimpsed Officer Jeronimo Yanez in a Facebook Live video last summer, his gun was pointed through the window of Philando Castiles Oldsmobile. The patrolmans voice was elevated. He shouted expletives. He claimed he opened fire because Mr. Castile was reaching for a gun.

title: Jimmy Piersalls Raw and Memorable Coaching
description: The longtime major-league outfielder Jimmy Piersall died last week in Wheaton, Ill. To many, he was a talented and eccentric All-Star from another era who ran the bases backward after his 100th home run. Others knew him from the book and the movie about his struggles with mental illness (Fear Strikes Out). To me, he was a coach, one of the most influential of my career.

title: Trump Calls Comey a Leaker. What Does That Mean?
description: WASHINGTON  James B. Comeys testimony on Thursday that he orchestrated the disclosure of his account of his discussions with President Trump has raised questions about the ethical and legal implications of his actions.

title: Lena Dunham: Losing Birth Control Could Mean a Life of Pain
description: I was 12 the first time I felt the crippling cramps. I hadnt yet gotten my period and was happily running around a state fair with my best friend, mouth full of cotton candy, when it hit me: a steady drum of pain beneath my pubic bone, a throbbing in my back that made its way down both my legs. I fell to the muddy ground. Suddenly the Ferris wheel was a nightmare, the carnival games distorted and unpleasant. I blacked out.

title: Amid Defensive Woes, Mets Try to Avoid Fumbling Top Prospects Call-Up
description: It has reached the point in the Mets dispiriting season that every time Asdrubal Cabrera does not field a ball cleanly fans wonder if their shortstop of the future  the top prospect Amed Rosario  could have made the play.

title: Comeys Testimony Was Ratings Gold, Even at 10 A.M.
description: It was the testimony of a once-obscure former law enforcement official. Before the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence. At 10 in the morning. On a workday.

title: What Turned the British Election? Maybe the Youth Vote
description: LONDON  As Britain took stock on Friday of the stunning results of a snap election that wiped out the parliamentary majority of Prime Minister Theresa May and her governing Conservative Party, one narrative bubbled up to the surface: The youth had spoken.

title: Stan Wawrinka Endures a Marathon to Reach a Crucible
description: PARIS  Stan Wawrinka has been late to the party, yet very much the life of the party, when it comes to Grand Slam finals.

title: Yankees Push Masahiro Tanakas Start Back by a Day to Try to End His Slump
description: Amid a surprisingly strong start by the Yankees this season, the task of getting Masahiro Tanaka back on track has proved a confounding one for the team. So as Tanaka, the ostensible ace, wallows in the worst slump of his professional career, the Yankees have decided he will not make his scheduled start on Sunday against the Baltimore Orioles at Yankee Stadium.

title: Quotation of the Day: Trump Accuses Comey of Lying to the Senate
description: I didnt say that. And thered be nothing wrong if I did say it.

title: Washington Remembers Brzezinski, and a Very Different Era
description: WASHINGTON  One after another, the mourners filed into the stately Cathedral of St. Matthew  ambassadors, cabinet secretaries, television hosts, a president  hunkering together behind the grand doors, at least for a little while, to consider a man and a capital from a bygone political moment most seemed to prefer.

title: Trump Talks; America Trembles
description: You know, it might be less terrifying if Donald Trump had cannily tried to obstruct justice, plying his F.B.I. director with flattery and carefully scripted suggestions.

title: Chana Bloch, Poet and Hebrew Translator, Is Dead at 77
description: Chana Bloch, a poet and an acclaimed translator of Hebrew verse whose intimate lyrics explored the mysteries and pains of love, her own illness and the unraveling of her first marriage, died on May 19 at her home in Berkeley, Calif. She was 77.

title: What to Cook, Watch, Listen To and More This Weekend
description: Psst. Hey you. Got a secret.

title: Exxon Mobil Calls Emissions Inquiry a Political Witch Hunt
description: Exxon Mobil, in a court filing on Friday, accused the New York attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, of abuse of the powers of his office in his investigation of the oil company.

title: Masquerading as Reporter, Assassin Hunted Putin Foes in Ukraine
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Ukrainians have long struggled with fake news from Russia, but last week, they discovered something even more insidious: a fake journalist.

title: Trump Picks the Wrong Fight on Infrastructure
description: Lacking a real plan to fix the countrys roads, bridges and water systems, President Trump on Friday trained his guns on the phantom menace of cumbersome regulations that he said were delaying much-needed public works projects.

title: Yoenis Cespedes Is Set to Return to the Mets, and None Too Soon
description: ATLANTA  The Mets may not be whole again for several more months, but at least on Saturday, they will welcome back an important part of their team. Yoenis Cespedes, the Mets All-Star outfielder and highest-paid player, will be activated from the disabled list.

title: For the First Time, 45 Counties Could Have No Insurer in the Obamacare Marketplaces
description: Maps showing places that are at risk of having one or no insurance carrier in 2018.

title: Obamas Global Visits Inspire Wistful Comparisons of Then and Now
description: WASHINGTON  Sleeves rolled up and tieless, with a candle glowing between them, the two friends slid into a booth next to the kitchen at Liverpool House, a cozy seafood place in a hip Montreal neighborhood. They chatted over oysters, Nova Scotia halibut and a rib steak for two.

title: Settlements for Company Sins Can No Longer Aid Other Projects, Sessions Says
description: When companies settle claims of wrongdoing, they are often compelled to pay for environmental or community development projects as well as pay fines and direct compensation to victims. Sometimes the third-party payments are only marginally related to the damages caused by the companys actions.

title: Kansas Man Indicted on Hate Crime Charges in Shooting of Indian Immigrants
description: A white man accused of opening fire on two Indian immigrants at a Kansas bar in February in a shooting that heightened international concern about American hostility toward foreigners has been indicted on federal hate crime charges, the Justice Department announced Friday.

title: The Year of Voting Recklessly
description: In the last year there have been four touchstone elections in the West: two in Britain, one in the U.S., one in France. Two of these were disasters, one was nearly so, and one was a huge relief. None went according to script.

title: Glenne Headly, a Versatile and Scene-Stealing Actress, Dies at 62
description: Glenne Headly, whose acting career took shape at the renowned Steppenwolf Theater Company in Chicago and found its biggest audience in Hollywood with films like Dirty Rotten Scoundrels and Dick Tracy, died on Thursday in Santa Monica, Calif. She was 62.

title: Las Vegas Man Accused of Death Threats to Lawyers Suing Fox News
description: A computer repairman from Las Vegas was charged on Friday in Manhattan with threatening to kill New York lawyers who have filed an anti-discrimination suit on behalf of 11 black employees at Fox News, the police and prosecutors said.

title: Top Uniformed Rikers Officer Steps Down Early
description: The highest-ranking uniformed officer overseeing Rikers Island abruptly stepped down on Friday, the latest sign of turmoil at the city jail agency.

title: As Democrats Regroup, Spotlight Turns to New Jersey Governors Race
description: UNION CITY, N.J.  The door cracked open slightly, about as far as the chain lock allowed, and Philip D. Murphy hunched over to peer inside.

title: El Capitan, My El Capitan
description: Alex Honnold woke up in his Dodge van last Saturday morning, drove into Yosemite Valley ahead of the soul-destroying traffic and walked up to the sheer, smooth and stupendously massive 3,000-foot golden escarpment known as El Capitan, the most important cliff on earth for rock climbers. Honnold then laced up his climbing shoes, dusted his meaty fingers with chalk and, over the next four hours, did something nobody had ever done. He climbed El Capitan without ropes, alone.

title: Begin at the Beginning
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  We happen to know that one of the most popular times to pick up The New York Times crossword for the first time and attempt to solve it is over a weekend and, on the surface, that makes perfect sense. Most people are off from work. They have downtime and seek to fill it. And what better time to take up a new hobby than when you have hours to devote to it?

title: West Point Band at 200: From Fife and Drums to Live Streaming
description: WEST POINT, N.Y.  Sure, there are plenty of bands that have stayed together a long time  the Rolling Stones (1960s), the Boston Pops (1880s).

title: Philip Murphys Election Day of Selfies, Door Knocks and a Victory Speech
description: The morning mist had turned into a steady rain as Philip D. Murphy, a Democratic candidate for governor of New Jersey, drove his family to their local polling location in his black sport utility vehicle.

title: Court in Brazil Clears President Michel Temer in Campaign Finance Case
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazils top electoral court cleared President Michel Temer on Friday night of claims that he violated campaign finance laws, lifting a critical burden on the deeply unpopular leader as he resists calls to resign over a simmering graft scandal.

title: Justice Dept. Wants Lawsuit Against President Trump Thrown Out
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department asked a federal court late on Friday to dismiss a lawsuit that accused President Trump of violating the Constitution by continuing to own and profit from his businesses, arguing in part that, even if he had broken the law, it would be up to Congress, not a federal judge, to act.

title: Surprises Turned Stalwarts Power Yankees Past Orioles
description: Talented players are about as likely to go undetected in Major League Baseball as a dropped $100 bill is to go unclaimed on a crowded subway platform.

title: Vic Gold, Hard-Charging G.O.P. Spokesman and Campaigner, Dies at 88
description: Vic Gold, a pugnacious political spokesman who helped pave the way for modern conservatism by making Barry Goldwater less opaque to the press in the 1960s and collaborating with Spiro T. Agnew to lambaste the news media for liberal bias in the 70s, died on Monday in Alexandria, Va. He was 88.

title: Watch April Ross Playing Beach Volleyball in Manhattan
description: Professional volleyball player April Ross has one of the fastest and most accurate jump serves in the world. Watch up close in 360 degrees as the AVP New York City Open runs through this weekend in Manhattan.

title: Cavaliers Explode, Refusing to Go Quietly Against the Warriors
description: CLEVELAND  It was impossible. It was inconceivable. There was no way the Cavaliers could escape from the wreckage of this series and slow the Golden State Warriors march to immortality.

title: Bill Maher Returns to Real Time on HBO After Use of Racial Slur
description: In his first television appearance since he was widely criticized for using a racial epithet on the air, the HBO late-night host Bill Maher was by turns contrite and defiant, apologizing for his remarks while arguing that comedians should be allowed the freedom to transgress and offend.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: The Last Season of Orphan Black Debuts
description: Tatiana Maslany and her clone sisterhood fight one last battle in the final season of Orphan Black. And Ben Affleck plays a mathematics savant with a wicked skill set in The Accountant.

title: Emmanuel Macrons Amateur Politicians Are Poised to Remake French Parliament
description: ST.-JACUT-DE-LA-MER, France  The unmistakable candidate stood out during a campaign stop in a traditional Breton seaside village. Ah, its you! a middle-aged woman called out excitedly as he worked potential voters at the market  as if it could be anybody else.

title: Personal And Service Note
description: For regular readers  Im taking next week off from the column, plus more days later in the month. I was supposed to be on a post-conference walking tour in England; instead, Im at Heathrow, flying home to help out in a family health crisis. But Ill keep the days off; dont know how much tweeting and blogging Ill do. Life happens.

title: I Want My Government to Ask Questions
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment. Some comments were edited for length and clarity.

title: How Have Your Politics and Religion Mixed in Unexpected Ways?
description: We would like to know more about how your religious beliefs have affected your political views and actions  or vice versa.

title: Culture Clash at a Chinese-Owned Plant in Ohio
description: MORAINE, Ohio  When a giant Chinese glassmaker arrived here in 2014 and began spending what would become more than a half-billion dollars to fix up an abandoned General Motors plant, it seemed like a tale from opposite land: The Chinese are supposedly stealing American jobs  as no less an authority than President Trump has pointed out.

title: Religious Liberals Sat Out of Politics for 40 Years. Now They Want in the Game.
description: In Nashville, a crowd of ministers carrying palm fronds occupied the governors office during Holy Week, demanding the expansion of Medicaid to cover more of the uninsured. In California and 16 other states, an interfaith network has organized thousands of volunteers to swoop into action when immigrants are arrested or houses of worship are vandalized.

title: Malcolm Gladwell Polishes His Podcast in a Brooklyn Studio
description: It was a windy spring afternoon, though thats not why Malcolm Gladwells hair was standing straight up as he hurried into a recording studio in Downtown Brooklyn.

title: Christine Ebersole Makes an Entrance Fit for the Tonys
description: Its been a decade since Christine Ebersole last walked the red carpet at the Tony Awards. Back then, when she was nominated for best leading actress for her role in Grey Gardens, the experience consisted of a 12-foot step and repeat, and fashion mattered little, if at all. But this Sunday, when she makes her entrance as a nominee for best performance by an actress in a leading role in a musical for War Paint, she will do so in a couture gown that has been twoweeks in the planning.

title: Getting Married Where the Catering Is a Pretzel Vendor
description: A great microcosm of the citys very diverse population, is how Daniel Arnold describes the swirl of people around City Hall in downtown Manhattan. You get representatives from every economic class, every race and religion, every gender and gender preference. The whole gamut is there.

title: Prozac Nation Is Now the United States of Xanax
description: This past winter, Sarah Fader, a 37-year-old social media consultant in Brooklyn who has generalized anxiety disorder, texted a friend in Oregon about an impending visit, and when a quick response failed to materialize, she posted on Twitter to her 16,000-plus followers. I dont hear from my friend for a day  my thought, they dont want to be my friend anymore, she wrote, appending the hashtag #ThisIsWhatAnxietyFeelsLike.

title: You Cant Rattle Her: Katy Tur on the Rise
description: The NBC correspondent Katy Tur sat in her unadorned office in the second floor of the networks 30 Rockefeller Plaza headquarters, coiling her compact 5-foot-3-inch frame on a swivel chair, and recounted with the chilly grin familiar to her TV viewers what it was like to have found herself an unexpectedly prominent figure in the 2016 presidential campaign.

title: 13 Philippine Marines Killed in Battle Against Islamist Militants
description: MANILA  Thirteen Philippine marines were killed and at least 40 others were wounded in a 14-hour clash with militants linked to the Islamic State in the city of Marawi, the military said on Saturday.

title: 14 Great Stories That Have Nothing to Do With Trump or Comey
description: Welcome to Our Picks, a guide to the best stuff to read, watch and listen to from around the internet. Check this space for the must-read long-form article, the next great podcast for your commute, the news-making tweetstorm. And yes, were also tooting our own horn here. Well share cant-miss New York Times articles from the week and reveal some gems you might have overlooked.

title: E. Tautz: Spring 2018
description: The label shows its spring collection.

title: Having Trouble Keeping Up With All the Trump News? Here Are the Must-Reads
description: Worried that you missed an important political story this week? Catch up on a very busy week of news from the Trump Administration.

title: Farhads and Mikes Week in Tech: More Ugly News for Uber
description: Farhad: Hello, Mike! Usually we start off with some kind of dad joke but today theres no time. We have a huge tech story to get to, one that will deeply affect my life and the lives of all of our readers: Taylor Swift is finally putting all of her music back on all streaming services, including Spotify. Hurrah!

title: Creating New Windows Without Ruining the Building
description: Q. A shareholder in our Greenwich Village co-op is combining two apartments and plans to create a few new windows as part of the renovation. The co-op board approved the work, but the building is almost 60 years old and has had various problems with the facade. Is it safe to have new windows carved out of the brick? It seems unnecessary and possibly problematic.

title: The Best Jump Server on Sand
description: April Ross is known for serving harder and faster than any woman on the AVP Tour. Heres what makes her jump serve so effective.

title: Cavaliers Offer a Glimpse of an Alternative Universe
description: For one night in what most likely is a lost cause of a series, Big Poison and Little Poison utterly dominated an N.B.A. finals game and caused a lake city to wonder what if.

title: Michigan Case Adds U.S. Dimension to Debate on Genital Mutilation
description: As more details emerge about the first-ever charges of female genital mutilation in the United States, the case is opening a window onto a small immigrant community, while stirring impassioned discussion about genital cutting among women who have experienced it.

title: Theresa Mays Top Aides Quit Under Pressure From U.K. Cabinet
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain, trying to pacify her Conservative Party after a major setback in the countrys election on Thursday, on Saturday let go her top two aides, who had earned reputations for secrecy and arrogance.

title: Agree With The 25 Best Films? Tell Us How You Really Feel
description: On the heels of their recent (and in some quarters controversial) ranking of the top 25 movies released since the year 2000, Manohla Dargis and A.O. Scott  The Timess chief film critics  share the wrangling and horse-trading that was involved in putting it together.

title: Opioid Dealers Embrace the Dark Web to Send Deadly Drugs by Mail
description: As the nations opioid crisis worsens, the authorities are confronting a resurgent, unruly player in the illicit trade of the deadly drugs, one that threatens to be even more formidable than the cartels.

title: Venezuela Musicians Rise Up After Violist, 18, Is Killed at Protest
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Armando Caizales left his viola at home that day.

title: Jelena Ostapenko, Unseeded Latvian, Rallies to Win French Open
description: PARIS  Skipping the usual base stations, Jelena Ostapenko climbed straight to one of tenniss major summits on Saturday, winning her first WTA Tour title at the French Open.

title: Ahead of the Tonys, Watching Everything
description: Sunday, June 11 is the biggest night of the year for Broadway: the Tony Awards, when the industry honors the best work of the season. Just as important to Broadway producers: the millions watching on television who are potential ticket buyers.

title: Britains Election: What the D.U.P. Is, and What It Wants
description: The surprise result of Britains snap election that backfired on Prime Minister Theresa May and weakened her Conservative Party may have stunned no one more than the Democratic Unionist Party of Northern Ireland, which now holds the unlikely role of kingmaker.

title: Trump-Comey Feud Eclipses a Warning on Russia: They Will Be Back
description: WASHINGTON  Lost in the showdown between President Trump and James B. Comey that played out this past week was a chilling threat to the United States. Mr. Comey, the former director of the F.B.I., testified that the Russians had not only intervened in last years election, but would try to do it again.

title: Freshening Up the Olympics. Sorry, Mens Weight Lifters.
description: Three-on-three basketball? Yes, please. Mixed-gender relays in the pool and on the track? Just tell me when to be there.

title: Australias Casey Dellacqua Chases Elusive Title With Persistence and Pride
description: PARIS  With many of her tennis peers rallied around her, Casey Dellacqua has reached another Grand Slam doubles final. On Sunday, she will be hoping that No. 7 brings her luck at Roland Garros.

title: Variety Puzzle: Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Todays acrostic quote is by the rock n roll singer and songwriter Chuck Berry, but that somehow doesnt seem like a hot enough description for the man who burned up the charts with hits like Maybellene, Roll Over BEETHOVEN (Yes, kids, the Beatles covered that song) and JOHNNY B. GOODE. Mr. Berry was a pioneer, a legend. He changed the landscape of music. Yes, thats better.

title: Charles Jeffrey Loverboy: Spring 2018
description: Charles Jeffrey, who in past collections embodied the life of artists, musicians and drag queens into his brand, shows his spring 2018 collection.

title: Before Scooter Gennett, a Slugging Show on a Smaller Stage
description: Mike Ford was a history major at Princeton University, but the annals of baseball were not his area of expertise.

title: In Video Snippets, a Collectors Mission: Get Hockey History Right
description: TORONTO  A humble, 1960s-era home that squats along a quiet north Toronto street is not where one would expect to find something so extraordinary that the hockey world is beating a path to its front door.

title: Uncertainty, More Than Populism, Is New Normal in Western Politics
description: Theresa May, Britains prime minister, has joined a long line of politicians who have gambled that they understood the populist wave overtaking Western politics and lost.

title: Chinas New Bridges: Rising High, but Buried in Debt
description: CHISHI, China  Soaring over a lush valley in southern China, the Chishi Bridge is a 1.4-mile-long marvel of concrete and steel. Four piers, like graceful tuning forks as tall as skyscrapers, secure cables suspending a four-lane expressway 610 feet above fields of corn and rice.

title: COTTWEILER + featuring Reebok: Spring 2018
description: The label shows its spring collection.

title: Dilemma for Uber and Rival: Egypts Demand for Data on Riders
description: CAIRO  As Uber sought this year to expand in Egypt, one of the most competitive ride-sharing markets, its executives faced a troubling request from Egyptian ministers: Could they provide access to heaven?

title: Beyond Raqqa, an Even Bigger Battle to Defeat ISIS and Control Syria Looms
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  American-backed forces have begun an assault on Raqqa, the Islamic States hub in northern Syria, and signs are that they could capture the long-sought target with relative ease. Yet the militant groups commanders, who have already withdrawn their toughest forces from the city, and most everyone else in Syrias multifaceted war are looking ahead to an even more decisive battle in the south.

title: Texting With Boys
description: It is a common complaint that modern communication has ruined romance. Wouldnt so much heartache be avoided, people claim, if we still spoke on the phone, if romantic intent could not be categorized through the time lapsed since a text message is returned?

title: The Politics of Climate Change
description: To the Editor:

title: A Public Service Message From the Class of 67
description: My generation was shaped to a considerable degree by Vietnam and, at least for the men, by the draft. Whether and how to elude military service was a constant during our time in college and beyond, and for many of us the wrenching debates and decisions of the tumultuous 1960s affected the rest of our lives. Some ended up in Vietnam, some opted for the Peace Corps or other national service, some became conscientious objectors, but all were touched by the draft. So it is not surprising that at our college reunions  including the 50th of my class of 67 at Harvard last month  both the men and the women spent a lot of time going over what Vietnam and the choices we made in those now-distant years meant for us.

title: Is Putin Getting What He Wanted With Trump?
description: In the Senate last week, Richard Burr, a Republican from North Carolina, asked the fired F.B.I. director James Comey if he had any doubt that Russia attempted to interfere in the 2016 elections. Mr. Comey responded with a single word: None.

title: The Headless Superpower
description: IF the United States imperium in all its might did not exist, if the Washington, D.C., of Donald Trump and James Comey were just the Sicilian-style backwater that it currently resembles, then no one looking at recent events would doubt that the entire Middle East is on the verge of its own version of a European Great War.

title: Can Democrats Save Themselves?
description: HALCOTTSVILLE, N.Y.  On a recent weekend at the farmers market here, Fred Margulies sat under a Vote Where It Counts sign and beckoned second-home owners to re-register in this area upstate instead of wherever their main residences were  New York City, most likely.

title: Its the Olympics for Trump Apologists
description: Hes just new to this, offered Paul Ryan, the speaker of the House, by way of explanation for President Trumps oafish efforts to get James Comey, then the F.B.I. director, to drop the bureaus investigation of Michael Flynn, the former national security adviser. Mr. Trump stumbled, Mr. Ryan went on, because he is learning as he goes, and because he wasnt steeped in the long-running protocols that establish the relationships between D.O.J., F.B.I. and White Houses.

title: The Power of the Russian State vs. a Librarian
description: There is something particularly Orwellian about accusing a librarian of hate crimes because books under her care dont jibe with government propaganda. That, in essence, is what a Russian court did in giving to Natalia Sharina a four-year suspended sentence because the Moscow Library of Ukrainian Literature, which she formerly headed, purportedly carried literature that didnt match Russias official version of whats happening in Ukraine.

title: Stop Pretending Youre Not Rich
description: When I was growing up, my mother would sometimes threaten my brother and me with elocution lessons. It is no secret that how you talk matters a lot in a class-saturated society like the United Kingdom. Peterborough, our increasingly diverse hometown, was prosperous enough, but not upscale. Six in 10 of the citys residents voted for Brexit  a useful inverse poshness indicator. (In Thursdays general election, Peterborough returned a Labour MP for the first time since 2001.)

title: America Made Me a Feminist
description: I used to think the word feminist reeked of insecurity. A woman who needed to state that she was equal to a man might as well be shouting that she was smart or brave. If you were, you wouldnt need to say it. I thought this because back then, I was a Swedish woman.

title: Comey and Trump, the G-Man vs. the Mob Boss
description: Lordy, what a fine day to be Donald Trump.

title: Bridgegate Lives!
description: When President Trump nominated Christopher Wray on Wednesday to lead the F.B.I., it appeared that Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey had finally made an imprint on an administration he was supposed to have helped shape all along.

title: Eureka? Yes, Eureka!
description: In the commencement address he delivered at Harvard last month, Mark Zuckerberg, the chief executive of Facebook, warned the graduating students not to trust the story of innovation that Hollywood promotes  namely, the idea of a single eureka moment in which a lone thinker has a groundbreaking epiphany. He characterized this idea as a dangerous lie that discourages real creativity.

title: Ending the Curse of Remedial Math
description: Can you simplify this square root? Erica Fells asks her class, and hands wave in the air. All but one of the students believe that its impossible to do so. The dissenter, Leslie Alcantara, lays out her argument. What do the rest of you think of Leslies reasoning? Ms. Fells asks, and after some back-and-forth, they agree  shes correct.

title: America Doesn't Feel Safe Anymore
description: They came here from Syria for security. Then came an ominous message.

title: The White House Leak Template for Journalists
description: With an endless stream of revelations and leaks about the Trump administration, it can be difficult for reporters to keep up. Heres an easy-to-fill-in template that can help.

title: 3 U.S. Soldiers Are Killed and a 4th Is Wounded by an Afghan Soldier
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Three American soldiers were killed and one other was wounded after an Afghan soldier opened fire on them in eastern Afghanistan on Saturday, according to Afghan officials.

title: Year After Pulse Massacre, Blessings and Frustrations Abound
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Leonel Melendez leans in as he sips coffee at his bagel shop here, and politely asks: What? I couldnt hear you. He is deaf in his left ear, and a hearing aid turbocharges his right one. But thats not all. His vision is faulty. His right foot and his left elbow are stitched up. His left kneecap is far from supple. And the thick U-shaped scar on the back of his head, where his hair wont grow back, is a permanent reminder of the sharp turn his life took on June 12, 2016.

title: Wales Bonner: Spring 2018
description: Grace Wales Bonner, one of the black designers to show during London Fashion Week, focused her work in the past on black male sexuality and masculine identity. She presents her spring looks.

title: U.S.-Led Forces Said to Have Used White Phosphorus in Syria
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Images and reports from witnesses in the northern Syrian city of Raqqa suggest that the United States-led coalition battling the Islamic State there has used munitions loaded with white phosphorus, the use of which in populated areas is prohibited under international law.

title: Sad Day for Gotham: Adam West, Who Played Batman, Dies at 88
description: Adam West, the classically handsome baritone actor who turned a comic-book superhero into live-action Pop Art in the 1960s television series Batman, died on Friday in Los Angeles. He was 88.

title: In Cavs Game 4 Victory, the Early Minutes Mattered Most
description: Even in those unusual moments when an opposing team has a big second-half lead on the Golden State Warriors, the prevailing sense is that the game is not over because of the Warriors ability to go on extended offensive runs. But in Game 4 of the N.B.A. finals Friday night, the Cleveland Cavaliers turned that notion on its head and had the game all but won in the first quarter.

title: The Cost of Dining With Warren Buffett? This Year, Its $2,679,001
description: A bidder on eBay offered nearly $2.7 million to have lunch with the billionaire investor Warren Buffett, as part of an annual auction to benefit a nonprofit organization in San Francisco.

title: Swedish Crew Ties Americas Cup Series
description: Nathan Outteridge, the skipper of Swedens Artemis Racing, fell overboard during a tack in the third race of the Americas Cup challenger finals on Bermudas Great Sound on Saturday, allowing Emirates Team New Zealand to sail ahead and take a 2-1 lead in the best-of-nine series.

title: Yoenis Cespedes, Back From the D.L., Smacks a Grand Slam to Lift the Mets
description: ATLANTA  Yoenis Cespedes returned to the Mets on Saturday, hit a ninth-inning grand slam and told reporters that, after six weeks of attending to a strained hamstring and a sore quadriceps, he did not feel 100 percent healthy yet.

title: Duterte, Focused on Drug Users in Philippines, Ignored Rise of ISIS
description: MANILA  It was classic bravado from the Philippines tough-guy president, Rodrigo Duterte.

title: Irresistible but Unavailable, at Least for a While
description: Emilyn Justine Leiva and Ernest John Economides were married June 10 at the Coral Gables Congregational Church in Miami. Milan Kralik, a Congregational minister, officiated.

title: Think Twice
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  If you have a better sense of spatial relationships than I do, you will really appreciate what Charles M. Deber has gotten himself into today. Me, I just sat back and marveled at the tangled, interlocking web he wove.

title: At the Tigers-Yankee Game, a Fleeting Moment That Wouldnt Go Away
description: Isabella Tobias and Samuel Kenneth Lites were married June 10 at the Fox Theater in Detroit. Lisa I. Murray, an aunt of the groom who was ordained through the Mount Zion Church, officiated, with Rabbi Tamara Kolton taking part.

title: To Understand Betsy DeVoss Educational Views, View Her Education
description: HOLLAND, Mich.  The students formed a circle around the Rev. Ray Vanderlaan, who draped himself in a Jewish ceremonial prayer shawl to cap his final lesson to graduating seniors in his discipleship seminar at Holland Christian High School.

title: Turks Click Away, but Wikipedia Is Gone
description: ISTANBUL  Baris Dede, a game design student, had a question: How easily did Viking longboats glide through the water? Dilara Diner, a psychologist, wanted to double-check a symptom of hysteria.

title: Who Was Roland Garros? The Fighter Pilot Behind the French Open

description: ARTS & LEISURE

title: Long Before It Lost Turf, ISIS Was Already Targeting Britain
description: LONDON  In the weeks after Islamic State operatives struck Paris in November 2015, the group released a prerecorded video of the killers. They stared into the camera, waved serrated knives, raged at the West and specifically warned Britain: Youre next. Footage showed scenes of London through a gunsight.

title: Quotation of the Day: Liberals Fighting for Their Faith
description: We cant have only Jews cry for anti-Semitism, and Muslims cry for Islamophobia. We can only win this if we see it as one big fight.

title: Sessions Will Testify in Senate on Russian Meddling in Election
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General Jeff Sessions told Congress on Saturday that he would testify before the Senate Intelligence Committee on Tuesday about issues related to Russias interference in the 2016 election.

title: Tapwrit Wins the Belmont in a Field More Barren Than Most
description: Someone had to win the 149th running of the Belmont Stakes, and as the field of 11 mostly maligned horses edged into the starting gate, the odds board was a patchwork of indecision, with no clear favorites and few bettors backing up their convictions with cold, hard cash.

title: Andimba Toivo ya Toivo, Namibian Independence Leader, Dies at 92
description: Andimba Toivo ya Toivo, a Namibian nationalist leader who fought a long and dogged campaign for his lands independence and was jailed for 16 years alongside Nelson Mandela in South Africas notorious Robben Island prison, died on Friday in Windhoek, Namibias capital. He was 92.

title: A Pro-Trump Conspiracy Theorist, a False Tweet and a Runaway Story
description: WASHINGTON  Jack Posobiec had his Twitter sights set on James B. Comey.

title: To Little Fanfare, Muammar el-Qaddafis Son Is Freed in Libya
description: CAIRO  A son and the onetime heir apparent of Libyas deceased former dictator, Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, was quietly released on Friday by the militia that had held him captive since the Arab Spring uprising of 2011, which ended his familys brutal rule.

title: Blazing Home Run by Aaron Judge Sets Tone for Yankees
description: Many things travel faster than a home run hit by Aaron Judge: fighter jets, for example, or supercars on the autobahn. But the solo homer that Judge sent over the left-field wall at Yankee Stadium on Saturday night was fast enough to at least make a Ferrari take notice.

Whatever the circumstances, once Mr. Cho appeared in their lives, from that day forward they spoke to him every day for years.

The season is the first to be programmed by Adolphe Binder, the fourth director to run the company, in Germany, since Bauschs sudden death in 2009, and the only one to have no direct relationship with Bausch.

description: Kiko Kostadinov, one of Forbes Europes 30 under 30 Art influencers, shows his spring looks.

If you are wishing upon a young player still challenged by the art of shaving, or a coming lottery prize in the June 22 draft, understand that late springtime basketball is not in your teams foreseeable future. Know that you are going to have time on your hands and envy in your heart as you watch other cities stage their championship parades.

title: U.S. Strikes Shabab, Likely a First Since Trump Relaxed Rules for Somalia
description: WASHINGTON  The United States military said on Sunday that it had carried out a drone strike in southern Somalia against the Shabab, the Qaeda-linked insurgent group  apparently the first such strike since President Trump relaxed targeting rules for counterterrorism operations in that country in March.

description: Yekwon Sunwoo won the Van Cliburn International Piano Competition on Saturday, besting 29 rivals over two weeks of playing to become the prestigious contests first champion from South Korea. The Cliburn, held every four years in Fort Worth, was founded in 1962 by Van Cliburn, the American pianist who stunned the world by winning the Tchaikovsky competition in Moscow in 1958, at the height of the Cold War.

I told my contacts with ISIS that I would ask whatever questions I wanted and that I wouldnt clear quotes or show them the article before it was published, she writes. I also needed their guarantee that I wouldnt be kidnapped.

description: Many emotions vie for dominance among the young men living in limbo in Kill Move Paradise, the bleak and beautiful new drama by James Ijames at the National Black Theater in Harlem. Fear, rage, disgust, helplessness, a sardonic amusement and a sorrow beyond tears  these responses ebb and flow in a seemingly unending cycle during the shows time-bending 80 minutes.

title: Reviving a Lost Language of Canada Through Film
description: HIELLEN, British Columbia  Speaking Haida for the first time in more than 60 years looked painful. Sphenia Joness cheeks glistened with sweat, and her eyes clenched shut. She tried again to produce the forgotten raspy echo of the Haida k, and again she failed. Then she smiled broadly.

title: Meet the Winner of the Childrens Mini Crossword Contest
description: SPECIAL POST  When The New York Times included a special print insert for children in the May 14 paper, the response from our young readers was overwhelmingly enthusiastic. The New York Times special inserts editor, Caitlin Roper, had asked me to contribute a small piece outlining some tips for creating ones own 5x5 mini crossword, which ended with a call for children to submit their own minis to The Times. The lucky winner would have their puzzle appear both in the paper and on our app.

title: A Subdued Puerto Rican Day Parade Marches On
description: After weeks of controversy, with withdrawals by corporate sponsors and several state and city officials over the plans to honor a guest condemned by many as a former bomb-maker, the Puerto Rican Day Parade rolled up Fifth Avenue on Sunday without discord or disruption, its numbers thinner than in years past on both sides of the police barricades.

title: For Flint, an 1882 Play About Bad Water Is Exactly What Were Living
description: FLINT, Mich.  The play was written in 1882, originally set in a small town in Norway  about as removed as imaginable from the daily struggles of this Michigan city. But as an adaptation of Henrik Ibsens An Enemy of the People played out over the weekend on a basketball court in a building that was once a Flint elementary school, the echoes were uncanny.

title: Another Return, and Another Win, for the Reviving Mets

title: Speeches From Cynthia Nixon and Others at the Tony Awards
description: Here are edited excerpts from some of the acceptance speeches at the Tony Awards on Sunday night. Winners paid tribute to parents, friends and educators. A couple made political points.

title: Et Tu, Delta? Shakespeare in the Park Sponsors Withdraw From Trump-Like Julius Caesar
description: New Yorks Public Theater lost financial support from two high-profile corporate donors, Delta Air Lines and Bank of America, on Sunday amid intense criticism of its production of Shakespeares Julius Caesar, which depicts the assassination of a Trump-like Roman ruler.

title: Ex-Rebel Leader Is Poised to Win Kosovo Election
description: SKOPJE, Macedonia  For the third time since Kosovo declared its independence in 2008, voters elected a new Parliament on Sunday, likely giving power to a former rebel leader who was twice acquitted of war crimes by an international tribunal.

title: America Needs Closure on the Travel Ban
description: President Trumps revised travel ban has surged from his signature to the Supreme Courts docket in less than three months. Under normal procedures, a case granted for review this late in the term would be argued by Thanksgiving with a possible resolution as late as June 2018. This case, indeed this president, is anything but normal. The legality of the travel ban, which implicates the commander in chiefs core statutory and constitutional authority over national security, demands an immediate resolution by the Supreme Court  one way or the other.

title: Pittsburgh Penguins Beat the Predators to Repeat as Stanley Cup Champions
description: NASHVILLE  The Pittsburgh Penguins became the first team in nearly two decades to win a second consecutive Stanley Cup championship when they defeated the Nashville Predators, 2-0, on Sunday in Game 6 of a seesaw series that pitted a high-scoring heavyweight against an upstart challenger.

title: Sebastian Telfair, Former N.B.A. Guard, Is Arrested on Gun Charges
description: Sebastian Telfair, a former N.B.A. point guard and high school basketball phenom, was arrested on Sunday morning in Brooklyn with four loaded guns and a bulletproof vest, the authorities said.

title: World Cup Hopes Revived, United States Ties Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY  The quadrennial World Cup qualifying match against Mexico at Estadio Azteca, where the partisan fans hurl invective and bottles and liquids that look like beer but may not be, tests the United States mens national team like none other during the qualifying cycle. At lung-searing altitude, and against the hosts wellspring of talent, the Americans spend 90 minutes every four years gauging their progress.

title: The British Supreme Takes New York
description: I am older now, but even when I wasnt, I abhorred a line. Time is finite, and meaningful. Lines are repudiations of that meaning. Certainly, there are things worth waiting for  a slice at Di Fara? a Lisa Vanderpump book signing?  but they are few and far between and, in truth, rarely as rewarding as you hope.

title: 150 Executives Commit to Fostering Diversity and Inclusion
description: Tim Ryan had been the United States chairman of PricewaterhouseCoopers for about a week last year when five police officers in Dallas were killed by a sniper during a protest over police shootings of African-Americans in Minnesota and Louisiana.

title: Word + Quiz: obeisance
Emmanuel Macron, Theresa May, French Open: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: At the Tony Awards, Avoiding Politics for the Most Part
description: Despite the hyperpartisan times, the Tony Awards skirted politics, for the most part.

title: An Uneven Night for Kevin Spacey as Tonys Host
description: Maybe its time for another hostless Tony Awards.

title: Whats on TV Monday: There Will Be Blood and The Putin Interviews
description: There Will Be Blood tops The New York Times movie critics list of the best films of the 21st century. Lake Bodom recreates an unsolved murder in Finland. And Oliver Stone interviews Vladimir V. Putin.

title: 2017 Tony Awards
description: Dear Evan Hansen, one of the nights favorites with nine nominations, turned out to also be its biggest winner. The musical took six awards, including best score, best actor and best musical.

title: Give Baseball Scouts a (Perfect) 80 for Tradition
description: One morning in February, by the back fields of the Kansas City Royals complex in Surprise, Ariz., Dayton Moore chatted casually with Rene Francisco. Moore is the Royals general manager and Francisco a top assistant, both with decades of scouting experience. Their conversation would be familiar to anyone in baseball.

title: Do You Think Anxiety Is A Serious Problem Among Young People?
description: In todays article, you will encounter this sentence:If youre a human being living in 2017 and youre not anxious, theres something wrong with you.

title: Roadside Bomb Hits American Convoy in Afghanistan
description: JALALABAD, Afghanistan  Three civilians were killed after a roadside bomb hit a convoy of American soldiers early Monday in Nangarhar Province in eastern Afghanistan, according to Afghan officials in the area. The civilians were killed when soldiers opened fire after the explosion, according to Attaullah Khogyani, a spokesman for the governor of Nangarhar.

title: A British Home Empire Aims to Colonize America
description: LONDON  On an unseasonably cold Monday morning in May, Chrissie Rucker sat perched on an elegant white armchair, on carefully distressed white floorboards, in an airy white-walled living room filled with scented white candles, white hydrangeas and white cashmere blankets. She was talking about, well, white.

title: Between War and Peace in Colombia
description: While the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia started laying down their arms, Federico Rios turned his gaze to the National Liberation Army, or E.L.N., the nations second-largest rebel group.

title: Changes in Hours for Low-Paid Workers
description: To the Editor:

title: Build It: The Role of Public-Private Partnerships
description: To the Editor:

title: Single-Payer Health Care Is Doable
description: To the Editor:

title: Shunning Gun Control, Helping Terrorists
description: When knife wielding terrorists struck in London this month, President Trump expressed odd satisfaction about one aspect of the carnage.

title: Sexual Abusers Shouldnt Be Allowed to Run the Clock
description: I was only 9 years old when my landlords teenage son led me into the basement with the promise of new toys. Instead, he forced me to touch him. He made me do things my young body and mind werent prepared to do. I distinctly remember how the damp floor and walls smelled of mildew, and how cold it was. I begged him to stop.

title: Trump and the True Meaning of Idiot
description: In a recent Quinnipiac University poll, respondents were asked what word immediately came to mind when they thought of Donald Trump: The No. 1 response was idiot. This was followed by incompetent, liar, leader, unqualified, and finally, in sixth place, president. Superlatives like great and a few unprintable descriptives came further down on the list. But let us focus on the first.

title: Wonder Woman, Weaponized
description: The hit movie Wonder Woman stages a clever sight gag when our heroine infiltrates a gala held by a hated villain while wearing an evening gown that exposes the hilt of the battle sword she carries on her back. Partygoers are oblivious to the weapon. But those of us who were weaned on the comic books of the 1950s and 60s recognized it right away as a sign that the filmmakers had discarded the original conception of Wonder Woman as an easygoing avenger who pledged not to kill even as she battled abject evil.

title: Mr. Trump Goes After the Inspectors
description: Just before the inauguration, Michael Horowitz, chairman of the Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency, was at a hockey game when he began getting calls from other inspectors general in federal agencies. The inspectors  independent officials who investigate waste, misconduct, mismanagement and criminal activity  were furious. Trump aides had let them know they might be replaced; for the first time ever, a president might fire them en masse.

title: The Resistance: Impeachment Anxiety
description: Last week, in highly anticipated Senate testimony, fired F.B.I. Director James Comey delivered a stinging rebuke and strong indictment of Donald Trump as an abuser of power, twister of arms and, above all, a spewer of lies.

title: The Revolutionary Specters of Russian Letters
description: How much time does it take to change a thing  a government, a society, a person?

title: A Night of Terror, a Year of Racism
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  A year ago today, a mass shooting during a Latin-theme dance night at Pulse, a popular gay bar in Orlando, Fla., left 49 people dead, more than 50 injured and the city  particularly its L.G.B.T. and Latino communities  shaken.

title: Making Google the Censor
description: Prime Minister Theresa Mays political fortunes may be waning in Britain, but her push to make internet companies police their users speech is alive and well. In the aftermath of the recent London attacks, Ms. May called platforms like Google and Facebook breeding grounds for terrorism. She has demanded that they build tools to identify and remove extremist content. Leaders of the Group of 7 countries recently suggested the same thing. Germany wants to fine platforms up to 50 million euros if they dont quickly take down illegal content. And a European Union draft law would make YouTube and other video hosts responsible for ensuring that users never share violent speech.

title: Finally, Something Isnt the Matter With Kansas
description: The most momentous political news of the past week? For my money, it wasnt James Comeys Senate testimony, riveting as it was. It was the Kansas Legislatures decision to defy the governor and raise income taxes  a move that could well be the first step in a transformation of American politics much more far-reaching than anything that could come from Russiagate.

title: Between War and Peace in Colombia
description: When members of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia began laying down their arms this year, it was a milestone in that countrys half-century of conflict. It did not, however, usher in peace. While the FARC, as it is known by its Spanish acronym, is the largest rebel group, it is not the only one. Among the others, the National Liberation Army, or E.L.N., has been in a pas de deux with the government as peace negotiations go in fits and starts in Ecuador.

title: Unions Come Into the Justices Cross Hairs, Again
description: Last year, the Supreme Court seemed poised to deal a sharp blow to public sector unions. Then Justice Antonin Scalia died and the court deadlocked, granting the unions a reprieve.

title: Theres No Magical Savings in Showing Prices to Doctors
description: Physicians are often unaware of the cost of a test, drug or scan that they order for their patients. If they were better informed, would they make different choices?

title: Bill Cosbys Fate Now Rests With the Jury
description: Read live updates from Day 7 of the Bill Cosby trial.

title: The Long, Lonely Road of Chelsea Manning
description: On a gray morning this spring, Chelsea Manning climbed into the back seat of a black S.U.V. and directed her security guard to drive her to the nearest Starbucks. A storm was settling over Manhattan, and Manning was prepared for the weather, in chunky black Doc Martens with an umbrella and a form-fitting black dress. Her legs were bare, her eyes gray blue. She wore little makeup: a spot of eyeliner, a smudge of pink lip gloss.

title: In Camino Island, John Grisham Takes a Vacation From Writing John Grisham Novels
description: CAMINO ISLAND By John Grisham 290 pp. Doubleday. $28.95.

title: How the Dark Webs Dread Pirate Roberts Went Down
description: AMERICAN KINGPIN The Epic Hunt for the Criminal Mastermind Behind the Silk Road By Nick Bilton Illustrated. 329 pp. Portfolio/Penguin. $27.

title: How Much Are Frequent Flier Miles Really Worth?
description: Merriam-Webster defines a mile as a unit of measurement equal to 5,280 feet. But in the increasingly byzantine world of frequent flier mileage reward programs, the term has little or no connection to physical distance. In 2015, United and Delta joined Southwest, Jet Blue and other airlines that award miles based upon ticket price and class, rather than distance traveled. American Airlines followed suit in August 2016.

title: U.S. Cyberweapons, Used Against Iran and North Korea, Are a Disappointment Against ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  Americas fast-growing ranks of secret cyberwarriors have in recent years blown up nuclear centrifuges in Iran and turned to computer code and electronic warfare to sabotage North Koreas missile launches, with mixed results.

title: When Opioid Addicts Find an Ally in Blue
description: BURLINGTON, Vt.  In this college town on the banks of Lake Champlain, Chief Brandon del Pozo has hired a plain-spoken social worker to oversee opioids policy and has begun mapping heroin deaths the way his former commanders in the New York Police Department track crime.

title: Social Interaction Is Critical for Mental and Physical Health
description: Hurray for the HotBlack Coffee cafe in Toronto for declining to offer Wi-Fi to its customers. There are other such cafes, to be sure, including seven of the eight New York City locations of Caf Grumpy.

description: Apples latest operating system for iPhones and iPads is set to roll out on September 19th, bringing with it a number of new features and tweaks that are designed to make your phone safer to use and more customizable.

description: It could finally be time for Travis Kalanick to take a break.

title: Fujifilm-Xerox Venture Ousts Executives Over Accounting Trouble
description: TOKYO  Fuji Xerox, the Japan-based joint venture between Xerox and Fujifilm Holdings, said on Monday that its chairman and three other executives were stepping down over accounting problems discovered at its operations in Australia and New Zealand.

title: Practicing What I Preached About Breast-Feeding
description: By the time my third child was born, I was in pediatric practice, advising new mothers about the American Academy of Pediatrics guidelines: exclusive breast-feeding for the babys first six months. Then, as foods are introduced, continuing breast-feeding until at least the first birthday.

title: A Look Back at Reagans Berlin Wall Speech, 30 Years Later
description: The staging was powerful: a United States president in front of the Brandenburg Gate at the height of the Cold War, with an East Berlin security post visible behind him.

description: Craig Green, whose work is notable for its unisex and gender-neutral qualities on the runway, shows his spring looks.

title: New iPad Pro Inches Toward Replacing PC, but Falls Short
description: When Steve Jobs introduced the first iPad in 2010, he described the tablet as a product that sat somewhere between the laptop and the smartphone, excelling at tasks like browsing the web, reviewing photos and watching videos.

title: Across Russia, Protesters Heed Navalnys Anti-Kremlin Rallying Cry
description: MOSCOW  An extraordinary wave of antigovernment protests swept across Russia on Monday, as thousands of demonstrators gathered in more than 100 cities to denounce corruption and political stagnation despite official attempts to stifle the expression of outrage.

title: A Stagnant General Electric Will Replace the C.E.O. Who Transformed It
description: General Electric, the 125-year-old industrial giant whose jet engines propel air travelers around the globe and whose electrical generators light millions of households, declared on Monday that it would be installing its first new leader in 16 years.

description: Article: Pittsburgh Penguins Beat the Predators to Repeat as Stanley Cup Champions

title: Ivanka Trump Says Father Felt Vindicated by Comey Testimony
description: WASHINGTON  Ivanka Trump said on Monday that her father felt very vindicated by the testimony last week of James B. Comey, the ousted F.B.I. director, who, under oath, accused President Trump of firing him for his handling of the investigation into whether the Trump campaign colluded with Russia to sway the election.

description: Three years into the Great Fashion Experiment that is Anna Wintours takeover of the Tony Awards red carpet, I think its fair to say that while things are looking, literally, better  there is less kooky costume, and more simple elegance  this particular awards show is never going to be a major fashion magnet.

description: Was it more important to own a gun, or know how to shoot it?

description: Are you cleanshaven and tattoo-free? Whats your credit score? What about marijuana  ever inhaled?

title: More Than 10 Percent of Worlds Population Is Obese, Study Finds
description: More than 10 percent of the worlds population is now obese, a marked rise over the last 30 years that is leading to widespread health problems and millions of premature deaths, according to a new study, the most comprehensive research done on the subject.

title: Are Diamonds Really Forever?
description: Q. Will a diamond look the same in a billion years? What happens to these giant carbon molecules over very long periods of time?

title: Its gonna hurt my pride
description: President Johnson and Henry Fowler speaking on Dec.3, 1965

title: For Arena and U.S. Soccer Team, a Vital Point Five Months in the Making
description: MEXICO CITY  The new coach, Bruce Arena, had taken over a United States national team in turmoil. No unity. No chemistry. No confidence. He was familiar with some of the players, though hardly all, but he knew what he would expect of them, and he knew the deadline for getting it done.

title: Loving, 50 Years Later
description: Couples shared stories of their interracial marriage, describing the struggles and triumphs in their lives.

title: How Much Do You Know About Solving Global Warming?
description: A new book presents 100 potential solutions. Can you figure out which ones are top ranked?

title: Maryland and District of Columbia Sue Trump Over His Businesses
description: In a new legal challenge to President Trump, the Democratic attorneys general of Maryland and the District of Columbia filed a lawsuit on Monday claiming that the presidents failure to shed his businesses has undermined public trust and violated constitutional bans against self-dealing.

title: Viking Hedge Fund to Return $8 Billion to Investors
description: Viking Global Investors, one of the larger hedge funds, is losing a top money manager and getting smaller in the process.

title: Players to Watch in the Baseball Draft
description: Unlike drafts in the N.B.A. and the N.F.L., which are showcases for players who are known to many fans, the Major League Baseball first-year player draft is still, after all these years, largely a crapshoot.

title: Winners of Our Eighth Annual Found Poem Contest
description: A total of 2,360 teenagers entered our eighth annual Found Poem Contest, more than double the number of entries in 2016. We hope this unexpected volume offers at least a partial excuse for the extra weeks it took us to choose our favorites, which we (finally!) announce below.

title: What to Cook Tonight
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: A Slow Ride Through (and Around) Yangon
description: YANGON, Myanmar  To ride Yangons charmingly decrepit Circle Line train is to ride through history. Built more than 60 years ago to connect rural suburbs and townships to the citys commercial heart, its trains  some almost as old as the line itself  move nearly 100,000 people a day, in a slow, 28-mile loop around Myanmars biggest city.

title: The Best (and Worst) of the 2017 Tony Awards
description: Accepting her award for The Little Foxes, Cynthia Nixon struck one of the nights more political notes in an otherwise apolitical night of speechmaking.

title: The Liver: A Blob That Runs the Body
description: To the Mesopotamians, the liver was the bodys premier organ, the seat of the human soul and emotions. The ancient Greeks linked the liver to pleasure: The words hepatic and hedonic are thought to share the same root.

title: All Should Rise for Yankees Gary Sanchez, Too
description: It was just another workday for Gary Sanchez, who operates in an oversized shadow.

title: Summer Cocktail Fun in a Pineapple Shaker
description: The pineapple has long been a symbol of hospitality. Now you can greet guests with a cocktail poured from a shiny shaker shaped like one, or give it as a gift to Dad or a grad: $80, available in gold, silver or copper, wandpdesign.com.

title: Mah-Ze-Dahr Adds Soft Serve to the Mix
description: Soft-serve ice cream was a childhood treat for Umber Ahmad and the pastry chef Shelly Barbera. So they decided to offer it with homemade waffle cones at Mah-Ze-Dahr, a bakery founded by Ms. Ahmad. Soft serve is fresher than regular ice cream because its churned to order, and its also lower in fat, Ms. Ahmad said. Vanilla bean and dark chocolate are available, plain or swirled, with tiny marshmallows, mini-meringues, candied hazelnuts and other add-ons: Soft serve, $7 cone with three toppings, $5 cup with a topping, Mah-Ze-Dahr Bakery, 28 Greenwich Avenue (10th Street), 212-498-9810, mahzedahrbakery.com.

title: Vivienne Westwood: Spring 2018
description: Vivienne Westwood, who brought modern punk wear to runways in the past, presents her spring collection.

title: Hearing Aids at the Mall? Congress Could Make It Happen
description: A few years hence, when youve finally tired of turning up the TV volume and making dinner reservations at 5:30 p.m. because any later and the place gets too loud, you may go shopping.

title: From a Bagel Maker, Torpedo Sandwich Rolls
description: Dianna Daoheung, the executive chef at Black Seed, has introduced torpedo-shaped sandwich rolls made from the dough used for bagels. These rolls are baked in a wood-burning oven and dusted with sesame seeds. They are just the right size for a sandwich and are sold on their own or as menu items that include a turkey melt, a chopped cheese (with hamburger meat and Cheddar), a banh mi and a vegan sandwich with spiced cauliflower: Black Seed Bagel Rolls, $1.75 each, sandwiches $8 to $12, Black Seed, 170 Elizabeth Street (Kenmare Street), 212-730-1950; Brookfield Place, 200 Vesey Street (West Street), 212-786-0402; 176 First Avenue (11th Street), 646-484-5718; blackseedbagels.com.

title: These Hungry Goats Learned to Branch Out
description: No, this is not an illustration from a book by Dr. Seuss.

title: DeKalb Market Hall Is Opening in Downtown Brooklyn
description: DeKalb Market Hall is among the citys largest food halls. Brightened by neon signage, it is home to more than 40 entrepreneurs selling everything from pickles to pho in about 60,000 square feet of underground space in Downtown Brooklyn. The hall, which opens Friday, also has the first outpost of Katzs Deli. It made perfect sense, said Jake Dell, the owner of Katzs. The crazy mix you have here reminds me of the Lower East Side. Foragers Market, based in Dumbo, Brooklyn, will have several stands in the market. Anna Castellani, the owner of Foragers, said she wanted visitors to be able to enjoy the smells of baking, pickles and barbecue as they walk through the space. Other vendors include the newcomers Fulton Landing Seafood and Pierogi Boys, as well as Caf dAvignon, Wilma Jean, Ample Hills Creamery and Cuzins Duzin, a doughnut shop that thrived in the area for 44 years before its last location was torn down to make way for City Point, the development that houses the food hall. A Trader Joes market shares the space, and there will be two full-service restaurants: a branch of Han Dynasty, and Fortina for Italian food: DeKalb Market Hall, City Point, 445 Albee Square West (Gold Street), dekalbmarkethall.com.

title: A Top Uber Executive Departs, Fraying the Companys A-Team
description: SAN FRANCISCO  For years, Travis Kalanick, Ubers chief executive, had his own personal A-Team at the ride-hailing company.

title: Email From Departing Uber Executive
description: An email sent by Emil Michael, Ubers second in command, who left the company on Monday.

title: Twin Peaks Season 3, Episode 6: A Dark Age
description: One of the best-remembered episodes of the original Twin Peaks is the one titled Zen, or the Skill to Catch a Killer, which features Special Agent Dale Coopers slipping for the first time into the shimmery dream world we now know as part of the Black Lodge. When the episode aired back in April 1990, its climactic nightmare sequence was so startlingly surreal that it helped cement the shows status as groundbreaking TV. And Coops insistence that his dream was essential to cracking the case kept fans busy for weeks, decoding all the symbolism.

title: A Rich Prosciutto to Slice and Savor
description: Cesare Casella, an Italian chef from Tuscany, calls Hurleyville, N.Y., in the Catskills, home. He works there on charcuterie, and he has just added an outstanding prosciutto to his line of products, mainly salami, all of which are produced and aged at a plant in Rhode Island. The fairly dark, intensely rich prosciutto is rimmed with silky fat, combining a salty tang with a sweet finish. The hams are aged at least a year using meat from heritage-breed pigs meant for Edwards Virginia Smokehouse in Surry, Va., which was destroyed by fire in 2016. The prosciutto will vary a bit from batch to batch depending on the breed of pig: Casellas Prosciutto Speciale, $30 a pound for whole (10-pound) boneless hams, $64 for four 4-ounce portions, sliced, Heritage Foods, 718-389-0985, heritagefoodsusa.com.

title: Bar Code: A New Infatuation Poised for a Puzzle Craze
description: Ever since the sudoku craze of 2005 to 2006, people have been wondering and asking me what the next big puzzle will be.

title: How to Use Google Image Search on the Go
description: Q. On a computer, you can use Googles reverse image search feature in several ways, like dragging and dropping an image file in the search box or right-clicking on an image file on a web page. But how can you do reverse searches for pictures using a mobile device?

title: Theresa May Battles to Hold On as U.K. Prime Minister
description: LONDON  Battling to hold on as prime minister of Britain after losing her majority in Parliament in the election last week, Theresa May shored up her position on Monday by expressing contrition to fellow Conservative Party lawmakers and promising to consult them more.

title: Trump Loses Travel Ban Ruling in Appeals Court
description: WASHINGTON  A second federal appeals court has ruled against President Trumps revised travel ban, delivering on Monday the latest in a string of defeats for the administrations efforts to limit travel from several predominantly Muslim countries.

description: The official after-party was held at the Plaza hotel, followed by O&Ms annual party at the Carlyle.

title: Daily Report: Another Week of Uber News
description: Uber has had a headline-making year in 2017  for the wrong kinds of reasons. The ride-hailing company has been in the news for problems such as sexual harassment claims, intellectual property fights and the use of tools to evade law enforcement personnel.

description: The New York Times would like to hear from teachers, parents and students about the lessons and discussions around teaching climate change.

description: A second federal appeals court on Monday ruled against President Trumps revised travel ban.

description: The photographer Acielle Tanbetova captured the stylish set in London for the mens fashion shows.

title: L.I.R.R. Announces Travel Options for Summer of Hell
description: More than two dozen rush-hour trains on the Long Island Rail Road will be canceled or rerouted at Pennsylvania Station in New York this summer as commuters brace for a summer of hell, officials said Monday.

title: NASAs Newest Class of Astronauts Is Ready to Hit the Pool
description: They dont yet know where they will be going, and they dont know how they will get there, but they do have a good chance of leaving the planet in the coming years.

title: Supreme Court Bars Favoring Mothers Over Fathers in Citizenship Case
description: WASHINGTON  Unwed mothers and fathers may not be treated differently in determining whether their children may claim American citizenship, the Supreme Court ruled on Monday. The gender line Congress drew is incompatible with the requirement that the government accord to all persons the equal protection of the laws, Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg wrote for the majority.

title: Pakistan, in a First, Sentences Man to Death Over Blasphemy on Social Media
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  An antiterrorism court in Pakistan has sentenced a Shiite man to death for committing blasphemy in posts on social media. The man, Taimoor Raza, 30, was found guilty of making derogatory remarks about the Prophet Muhammad, his wives and others on Facebook and WhatsApp.

title: Halseys hopeless fountain kingdom Gives Her a No. 1 Album
description: Two years ago, Halsey was an unknown pop singer who, with help from some online tastemakers, had a minor hit with New Americana, a sharp-tongued portrait of disaffected millennials (raised on Biggie and Nirvana). Then she was the voice on the Chainsmokers Closer, a smash around the world, and now Halsey  born Ashley Nicolette Frangipane 22 years ago  has her own No. 1 album.
