title: Why Dont You Donate for Syrian Refugees? Blame Bad Marketing
description: This summer, as youre watching television or sifting through mail, youre likely to come across charities asking for your money. And at some point, youll probably dig into your pocket to help victims of last years Ecuadorean earthquake, the continuing drought in Yemen or some other worthy cause.

title: Writers From the Right and Left React to the Sessions Hearing
description: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. Thats why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.

title: Culture and Traditions in Communities of Color
description: A friendship forged as teenagers in Chicago has taken Frank Stewart and John Simmons on a long journey documenting the lives and traditions of African-Americans.

title: The Trumpiest Roman of Them All
description: The problem with staging a Julius Caesar in which Caesar clearly resembles Donald Trump, the culture-war controversy du jour thanks to Shakespeare in the Park, isnt that doing so encourages the presidents assassination. The rough-and-tumble of democratic politics has always been rife with classical call-outs and far more egregious forms of lse-majest. The theatergoers who show up to watch a Shakespeare play in Central Park are  I hope  not high on the Secret Services watch list. And the plays tragic arc does not exactly make tyrannicide look like the wisest of strategies, even if the director is crude and on-the-nose enough to dress his Cassius for the Womens March.

title: The Myth of Disability Sob Stories
description: Last November, a surprise announcement changed my life. I had been selected as a 2017 Rhodes Scholar. It was exhilarating news. Several days later, however, I got another, less pleasant surprise. A professor at my university stopped me in the hall and said, I know I shouldnt say this, but now that you won the Rhodes, will you throw away your cane and your brace?

title: How to Protest in Russia
description: Lets get this out front: Aleksei Navalny, who called the protests against corruption held across Russia on Monday and was himself once again arrested, will not defeat Vladimir Putin for the Russian presidency in March 2018. Mr. Putin has a firm grip on power, continues to enjoy enormous popularity among Russians and controls Russian television. So why do these demonstrations  this one was the second in four months  arouse worldwide interest?

title: Julius Caesar, Another Opportunity for Outrage
description: It is only fitting that in this season of fake news there is plenty of exaggerated outrage to go around. Consider the latest kerfuffle over the Public Theaters production of Julius Caesar, in which Caesar is a Trumpian figure with blond hair, odd hand gestures and a wife with an Eastern European accent.

title: In Defense of Cultural Appropriation
description: LONDON  It is just as well that Im a writer, not an editor. Were I editing a newspaper or magazine, I might soon be out of a job. For this is an essay in defense of cultural appropriation.

title: Solving the Korea Crisis by Teaching a Horse to Sing
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Some stories have to be experienced to fully grasp  the Korea crisis is one of them. I arrived in Seoul on the evening of May 28. As I was dressing for breakfast the next morning, I was jarred by a news alert ringing on my phone: North Korea had just fired a short-range ballistic missile that had landed in the sea off its east coast.

title: Photographing Culture and Traditions in Communities of Color
description: Frank Stewart and John Simmons forged a friendship as teenagers on Chicagos South Side in the mid-1960s, sharing a love for jazz and the visual arts. They also discovered photography together.

title: Questions for: Across Russia, Protesters Heed Navalnys Anti-Kremlin Rallying Cry
description: Article: Across Russia, Protesters Heed Navalnys Anti-Kremlin Rallying Cry

title: How to Have a Destination Celebration
description: Whether its a milestone birthday or anniversary or a big work promotion, why not mark the occasion with a destination celebration? Instead of a three-hour party, you can have a three-day celebration where you connect with your closest family and friends and create everlasting memories, said Jack Ezon, who plans destination celebrations and is president of the New York City travel consultancy Ovation Vacations.

title: Should I Report the Biased Remarks of a Campus Cop?
description: I am a graduate student at a prestigious university in the rural United States. On a recent evening, I found myself locked out of my campus office after the administrative staff in the building had left for the day. Sheepishly, I called the campus police for help, and soon after, an officer  a white man, probably in his 60s  showed up with the master keys. Because I felt bad about using police resources for such a silly oversight, I was apologetic and very friendly. He opened the door and then asked for two forms of identification, just for the purposes of procedure.

title: Fed Actions Show Confidence but Are Not at Trump Speed
description: WASHINGTON  As one of the longest economic expansions in American history chugs into its ninth year, the Federal Reserve said Wednesday it was raising its benchmark interest rate to a range of 1 percent to 1.25 percent.

title: Naomi Klein Is Sick of Benevolent Billionaires
description: Your book No Is Not Enough frames Donald Trumps impunity as a type of branding. How does that help explain him? Hes a culmination of many dangerous trends in the culture, especially the triumph of the idea that a successful corporation is first and foremost selling an idea of itself and a sense of belonging and identity to its customers. In the late 80s, you saw brands start to sell the idea, the sense of belonging, first. That primacy of the brand does a lot to explain Trump, and how he has developed this intimate relationship with his base, why they expect so little of him and why he gets away with what he gets away with, because the rules of branding are really simple: Be true to your brand. The problem with Donald Trump is that he went and designed a brand that is entirely amoral.

title: Did Delta Air Lines and Bank of America Do the Right Thing When They Pulled Their Funding of Julius Caesar?
description: Where do you stand on freedom of expression in the arts, particularly the theater?

title: Reading Erdogans Ambitions in Turkeys New Mosques
description: In Turkey, mosques have a dual spiritual and economic purpose. This surprised me when I first moved to the country more than a decade ago. I expected God and money to be kept separate, at least outwardly, more in keeping with the discreet, cash-in-envelopes Christian churches of my youth. Yet around the exterior of the tiny, seafoam green 19th-century mosque across the street from my Istanbul home, I discovered an array of shops: a locksmith, a market, a kebab joint, a teahouse and a rotisserie vendor whose delicious, buttery chickens twirled all day outside. One of the imams who preached at the mosque was a part-time real estate agent. The attempted military coup last July lasted until the wee hours of the night, yet my little green mosque was, as usual, open and ready early the next morning for prayer; the locksmith whose shop was part of the complex waddled in by 9 a.m., and the happy blend of prayer and small-time hustle in Istanbul continued unabated.

title: Efforts to Rescue Migrants Caused Deadly, Unexpected Consequences
description: Strategies to reduce migrants in the Mediterranean Sea may have made the journey more treacherous.

title: Sipping Sherry in Spain With the Frugal Traveler
description: The Frugal Traveler, Lucas Peterson, takes us on a 360 tour of the Tio Pepe bodega in Spains Sherry Triangle.

title: What Sara Blakely, Spanx Founder, Cant Travel Without
description: Home for Sara Blakely, founder of the shapewear brand Spanx, is Atlanta, where her company has its headquarters. For at least a decade, while building her business, Ms. Blakely was away from home three weeks of every month. Now that she is a parent she travels less, although shes often in New York and Los Angeles for work. Im now a mom of four under the age of 7, so Im much more selective about where I go and when, she said, and Spanx is not as reliant on me as the spokesperson and the face of the brand.

title: One Way to Fix Uber: Think Twice Before Using It
description: You gasp with each new report on Ubers toxicity. On Tuesday, there was the harassment and discrimination documented in an endless list of internal recommendations by Eric H. Holder Jr., the former attorney general, who was hired to peer into Ubers ugly depths. Then, while presenting the report to employees, an Uber board member made a sexist remark. (He later resigned.) All of it comes after a parade of escalating scandals that seem more fitting at a company run by Tony Soprano than by nerds in San Francisco.

title: Who Is Ralph Northam, Virginias Democratic Nominee for Governor?
description: ARLINGTON, Va.  Ralph S. Northam, Virginias lieutenant governor, claimed the Democratic nomination for governor on Tuesday, The Associated Press reported.

title: How to Live With Critics (Whether Youre an Artist or the President)
description: When President Trump delivered his commencement address at Liberty University on May 13, his themes were mostly conventional ones: patriotism, faith, the importance of striving for ones goals. The true Trumpian note emerged only when the president strayed for a moment onto the subject of criticism. Nothing is easier or more pathetic than being a critic, because theyre people that cant get the job done, Trump said. Against the impotent carping of critics, he posed the constructive ambition of dreamers: The future belongs to the dreamers, not to the critics.

title: Dustin Johnsons Brother: Buddy, Goad and Caddie
description: ERIN, Wis.  Dustin Johnsons brother, Austin, did not tiptoe around after Johnson slipped on some stairs in his stocking feet on the eve of the Masters and wrenched his back. As others in his inner circle struggled to process the disappointment of Johnsons having to withdraw from a major he was favored to win, his brother leavened the mood by threatening to buy Johnson the nonslip grip socks commonly used in yoga and barre classes.

The last time she was in the building was election night, when she had been preparing to toast the victory of Mr. Trumps opponent.

title: G.O.P. Senators Might Not Realize It, but Not One State Supports the Republican Health Bill
description: Its no secret that the American Health Care Act is unpopular. In recent national polls, only about 29 percent of Americans support the bill. It is the most unpopular piece of major legislation Congress has considered in decades  even more unloved than TARP (the bailout), and much more unpopular than the Affordable Care Act, also known as Obamacare.

title: ISIS Captures Tora Bora, Once Bin Ladens Afghan Fortress

title: How to Be Mindful at the Beach
description: One of the reasons we love the seaside is that so many things invite us into the present moment: the sound of waves crashing on the shore, the flight of sea gulls, the moist, salty air and the feel of sand between our toes. By bringing attention to our moment-to-moment experience, the beach can be a wonderful place to practice mindfulness, and by doing so, enhance our joy and appreciation of the present.  Mark Coleman, a mindfulness teacher and author of Make Peace With Your Mind.

title: Congressman Steve Scalise Gravely Wounded in Alexandria Baseball Field Ambush

A lone gunman who was said to be distraught over President Trumps election opened fire on members of the Republican congressional baseball team at a practice field in this Washington suburb on Wednesday, using a rifle to shower the field with bullets that struck four people, including Steve Scalise, the majority whip of the House of Representatives.

title: Five Places to Go in Paris
description: Rue de Paradis, in the 10th Arrondissement of Paris, is known as Veggietown for its many vegetarian and veganfriendly restaurants. In the 19th century, the street was a hub for ceramics and crystal. The gothic Le Manoir, for instance, now a haunted house where visitors can relive spooky Parisian legends in immersive visits, was the headquarters of Boulenger ceramics. Today, a handful of ceramics stores remain, but playfully named establishments such as Le Fantme (ghost) bar and Le Purgatoire (purgatory) gallery have given the area the cachet of a cool and up-and-coming place.

title: U.S. Soccer Fans Can Relax. The Team Should Make the World Cup.
description: Last November, the United States was seemingly in danger of missing out on the World Cup. The team had lost its first two games in the final round of qualifying, capped by an ugly 4-0 loss in Costa Rica that led to the firing of Coach Jurgen Klinsmann. The United States stood last in the six-team qualifying group, with only the top three finishers guaranteed a World Cup spot.

title: I Thought I Understood America. Then Came Trump.
description: WASHINGTON  I first came to America 40 years ago. It was the summer of 1977, and I was 20 years old. Jimmy Carter had moved into the White House a few months earlier. I and five friends rented a motor home in Bethlehem, Pa., and drove manically to Santa Barbara, Calif., and back, following the imperious orders of Fleetwood Mac  Dont Stop, the ubiquitous hit of that summer. The day Elvis Presley died in Memphis  Aug. 16, 1977  we were driving across the South, not too far away. But our English was tentative, and we missed the news.

title: 5 Charged With Involuntary Manslaughter in Flint Water Crisis
description: FLINT, Mich.  By the time Robert Skidmore, an 85-year-old former auto industry worker, died in late 2015, officials had seen signs for months that Flint was wrestling with outbreaks of Legionnaires disease, prosecutors say. Yet despite a wave of such cases in 2014 and 2015, no public warning was issued until early 2016.

title: Hong Kong Wants a 3rd Runway. Will Its Dolphins Pay the Price?
description: HONG KONG  As pink fins surfaced off the boats port side, the Canadian college students scrambled toward the bow, cameras in hand, and began snapping pictures.

title: A Beloved British Illustrator, at the Beach
description: The small town of Hastings on Englands south coast could keep a vehicle-obsessed child entertained for hours. Theres the Victorian railroad that brought tourists here in the 19th century, bumper cars, carousel horses and swan-shaped paddleboats at the fairground, and funicular railways scaling the cliffs at the towns edge. On the shingle beach, the towns colorful fishing fleet waits at low tide, surrounded by lobster pots and net.

title: Officers Journey to Gay Pride Honoree Marks a Towns Progress
description: GLEN ROCK, N.J.  As he hoisted the rainbow flag skyward, Officer Matt Stanislao felt a sense of the surreal as it joined the American flag atop the flagpole and fluttered in the breeze. He looked dazed as the crowd of elected officials and community leaders gathered in the park for the towns first official gay pride celebration applauded him, their honored guest.

title: What Happened at the Shooting at a Congressional Baseball Practice
description: Five people were shot at a morning practice about five miles from the Capitol, the police said.

title: Megyn Kelly, Alex Jones and a Fine Line Between News and Promotion
description: Wheres the line between covering a scoundrel as a news figure and giving him a promotional platform?

title: Fried Cheese!
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: The London Fire: What We Know
description: LONDON  A fire tore through a 24-story West London apartment building early Wednesday, killing at least 30 people and injuring more than 70. The authorities said that the death toll was expected to rise, and that some bodies might never be identified.

title: Dancers Welcome Summer by Moving About Outdoors
description: Its a sure sign that summer is looming when dancers are suddenly all over town, leaping across grassy parks and sandy beaches. The latest setting for moving bodies can be found among Josiah McElhenys glass-tile sculptures in Prismatic Park, the outdoor public art project presented by Madison Square Park Conservancys Mad. Sq. Art. In Desire Lines, Rashaun Mitchell and Silas Riener create a two-week slate of improvisation that explores ideas about change and connection. Mr. Mitchell and Mr. Riener, along with 13 others  including Eleanor Hullihan, Cori Kresge and Mina Nishimura  will perform solos or in small groups. Other programs are dedicated to music and poetry, but the dance part of Prismatic is curated by Judy Hussie-Taylor of Danspace Project. (danspaceproject.org, madisonsquarepark.org.)

title: Digable Planets at SummerStage in Brooklyn
description: Of all the great 1990s rap groups, few went more silent than the jazz-rap giants Digable Planets, which disbanded in 1995 and stayed that way for years. But a decade later, the group  Ishmael Butler, known as Butterfly; Mary Ann Vieira, called Ladybug Mecca; and Craig Irving, a.k.a. Doodlebug  had a brief reunion, and beginning in late 2015, the trio has been performing more regularly, including on Wednesday, June 21, at Coffey Park in Red Hook, Brooklyn, as art of a week of free SummerStage concerts there.

title: Two Histories, of Aesthetics and Diasporas, at Bard College
description: Two exhibitions opening on Saturday, June 24, at the conjoined Center for Curatorial Studies and Hessel Museum at Bard College in Annandale-on-Hudson, N.Y., promise unfamiliar artists and revisionist viewpoints. The larger of the two, Picture Industry, is a sprawling show organized by the artist Walead Beshty that spans from the late 19th century to the present. It will represent some 80 artists with photographs, slide projections, film, historical documents and more. Through Dec. 15.

title: Steve Scalise, Wounded Lawmaker, Takes Pride in Baseball and Politics
description: WASHINGTON  As the majority whip in the House, Representative Steve Scalise is known among his Republican colleagues as a pleasant, persistent force, who gently checks back to see whether a lawmaker who has repeatedly said nope, not with you on a coming vote has had a change of heart.

title: Sam Gold Brings His Touch to Hamlet
description: The director Sam Gold has made his name with contemporary plays, and of the two shows he brought to Broadway this spring, only the new one  Lucas Hnaths A Dolls House, Part 2  caught fire with critics. The other, his bracingly stripped-down revival of The Glass Menagerie, was a hard sell  coming too soon, it seemed, after John Tiffanys stunner of a production. Yet Mr. Golds interpretation, which gave us a lovely Laura (Madison Ferris) in a wheelchair, made sense of that play in a way that felt powerfully necessary. It succeeded at the job of every revival: justifying its own existence. Now Mr. Gold, who staged a starry Othello Off Broadway last fall, has a Hamlet on the horizon. With Oscar Isaac as Hamlet and Charlayne Woodard as Gertrude, it begins previews on Tuesday, June 20, at the Public. What dreams may come? Well see. (publictheater.org)

title: The Legends of Chamberlain Heights Is Back, and Still Raunchy
description: Admirers of Comedy Centrals ribald Legends of Chamberlain Heights might have watched the 10th episode in December and assumed it was the last. The animated series is about three high school freshmen who aspire to basketball glory, and the perks that come with it, but dont want to do the work of serious athletes. They spent the series riding the bench until, in that first seasons finale, one of them, Grover (voiced by Josiah Johnson), was called upon to shoot a pivotal free throw, which he made.

title: Womens Voices of Afghanistan Rise in Gemma Peacockes Song Cycle
description: During her travels in Afghanistan, the journalist and poet Eliza Griswold collected dozens of landays, a form of poetry recited by women at village feasts and in refugee camps, as well as on clandestine poetry phone-ins.

title: Jennifer Jones Animates The Wild Heart at MoMA
description: Michael Powell and Emeric Pressburgers British melodrama Gone to Earth  at the Museum of Modern Art on Wednesday, June 21, as part of Modern Matinees: Becoming Jennifer Jones  has a reputation often eclipsed by the drama surrounding its production. The executive producer, David O. Selznick, married Jones before filming and had the film re-edited for its American release, adding scenes directed by Rouben Mamoulian and retitling it The Wild Heart (1952).

title: Too Many Opioids After Cesarean Delivery
description: Doctors may be overprescribing opioids to women who have had cesarean sections.

title: Using Android to Zoom In for a Closer Look
description: Q. I read your recent answer to a question regarding the magnifier on iPhones. Im visually impaired, and this helps me and many others, but I have an Android smartphone and tablet. I cannot afford Apple, so what magnifying options are available for Android?

title: How Pasteurs Artistic Insight Changed Chemistry
description: If youve ever had milk, youre probably familiar with the work of Louis Pasteur, the 19th-century French chemist and biologist. He prevented diseases, developing a process  widely known as pasteurization  for killing microbes in milk and wine. He also created vaccines for rabies and anthrax. And his ideas led to the acceptance of germ theory, the notion that tiny organisms caused diseases like cholera. Pasteur even helped us brew better beer.

title: Daily Report: The Perils of Continuing to Use Uber
description: Uber has promised to reform its corporate misbehavior. On Tuesday, the company released a long list of recommendations that it plans to adopt to avoid the workplace scandals that have recently plagued it. Ubers chief executive, Travis Kalanick, also said he planned to take a leave of absence.

title: J. Crew Debt Maneuver Can Be a Model for Other Troubled Retailers
description: J. Crew may have found a clever way to mend several tears in its corporate fabric. The flailing clothier owned by TPG Capital and Leonard Green & Partners is trying to restructure some $567 million of notes by offering holders a deal that runs the risk of irking another set of creditors. So J. Crew has stitched something up for them, too. If it manages to thread the needle, J. Crew may provide a blueprint for other wobbly retailers contemplating bankruptcy.

title: What We Know and Dont Know About the Shooting of the G.O.P. Mens Baseball Team
description: Right Now: Five people have been wounded by a single gunman, who died after he was shot and taken into custody.

title: The Breakdown: Balenciaga
description: A structural, oversize look, pared back to its fundamental elements.

title: The Breakdown: How to Wear a Balenciaga Look  Piece by Piece
description: Sometimes when clothes come down the runway, its hard to see what they actually look like. Pieces are styled on top of each other, accessories are stacked dizzyingly  shoes and socks, even, are matched in ways you couldnt imagine in real life. T breaks down runway looks into their most fundamental elements  which, in their simpler forms, are surprisingly easy to wear. Here, a look from Balenciaga with interesting, oversize proportions.

title: Otto Warmbier Got an Extra Dose of Brutality From North Korea. The Mystery Is Why.
description: SEOUL, South Korea  One American who was held captive in North Korea said he was interrogated up to 15 hours a day by officials who wanted him to confess to plotting to overthrow their government. Another said she was held in a 5-by-6-foot windowless cell. Yet another former American inmate shivered on the concrete floor of a room no bigger than a dogs house.

title: Anita Pallenberg, Actress and Muse of Rolling Stones, Dies at 75
description: Anita Pallenberg, the German-Italian actress and model who became best known for her relationships with members of the Rolling Stones, died on Tuesday in a hospital in Chichester, West Sussex, England. She was 75.

title: Virginia Shooting Suspect Was Distraught Over Trumps Election, Brother Says
description: WASHINGTON  He lived out of his van in the Northern Virginia suburbs and took showers at the Y.M.C.A. On Facebook, he posted furious criticism of President Trump and pledged allegiance to Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont. Back home in Illinois, neighbors complained to the police of his practicing his shooting near their home.

title: U.S. Halts New Rules Aimed at Abuses by For-Profit Colleges
description: The Trump administration is formally reconsidering  and may dismantle  two new rules that were a cornerstone of the Obama administrations crackdown on predatory for-profit colleges.

title: 5 Fires That Shaped Modern London
description: The fire that engulfed an apartment tower in London on Wednesday joins a list of disasters that have marked the citys history. Few were more prominent than the Great Fire of 1666, which wiped out 80 percent of the city and led to a rebuilding that laid the groundwork for London as we know it today. Although modern Londoners live a life relatively sheltered from such destruction, some fires in recent history have shaped it. Here are five examples from the last 100 years.

title: Harvard President Says She Will Step Down Next Year
description: Drew Gilpin Faust, the first woman to be Harvards president, announced on Wednesday that she would step down next year after 11 years of service, a period in which she oversaw ambitious fund-raising, expansion of academic programs and increases in student and faculty diversity.

title: Russian Lawmakers Approve Plan to Relocate 1.6 Million Muscovites
description: MOSCOW  At least 16 protesters were detained in front of the Russian Parliament building on Wednesday as legislators approved a plan that could uproot up to 1.6 million Muscovites from their aging Soviet-era residences and move them into newly built apartments.

title: America 'Was Born to Serve Mankind, Wilson Says
description: The Trump administration says its compass is set to America first. A century ago, President Woodrow Wilson, standing at Arlington Cemetery on Memorial Day, told the nations of Europe: We did not set this government up in order that we might have a separate and selfish liberty, for we are now ready to come to your assistance and fight out upon the field of the world the cause of human liberty.

title: Review: In The Man in the Ceiling, Jules Feiffer Adapts Himself
description: SAG HARBOR, N.Y.  Lots of family-friendly musicals dont aim very high; they rely on lightweight songs and simple storytelling that any kid could grasp. The Man in the Ceiling, a new work with some impressive names behind it that is receiving its premiere at the intrepid Bay Street Theater here, wants to be more challenging. This is a show best suited to children born with the theater-nerd gene and to parents curious to see how the source material, Jules Feiffers 1993 book, translates to the stage.

title: Despite Tony Wins, Indecent Announces Its Broadway Closing
description: Paula Vogels Indecent, a well-respected play that received three Tony Award nominations and two wins, will close on Broadway after struggling to gain traction at the box office.

title: The Virginia Shooting: The Scene and Reaction
description: Witnesses describe the scene of the shooting that injured Representative Steve Scalise and others Wednesday morning. President Trump and Senator Bernie Sanders made statements.

title: Tenement Museum in New York Names Its New President
description: Kevin Jennings, a history teacher turned nonprofit leader who is also a former Obama official, has been named the next president of the Tenement Museum in Manhattan.

title: Uber Investigation Leads to Shake-Up
description: An investigation into Ubers troubled company culture has led to changes in leadership. The chief executive has taken a leave of absence and several others have been fired over the past two weeks.

title: How Ubers Brash Approach Backfired
description: A series of scandals have toppled executives, including Travis Kalanick, Ubers co-founder.

title: A.R. Gurney, Playwright Who Explored Upper-Crust Anxieties, Dies at 86
description: A. R. Gurney, a prolific playwright who dissected the fading folkways of the Northeasts traditional white Anglo-Saxon Protestant society, of which he himself was a member, in plays like The Middle Ages, The Dining Room and The Cocktail Hour, died on Tuesday at his home in Manhattan. He was 86.

title: Where to Score Summery Staples This Week
description: On Thursday, Arj, a label designed by Bessie and Oliver Corral, the husband-and-wife duo who previously were head designers at Donna Karans Urban Zen, will open a summer pop-up. The gallerylike space is filled with warm-weather basics such as a sweater knit from the softest linen twisted yarn and merino wool ($670) and featherweight cotton poplin trousers ($470)  appropriate considering the shops name is taken from a Greek word philosophers used to describe the essence of everything. At 262 Mott Street.

title: Activists Sue Police Dept. Over Cant Confirm or Deny Tactic
description: In the early 1970s, the reclusive billionaire Howard Hughes undertook a covert operation with the Central Intelligence Agency: He built a salvage ship, the Hughes Glomar Explorer, for a secret mission to raise a Soviet submarine that had sunk a few years earlier in the Pacific Ocean.

title: Accusations About Bob Dylans Nobel Prize Lecture Rekindle an Old Debate
description: Perhaps it was just a matter of time.

title: 4 Shot at Baseball Field, Including a Republican Congressman
description: Steve Scalise, the No. 3 Republican in the House of Representatives, was among those wounded when shots were fired in Alexandria, Va.

title: Your Summer Style, Sorted
description: On Seinfeld, George Costanza dreamed of one day being able to drape himself in velvet, if it were socially acceptable. Not to rain on his parade, but linen or cotton would be a far savvier  not to mention, socially sanctioned  choice, particularly as summer begins to heat up. Certainly it is the preferred fabric for fashionable castaways in the city who must face the challenge of dressing appropriately for the office or crowded subway commute without dissolving into a puddle of sweat. Lightweight linen and cotton offer maximum breathability while keeping one covered  and, being natural, have added appeal to eco-minded shoppers. Its no wonder, then, that so many new and under-the-radar labels have chosen to work almost exclusive with these materials. Here are five that are sure to become your new warm-weather go-tos.

title: Gunman Kills 3 and Then Himself at San Francisco UPS Building
description: Three people were fatally shot and two were wounded when a co-worker opened fire on Wednesday inside a United Parcel Service complex in San Francisco, the authorities said. The gunman then shot himself to death.

title: Two Parisian Creatives, at Home in the Countryside
description: I just asked Gesa to marry me this morning! Charles Compagnon said. He was driving to the verdant village of Courances, about 20 miles south of Paris, where he and his fiance, the German-Danish furniture designer Gesa Hansen, just bought and refurbished a 19th-century country home. And we found out that were having a baby girl. Things are good.

title: Criticism Builds as Theresa May Prepares to Form New Government
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain still hangs by a thread.

title: Solemn Trump Calls for Unity After Congressmans Shooting
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump, a political agitator pressed into the unfamiliar new role of soothing a nation, called for bipartisan unity in his first statement responding to the shooting  Wednesday morning of a congressman and three others on a suburban Virginia baseball diamond.

title: An Attack on Congress and Baseball
description: A congressman was shot  early Wednesday morning while playing baseball with his colleagues in Virginia. The congressman, Steve Scalise, the majority whip of the House of Representatives, is in critical condition, and two other people were also critically wounded. It wasnt just an attack on members of Congress and their staff and police protective details but on one of the few vestiges of bipartisanship left in Congress: baseball.

title: San Francisco to Develop Treasure Island as Major Cultural Site
description: Earlier this year, George Lucas rejected Treasure Island in the San Francisco Bay as the home for his new Lucas Museum of Narrative Art. But San Francisco arts officials remain committed to developing the island as a major cultural destination and this week are releasing their Treasure Island arts master plan to the public.

title: Irans Regional Record
description: To the Editor:

title: Mastering a Master: How a Small Gallery Put On a Big Rodin Show
description: LONDON  Millions of dollars of insurance. Transport logistics. Paperwork. Labor. Movement sensors. Export duties. Artwork passports.

title: Rodin Celebrations Around the World
description: RODIN: THE CENTENNIAL EXHIBITION, the Muse Rodin and Runion des Muses Nationaux, Grand Palais, Paris. Over 200 Rodin works, as well as sculpture and drawings by Brancusi, Picasso, Matisse, Gormley and other artists. Through July 31.

title: The Shooting Attack on Republican Lawmakers
description: To the Editor:

title: Steve Scalise, London, U.S. Open: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: The Questions Jeff Sessions Didnt Answer
description: To the Editor:

title: Instant Pot, the Latest Prized Kitchen Gadget, Has Staying Power
description: Im a sucker for the latest kitchen technology. Vegetable spiralizers, smoke guns, you name it, especially if it has an LED light. And sometimes there are truly useful ones. I asked Lesley Stockton, staff writer for The Wirecutter and Sweethome, The New York Timess product testing sites, for advice on a latest craze: the Instant Pot, a combination slow cooker/pressure cooker.

title: No Strategy on Afghanistan
description: To the Editor:

title: Modern Love Podcast: Griffin Dunne Reads Before the Web, Hearts Grew Silent
description: On this weeks podcast, the actor Griffin Dunne reads Before the Web, Hearts Grew Silent. In it, the author David Vecsey writes about love in the time of no cellphones or social media.

title: Mixed-Marriage Pioneers
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: In Cars 3, Lightning McQueen Faces an Existential Crisis
description: The conventional reviewers wisdom about Pixars Cars movies is that they are colorful and engaging but hardly as breathtaking as much of the other output from that animation studio. There are some who think Pixar should aim for awe-inspiring every time, because why not? Then there are crankier critics who will point out that driverless talking cars just arent terribly interesting, and can be a little goofy.

title: Staubitz Market in Brooklyn: 100 Years of Sawdust, Steaks and Chops
description: A screen door slams, and a customers shoes shuffle across a hardwood floor sprinkled with sawdust. Behind a polished glass counter filled with carefully arranged steaks, lamb chops and other pristine cuts of meat stand several butchers, thick through the shoulders and hands, shiny with confidence and wearing aprons as white as copy paper. If the men are not in the middle of preparing an order, they are chatting with the regular customers. Its 1917 in Staubitz Market on Court Street in Cobble Hill, Brooklyn. Or is it 2017?

title: JW Anderson: Spring 2018
description: The labels Mens 2018 collection.

title: Turtles Bred for Food in Asia Can Transport Cholera
description: Soft-shell turtles raised for food in Asia can infect people with cholera and spread the lethal bacteria from place to place, according to a new study.

title: Rangers Are Buying Out Dan Girardis Contract
description: The Rangers said goodbye to a key member of their veteran core on Wednesday, buying out the remaining three years of defenseman Dan Girardis contract.

title: A Horse Walks Into a Bar Wins Man Booker International Prize
description: LONDON  A Horse Walks Into a Bar, a novel that centers on a stand-up routine that goes off the rails as a comic dredges up ghosts from his past, won the Man Booker International Prize, for work written in a language other than English, on Wednesday night.

title: W.N.B.A. Players Union Leader Takes a Thoughtful Approach
description: As a five-time W.N.B.A. defensive player of the year, Tamika Catchings was adept at predicting how situations should unfold.

title: United Airlines Apologizes After 2015 Video Shows Worker Shoving Customer
description: United Airlines has again been sued by a passenger for mistreatment, after he was pushed to the floor by a United employee in 2015 at George Bush Intercontinental Airport in Houston. The airline issued an apology, but only after video of the episode was made public.

title: A New Lure for Spa Customers? A Salt Cave
description: Two young women in white chamois robes exited the Himalayan salt sauna at Premier57, a spa in Midtown Manhattan, looking rosy and happily spent.

title: Global, With Local Flavor: Restaurant Critic Pete Wells in Sydney
description: The restaurant world may be getting smaller but the actual distance between the earths major land masses hasnt changed much. And so I found myself, once Id landed in Sydney after a trip that was supposed to last about 20 hours but took much longer (delays, cancellations, rerouted planes) eating in a lot of restaurants that wouldnt have been out of place in New York or any number of other cities where people take food seriously.

title: Turkish Guards Will Be Charged in Embassy Protest, Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON  Law enforcement officials plan to announce charges Thursday against a dozen members of the Turkish presidents security detail for their involvement in a brutal attack on protesters outside the Turkish ambassadors residence here last month, two American officials said on Wednesday.

title: Wells Fargo Is Accused of Making Improper Changes to Mortgages
description: Even as Wells Fargo was reeling from a major scandal in its consumer bank last year, officials in the companys mortgage business were putting through unauthorized changes to home loans held by customers in bankruptcy, a new class action and other lawsuits contend.

title: Janet Yellen and the Case of the Missing Inflation
description: Inflation has stubbornly stayed lower than the Federal Reserve has desired for the past eight years, and it has been falling in the last few months. In a move that could well define her chairmanship of the central bank, Janet Yellen is betting that falling prices are a temporary blip that will soon be forgotten.

title: Review: A Corrupt Cop Is Up Against the Wall in Don Winslows The Force
description: THE FORCE By Don Winslow 479 pp. William Morow. $27.99.

title: London Fire Shows Why Britons Dont Trust the System
description: LONDON  Helicopters are not unusual in London, but the intense buzzing from the sky at 5 a.m. roused me early. From my balcony, I could see a huge plume of smoke billowing up from behind trees. It came from a blaze at Grenfell Tower, a 24-floor residential building, not far from where I live in West London. The authorities declared it a major incident as more than 200 firefighters battled the fire, with an unknown number of people trapped inside.

title: Street Style: Pitti Uomo
description: The Pitti Uomo fashion fair in Florence brings out the best dressed.

title: They Know Robert Durst the Best. But Theyre Not Talking.
description: Stewart and Emily Altman have been friends with Robert A. Durst for decades, even as he has faced numerous charges, including murder, over the years. Now they are engaged in a cross-country legal battle over whether they can be compelled to testify in a pretrial hearing in Mr. Dursts Los Angeles trial in the killing of another close friend 17 years ago.

title: Street Style: Pitti Uomo
description: New and old-world suiting styles faced off at the Pitti Uomo fashion fair in Florence, Italy.

title: Steve Scalise, London, Federal Reserve: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Conor McGregor and Floyd Mayweather Jr. Agree to Fight
description: Two years after Conor McGregor declared in an Esquire interview that he would kill the boxer Floyd Mayweather Jr. in less than 30 seconds, it appears that McGregor, a mixed martial arts star, will get his chance.

title: Beth Ditto on Her New Time Capsule: Her First Solo Album
description: Beth Ditto did not set out to make her first full-length solo album. When she went into the studio a few years ago, Ms. Ditto, the powerhouse singer and feminist glamazon, planned to make another record for Gossip, the Portland, Ore., disco-punk trio she had fronted since 1999.

title: Patricia Knatchbull, a Grande Dame of Britains Elite, Dies at 93
description: LONDON  Patricia Knatchbull, a grande dame of Britains titled elite, whose life embraced a fabled childhood between two world wars and deep personal tragedy after her father and a teenage son were killed in a bomb attack at sea, died on Tuesday at her home in England, in Mersham, Kent. Lady Mountbatten, as she was known, was 93.

title: Fox News Drops Fair and Balanced Motto
description: Fox News is Fair and Balanced no more.

title: Civil Rights Groups Sue Chicago Over Abuses by Police
description: Hoping to step into the breach left by the end of the Obama administrations aggressive approach to civil rights abuses by the police, a coalition of civil rights groups filed a federal lawsuit against the City of Chicago on Wednesday.

title: Despite Public Outcry, Egypt to Transfer Islands to Saudi Arabia
description: CAIRO  The fate of Tiran and Sanafir, a pair of small, barren islands in the Red Sea, is one of the most politically sensitive issues facing Egypts president, Abdel Fattah el-Sisi.

title: New York Adding Shelter Options for Homeless Victims of Domestic Abuse
description: Domestic violence continues to drive homelessness in New York City, ahead of evictions and overcrowding, at a time when the citys primary shelter system is so taxed that Mayor Bill de Blasio plans to open 90 new facilities over five years.

title: De Blasio Makes a Rare Underground Appearance
description: There were plenty of seats on the uptown C train as it creaked its way from Pennsylvania Station to Times Square. But one patron, standing 6-foot-5 in a shiny blue suit and clutching a leather folder, opted to stand.

title: Ronald Markman, an Artist Who Conjured His Own Kingdom, Dies at 86
description: The artist worked to break free of the confines of classical art, and wasnt afraid to poke fun at society.

title: Finding Bravado, and Worry, at an Iranian Shrine Where ISIS Struck
description: TEHRAN  I had visited the sprawling mausoleum of the founder of the Islamic republic multiple times, trying to blend in with pilgrims.

title: Moving a Mezuza
description: Dear Diary:

title: Bunkers at U.S. Open Course Give New Meaning to Sand Hazard
description: ERIN, Wis.  The 138 bunkers that will be in play at this years United States Open have nothing remotely routine about them.

title: Shooting Shines Light on an Annual Baseball Game and a Bipartisan Pastime
description: WASHINGTON  It was an attack on politicians in the least political of venues: a baseball field.

title: Shaken Lawmakers Soften Partisan Tone While Uniting in Concern
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Chuck Fleischmann stood just outside the House chamber in the Capitol on Wednesday morning recounting his harrowing survival of a shooting rampage aimed at a group of lawmakers practicing for an annual charity baseball game. He was still wearing his cleats and red jersey with Republicans emblazoned across the front.

title: Georgia Escapees Steal Second Vehicle as Manhunt Continues
description: The two escaped inmates who the authorities say killed two Georgia prison guards stole a second vehicle overnight as they began their second day on the run, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Their Own Targeted, Republicans Want Looser Gun Laws, Not Stricter Ones
description: WASHINGTON  Shaken and angry, Republican members of Congress seized on the brazen daytime shooting of their colleagues on Wednesday to demand that existing restrictions on gun access be loosened so that people facing similar attacks are able to defend themselves.

title: Saudi Arabia Tries to Ease Concerns Over Civilian Deaths in Yemen
description: WASHINGTON  Saudi Arabia is engaging in a $750 million, multiyear training program through the American military to help prevent the accidental killing of civilians in the Saudi-led air campaign against Houthi rebels in Yemen.

title: Trump Named Childrens Word of the Year. Thats Trumpwinningtastic.
description: LONDON  Its the greatest word. The best.

title: Senate Backs Measure Limiting Presidents Power to Lift Sanctions
description: The Senate voted nearly unanimously on Wednesday to allow Congress to strip the president of the power to unilaterally lift existing sanctions against Russia, a matter that had many of President Trumps allies siding with his harshest critics.

title: A Finger Exercise On Hyperglobalization
description: The days when surging world trade was the big story seem like a long time ago. For one thing, trade has stopped surging, and seems to have plateaued. For another, we have more pressing issues, like the rise of authoritarianism and the attempt to sabotage health care.

title: The Fall and Rise of Australian Culture
description: (Damien Cave, our Australia bureau chief, shares insights on global news, local recommendations and feedback from readers in this weekly newsletter. To receive it in your inbox, sign up here.)

title: U.S.-Led Airstrikes in Syria Killed Hundreds of Civilians, U.N. Panel Says
description: GENEVA  Airstrikes by the American-led coalition against Islamic State targets have killed hundreds of civilians around Raqqa, the militant groups last Syrian stronghold, and left 160,000 people displaced, a United Nations panel said on Wednesday.

title: The Universal Phenomenon of Men Interrupting Women
description: For women in business and beyond, it was an I-told-you-so day.

title: Mueller Seeks to Talk to Intelligence Officials, Hinting at Inquiry of Trump
description: WASHINGTON  Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel examining Russias meddling in the 2016 election, has requested interviews with three high-ranking current or former intelligence officials, the latest indication that he will investigate whether President Trump obstructed justice, a person briefed on the investigation said on Wednesday.

title: Robert S. Leiken, Political Scientist Who Defied Labels, Dies at 78
description: Robert S. Leiken, a maverick political scientist who stunned fellow liberals in the 1980s when he denounced the leftist Sandinista government in Nicaragua, died on June 7 in Boston. He was 78.

title: Americas Lethal Politics
description: Americas elected representatives enjoying Americas pastime on a ball field just across the Potomac from the Capitol: A particularly American form of terror changed that idyll early Wednesday morning into what Senator Rand Paul, who was there, called basically a killing field.

title: 39 Members of MS-13 Are Arrested, Authorities Say
description: Thirty-nine members of MS-13, a brutal gang with roots in Central America, were arrested by the immigration authorities in New York in the past month, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Shooting Is Latest Eruption in a Grim Ritual of Rage and Blame
description: The violence has come regularly for years, in one politically charged spasm after another. A member of Congress shot through the head in Tucson. Assaults on the Holocaust Museum, a Planned Parenthood office and the Family Research Council, a socially conservative group. Gunmen targeting black churchgoers in South Carolina, Indian immigrants in Kansas and police officers in New York and Texas.

title: Attack Tests Movement Sanders Founded
description: WASHINGTON  The most ardent supporters of Senator Bernie Sanders have long been outspoken about their anger toward Republicans  and in some cases toward Democrats. Their idol, the senator from Vermont, has called President Trump a demagogue and said recently that he was perhaps the worst and most dangerous president in the history of our country.

title: Company Lost Secret 2014 Fight Over Expansion of N.S.A. Surveillance
description: WASHINGTON  An American communications company in 2014 balked at an expansion of the National Security Agencys warrantless surveillance program, but was ordered to comply by the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court, a newly declassified document shows.

title: Something That Might Be Bleeped
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Occasionally, we get mail from people who are shocked, absolutely shocked, at an entry or clue that appears in the puzzles, and that is always interesting because everyones mileage for what is appropriate in a newspaper crossword puzzle varies significantly.

title: Quotation of the Day: G.O.P. Lawmaker Shot Outside Capital
description: He was hunting us at that point.

title: Shabab Kill 31 and Take Hostages in Somalias Capital
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  Militants began an assault in the capital, Mogadishu, on Wednesday evening with a car bombing at the gates of a hotel popular with foreigners, and continued with gunfire at a nearby restaurant.

title: Dustin Johnson Is Favored at a Major Again. Just Watch the Stairs.
description: ERIN, Wis.  Which poses the greater obstacle to Dustin Johnsons chances of successfully defending his United States Open title: the diabolical fescue grass that frames the fairways at Erin Hills or the double-spiral staircase in his rental house?

title: Corrections: June 15, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Home Runs by Curtis Granderson and Lucas Duda Help Mets Rally Past Cubs
description: Candid answers leavened with a healthy dollop of humor are a standard features of Mets Manager Terry Collinss pre- and postgame interview sessions.

title: Fargo Season 3, Episode 9 Recap: You Think the World Is Something
description: 30 years Ive been killing him. That was just when he fell.

title: Sabathia Looks Headed to D.L. as Struggling Yankees Lose to Angels
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  Sluggers like Aaron Judge and Gary Sanchez  and thus far, just about anybody else in the lineup  have been the scene stealers for the Yankees over the initial two and half months of the season, as they have bludgeoned their way to the top of the American League East.

title: A Blue Note Jazz Club Is Coming to Brazil
description: The music of Brazil has exerted an outsize influence on jazz in the United States since at least the early 1960s, but its impact has come at a remove  largely from recordings, and the renown of a few Brazilian stars, rather than through immigration and interaction.

title: You and Me
description: Whats the story behind this image?

title: Leonard Cohen Exhibition Is Planned for Museum in Montreal
description: Leonard Cohens life and career as a visual artist, poet and musician will get the exhibition treatment at the Muse dArt Contemporain de Montral.

title: The Dutch Have Solutions to Rising Seas. The World Is Watching.
description: In the waterlogged Netherlands, climate change is considered neither a hypothetical nor a drag on the economy. Instead, its an opportunity.

title: London, Robert Mueller, Climate Change: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Whats on TV Thursday: The Tunnel: Sabotage and a Salute to Diane Keaton
description: The Tunnel returns with a fresh investigation  and without the baggage of The Bridge. Diane Keaton is honored by the American Film Institute. And Cate Blanchett, Heath Ledger and others channel various aspects of Bob Dylan in Todd Hayness musical essay, Im Not There.

title: Word + Quiz: anthropologist
Found Poem Favorite | Glasses
description: We are honoring the top winners of our Eighth Annual Found Poem Student Contest by publishing their work from June 13 to July 3. Youll be able to read the whole collection here as we go.

title: Daughters Will Suffer From Medicaid Cuts
description: Nearly one in five adult children at some point provide care for at least one elderly parent, according to a new study by the Center for Retirement Research at Boston College. The burden is particularly demanding for daughters, who spend as much time on such care as spouses of older adults, and as much time as sons, in-laws, grandchildren and other relatives combined.

title: Trumps Imminent Cuba Problem
description: Soon  maybe as early as Friday  President Donald Trump, with Senator Marco Rubio of Florida, is expected to announce a presidential initiative that will roll back the Obama-era efforts that loosened the 56-year-old United States embargo on Cuba. How far will the president go?

title: Regulatory Reform That Is Anything But
description: After decades of failed efforts to enact regulatory reform bills, Congress appears to be within a few votes of approving reform legislation that would strip Americans of important legal protections, induce regulatory sclerosis and subject agencies that enforce the nations laws and regulations to potentially endless litigation.

title: How ISIS Grew in the Philippines
description: While President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines was bragging about his brutal war on drugs, the Islamic State was consolidating its sway over Islamist rebel groups on the island of Mindanao. The extent to which ISIS has succeeded is now alarmingly evident, as a pitched battle between Philippine troops and Islamist militants for control of the largely Muslim city of Marawi enters its fourth week.

title: Rhetoric and Bullets
description: In 2011, after Representative Gabby Giffords of Arizona was gravely injured and six others were killed by a shooter in Tucson, I was moved to commit an entire column to condemning the left for linking the shooting so closely to political rhetoric.

title: Where Democrats Can Find New Voters
description: The relentless focus on the white working class in the aftermath of the election of President Trump has overshadowed a much larger bloc of voters, the roughly 65 million service sector workers whose partisan loyalty is up for grabs.

title: Play Ball, and Then Gunfire
description: When a gunman opened fire on a congressional baseball practice Wednesday, everyone in Washington looked for a positive message. There had to be a point to something so awful. The consensus was for Coming Together.

title: Questions for: Steve Scalise Among 4 Shot at Baseball Field; Suspect Is Dead
description: Article: Steve Scalise Among 4 Shot at Baseball Field; Suspect Is Dead

title: The Children of 1984: Dystopia Down the Decades
description: The stage adaptation of 1984 opening on Thursday, June 22, may be George Orwells Broadway debut. But his novel  and coinages like Big Brother, thought police and double-think  have never been far from the cultural stage. Heres a partial history of the prophetic year that somehow never passes into the past.

title: Do You Have Emerging Adult Skills?
description: Do you feel prepared to enter the world of adulthood? What sorts of skills and habits do you think you need to be a successful, self-sufficient adult?

title: Letter of Recommendation: The Canadian Football League
description: In November 1989, the Saskatchewan Roughriders met the Hamilton Tiger-Cats at the SkyDome in Toronto for the Canadian Football Leagues championship game. I was 9 years old, and I had already developed a tortured relationship with the Roughriders, familiar to any of the million-odd people who live in the province where I grew up. Until that point in the clubs 79-year history, the Riders had taken home just one title; in an eight-team league, this fact seemed to defy the laws of statistics.

title: A Whimsical Wordsmith Charts a Course Beyond Twitter
description: There are a few things we should clear up about the Twitter humorist known as jomny sun. Although suns Twitter bio describes him as an aliebn confuesed abot humamn lamgauge, and his avatar is a line drawing of a smiling alien in a T-shirt, he is, in fact, a real person, and that really is his name. Also, he knows how to spell.

title: 36 Hours in Birmingham, Ala.
description: This quintessential Southern city with a complex past is ready to surprise you.

title: For Sale: A $7 Million Wild West Town
description: As a family-owned amusement park opens for the summer, its owners of 43 years ponder its future. Step inside Donleys Wild West Town in Union, Ill. in 360-degree video.

title: As Female Elk Age, They Learn to Evade Hunters
description: If you come across an old elk in southwestern Canada, chances are it is female.

title: The Pleasure of a Chilled Soup on a Sweltering Day
description: Back when it used to snow in winter and bloom in spring, and when the dog days of summer came reliably in August and not weirdly in April or June, I used to drink ice-cold schav to keep from falling completely apart. In those days, we languished in our East Village or Hells Kitchen railroad apartments  the kind with floors that sloped and a tub in the kitchen from which you could reach a wet hand out of the morning shower to turn off the gas under the hissing pot of Caf Bustelo. Youd throw your key down in a balled-up tube sock to friends below on the sidewalk  because the buzzer never worked  and youd sit out on the fire escape at night to try to stay cool.

title: With 1984 on Broadway, Thoughtcrime Hits the Big Time
description: A British adaptation of George Orwells 1984, first staged in 2013, had three successful runs in the West End and national and international tours, including stops in Boston, Los Angeles and Washington. There was talk of bringing it to New York, but no sense of urgency.

title: Explaining Executive Privilege and Sessionss Refusal to Answer Questions
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General Jeff Sessions repeatedly refused to answer senators questions on Tuesday about his conversations with President Trump, even though Mr. Trump had not asserted executive privilege to keep them secret. That raises questions about whether Mr. Sessions had any legal basis to stonewall Congress.

title: Packages for New Pandora-The World of Avatar in Orlando
description: Pandora  the World of Avatar opened in May at Disneys Animal Kingdom in Orlando, Fla., and travel companies that specialize in Disney vacations were ready and waiting with Pandora packages.

title: Jury in Bill Cosby Trial Still Deadlocked as Fourth Day Ends
description: Read updates from Day 10 of the Bill Cosby trial.

title: When Mom and Pop Cant Sell the Farm (or in This Case, the Theme Park)
description: UNION, Ill.  Its not easy selling a Wild West Town theme park located 60 miles northwest of Chicago, as Larry and Helene Donley have discovered.

title: More Space, and More Projects, in a Place Upstate
description: Though Sean Hanna and Scott Melcher were happy in their two-bedroom rental in Astoria, Queens, they longed for outdoor space.

title: Americas Collision Course With China
description: EVERYTHING UNDER THE HEAVENS How the Past Helps Shape Chinas Push for Global Power By Howard W. French Illustrated. 330 pp. Alfred A. Knopf. $27.95.

title: NYC Ferry, More Popular Than Expected, Scrambles to Meet Demand
description: Mr. Mayor, youre gonna need a bigger boat.

title: Late Night Wishes President Trump a Happy Birthday
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: How to Complain and Get Results
description: The blender does not blend. Your vacation was spoiled by a late flight. Or the cabinet you bought is as sturdy as wet cardboard.

title: The Daily: Political Violence in a Time of Partisanship
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Talking to Boys the Way We Talk to Girls
description: At a Fathers Day breakfast, my 5-year-old son and his classmates sang a song about fathers, crooning about my dad whos big and strong and fixes things with his hammer and, above all else, is really cool.

title: Katy Perrys Witness Experiment Gone Wrong, and Understanding How Our Culture Treats Victims
description: Over the weekend, we watched in amusement as the musician Katy Perry turned herself into a reality star to promote her new album, Witness. Perry put herself on a live-streamed trial for 96 hours, while she sang, cooked, attended a therapy session and cried her way through an interview with the activist DeRay Mckesson, lamenting her history of cultural appropriation (she dressed up as a geisha during a 2013 live performance, among other missteps). Her music, ostensibly the occasion for this emotional display, rarely came up. Perry painted herself as a victim of ignorance, and the whole spectacle made us think about the elaborate performances of self that people stage in public to sell their image.

title: New York Today: Brewing in Harlem
description: Updated, 9:45 a.m.

title: Morning Agenda: Another Wells Fargo Scandal?
description: The prospect of your bank adjusting your mortgage and lowering those monthly payments probably seems quite attractive, especially if youre in bankruptcy.

title: A $664,000 Parking Spot Symbolizes Hong Kongs Property Frenzy
description: HONG KONG  In many places, $664,000 can buy you a nice house. For that price in Hong Kong, you can buy a slab of concrete, roughly 17 feet long and 11 feet wide, to leave your luxury car.

title: Grenfell Tower Death Toll Rises to 17; U.K. Government Is Criticized
description: LONDON  With the death toll from a horrific London fire rising and many residents still unaccounted for, Prime Minister Theresa May  under pressure from critics  on Thursday ordered a formal inquiry into the disaster that turned an apartment tower into a smoldering ruin.

title: When the Horses Stopped Coming to Belmont Park
Malcolm Turnbull, Australian Leader, Pokes Fun at Trump in Leaked Recording
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbulls first phone call with President Trump was famously unpleasant. His next one might be even more so.

title: Year-End Roundup, 2016-17 | Questions for Writing and Discussion
description: For eight years, we have asked a fresh Student Opinion question every weekday. Each June, just as we do with lesson plans, we round them all up and post them in one place.

title: Tracks Most Resilient (and Suspect) Record Is in Danger
description: CASLAV, Czech Republic  In 1983, at age 32, when most track athletes are beyond their fastest times, Jarmila Kratochvilova ran 800 meters in 1 minute 53.28 seconds. The result was so blistering and unprecedented that it has become track and fields longest-standing outdoor world record.

title: Explosion at China Kindergarten Kills at Least 8 and Wounds Dozens
description: XUZHOU, China  An explosion outside a kindergarten in eastern China killed at least eight people and injured nearly 70 on Thursday, leaving a chaotic scene as dozens, some clutching children, were thrown to the ground.

title: Calling Inquiry Unfair, Trump Asks: What About Clintons Russia Ties?
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump complained on Thursday about the unfairness of the Russia investigation, wondering on Twitter why Hillary Clintons connections to Russia are not being similarly scrutinized.

title: Movers: Tech Stocks Decline, and Booz Allen Is Investigated
description: Were following major market developments throughout the day.

title: A Look Back at Anita Pallenbergs Enduring Style
description: Ms. Pallenberg, the It Girl and style icon, has died at 75. Her bohemian looks continue to inspire.

title: Anita Pallenberg Changed How We All Dress, Not Just Keith Richards
description: In the days since the news that Anita Pallenberg, the German-Italian actress and quintessential rock chick, had died at 75, much has been written about her contribution to music history  most notably her effect on the Rolling Stones. For three band members, she was something of a lifestyle catalyst (also, at least for two, a lover).

title: North Korea Says Otto Warmbier Was Released on Humanitarian Grounds
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea said on Thursday that it had freed the American college student Otto F. Warmbier on humanitarian grounds but did not reveal any details of his medical condition or the diplomatic negotiations that led to his release.

title: California Today: The Housing Crisis Hits Berkeley
description: Good morning. Todays introduction comes from Conor Dougherty, who reports on economics from the Bay Area.

title: The Indigenous American Berserk Strikes Again
description: It didnt take long  hours, in fact  after Rep. Gabrielle Giffords was shot, and six others murdered, in Tucson, Ariz., in January 2011, for liberals to begin pinning political blame for the atrocity.

title: Erdogan Adversary Begins 250-Mile Protest March in Turkey
description: ISTANBUL  The leader of Turkeys largest opposition party began a 250-mile march to Istanbul from Ankara, the capital, on Thursday to protest President Recep Tayyip Erdogans widening crackdown on dissent.

title: Mayweather-McGregor Boxing Match Draws Hype, and a Clear Favorite
description: Generally, the most exciting question about a much-anticipated sporting event is the basic one: Who is going to win?

title: The Strong, Silent Type Whos Also a Little Rude
description: My husband is a pretty smart guy. But sometimes when I tell him things  about good friends or articles Ive read  he stays silent. When we were dating, this bothered me, so I asked him about it. He said, Theres nothing to say if a subject doesnt interest me. I thought he was being a jerk. Then I discovered his parents do the same thing. Now, five years into our marriage, Ive started doing this to him. But it feels wrong to me. Any advice?

title: Yoko Ono Will Share Credit for John Lennons Imagine
description: Imagine, John Lennons seminal 1971 ballad for a utopian future without religion, borders or property, is getting a co-writer: Lennons widow and collaborator, Yoko Ono.

title: We Should Keep Our Word on Refugees
description: President Trumps travel ban has drawn much scrutiny for its attempt to prohibit citizens from six Muslim-majority countries from entering the United States. But the executive order  which this week was struck down by a second federal court and seems headed to the Supreme Court this summer  has another important part: a reduction, by more than half, of refugee admissions, to 50,000 from 110,000. This provision is bad for the country for security and economic reasons. As discussed in a forthcoming report by the Harvard Immigration and Refugee Clinical Program, it also potentially violates international commitments and American laws.

title: Review: Once Upon a Time in Venice Unleashes a Bland Bruce Willis
description: A bunch of well-known faces look lost in Once Upon a Time in Venice, which is billed as an action-comedy but has little comedy and less action.

title: The Los Angeles Philharmonic Lost Its Leader. Can It Stay on Top?
description: LOS ANGELES  American orchestras are supposed to be in crisis, fighting for economic survival and cultural relevance. But no one seems to have told the Los Angeles Philharmonic, which, two years shy of its centennial, is stronger than ever.

title: Energy Department Closes Office Working on Climate Change Abroad
description: WASHINGTON  The Energy Department is closing an office that works with other countries to develop clean energy technology, another sign of the Trump administrations retreat on climate-related activities after its withdrawal from the Paris agreement this month.

title: In Return From North Korea, Otto Warmbier Is Brutalized and Terrorized in North Korea
description: WYOMING, Ohio  For more than a year, while their son Otto was a prisoner in North Korea, Fred and Cindy Warmbier knew nothing about his fate.

title: Nike, a Global Brand, Will Try Going Local
description: Nike shaped itself into one of the globes most recognizable brands. Now it has a new idea: Go local.

title: How a Love of French Art Helped Shape the American Republic
description: WASHINGTON  I know you are a very great nation, Emmanuel Macron told us this month,  and that the United States was founded to let freedom, truth and reason prevail over ignorance and darkness. The young French president was hastily speaking, in English and French, just before midnight after his American counterpart announced he would withdraw the United States from the landmark climate agreement forged in Paris in 2015. Mr. Macron  whom the French press occasionally mocks for his American-style communications  knew just how to win Yankee hearts. Go back to the origins of his nation and ours: back to the 18th century, and to ideals that no one can repeal.

title: Joseph Kanon: By the Book
description: The author of Defectors says that he likes to cook, but likes to read cookbooks even more. And the best cookbooks have really distinctive voices. I never met Marcella Hazan, but I feel I have.

title: Chinas Real Estate Mirage
description: BEIJING  When the Chinese government privatized housing in the 1990s, enriching a vast swath of the urban population, it was hailed as a remarkable achievement of the reform economy. Since then, the housing industry has ballooned into a juggernaut that accounts for 70 percent of the countrys household wealth.

title: Trump Move on Job Training Brings Skills Gap Debate to the Fore
description: President Trump is taking one of the most concrete steps of his presidency on Thursday to address the employment prospects of workers left behind by the current economic expansion. In doing so, he also joins a long-running and occasionally contentious debate over whether those workers have the skills they need to land desirable jobs.

title: On TV, Putin Plays the Role He Likes Best: Russias Mr. Fix-It
description: MOSCOW  In the 15th episode of his annual call-in show on Thursday, President Vladimir V. Putin was part Oprah, part King Solomon, part Avenger against an incompetent bureaucracy, and very much a modern czar, fielding questions mostly from aggrieved Russians and promising to personally solve their problems.

title: N.C.A.A. Places Louisville on Probation and Suspends Pitino
description: The N.C.A.A. announced on Thursday that it had suspended Louisvilles Hall of Fame basketball coach, Rick Pitino, for the first five games of Atlantic Coast Conference play next season and ordered the program to forfeit what could be dozens of victories. Those forfeited wins could include the Cardinals 2013 national championship, which would become the first vacated national title in mens basketball history.

title: N.C.A.A.'s Louisville Public Infractions Decision
description: The N.C.A.A.'s committee on infractions released its report on violations committed by the Louisville men's basketball team.

title: The World According to Black Women Photographers
description: As a young photographer growing up in Brownsville, Brooklyn, Laylah Amatullah Barrayn was deeply influenced by Jeanne Moutoussamy-Ashes book Viewfinders: Black Women Photographers. The 1986 book took a historical look at female photographers from the 1800s to the present day and left her eager to see more.

title: The World According to Black Women Photographers
description: Mfon: Women Photographers of the African Diaspora, features images by 100 women from around the world and offers a challenge to anyone who says they dont know of any black women photographers.

title: Its the Same Old Song  Until You Take It Off Repeat
description: Q. The Music program on my iPhone is stuck on the same song, playing it over and over, and I dont see how to stop it. Why is this?

title: Did the Jack Welch Model Sow Seeds of G.E.s Decline?
description: For Fortune magazine in 1999, Jack Welch, then General Electrics chief executive, wasnt just the countrys best executive, or the manager of the year, but nothing less than the best manager of the 20th century, far and away the most influential manager of his generation.

title: Daily Report: Can Uber Escape From Neverland?
description: It is a bit startling to hear a 40-year-old man say that it is time for him to grow up. But that is what Ubers chief executive, Travis Kalanick, implied in an email to Uber employees on Tuesday when he said it was time to work on Travis 2.0.

title: Before Shooting, Suspect Began Day at Y.M.C.A. as Usual
description: WASHINGTON  James T. Hodgkinson, the man who the police say opened fire on a crowd of congressional Republicans on Wednesday, began his day at the nearby Y.M.C.A. at 5:31 a.m. and appeared to go about his normal morning routine before unleashing the attack, the Y.M.C.A. said Thursday.

title: Leader of Polygamous Breakaway Sect Is Arrested After a Year on the Run
description: Lyle Jeffs, the leader of a polygamous breakaway sect of the Mormon Church, has been arrested nearly a year after he slipped out of home confinement in Salt Lake City where he is facing fraud and money laundering charges, the authorities said on Thursday.

title: How to Win at Retirement Savings
description: Here is what you need to know about saving for life after you stop working and getting on the path toward a comfortable retirement, no matter your career or the size of your paycheck.

title: Tama
description: At a new Filipino restaurant, every dish comes with a careful presentation, and a story.

title: In Tamas No-Frills Space, the Filipino Food Is Anything But
description: In the Philippines, itlog na maalat is egg soaked in brine until the yolk turns as dark as a dying sun. At Tama, which opened in April in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn, the yolk is liberated after a week, while still high-noon yellow, and grated into strands that taste meaty and melting at once. They land on leaves shorn off brussels sprouts and littered like petals, edges curling into black, over a bed of noodles, garlic scapes and asparagus.

title: Uber Is Sued by Woman Who Was Raped by One of Its Drivers in India
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A woman who was raped by her Uber driver in India filed a lawsuit against the ride-hailing company and three current and former executives, after revelations that they had obtained and mishandled her medical records.

title: Banker Admits to Money Laundering in FIFA Case
description: Jorge Luis Arzuaga, a former managing director at the Swiss bank Julius Baer, pleaded guilty to money laundering conspiracy in Brooklyn federal court on Thursday, revealing his role in the United States sweeping criminal case focused on FIFA, the governing body of international soccer.

title: India, Stung by Backlash, Plans to Roll Back Restrictions on Cattle Slaughter
description: NEW DELHI  Indias Supreme Court on Thursday called on the government to answer charges that stringent new restrictions on cattle slaughter violate constitutional rights to freedom of religion and would impose a huge economic burden on some of the countrys poorest families.

title: Have You Had Difficulty Paying For or Obtaining Prescriptions?
description: The New York Times would like to hear from people about their experiences paying for prescription drugs.

title: How We Became Bitter Political Enemies
description: It wasnt long after a gunman opened fire on members of a Republican congressional baseball team on Wednesday that the emotional calls for unity began.

title: Paladino Sues School Board Trying to Remove Him
description: Carl P. Paladino, a former candidate for governor of New York, filed a lawsuit on Wednesday against members of the Buffalo Board of Education who are trying to get him removed from the board.

title: Ed Templetons Amalgamated Fragments
description: The photographers pictures are on view at Danziger Gallery in New York beginning this week.

title: Summery Images of Youth at Play, From a Pro-Skateboarder
description: As an artist known for documenting his fellow pro-skateboarders living like rock stars on tour, Ed Templetons home life in Huntington Beach, Calif., sounds surprisingly provincial. Every day, he and his wife Deanna take a walk down to the pier for what Templeton calls a daily photo mission, a mental and physical exercise that continues to hone the situational awareness he developed as a skateboarder. Being out in the streets, a lot of times in bad neighborhoods, trying to skate spots, is what gave me an eye for looking 20 paces ahead and being ready for something, Templeton says. Many of the fleeting moments that Templeton has captured throughout his career, from teenage kissers to surfers and skaters, are loosely arranged by theme in the exhibition Amalgamated Fragments, on view at Danziger Gallery in New York City through July 27.

title: Heres How to Make the Most of Your Hulu Subscription
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film streaming website. Sign up for our email newsletter, which is full of hand-picked recommendations and news about whats new on Netflix, Hulu and other streaming services.

title: Facebook Will Use Artificial Intelligence to Find Extremist Posts
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Responding to complaints that not enough is being done to keep extremist content off social media platforms, Facebook said Thursday that it would begin using artificial intelligence to help remove inappropriate content.

title: Secrecy Surrounding Senate Health Bill Raises Alarms in Both Parties
description: WASHINGTON  As they draft legislation to repeal the Affordable Care Act, Senate Republican leaders are aiming to transform large sections of the American health care system without a single hearing on their bill and without a formal, open drafting session.

title: Freedom of the Press in India
description: To the Editor:

title: Anbangs Sales Dry Up in New Challenge for Chinese Insurers
description: HONG KONG  Anbang Insurance Group, whose chairman has been detained by the police, has seen its growth come to a screeching halt as Chinese investors who helped fund its meteoric rise prove skittish about a politically connected company that is no longer in Beijings good graces.

title: Connecticut Bill Would Force Fee Disclosures for Teacher Retirement Plans
description: Public schoolteachers and other education workers in Connecticut should soon have an easier time figuring out how much they are paying for their retirement investments.

title: Nestl Looks to Sell U.S. Candy Business as Americans Eat Fewer Sweets
