Lenin made an immediate splash with a fiery speech and a radical political program known as the April Theses. Russian, and world, politics would never be the same.

title: Why Is the U.S. Killing So Many Civilians in Syria and Iraq?
description: Two weeks ago, the American military finally acknowledged what nongovernmental monitoring groups had claimed for months: The United States-led coalition fighting the Islamic State since August 2014 has been killing Iraqi and Syrian civilians at astounding rates in the four months since President Trump assumed office. The result has been a staggering loss of civilian life, as the head of the United Nations independent Commission of Inquiry into the Syrian civil war said last week.

title: A Bygone Era of Big City Life
description: Mehr Licht  more light  were Goethes famous last words. That deathbed declaration was also the title of Fred Steins only book, featuring images taken along Fifth Avenue, which was published posthumously. What could be more fitting?

title: London Attack Near Mosque Investigated as Terrorism
description: LONDON  The authorities in Britain said on Monday that they were treating an early morning attack near a mosque in London as an act of terrorism against Muslims, amid fears of retaliation for several recent assaults in the country attributed to Islamist extremists.

title: The Senate Is Close to a Health Care Bill, but Do Republicans Have the Votes?
description: How senators have different priorities on health care.

title: In Mexicos Violent Drug World, a Priests Dilemma Over the Seal of Confession
description: SOME RISE BY SIN By Philip Caputo 335 pp. Henry Holt & Company. $28

title: Five Sites of New Yorks L.G.B.T.Q. History
description: Jacob Riis Park, a Manhattan church, the Bum Bum Bar and more. In 360 degrees, visit five sites that helped shape New York Citys L.G.B.T.Q. community and its history.

title: At Watergate, Recalling a Burglary That Toppled a President
description: WASHINGTON  Under the glittering lights of a ballroom in a hotel whose name is synonymous with political scandal, they gathered for a reunion.

title: Penn Station Commuters Plot Plan B for Summer of Hell
description: The train schedules are set. Commuters have been warned. Now the hard part begins.

title: How to Conquer the Challenge of Long-Term Travel
description: One summer a friend showed me her itinerary for a week in Maui. It was three pages long, laid out on Excel. Every hour was choked with food stops, beaches, leisure time and noteworthy sights. It was a small wonder she didnt also pencil in bathroom breaks.

title: How The Times Gave Gay Its Own Voice (Again)
description: Im gay.

title: Haunted by a Players Death, a Coach Walks Away From His Sport
description: HOMER, N.Y.  Jeff Charles, a former high school football coach, had tried to come to the football field here twice in recent years but could not bring himself to go farther than the parking lot. One day last week he made his way down the winding ramp from the parking lot and onto the turf.

title: World Leaders Wary of Trump May Have an Ally: Congress
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump threatens to upend the post-World War II foreign policy order, but Congress is working to ensure that American foreign policy remains rooted in the trans-Atlantic alliance against traditional rivals like Russia.

title: Gay Prides Choice: March in Protest or Dance Worries Away
description: People in the L.G.B.T.Q. community have had many gains to celebrate over the last decade. Marriage became legal. Caitlyn Jenner and others pushed open doors for transgender people. Oregon elected an openly bisexual governor  the nations first. Even the Boy Scouts dropped its ban on gay leaders.

title: How Uber and Airbnb Became Poster Children for the Disruption Economy
description: WILD RIDE Inside Ubers Quest for World Domination By Adam Lashinsky Illustrated. 228 pp. Portfolio/Penguin. $28.

title: For Your Consideration: An Increasingly Lavish Emmy Campaign Season
description: On a recent Sunday in the heart of Beverly Hills, Calif., the hordes were ready.

title: New Yorks L.G.B.T.Q. Story Began Well Before Stonewall
description: The Stonewall Inn is perhaps the best-known gay historical site in the United States. Riots that erupted there at the end of June 1969  when patrons fought back against a police raid  are widely hailed as the catalyst for the modern movement for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender rights.

title: Two Years Later, What It Means to Be Wed
description: The Supreme Court made same-sex marriage a nationwide right on June 26, 2015. The next day, The New York Times highlighted 12 same-sex couples, many of whom were the first in their cities to wed on that day.

title: London, Megyn Kelly, Diana Taurasi: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Get Well Sooner? A Healthier Roommate Could Help
description: Your speed of recovery in a hospital is related to many things. Among them is one you might not consider: the condition of your roommate.

title: The Daily: The Secret Health Care Overhaul
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Cranky Baby? Feeding May Not Be the Right Answer
description: Feeding a hungry baby can seem like one of the most basic tasks of parenthood, but right from the beginning, the way an individual baby eats, gains weight and grows is a complicated parent-child mix of behavior and biology.

title: Who Really Needs to Be Gluten-Free?
description: The gluten-free craze is unlikely to go away anytime soon. Many people say they feel better after adopting a diet free of gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley and rye, even though relatively few gluten avoiders have been given diagnoses of celiac disease, an autoimmune condition that can attack the intestines and other tissues when gluten is consumed.

title: Morning Agenda: Upheaval in Retail
description: Jeff Bezos went shopping and now the entire retail industry is scrambling to secure shelf space.

title: New York Today: Meeting a Gay Pride Grand Marshal
description: Good morning on this muggy Monday.

title: A College Built for Canadian Settlers Envisions an Indigenous Future
description: SASKATOON, Saskatchewan  On a recent brilliant morning, the University of Saskatchewan transformed its college green into a powwow arena, with white canvas tepees, drum circles and lines of young women braiding their hair and affixing eagle plumes in preparation for graduation festivities.

title: Movers: Activist Investor Takes Aim at Parent of Saks
description: Were following major market developments throughout the day.

title: Dallas Schools, Long Segregated, Charge Forward on Diversity
description: DALLAS  Michael Hinojosa was about to enter the ninth grade in Dallas when a federal judge ordered the citys public schools to integrate.

title: U.K. Officials Said Material on Tower Was Banned. It Wasnt.
description: LONDON  In the aftermath of Britains deadliest fire in decades, two senior officials sought to deflect blame from the government over the weekend by arguing that the type of building material believed to have spread flames rapidly up the 24-story Grenfell Tower had been banned under national fire safety regulations.

title: Twin Peaks Season 3, Episode 7: Absent Friends
description: It feels a little wrong to watch Twin Peaks on Fathers Day, given that the original series on ABC featured some of the worst fathers in TV history. Leland Palmer, who raped and killed his daughter Laura while possessed by an evil spirit? Ben Horne, who was so neglectful toward his daughter Audrey that he almost slept with her while she was going undercover as a prostitute? These gentlemen are not good dads.

title: N21: Spring 2018
description: The labels Mens 2018 spring looks.

title: In Bali, 4 Foreign Inmates Tunnel Out of Prison
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Four foreign inmates have escaped from a high-security prison on the Indonesian resort island of Bali after digging a 50-foot tunnel under the prisons walls, the authorities said on Monday.

title: Afghan Government Quietly Aids Breakaway Taliban Faction
description: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan  It was a particularly bitter fight in the heavily contested district of Gereshk in Helmand Province. The adversaries deployed suicide attackers, roadside explosives and a magnetic bomb stuck to the undercarriage of a commanders car, amid pitched firefights that went on for several days last week.

title: The 2017 U.S. Open Winners: Brooks Koepka and Millennial Pink
description: Brooks Koepka may have won his first major golf title on Sunday at the United States Open in Wisconsin, but he wasnt the only dominant player of the tournament. And Im not talking about Justin Thomas, who made history the day before by shooting the tournaments lowest score in relation to par. Im talking about what Mr. Thomas wore on his record-breaking day.

title: Russia Warns U.S. After Downing of Syrian Warplane
description: WASHINGTON  Long-running tensions between the United States and Russia erupted publicly on Monday as Moscow condemned the American militarys downing of a Syrian warplane and threatened to target aircraft flown by the United States and its allies west of the Euphrates.

title: Japan Says Deadly Ship Collision Happened Earlier Than Reported
description: TOKYO  The Japanese Coast Guard said on Monday that a deadly collision between a container ship and a United States Navy destroyer had occurred nearly an hour earlier than previously believed, adding that it was investigating whether there had been a delay in reporting the crash.

title: California Today: Talking to Californias Top Judge
description: Good morning.

title: The 15 Best-Educated Congressional Districts in the U.S.
description: Across the country, there are only 15 congressional districts where at least half of adults have a college degree.

title: Blue Apron Pursues I.P.O. as Amazon Looms Over Industry
description: Even as Amazons $13.4 billion bid for Whole Foods threatens to shake up food retailing, Blue Apron, a New York-based meal-delivery service, is setting its sights on a stock market debut.

title: Giorgio Armani: Spring 2018
description: Presents the Mens 2018 collection.

title: Londoners Fear We're Not Safe
description: Residents on Monday voiced their uneasiness and praised the community response after an attack in which a van plowed into pedestrians outside a mosque during Ramadan.

title: Justices to Hear Major Challenge to Partisan Gerrymandering
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court announced on Monday that it would consider whether partisan gerrymandering violates the Constitution, potentially setting the stage for a ruling that could for the first time impose limits on a practice that has helped define American politics since the early days of the Republic.

title: Kim Kardashian West on Her New Beauty Line and Those Blackface Allegations
description: When it comes to beauty influencers, Kim Kardashian West can be credited as a pioneer. With her longtime makeup artist Mario Dedivanovic, she lauded the benefits of contouring (that old-school stage-makeup method of using darker base shades or bronzer to chisel and define features) early on. But unlike her half sister Kylie Jenner, whose Kylie Cosmetics line had its debut two years ago and has enjoyed booming success, Ms. Kardashian West held herself apart from the legions of social media tastemakers turned solo makeup entrepreneurs  until now.

title: After Terror Attacks, Britain Moves to Police the Web
description: After deadly terrorist attacks and a nationwide election, Britain is once again focusing on a controversial plan: to regulate the internet.

title: Kevin Durant Goes a Couple of Rounds With His Twitter Critics
description: Less than a week after winning his first N.B.A. championship, one might expect Kevin Durant to be basking on an island somewhere, content that his off-season gamble to take up with the Golden State Warriors had paid off.

title: Fendi: Spring 2018
description: Spring looks from Silvia Venturini Fendi.

title: Earth-Size Planets Among Final Tally of NASAs Kepler Telescope
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.  Are we still alone?

title: Armed Man Is Killed After Driving Into Police Convoy on Champs-lyses
description: PARIS  An armed man was killed in Paris on Monday afternoon after he rammed a car into a police convoy on the Champs-lyses, the French authorities said.

title: The iPhone Is 10 Years Old. Heres the Story of Its Birth.
description: THE ONE DEVICEThe Secret History of the iPhoneBy Brian MerchantIllustrated. 407 pp. Little, Brown & Company. $28.

title: Tamarind Now!
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Justices Strike Down Law Banning Disparaging Trademarks
description: WASHINGTON  In a decision likely to bolster the Washington Redskins efforts to protect their trademarks, the Supreme Court on Monday ruled that the government may not refuse to register potentially offensive names. A law denying protection to disparaging trademarks, the court said, violated the First Amendment.

title: U.K. to Decide on 21st Century Fox Deal for Sky by June 29
description: Rupert Murdochs legacy as a media mogul will be tested in the coming days, with the British government set to decide next week whether 21st Century Fox should be allowed to buy the rest of Sky, the British satellite giant.

title: A Dire Weekly Total for the U.S.: 25 Children Killed by Guns
description: Gunshots are the second leading cause of injury-related death in children, exceeded only by car accidents. In a typical week in the United States, 25 children die from bullet wounds.

title: Our Phones Are Being Monitored: How a Hacking Story Unfurled
description: Azam Ahmed: One morning earlier this year, I got a call from Mario E. Patrn, a prominent human rights lawyer in Mexico. He wanted to talk in person. When he arrived at The New York Timess Mexico bureau, he took a seat in the conference room and asked me for my phone. He then collected the phones of everyone else in the room, walked them outside and placed them in our lobby. Out of earshot. Our phones are being monitored, he told me.

title: Road Rage Is Cited in Killing of Muslim Girl in Virginia
description: The killing of a Muslim teenager in Virginia whose body was found in a pond on Sunday was most likely a road rage incident and not a hate crime, the Fairfax County Police Department said on Monday night.

title: Do Birds Listen When You Play Music?
description: Q. Do the songbirds on the wire outside my window listen when I practice the violin?

title: Ice Cream Carnival Pops Up in NoLIta
description: Chefs Club Counter will take on the look of a carnival for summer thanks to OddFellows Ice Cream. Caramel-popcorn soft serve, cones swathed in cotton candy, candied peanuts and rainbow sprinkles are some of the treats for sale inside a room transformed to look like a striped circus tent. Sidewalk jugglers and stilt walkers will be on hand for opening day on Wednesday as well as subsequent Saturdays: Through Labor Day.  OddFellows Carnival at Chefs Club Counter, 62 Spring Street (Lafayette Street), 646-438-9172, chefsclubcounter.com, oddfellowsnyc.com.

title: A French Shop Moves to Brooklyn
description: A small corner of France appeared in Brooklyn a few months ago. The chef Laurent Chavenet moved his Staten Island shop, French Tart, to South Park Slope to cater to the fair number of French residents who live there. He has stocked the cafe, now Le French Tart, with imported cheeses, condiments and biscuits, along with domestic items, especially charcuterie. Croissants, including whole grain, and other baked goods like tartlets, cookies and excellent quiches, are made on the premises. When people come here, I want them to taste France, he said: Le French Tart, 579 Fifth Avenue (16th Street), South Park Slope, Brooklyn, 929-276-3035.

title: A Ros That Defies the Season
description: Let this wine chill a bit and you have a distinctive ros for summer, the first from the Napa Valley estate of Grgich Hills. The winemaker, Ivo Jeramaz, was inspired by the Mediterranean, but what he achieved goes beyond the typical crisp blush of Provence. The wine is organic, mostly a Bordeaux blend with some touches of zinfandel and gewrztraminer. Set aside a few bottles of this garnet-pink wine for Thanksgiving dinner; its berry-rich aroma and cranberry tartness are tailor-made for the autumn feast: Grgich Hills Estate Ros 2016, $25, grgich.com.

title: Children Get Sticky Making Bread in Brooklyn
description: A hands-on class at the Museum of Food and Drink in Brooklyn will explore bread. The one-hour class, for children 8 to 12, will be led by Karen Bornarth of Hot Bread Kitchen in Harlem. Participants will learn how to make bread, get their hands sticky as they work with dough, and take home some sourdough starter: Saturday  at 10 a.m., $15 per child with up to two adult companions free, Museum of Food and Drink, 62 Bayard Street (Lorimer Street), Williamsburg, Brooklyn, 718-387-2845, mofad.org.

title: A Student Strike Becomes an Occupation, for 17 Years
description: MEXICO CITY  Exams are over and classrooms have gone dark as summer comes to the National Autonomous University of Mexico, the pride of the countrys public education system.

title: Supreme Court Rules for Bush Officials in Post-9/11 Suit
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court ruled on Monday that several high-ranking Bush administration officials may not be sued for policies adopted after the attacks of Sept. 11, 2001. The officials include John Ashcroft, the former attorney general, and Robert S. Mueller III, the former F.B.I. director who is now investigating possible links between the Trump administration and Russia.

title: Inspired by War Zones, Balloon Device May Save Civilians From Fatal Blood Loss
description: A high school senior mowed down by a car with other pedestrians in last months Times Square attack was hemorrhaging internally and transfusions could not keep up with the blood loss.

title: Gifts to Adult Children, While the Parents Are Still Alive
description: To the Editor:

title: Arianna Huffington Gains Power at Uber
description: Uber, the ride-hailing service, is undergoing a lot of turbulence of late, including leadership questions. The companys chief executive, Travis Kalanick, is taking an indefinite leave of absence. There is churn in the executive ranks, and on Ubers board, too.

title: Palm Angels: Spring 2018
description: The labels Mens 2018 collection.

title: Making Your Messages Really Move
description: Q. Whats the fastest way to get animated GIFs into text messages?

title: Mistrial in the Bill Cosby Case
description: To the Editor:

title: Precision and Attack: Benjamin Millepieds In Silence We Speak
With Witness, Katy Perry Is the Second Woman to Hit No. 1 in 2017
description: The new, more introspective version of Katy Perry has something in common with the old Katy: a No. 1 album.

title: The High-Tech Device Thats Like a Bouncer for Mosquitoes
description: Dotted around Houston, hidden in overgrown backyards and piles of old tires, are what look like 10 tiny models of Hollywoods iconic Capitol Records building.

title: Megyn Kelly Interview With Alex Jones Draws 3.5 Million Viewers
description: It apparently wasnt must-see TV.

title: A Streamlined Way to Build Projects Runs Into New York Politics
description: By now, it has been well established that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Mayor Bill de Blasio diverge on many issues, leading to sharp words over who is to blame for subway delays, competing plans for financing affordable housing and even a disagreement over saving a beloved white-tailed deer.

title: Trading the No. 1 Pick Worked Out Well for the Celtics in 1980
description: BOSTON  As the 2017 N.B.A. draft approaches, history is, perhaps, repeating itself in Boston. If it is, Celtics fans will be immensely gratified.

title: Netflix and Amazon Still Have Great New Movies and TV Shows Coming This Month
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation newsletter and website.

title: Lemon Bars
description: Bursting with pure lemon flavor, this classic dessert is a picnic-table standout.

title: The Ideal Lemon Bar: A Fierce Filling and a Strong Supporting Crust
description: When the pastry chef Shuna Lydon was preparing for the opening of Bouchon, the chef Thomas Kellers supposedly casual and impossibly perfect French bistro in Napa Valley, he told her it would be the hardest thing shed ever done  more difficult than her work creating desserts like white truffle egg creams at the French Laundry.

title: The 7-Foot Question at the Heart of the Knicks Future
description: Kristaps Porzingis and Willy Hernangomez first teamed up in 2013 in Seville, Spain, playing for that citys prominent basketball club. They were reunited this past season as Knicks after a year in which they were an ocean apart.

title: From Opioid Epidemics Front Lines, Filling In the Brutal Back Story
description: ELIZABETHTOWN, N.Y.  As a county coroner here, Frank Whitelaw has an unusual perspective to share with local students on the opioid crisis. He is the one who examines the bodies.

title: Diana Krall on Handling Grief, and Finding Romance in Everything
description: On a spring afternoon, Diana Krall sat in an empty Caf Carlyle, quoting lines from Woody Allens Hannah and Her Sisters in a respectable New Yawk accent. Ms. Krall, the jazz pianist and singer, mentioned a scene in which Mr. Allens character takes a date to see Bobby Short, the Carlyles longtime cultural ambassador.

title: Yiddish Theater Plans an Immigration Arts Summit
description: The National Yiddish Theater Folksbiene, a downtown cultural mainstay for 100 years, has recently placed an emphasis on cross-cultural pollination: its annual KulturfestNYC festival started in 2015 and has brought together performers from Argentina to Russia to Japan. Now, the Folksbiene will host the Immigration Arts Summit on July 17-18, featuring a diverse array of cultural arts groups. The summit will feature panels, discussions and performances at the Museum of Jewish Heritage, and culminate in a free concert in Robert Wagner Park.

title: For the Business Traveler Worried About Security: Youre Not Alone
description: Corporate travel managers have long had their hands full dealing with political unrest, terrorism and severe weather around the world. But now, they are contending with new complications  issues like security at border crossings and the legalities of data searches of electronic devices at airports.

title: Madrid Transit Officials Tackle El Manspreading
description: That annoying habit some men have of spreading their legs on buses and trains, encroaching on seats next to them, has become so universal that one word crosses language barriers to describe it.

title: Move Over, Bitcoin. Ether Is the Digital Currency of the Moment.
description: The price of Bitcoin has hit record highs in recent months, more than doubling in price since the start of the year. Despite these gains, Bitcoin is on the verge of losing its position as the dominant virtual currency.

title: Beating of U.S. Protesters by Turkish Security
description: To the Editor:

title: Billions Worth of Baubles Could Wind Up in U.S. Hands in 1MDB Case
description: You can almost hear Robin Leach narrating the introduction to an episode of Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous by describing a luxury yacht, diamond jewelry, a Picasso painting, and real estate in New York, Beverly Hills and London.

title: Walmart Will Struggle to Top Amazons Offer for Whole Foods
description: Walmarts market capitalization dropped 5 percent, losing $11 billion, after Amazon unveiled its $13.4 billion deal to buy Whole Foods Market on Friday. Meanwhile, Whole Foods shares closed Friday nearly 2 percent above the agreed price, implying that some investors think a rival bid could emerge. But even for Walmart, that would be a stretch.

title: Review: Good Muslim Highlights a Mixed Bag of One-Acts
description: Most one-act plays have, by default, a tight focus: between two and four characters, unity of time and place. The Good Muslim, on the other hand, ambitiously moves seven characters through a fast-food prep area, a porch, the subway and even virtual reality. Zakiyyah Alexanders piece  part of the final installment of Ensemble Studio Theaters annual one-act play series  also tackles assimilation, racism and sexism.

title: Review: Wait, Was That Confucius? PBSs Rushed Story of China
description: Six hours of television would be enough to cover the histories of most countries satisfactorily, but China is not most countries.

title: Brexit, Syria, Champs-lyses: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: After U.S. Open Breakthrough, Brooks Koepka Thanks a Calming Force
description: ERIN, Wis.  Trey Jones had replied to dozens of texts and emails and spoken by phone with several well-wishers Sunday night after Brooks Koepka, whom Jones coached at Florida State, became the fourth Seminole, after Hubert Green, Paul Azinger and Jeff Sluman, to win a mens golf major championship.

title: Hear the New Singer of the World Winner
description: Catriona Morison, a Scottish mezzo-soprano, burst out of the pack to win the prestigious BBC Cardiff Singer of the World competition in Wales on Sunday. It was a surprise that she even made it to the finals: The judges gave her a wild-card slot to go up against the four winners of the previous concert rounds.

title: Want to Work for Jaguar Land Rover? Start Playing Phone Games
description: LONDON  Want to work for Jaguar Land Rover? You could improve your chances by solving puzzles.

title: Trumps Reversal of U.S. Policy on Cuba
description: To the Editor:

title: Brexit Talks Open in Brussels, With a Mountain to Climb
description: BERLIN  Britain and the European Union began formal negotiations on Monday over how Britain will leave the bloc and what might come afterward. The talks began a year after British voters chose withdrawal in a referendum and three months after Britain gave formal notice of its intention to pull out.

title: For Emmanuel Macron, Fight for France Is Just Beginning
description: PARIS  Emmanuel Macron won the battle of the votes in Sundays parliamentary voting, but he hasnt necessarily won the battle of the voices, and that could spell trouble for his pro-market agenda down the road.

title: Capturing the Scene at 200 M.P.H.
description: For two weeks in late spring, motorbikes zoom at death-defying speeds (sometimes topping 200 m.p.h.) up, down and around a 37.7 mile course on the narrow public roads of the Isle of Man for the TT (or Tourist Trophy) race, which is easily among the most dangerous in the world.

title: Otto Warmbier, American Student Released From North Korea, Dies
description: Otto F. Warmbier, the University of Virginia honors student who was released from a North Korean prison last week after spending 17 months in captivity and more than a year in a coma, died on Monday at the Cincinnati hospital where he had been receiving treatment, his family said.

title: C.B.O. Head, Who Prizes Nonpartisanship, Finds Work Under G.O.P. Attack
description: WASHINGTON  When much of Washington was glued to the testimony of former F.B.I. director James B. Comey this month, Keith Hall, the head of the Congressional Budget Office, was one of the few who averted their eyes from televisions.

title: Saudis Say They Seized 3 Iranians Planning Terrorist Act at Sea
description: TEHRAN  Saudi Arabia said on Monday that its navy had seized three members of Irans Revolutionary Guards piloting a boat loaded with explosives toward a Saudi offshore oil drilling rig.

title: Carrie Fisher Tested Positive for Drugs Before Her Death, Coroner Says
description: Carrie Fisher tested positive for cocaine, methadone, ethanol and opiates when she was admitted to the hospital four days before her death in December, according to a toxicology report released on Monday by the Los Angeles County Department of Medical Examiner-Coroner.

title: A Big Beneficiary of 2017 Tony Awards? Oslo, a Play About Diplomacy
description: The big money and the media attention at the Tony Awards are invariably directed at the musicals and the host, but the biggest short-term beneficiary of this years broadcast is a three-hour play about the Middle East peace process.

title: New Beef Jerky for Summer Snacking
description: The latest flavor from Krave Jerky, spiced with pink peppercorns and Himalayan pink salt, could be the next cocktail nibble at the beach. The company is not shy when it comes to inventive flavors; it also makes cabernet-rosemary beef jerky and basil-citrus turkey jerky: Pink Peppercorn Beef Jerky, $5.99 for 2.7 ounces, kravejerky.com.

title: Review: Operas Within Operas Within Operas: A Baroque Explosion in Boston
description: BOSTON  So how did the biennial Boston Early Music Festival, which ended on Sunday, celebrate this years big anniversary, the 450th birthday of Claudio Monteverdi? Having stolen a march on the field in 2015 with productions of all three of Monteverdis surviving operas, as well as a performance of his 1610 Vespers, it mostly ignored the occasion, featuring instead two operatic larks.

title: A Famous Argentine Chef on Food and Romance
description: Chef Francis Mallmann doesnt like to play it safe. He is perhaps best known for playing with fire  and the Argentine barbecuing techniques he demonstrated on Netflixs docu-series Chefs Table. He has opened restaurants in destinations as far-flung as a ghost town in Uruguay and the mountains of Mendoza. And now, he opens his first European restaurant at Chteau La Coste, the 600-acre organic winery and open-air contemporary art park on a remote estate north of Aix-en-Provence.

title: In The Retreat of Western Liberalism, How Democracy Is Defeating Itself
description: In his insightful and harrowing new book, Edward Luce, a columnist for The Financial Times, issues a chilling warning: Western liberal democracy is not yet dead, he writes, but it is far closer to collapse than we may wish to believe. It is facing its gravest challenge since the Second World War. This time, however, we have conjured up the enemy from within. At home and abroad, Americas best liberal traditions are under assault from its own president. We have put arsonists in charge of the fire brigade.

title: Prada, Versace, Ralph Lauren Purple Label, Ferragamo and Moncler
description: A photo diary of the spring/summer 2018 collections that were presented in Milan.

title: The Best of Milan Mens Fashion Week
description: Furs and boiler suits, blousy baroque prints and Great Gatsby suiting. What do all these have in common? Well, nothing, other than the fact that they were all proposed by different Milanese designers as dressing options for men for spring/summer 2018. The overall takeaway from the Milan mens wear shows was that designers pulled in their own distinct directions, ignoring trends, and proposing what they do best. Even in troubled times, theres a customer for that kind of conviction.

title: Syria, London, Supreme Court: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Tom Ford Spring 2018
description: Mr. Ford is returning to color this season.

title: Yearning for New Physics at CERN, in a Post-Higgs Way
description: MEYRIN, Switzerland  The worlds biggest and most expensive time machine is running again.

title: A Chat With the Ever-Evolving Tom Ford
description: MILAN  Classics, the designer Tom Ford said, looking out over his showroom. We make classic mens wear. Thats what I like on men.

title: A Top Presidential Public Defender Was Also a Twitter Critic
description: WASHINGTON  In April, Mark Corallo, the spokesman for President Trumps personal legal team, used Twitter to suggest  twice  that Vice President Mike Pence, not Mr. Trump, should be the Republican nominee for president in 2020.

title: Stackable Mixing Bowls for the Millennial Set
description: This is not your mothers Pyrex: These lightweight bowls come in more sizes and subtler colors. The seven nesting bowls are made from bamboo, yet they are dishwasher safe and damage resistant. Consider them for serving at outdoor parties, or give them as a wedding or housewarming gift: Pastel Nesting Bowls, $70 ($56 for Museum of Modern Art members), store.moma.org.

title: Gerrymandering Case Echoes in Inkblot-Like Districts Across the U.S.
description: The Supreme Courts decision to hear a case on partisan gerrymandering in Wisconsin is being closely watched in other states, including Pennsylvania, where a lawsuit is challenging the process that gave the state its so-called Goofy Kicking Donald Duck-shaped congressional district.

title: In Greece, China Finds an Ally Against Human Rights Criticism
description: GENEVA  China has long won diplomatic allies in the worlds poor countries by helping them build expensive roads and ports. Now, it appears to have similarly won over a needy country in Europe.

title: Portugal Fire Survivors Recount Confusion Amid a Search for Escape
description: NODEIRINHO, Portugal  Constantino Gracieta and his wife were among the lucky ones. At first, they got in their car and tried to escape the advancing flames that swept across a vast, dry forest in central Portugal over the weekend.

title: Discussing the Vietnam War With Ken Burns and Lynn Novick
description: Ken Burns has already directed landmark documentaries on the Civil War and World War II, but the Vietnam War was a different challenge entirely. From the Vietnamese declaration of independence in 1945 to the fall of Saigon 30 years later, the war killed millions of civilians and combatants and left deep fissures in American society, creating cultural and political rifts that still divide the country.

title: An Attack on Muslims Shakes Cosmopolitan London
description: LONDON  Like many of Londons Muslims, Mohammed Abdullah grew tired of defending himself, and his religion, after Islamist terrorists carried out two attacks in the city and another in Manchester during the past three months. Hostile glances followed him on the street, and rising fury greeted him on social media.

title: Art Forger Is Accused of Selling Fake Prints. Again.
description: Just 15 days after being released from prison, a ubiquitous forger started selling phony art again, the authorities said.

title: Miuccia Prada and Sylvia Fendi Grapple With the New World
description: MILAN  The coming of the robots; the end of work as it was previously understood; the lonely, hollow ring accompanying the virtual noises ceaselessly sent into the ether, sounds without echoes: These were some of the unlikely themes linking a bunch of disparate designers here over the past week.

title: Bill Dana, Comic Best Known for Jos Jimnez Character, Dies at 92
description: Bill Dana, a comedian and comedy writer whose most famous character, the bumbling, English-mangling Jos Jimnez, provoked anger as well as laughter, died on Thursday at his home in Nashville. He was 92.

title: Larry Grantham, Defensive Captain of Champion Jets, Dies at 78
description: Larry Grantham, an undersize linebacker who as the defensive captain of the Jets helped the team upset the Baltimore Colts in Super Bowl III, a watershed game in the history of professional football, died on Saturday in Jackson, Miss. He was 78.

title: A Piece of Gum Outside the Window
description: Dear Diary:

title: Conglomerates Didnt Die. They Look Like Amazon.
description: The conglomerate was supposed to be dead, a relic of a bygone era of corporate America. Investors, we have been repeatedly told, want smaller, nimbler, more focused companies.

title: Gleyber Torres, a Top Yankees Prospect, Will Undergo Tommy John Surgery
description: Gleyber Torres, one of the Yankees top prospects, tore the ulnar collateral ligament in his left elbow and will have season-ending surgery, the team announced Monday.

title: Why the Slants Took a Fight Over Their Band Name to the Supreme Court
description: On Monday, the Supreme Court ruled that a law denying federal trademark protection to names that are deemed disparaging is unconstitutional. It offends a bedrock First Amendment principle: Speech may not be banned on the ground that it expresses ideas that offend, Justice Samuel Alito wrote in the unanimous decision (though the justices were split on the exact reasoning).

title: Mayor de Blasio Waits (and Waits) for a New Mandate to Run New Yorks Schools
description: Theres still not much love in Albany for Mayor Bill de Blasio. Hoping to win a last-minute deal in the Legislature to extend mayoral control over city schools, he telephoned the leader of the Republicans in the State Senate, John J. Flanagan, on Monday morning.

title: In Raising the Bar, the Young Yankees Face a Trade Predicament
description: There is nothing more potentially destructive for a major league baseball team than a slow start  unless, perhaps, it is a fast start that is too difficult to sustain.

title: For Jay Sekulow, New Trump Lawyer, Public Stumble Is Out of Character
description: WASHINGTON  It was supposed to be a simple message for a man known as an articulate advocate.

title: Terrorist or Disturbed Loner? The Contentious Politics of a Label
description: When a 48-year-old man rammed a van into a crowd near a London mosque on Monday morning, controversy quickly erupted over whether the attack would be treated as less significant than others because it was committed against Muslims but not by them.

title: Jared Kushner Is About to Plunge Into Middle East Diplomacy
description: WASHINGTON  Jared Kushner, the presidential adviser who oversees a bulging policy portfolio but operates mainly behind the scenes in his father-in-laws White House, is stepping out this week, meeting with technology executives on Monday and making a foray into Middle East diplomacy days later.

title: Tech Titans Make Pilgrimage to White House to Discuss Government Systems
description: WASHINGTON  Silicon Valley is fuming about President Trumps stance on climate and immigration, but top technology executives still made a pilgrimage to the White House on Monday to discuss a potential upgrade of government technology.

title: Corrections: June 20, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: 7 Sailors Emerged From Diverse Backgrounds to Pursue a Common Cause
description: The seven sailors who died when the destroyer Fitzgerald collided with a container ship last weekend were a snapshot of the nation they served: an immigrant from the Philippines whose father served in the Navy before him; a poor teenager whose Guatemalan family came north eager for opportunity; a native of Vietnam hoping to help his family; a firefighters son from a rural crossroads in the rolling green fields of Virginia.

title: Senate Democrats Try to Gum Up Works Over Affordable Care Act Repeal
description: WASHINGTON  Democrats vowed on Monday to slow work in the Senate to a crawl to protest the secrecy surrounding the Republican effort to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, as Republican leaders raced to prepare a bill for a vote as soon as next week.

title: Man Who Jumped From Ambulance Says Its New York Citys Fault
description: In an ambulance speeding through Staten Island, a patient began tending to his own needs. He unbuckled the straps of the gurney on which he lay, and opened the doors of the moving vehicle.

title: Quotation of the Day: Cladding Eyed in Inferno Isnt Banned, Experts Say
description: It is like you have got a high-rise building and you are encasing it in kerosene.

title: Investment Group Challenges Chicago Tribune in Effort to Buy Sun-Times
description: With the future of The Chicago Sun-Times hanging in the balance, a group of investors led by the Chicago businessman Edwin Eisendrath submitted a bid for the newspaper on Monday, setting up a potential battle with the owner of The Chicago Tribune.

title: Otto Warmbier Dies Days After Release From North Korea
description: Mr. Warmbier, the U.S. student held by North Korea for 17 months, was released in a coma to the United States on June 13. He died on June 19. He was 22 years old.

title: Criticized Team Names Get a Legal Lift, but the Price Could Be High
description: A decision by the United States Supreme Court on Monday that could help the Washington Redskins secure legal protections for its nickname, long a target of activists and many sports fans who call it offensive, will most likely further muddy the longstanding debate in sports over team names and mascots.

title: Free Speech at the Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court reaffirmed core free-speech principles in two cases on Monday, both decided without dissent. It also took on a major case about partisan gerrymandering.

title: Review: Specters of the Stage Enchant in Ghost Light
description: The glorious ghosts who walk the halls of the Claire Tow Theater at Lincoln Center have greasepaint in their ectoplasm, and they do hope youll like what they do. These wandering souls are doomed to an eternity of narcissism, yet there is something they love even more than themselves.

title: Arrivals and Departures
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Jason Flinn offers us a very simple concept today. This simplicity is great for solvers and is also deeply, deeply ironic in that it is the polar opposite of the actual experience of air travel, which his theme suggests.

title: Better Call Saul Finale: Michael McKean on Chucks Inflammatory Act
description: This interview includes spoilers for the Season 3 finale of Better Call Saul.

title: Cubas Foreign Minister Calls Trumps New Policy a Grotesque Spectacle
description: Mexico City  Cubas foreign minister on Monday delivered a searing rebuke of President Trumps new policy toward the island nation by calling it a grotesque spectacle and vowed that his country will never negotiate under pressure or under threat.

title: The Symptoms of Dying
description: You and I, one day well die from the same thing. Well call it different names: cancer, diabetes, heart failure, stroke.

title: How to Pull Off Rainbow Hair and Still Look Like an Adult
description: When that 80s signature, rainbow-colored hair made a comeback, it was wilder than ever. Layers of crazy pink transitioning to purple, blue and green now pepper Instagram feeds and pop up in everyday life  and not just at the Mermaid Parade.

title: In French Labor Overhaul, Union Leader Offers a Way to a Compromise
description: PARIS  As thousands of workers last summer protested changes to Frances labor laws, Laurent Berger, the head of one of the countrys most influential unions, got an unsettling call.

title: At Colleges, Demographic Changes Everywhere but the Top
description: Although diversifying the makeup of student bodies has been a major effort on college campuses in recent years, when it comes to the presidents office, there has been little change: The typical college president continues to be a white man in his early 60s, a new national survey has found.

title: Exxon Mobil Lends Its Support to a Carbon Tax Proposal
description: Exxon Mobil, other oil companies and a number of other corporate giants announced on Tuesday that they are supporting a plan to tax carbon emissions that was put forth this year by a group of Republican elder statesmen.

title: London, Emmanuel Macron, Brexit: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Dagger, but No Cloak: Brazils Top Spy Exposes C.I.A. Officer
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Intelligence officers who think they might like to be posted in Brazil take note: A simple meeting with the countrys spying hierarchy can get your cover blown.

title: Fatal Police Shooting of Seattle Woman Raises Mental Health Questions
description: Officers with the Seattle Police Department were no strangers to Unit 4303 in the Brettler Family Place apartment complex in the northeast part of the city. After they responded to at least three domestic violence calls there in the past year, the police were dispatched there again on Sunday morning to investigate a theft in Charleena Lyless unit.

title: Dont Miss Chance to Rewrite Tax Code, Paul Ryan Will Tell His Party
description: WASHINGTON  Speaker Paul D. Ryan, hoping to revive his dream of rewriting the tax code, will insist in a speech on Tuesday that Republicans come together to avoid letting a once in a generation opportunity slip out of their hands.

title: Afghanistan and Ireland Are Poised to Join Crickets Elite
description: LONDON  The International Cricket Council plans to award Test status to Afghanistan and Ireland in a vote this week, adding the countries to the elite group of 10 nations that play the five-day format that is considered the sports highest level of competition.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: Queen Sugar, Paterson and Wendy and Lucy
description: Ride the rush of Queen Sugar as a second season begins. Or opt for the quiet charm and scene-stealing dog performances of Paterson and Wendy and Lucy.

title: Found Poem Favorite | She
description: We are honoring the top winners of our Eighth Annual Found Poem Student Contest by publishing their work from June 13 to July 3. Youll be able to read the whole collection here as we go.

title: Olympic Canoeing Prizes Balance, and Adds More Women to Provide It
description: PRAGUE  The careers of many athletes have been drastically changed as the International Olympic Committee moves closer to its goal of gender equality at the Olympics. On June 9, the I.O.C. increased the number of womens events and participants for the Tokyo Games in 2020 in sports like boxing, canoeing, judo, rowing, sailing and shooting.

title: Anytown, U.S.A.  in Saudi Arabia
description: Ayesha Maliks new book will examine her hometown, Dhahran, a gated community for employees of Saudi Aramco.

title: As Government Retrenches, Philanthropy Booms
description: Last year, as Kalamazoo, Mich., struggled with a budget deficit and other economic woes, two local philanthropists stepped forward, pledging $70 million to improve the citys fortunes. Earlier in 2016, a group of foundations put up even more money to help another troubled Michigan city, Flint, recover from the contamination of its water supply. And a few years before that, foundations helped to rescue Detroit from bankruptcy.

title: For Macron, Triumph and a Warning
description: Along with conferring the legislative power to easily enact promised economic and social reforms, the overwhelming victory by President Emmanuel Macrons party and its allies in Sundays National Assembly election in France allowed Mr. Macron to make good on his promise of political renewal. Many of the winners in his party were first-time candidates, including some of Arab or African ancestry. A historic number of women also won seats: 223 of 577 members, versus 155 in the last Parliament.

title: Philando Castile and the Terror of an Ordinary Day
description: Philando Castile was shot to death last July on his way home from buying groceries with his girlfriend and her 4-year-old daughter. Last week, the Minnesota police officer who killed him was acquitted by a jury on all counts.

title: Where Are the Rape-Kit Nurses?
description: Las Vegas  If you are an adult victim of sexual assault in Las Vegas, there is only one hospital where you can go to have a rape kit completed. Only two nurses in that hospital have specialized training to do the exam.

title: Brotherhood and Loss in the Mekong Delta
description: It was the spring of 1966 and I was 19 years old, working nights at a General Motors plant in Van Nuys, Calif., and attending day classes at Pierce College, carrying 12 credits and a student deferment status. I owned a brand new 1965 Chevelle Malibu Super Sport, and I had a gorgeous girlfriend. Life was simply great! But I soon grew weary of my college curriculum and dropped out, intending to resume the following semester.

title: Empowering Women to Break the Jihadi Cycle
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Husnul Khotimah Tuban had no previous business experience when she started her roadside shop selling sandals and dolls in Jatirogo, East Java. She had to work to support her two children and picked the trade almost at random. Business was fine. She could put food on the table. After she attended free entrepreneurship training last year, though, she picked up one useful idea: print some of the sandals with the phrase This belongs to the mosque. That simple tweak, she said, has turned local mosques into major clients, because it deters visitors from making off with the specially designated sterile shoes available there.

title: What if They Dont Even Make a Sausage?
description: Bret Stephens:  Somewhere between the appearance of Jeff Sessions before the Senate and the Cosby Horror Show mistrial, we had this awful attempted massacre of Representative Steve Scalise, the G.O.P. whip, and others on a baseball field in Virginia. This seems to have prompted three types of reaction from the national commentariat: He (the shooter) is nuts; you (the person on the other side of the political divide) are nuts; we (the country in which all bad things conspire to produce this) are nuts. Where do you come down?

title: Lets Not Get Carried Away
description: I was the op-ed editor at The Wall Street Journal at the peak of the Whitewater scandal. We ran a series of investigative pieces raising serious questions (as we say in the scandal business) about the nefarious things the Clintons were thought to have done back in Arkansas.

title: Can You Kill the Islamic State?
description: Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the self-appointed caliph of the self-described Islamic State, might have been killed. Again.

title: Lawyers Cant Save America From Trump
description: Lawyers, rather than elected leaders or activists, are playing the most visible role in responding to emergencies created by the Trump administration. I have a great deal of respect for attorneys  as a law professor, I make my living by training them  but they are not the best first responders to the Trump presidency.

title: If Liberals Voted ...
description: If liberals voted at the same rate as conservatives, Hillary Clinton would be president. Even with Donald Trumps working-class appeal, Clinton could have swept Michigan, Wisconsin and Pennsylvania.

title: An Intergenerational Graduacin
description: My mother was three months away from graduating when soldiers opened fire on her and other students at the National University of El Salvador. It was June 1980, several months into the Salvadoran civil war, and the military believed that students were aiding guerrilla fighters. My mother fled the attack past wounded classmates and blood-spattered walls, shaken but unharmed. The school closed. The war lasted 12 more years.

title: A New Rating for TV and Movies Tries to Combat Gender Stereotypes
description: Thirty-two years ago, the cartoonist Alison Bechdel proposed a test to determine whether a movie portrayed girls and women as fully formed characters: Does it have two female characters who talk to each other about something other than a man? A yes meant pass. Now the nonprofit media watchdog group Common Sense Media is applying a new test to its ratings of movies and television shows: Do they combat gender stereotypes?

title: Anytown, U.S.A.  in Saudi Arabia
description: Ayesha Malik had a pretty idyllic childhood. She spent her days biking down tree-lined streets past green lawns and modest houses, going to softball practice. It would have been fairly standard Norman Rockwell Americana  if it hadnt taken place in an enclosed compound in Saudi Arabia operated by the worlds largest oil company.

title: Mets Home Run Barrage Cant Overcome Wheelers Poor Pitching
description: LOS ANGELES  What if, you Mets fan probably reading this early Tuesday in New York, woke up to learn that your favorite team hit four home runs against Clayton Kershaw, baseballs best starting pitcher, late the night before in Los Angeles? What if it managed six runs against Kershaw, the first time he had allowed that many in a start in two years?

title: Barclays and Former Executives Charged in Qatar Fund-Raising
description: LONDON  With two capital infusions in 2008, Barclays was able to survive the financial crisis without a government bailout even as other British banks teetered.

title: Inside an Iraqi Majors Battle Against ISIS
description: Ben C. Solomon, a Times video journalist, tells the story of Major Sajjad al-Hour as he leads 150 men through the war-torn streets of Mosul.

title: New Sentences: From Infinite Tuesday, by Michael Nesmith
description: Here is a pithy summation of the special loneliness of genius. Great artists live in a world in which their own excellence does not exist. They are shut out, uniquely, from their defining achievements. In the same way that an apple cant eat an apple and a sunset cant admire a sunset and the Matterhorn cant ski its own slopes, Michael Jackson could never watch himself dance, at least not the way everyone else on Earth did. Although Herman Melville wrote every word of Moby-Dick, he could never read it as a reader  could never unsee the origin of all those wild metaphors, never turn the page with true surprise. Artists may know when theyve done something great, but theyll never know what its like to experience it from the other end. Its like how we cant tickle our own feet.

title: How to Have an Affordable Vacation in Greece
description: A high-end vacation in Greece is within reach even if you dont have a big budget, says Christos Stergiou, the founder and owner of TrueGreece, an Athens-based travel company selling luxury trips to Greece. Compared to many other European countries popular with travelers, Greece is affordable, and its possible to have a very upscale vacation here without blowing the bank, he said.

title: Dear Match Book: What Audiobooks Will Liven Up My Summer Road Trips?
description: Dear Match Book,

title: Tired of Winning? You Should Be
description: Not long ago in America, there was a widespread belief that some things were good for everyone. Never mind balancing competing interests: Why should anyone have to lose? Back then, you often heard the phrase win-win, business-speak for an arrangement that could benefit all parties involved. Barack Obama, always keen to pitch his policies as a product of well-reasoned consensus, applied this phrase to everything from international relations to solar energy; in 2014, he even described new fuel standards for trucks as a win-win-win  youve got three wins.

title: The Rise of Jeremy Corbyn and the Death Throes of Neoliberalism
description: We do not believe in untrammeled free markets. We reject the cult of selfish individualism. We abhor social division, injustice, unfairness and inequality.

title: Is North Carolina the Future of American Politics?
description: On the last Thursday in March, the air horns returned to the governors mansion in Raleigh, N.C. There were about 75 of them, and they belonged to the Air Horn Orchestra, an ad hoc ensemble of liberal activists. In 2016 the orchestra gathered once a week for 30 consecutive weeks, beginning right after North Carolinas Republican-dominated General Assembly passed  and the Republican governor Pat McCrory signed into law  House Bill 2, which prohibited transgender individuals from using public restrooms that match their gender identity and barred cities from passing anti-discrimination ordinances that protect gay and transgender people.

title: A Powerful, Disturbing History of Residential Segregation in America
description: THE COLOR OF LAWA Forgotten History of How Our Government Segregated AmericaBy Richard RothsteinIllustrated. 345 pp. Liveright Publishing. $27.95.

title: Reviving a French Opera
description: Step into Alcyone, an 18th-century French opera that had not been performed in Paris for 246 years.

title: What to Pack for a Galpagos Trip
description: Youll want comfortable shoes, a couple of swimsuits and, of course, plenty of sunscreen. But to really get the most out of your Galpagos trip, the editors at The Wirecutter, a product review website owned by The New York Times Company, recommend a few extras:

title: When the Job Is One Never-Ending Signal Malfunction
description: It can begin before the subway even stops in the station. As the operator in the front car slows the train to a halt, the riders on the platform catch his eye and gesture.

title: Same-Sex Parents Still Face Legal Complications
description: At gay pride marches around the country this month, there will be celebrations of marriage, a national right that, at just two years old, feels freshly exuberant to many lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender Americans.

title: Music and Ancient History in the Caucasus
description: The idea was to take a trip with my 22-year-old daughter, Liza, an adventure worthy of a college graduation present. We settled on a 10-day journey through the small Caucasus country of Georgia, with a swing through neighboring Turkey, in search of the long-lost kingdom of Tao.

title: Georgias Special Election Comes to a Nail-Biting Finish
description: Update: Karen Handel, a Republican, won a U.S. House seat in Georgia. Its a reprieve for President Trump and a demoralizing blow to Democrats.

title: In the Footsteps of Charles Darwin
description: The Galpagos Islands, with their gorgeous scenery, unparalleled and rare wildlife unafraid of humans, and paramount historical and scientific importance, were once a place you saved for years to see, a splurge that made a ski trip to Aspen look positively cheap in comparison. The only way to visit was by cruise ship, or by living aboard a boat, which put the cost, when combined with flights to the Ecuadorean mainland and then to the islands, out of the reach of many travelers.

title: On the Mexican Border, a Case for Technology Over Concrete
description: ROMA, Tex.  From a compact, portable shed on the outskirts of this border town, Jonathan Hoyt has an expansive field of vision. His computer is linked to cameras and surveillance equipment that allow him to see rubber rafts on the Mexican side of the Rio Grande nearly three miles away, simply by moving a tiny joystick.

title: Defiant on the Dance Floor: L.G.B.T.Q. Night Life in New York, 2017
description: Joey Arias, a gender-bending performer in the mold of a 1930s jazz chanteuse, was in his element as he looked out on the hundreds of plumed, spangled and painted 20-something men and women crowding the dance floor of Susanne Bartschs weekly summertime party, On Top.

title: Beyoncs Twins Are the Only Kids Trevor Noah Wants to See on Facebook
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: Georgia Runoff, Otto Warmbier, London: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: A Superhero Power for Our Time: How to Handle the Truth
description: What one does when faced with the truth is more difficult than you would think.  Wonder Woman, in the movie released last month.

title: The Daily: A Major in Mosul
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: New York Today: Color Coding the Subway
description: Good morning on this drier Tuesday.

title: Morning Agenda: Barclays Charged with Fraud
description: The British Serious Fraud Office has charged Barclays and four of the banks former executives with conspiracy to commit fraud. The charges come after a five-year investigation into the London-based lenders fund-raising at the height of the 2008 financial crisis.

title: When Soft Serve Isnt Enough, Add Cotton Candy
description: Marie Sullivan and Burton Eggertsen were walking off a dim sum lunch when they stopped to study the colorful menu in the window of Ruimilk Soft Icecream  a shop in Flushing, Queens, that combines soft-serve ice cream with cotton candy art.

title: Otto Warmbiers Death a New Wedge Between U.S. and North Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea  When a senior United States official visits North Korea, it is usually taken as a sign that tensions between the adversaries are easing somewhat. That is particularly true when the official brings home a newly freed American captive.

title: Russias Gay Propaganda Laws Are Illegal, European Court Rules
description: LONDON  Russias prohibition of what it considers the promotion of homosexuality is discriminatory and violates freedom of expression, Europes top human rights court ruled on Tuesday, in a strong rejection of laws that rights groups say have been routinely used as cover for abuse and violence.

title: As Sailors Bodies Are Flown to U.S., Fitzgerald Inquiries Intensify
description: TOKYO  As the bodies of the seven sailors who died aboard the American destroyer Fitzgerald last weekend were flown back to the United States from Japan on Tuesday, multiple investigations of the fatal collision with a container ship began in earnest.

title: How Neighbors Saw Man Held in London Mosque Attack: Drunk, Cursing and Vile
description: CARDIFF, Wales  He was born in Singapore, but his family moved back to Britain when he was a child. He had family problems and was known by locals as belligerent and aggressive, with a drinking problem. He had Muslim neighbors, who described his behavior as fairly unremarkable, and his children had Muslim friends.

title: California Today: Googles Idea for a New Silicon Valley
description: Good morning.

title: Netflix Lets Viewers Pick the Plot
description: Attention, kids: Netflix just put you in charge.

title: Twitter to Live-Stream Womens Hockey
description: As a full-time professional working in cybersecurity and technology research, Anya Battaglino is well versed in tracking the latest online trends.

title: Trade in the Balance: An Interview With Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada
description: Welcome to Times Insider Events  live programming for Times Insiders and their guests. Times Insider offers behind-the-scenes insights into news, features and opinion at The New York Times.

title: With Acrobats and Cake, a Paris Opera Celebrates Its Rebirth
description: PARIS  The Opra Comique has stood, in one form or another, on the discreet Place Boieldieu in central Paris since 1783, making it one of the oldest performance sites in the city.

title: Ford Chooses China, Not Mexico, to Build Its New Focus
description: DETROIT  In a move that highlights the shifting landscape of global auto production, Ford Motor said Tuesday that it would build its next-generation small car in China rather than in the United States or Mexico.

title: Patient Voices: A.L.S.
description: A.L.S., also known as Lou Gehrig's disease, is a progressive disease that causes difficulty walking, speaking, breathing and, ultimately, death. Here, five men and women speak about how A.L.S. has changed their lives.

title: Steven Pasquale, Set to Star in Junk, Backs Out of Brigadoon
description: One theaters gain is another ones loss.

title: Who Financed the Georgia Sixth, the Most Expensive House Election Ever
description: Candidates and outside groups have spent roughly $55 million in a battle over a U.S. House seat vacated by Tom Price, the health and human services secretary.

title: The Green Energy Revolution Will Happen Without Trump
description: The reaction to Trumps climate policies suggests a possible future, where states and cities take the brunt of climate responsibility.

title: Eater Hires a San Francisco Restaurant Critic
description: Eater, the website devoted to food and restaurant news in nearly two dozen American cities, is expanding its footprint in San Francisco with its first dedicated restaurant critic there.

title: Is There a Man I Can Talk To?: Stories of Sexism in the Workplace
description: Last week, after an Uber board members wisecrack and the interruption of Senator Kamala Harris during a Senate Intelligence Committee hearing, The New York Times asked women to share their own experiences. More than 1,000 responded, offering up vivid anecdotes of times they had been interrupted, penalized for speaking up, belittled or discriminated against in terms of salary, promotions or pregnancy.

title: Amazon Will Let Customers Try On Clothes Before Buying
description: SEATTLE  For many people, buying clothing online is not worth the hassle of getting a pair of pants or a shirt that does not fit. Many retailers have sought to eliminate that risk by offering free returns on clothing, but now Amazon is going even further.

title: Killing of 8 Afghan Guards Shows Bitter Change at Bagram
description: BAGRAM, Afghanistan  It used to be one of the most coveted jobs in Afghanistan: a position on a sprawling American military base, the biggest in the country. Pay was above average. The base was well guarded. The surrounding Parwan Province was one of the safest places in the country, well known as a Taliban-free zone.

title: A Former Refugee, Now a Fearless Champion for Women
description: This years winner of my annual win-a-trip contest, to take a student with me on a global reporting trip, is Aneri Pattani, a freshly minted graduate of Northeastern University  and a future star journalist! We traveled by Land Rover, (briefly) motorcycle and foot across Liberia, and here is Aneris first article from our trip. More posts are forthcoming, and Aneri is also interning for The Timess Science section this summer, so look for her articles there as well.  Nicholas Kristof

title: American Warplane Shoots Down Iranian-Made Drone Over Syria
description: WASHINGTON  An American F-15E fighter jet shot down an Iranian-made armed drone that was flying toward American-backed Syrian fighters and their advisers on Tuesday, Pentagon officials said.

title: Haven for Recovering Addicts Now Profits From Their Relapses
description: DELRAY BEACH, Fla.  It was the kind of afternoon that cold-weary tourists revel in as they sip mojitos near the beach  a dazzling sun, a sky so blue it verged on Photoshopped and weather fit for flip-flops. But the young visitor from Arkansas, curled up into a ball near the sidewalk, had a better reason to be grateful. He was alive.

title: Can Amazon Be the Next Apple?
description: Blood is running in the retail aisle. Sears, the most iconic name in American retailing, told its investors in March that substantial doubt exists related to the Companys ability to continue as a going concern. The appliance retailer HH Gregg went defunct at the end of May, and once-celebrated companies like Bebe and Limited are desperately trying to survive as online-only storefronts. The carnage has spread beyond empty shopping malls and big-box stores to the grocery trade. Last week, a poor earnings report cost Kroger, the nations second-largest food retailer, 19 percent of its stock market value in a matter of hours  and that was before Amazon announced its acquisition of Whole Foods Market.

title: A Blackberry Farm Chef Goes for a Broader Audience
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn.  A big smile broke out on the chef Joseph Lenns face when an elderly woman with a cloud of platinum hair burst through the door and waved excitedly at him. Thats Mary Evelyn, he said. Im pretty sure Im related to her. Ill have to call my mom later and ask her how.

title: The Best Articles and Interviews About Mondays Better Call Saul Finale
description: Better Call Saul delivered a surprisingly twisty, action-packed Season 3 finale on Monday night. In an episode that was extra long and ultra dark, Chuck (Michael McKean) loses his job; Jimmy (Bob Odenkirk) and a newly injured Kim (Rhea Seehorn) lose their office; and Hector Salamanca (Mark Margolis) loses his power within the drug cartel. And then theres that closing scene, when Chuck descends into madness, rips apart the walls of his own house and kicks over a flaming lantern.

title: What to Do When Chrome Wants to Update  but Cant
description: Q. I get a message when I open Chrome and use Gmail or Facebook every day that says that my Chrome version is out of date and that I need to upgrade. When I go to Chrome to check the version, it says I have the latest one. Why do I keep getting these messages?

title: Daily Report: When Tech Titans Go to Washington
description: A bunch of top technology executives and investors visited the White House on Monday. What unfolded?

title: When Amazon Comes to Town
description: Amazon agreed to buy the grocery chain Whole Foods for $13.4 billion.

title: Brooklyn Academy of Music Puts 70,000 Archive Materials Online
description: More than 70,000 playbills, posters and ephemera from the history of the Brooklyn Academy of Music  from as far back as the Civil War era  are now available through the Leon Levy BAM Digital Archive, which opened to the public on Tuesday.

title: 150 Psalms, 150 Composers at Lincoln Centers White Light Festival
description: A veritable Psalm-athon will be the centerpiece of Lincoln Centers White Light Festival this fall. Organizers said Tuesday that the festival would feature performances of settings of all 150 biblical psalms, by 150 different composers, in The Psalms Experience.

title: Matt Walsh: The First Time I Was Hustled (by Evel Knievel)
description: As a boy in the 70s, I worshiped Evel Knievel. His motorcycle jumps, whether successes or bone-crushing failures, were legendary. He traveled the world attempting to leap over cars, buses, canyons and even sharks in his signature leather jumpsuit and cape. I consumed all of his trading cards, posters and toys, and my friends and I would spend our summer days in Chicago building ramps in the street and trying to leap things on our Schwinn bicycles. One friend, Johnny P., seemed to break a bone every year trying to emulate our hero. I outgrew Knievel mania as an adult, but it still lurked deep down, waiting to be reignited.

title: Better Call Saul Season 3 Finale Recap: Adios
description: Fittingly enough, the Season 3 finale of Better Call Saul was all about goodbyes. Jimmy said goodbye to his senior law practice and the office where he and Kim worked. Howard said goodbye to Chuck, having masterfully engineered his former mentors exit from Hamlin, Hamlin & McGill. Chucks bid adieu to his sanity and then his life.

title: Mexico Denies Spying Charge
description: To the Editor:

title: Journalists Notebook: Into the Battle of Mosul, Armed With a Camera
description: When I met Major Sajjad al-Hour, he and his men were preparing a large fish dinner.

title: A Yoga Code of Ethics?
description: To the Editor:

title: Accused in Spying Case, Ex-Panama President Fights Extradition in Miami
description: MIAMI  The former president of Panama faced a federal magistrate judge in Miami on Tuesday, in a plea to stay out of jail and fight extradition on charges that he commandeered sophisticated wiretapping gear to listen in on political enemies, business rivals and even a mistress.

title: Fisticuffs Over the Route to a Clean-Energy Future
description: Could the entire American economy run on renewable energy alone?

title: L.A.s Best Avocado Toasts: a Guide
description: There is a group of purists of avocado toast who would insist the paragon of the form would be toast, mashed avocado, chile flakes and lemon juice," explains Kyle Glanville, co-founder of Go Get Em Tiger, which is said to have the countrys best iced latte. Ours is not that. Their toast includes half an avocado, sliced paper thin, on seeded sourdough bread that has been crisped in the panini press or griddled on the flat-top. Its finished off with pickled shallots for acidity and homemade flaxseed cracker crumble for crunch.

title: An Instigator Emerges as the Racial Awkwardness of The Bachelorette Grows
description: Another season of The Bachelorette is underway on ABC, and unlike Lee, The New York Times is still here for the right reasons. Our resident obsessives are following Rachel Lindsays love journey while dancing to the sound of Russell Dickersons voice. Can we steal you for a sec?

title: Mass Resignations Embroil Boulder Museum of Contemporary Art
description: DENVER  What caused nearly every employee of the Boulder Museum of Contemporary Art to resign en masse last week? Was it a difficult museum boss who staffers say worked them to the point of exhaustion for low wages and treated them with little respect? Or was it the result of a plan that backfired  a plan hatched by a handful of disgruntled workers who, as Ron McMahan, a board member, put it, tried to take over control of the institution?

title: Trump Takes Steps to Undo Obama Legacy on Labor
description: President Trump, who came into office courting labor unions and vowing to stand up for American workers, is taking a major step to alter the direction of federal labor policy, positioning the National Labor Relations Board to overturn a series of high-profile Obama-era decisions.

title: More Doubts Are Raised Over Mrs. Mays Leadership
description: What the country needs now is a period of calm while we get on with the job at hand, said Britains chancellor of the Exchequer, Philip Hammond, no doubt reflecting what was on the mind of the prime minister, Theresa May, and many a fellow Conservative politician.

title: Subway Delays, Again, Disrupt Commutes; L.I.R.R. Will Offer Some Discounts
description: Subway riders in New York City faced another morning of upheaval on Tuesday after a dozen lines were plagued by painful delays.

title: Don Peppe
description: An Italian-American restaurant in South Ozone Park, Queens, where pride and purpose remain intact.

title: At Don Peppe, Expect a Lot of Everything
description: Get ready for a lot of flavor.

title: This Boy Scout Has Enough Merit Badges for a Whole Troop
description: Ty Bingham had to earn 21 merit badges on his way to becoming an Eagle Scout. Its the highest rank in Boy Scouts, reached by more than 2.4 million boys since the award was first presented in 1912.

title: Germany Raids Homes of 36 People Accused of Hateful Postings Over Social Media
description: BERLIN  In a coordinated campaign across 14 states, the German police on Tuesday raided the homes of 36 people accused of hateful postings over social media, including threats, coercion and incitement to racism.

title: A Kenyan Pursuit: Perfecting the Chicken Dish Kuku Paka
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  The downpour stopped, so Kirti Patel decided to hold the dinner party on her balcony, with its views of colossal flowering trees and construction that had stalled for the rainy season. Pink vines of bougainvillea were in bloom, and the raw scent of ginger and garlic was in the air.

title: After Inquiry Into Cast, Bachelor in Paradise Will Resume Taping
description: In a surprising twist, the latest season of ABCs Bachelor in Paradise is to resume taping after an investigation into an allegation of sexual misconduct did not turn up evidence of wrongdoing, according to Warner Bros., the studio behind the show.

title: Lets Remember Why Gay Pride Still Matters
description: To the Editor:

title: The Secret Room, the Nazi Artifacts and an Argentine Mystery
description: In a hidden treasure room dedicated to celebrating the Third Reich, Argentine police officers have found a trove of Nazi artifacts, including a bust of Hitler, that they believe were taken to the country by fugitive Germans.

title: The Senate Republicans Secret Health Bill
description: To the Editor:

title: Jeff Bezoss Philanthropy
description: To the Editor:

title: How to Endure Summer
description: To the Editor:

title: A Brief History of the Tartufo
description: A short visual history of this Italian frozen treat dipped in chocolate.

title: Audrey Tautou: Superfacial
description: Over several years, the actress has built up a private practice as a photographer  and debuts a body of portraiture work in Arles next month.

title: Audrey Tautous Very Private Self-Portraiture
description: Audrey Tautou received a camera as a gift for her first communion. As a child, she says, she was inspired by the primatologist Dian Fossey, and imagined herself photographing wild animals in the jungle. The camera was, for me, more an expression of my desire for adventures, she says. It was not a photographer who made me want to become a photographer.

title: Australias Dark Vision of the World
description: A new Lowy Institute poll finds that Australians are losing faith in the United States, and democracy.

title: Prodigy of Mobb Deep Dies at 42; Forged Sound of New York Rap
description: Prodigy, the hard-nosed Queens rapper who kiln-fired New York hip-hop into a thing of unhurried attitude and stoic elegance as half of the duo Mobb Deep, died on Tuesday in Las Vegas. He was 42.

title: A Founder of the Childrens Health Fund Packs Up His Doctors Bag
description: In 1986, as New York City reeled from a crack epidemic and runaway violence, Paul Simon, the musician, and Irwin Redlener, a doctor, paid a visit to one of the citys notorious welfare hotels, the Martinique in Midtown Manhattan.

title: With Roots in Shanghai, Little Alley Opens in Murray Hill
description: LITTLE ALLEY The name of this restaurant, selected by Yishu He, who owns it with the chef Yuchun Cheung, is a reference to Shanghais network of alleyways, or long tang. Mr. Cheung, a native of Shanghai, has cooked there and in New York, at China Blue in TriBeCa, and his entire staff has roots in Shanghai. The menu offers smoked carp, white cut chicken, fish soup with pickled mustard greens and lime, lions head with salted duck eggs, dong po pork, Shanghai rice cakes, stir-fried thick noodles, and, of course, soup dumplings, alongside many tofu dishes and vegetable preparations. The dining room is spare, with brick walls and plain wooden tables and chairs. (Opens Wednesday): 550 Third Avenue (37th Street), 646-998-3976, littlealley.nyc.

title: Middle Class, Not Poor, Could Suffer if Trump Ends Health Payments
description: ASHEVILLE, N.C.  Jane and Abe Goren retired here five years ago to escape the higher cost of living they had abided for decades in the suburbs of New York City. They did not anticipate having to write monthly checks for health insurance that would exceed their mortgage and property taxes combined.

title: Live Event: Jeffrey Gettleman on Love and War in East Africa
description: Welcome to Times Insider Events  live programming for Times Insiders and their guests. Times Insider offers behind-the-scenes insights into news, features and opinion at The New York Times.

title: Review: Transformers Get Arthurian in The Last Knight
description: Get to the fifth installment of a film series, especially a sci-fi action one with a reputation for mindless bloat, and you can generally assume youll be looking at the franchises most dreadful offering yet. But  surprise  the fifth Transformers movie, The Last Knight, is far from the worst in this continuing experiment in noisy nonsense based on Hasbro toys. That is thanks largely to two words: Anthony Hopkins.
