description: One of those jaded deadbeats passing for an East Coast reporter welcomed Lonzo Ball to New York on Wednesday afternoon by asking him to share his worst nightmare on the eve of the N.B.A. draft.

title: Silicon Valley Investors Flexed Their Muscles in Uber Fight
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The conventional wisdom in the world of Silicon Valley start-ups has been that the founders call the shots and that the investors are cheerleaders  and sometimes enablers  of the entrepreneurs they backed.

title: Quotation of the Day: Suit Gives New Details of Brutal Interrogations
description: They kept telling me every day a nuclear bomb was going to be exploded in the United States and thats because I had told them to stop, I had lost my nerve and it was going to be my fault if I didnt continue.

title: Giving You a Leg Up
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  One of the things I love most about the English language is how flexible it is.

title: Review: An Immersive Seeing You Sends Its Audience to War
description: BEN BRANTLEY So, Jesse, my first question for you is: How did you avoid the draft? Though I was clearly too old to serve, I was among those recruited for basic training about a half-hour into Seeing You, the interactive performance piece in the meatpacking district, set in Hoboken during World War II.

title: New York Lawmakers Push Bills Across Finish Line as Session Ends
description: ALBANY  As the legislative session sprinted to a finish on Wednesday, the fate of mayoral control over New York City schools commanded much of the attention at the Capitol.

title: From Courtney Barnett to Beer Snake
description: Damien Cave, our Australia bureau chief, shares insights on global news, local recommendations and feedback from readers in this weekly newsletter. To receive it in your inbox, sign up here.

title: Zack Wheeler Goes on Disabled List as Mets Lose Third Straight to Dodgers
description: LOS ANGELES  In a Mets season defined by unanticipated pitching woes, Zack Wheeler was the steadiest starter over the first two months. It was an unexpected development because Wheeler had missed the previous two seasons after elbow and forearm operations.

title: Trump Turns an Iowa Rally Into a Venting Session
description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa  President Trump said on Wednesday that he was crafting legislation to bar new immigrants from receiving welfare for at least five years. He announced the proposal in a conquering-hero-returns speech in Iowa, his first trip back to the political battleground state since his inauguration.

title: What To Read Before Your Galpagos Vacation
description: With their oversize wildlife and gorgeous scenery, the Galpagos Islands in Ecuador have long attracted nature lovers. Charles Darwin visited in 1835 and was inspired to write his seminal work, The Origin of Species. Yet that which has allowed the unmatched natural ecosystem to thrive  its isolation, in particular  has also made it inaccessible to many travelers. Over the last ten years, tourism to the archipelago has opened up. If you plan to go, or need some convincing, here are three books on this remarkable destination.

title: Actor David Thewlis on the Fargo Season Finale, V.M. Varga and Greed
description: Fargo, Noah Hawleys crime anthology series on FX, introduced memorable villains in its first two seasons. But in the third, which aired its final episode Wednesday, a different beast emerged. David Thewliss turn as V.M. Varga, a bulimic loan shark with decaying teeth and far-right political leanings, has been a hilariously chilling aspect of this seasons exploration of alternative facts and magical realism. Reached by telephone in London the day after the British elections, Mr. Thewlis discussed bingeing, purging and politics. Following are edited excerpts from the conversation.

title: Noah Hawley on Season 3 of Fargo and a Post-Truth World
description: For several years, Noah Hawley has dined out on the idea of interpreting Joel and Ethan Coens 1996 film, Fargo, as a television series. The concept has expanded into a unique anthology of idiosyncratic villains, endearing heroes and frozen landscapes. But with the third season, which concluded Wednesday, Mr. Hawley threaded something prescient into his pulp narratives: the current political discourse, in which basic concepts of reality are debated. As two of the seasons characters say to each other:

title: Fargo Season 3 Finale: Bled Out
description: The third season of Fargo ends with the ultimate cliffhanger: Is there justice in this world or isnt there? Can we talk to our children, as Gloria does, about the fact that sometimes the world doesnt make a lot of sense? Or is the system so rigged that injustice cannot be treated as an anomaly? Although Gloria ends this superb episode with the confident prediction that she and her son will be enjoying deep-fried Snickers bars at the state fair while V.M. Varga is shipped off to Rikers, even she is shaken in her convictions. If not for an accident of timing, she would have resigned her position, defeated by a case in which justice was not served and her efforts to pursue it were obstructed at every turn.

title: Corrections: June 22, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Kristaps Porzingis Gone? Carmelo Anthony Staying? Phil Jackson on the State of the Knicks
description: Phil Jackson, in an interview with the Madison Square Network on Wednesday night, confirmed that the Knicks are listening to trade offers for Kristaps Porzingis and did not rule out the possibility of a deal in the hours leading up to Thursday nights N.B.A. draft.

title: Is Thom Browne the Most Underestimated Designer in New York?
description: Going into the headquarters of the designer Thom Browne, whose spring 2018 mens wear collection will be unveiled in Paris on Sunday, is like falling down a rabbit hole.

title: Consumer Agency Condemns Abuses in Loan Forgiveness Program
description: The governments consumer watchdog is adding its voice to a growing chorus of warnings about problems with a federal program that permits people who take public service jobs to have their student loans forgiven after a decade.

title: De Blasio to Unveil Plan for Rikers While Warning It Will Not Be Easy
description: Closing New York Citys troubled jail complex on Rikers Island will take at least a decade and will require a big decline in the inmate population, a continued drop in the citys already low crime rates, a wellspring of funding and political capital, according to a strikingly blunt proposal that Mayor Bill de Blasio intends to unveil on Thursday.

title: Brexit, Uber, Cristiano Ronaldo: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Frdrick Leboyer, Who Saw Childbirth Through Babys Eyes, Dies at 98
description: Frdrick Leboyer, a French physician whose natural birth methods were adopted in delivery rooms around the world, died on May 25 at his home in Vens, Switzerland. He was 98.

title: Vegas Golden Knights Focus on Defense in N.H.L. Expansion Draft
description: LAS VEGAS  Almost a year to the day after the N.H.L.s Board of Governors granted Las Vegas its first major professional sports franchise, the city finally has some players on which to pin its hockey hopes.

title: Yankees Beat Angels and End Seven-Game Losing Streak
description: If one tried to come up with the unlikeliest headline in this Yankees season, Yankees First Baseman Powers Important Victory would be among the contenders.

title: De Blasio's Plan to Close Rikers Island
description: A 51-page report from Mayor Bill de Blasio's office lays out what City Hall describes as a credible path to closing down the Rikers Island jail complex. Shuttering the jail will not be easy, the report says, and will take at least a decade.

title: Stalemate in Albany May End de Blasios Control of City Schools
description: ALBANY  The State Legislature has adjourned for the year without coming to an agreement on mayoral control of New York Citys schools, leaving a looming question mark over the chain of command for the nations largest public school system and its 1.1 million students.

title: Virtual Reality Is a Disappointment? Not in the World of Video Gamers
description: LOS ANGELES  Before the end of this year, people will be able to play the popular open-world action game The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim in virtual reality. They will also be able to get their hands on virtual-reality versions of the first-person shooter game Doom, the post-apocalyptic game Fallout, and independent titles like Sisters, a horror game that explores virtual reality in an episodic format.

title: Amid Subway Crisis, Cuomo Taps an Old Hand to Head M.T.A.
description: Joseph J. Lhota, who led the Metropolitan Transportation Authority under Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo before leaving for a failed mayoral run in 2013, has been chosen by the governor to return as chairman.

title: A Census Time Machine: Sioux Falls Is the Past, Staten Island the Present, Las Vegas the Future
description: A look at which counties today resemble what America will look like in decades ahead, and which ones most resemble the nations ethnic composition as it once was.

title: How the G.O.P. Health Bill Would Change Medicaid
description: The reporter Margot Sanger-Katz examines how the Republican health plan aims to roll back a program that insures one in five Americans.

title: Found Poem Favorite | To Whitman
description: We are honoring the top winners of our Eighth Annual Found Poem Student Contest by publishing their work from June 13 to July 3. Youll be able to read the whole collection here as we go.

title: Gay Life in New York, Between Oppression and Freedom
description: The photographs of Luis Carle document the hopes, crises and dreams of his generation in the L.G.B.T. community, which endured discrimination and AIDS while fighting for acceptance.

title: The Immigrants No One Wants
description: On a recent Wednesday, 75 Guatemalans disembarked from one of three charter flights, all full of deportees from the United States, scheduled that day. The group was led into a hangar, where authorities gave them a perfunctory welcome: a hello, a snack and bus fare to wherever they were headed.

title: Grenfell Tower Fire: Mindless Deregulation, Senseless Harm
description: The fire that destroyed a London apartment building, killing at least 79 people, provides a grim warning about the dangers of a regulatory approach President Trump has made official policy in Washington.

title: Congress Steps Up on Foreign Policy
description: When President Trump began taking a wrecking ball to some of Americas traditional foreign policies, going so far as to threaten the countrys long and sturdy relationship with its Western European allies, many hoped that the other branches of government would provide a counterweight to the executive branch, and restrain his worst impulses.

title: They Brushed Off Kamala Harris. Then She Brushed Us Off.
description: Last week, Senator Kamala Harris, a Democrat from California, made headlines when Republican senators interrupted her at a hearing of the Senate Intelligence Committee while she interrogated Attorney General Jeff Sessions. The clip of the exchange went viral; journalists, politicians and everyday Americans debated what the shushing signified about our still sexist culture.

title: Opioids, a Mass Killer Were Meeting With a Shrug
description: About as many Americans are expected to die this year of drug overdoses as died in the Vietnam, Iraq and Afghanistan wars combined.

title: Justice Ginsburg and the Price of Equality
description: The flood of news in recent days has all but swamped a fascinating Supreme Court decision that deserves more than a footnote to the term now coming to an end. The ruling defied expectations in nearly every way that counted and suggests a more complex picture of the Roberts court than its notably ideology-riven decisions usually offer.

title: Youve Named Trumps Worst!
description: It was a hard-fought race, people. But the results of our Worst Trump Cabinet Member reader poll are in.

title: The End of the Left and the Right as We Knew Them
description: By now it has become quite clear that conservative parties in Europe and the United States have been gaining strength from white voters who have been mobilized around issues related to nationalism  resistance to open borders and to third-world immigration. In the United States, this development has been exacerbated by ongoing conservative recruitment on issues of race that has reinforced opposition to immigration. On the liberal side, the Democratic Party and the center-left European parties have been allied in favor of globalization, if we define globalization as receptivity to open borders, the expansion of local and nationalistic perspectives and support for a less rigid social order and for liberal cultural, immigration and trade policies. In recent decades, these parties, both in Europe and in the United States have begun to include and reflect the views of large numbers of well-educated elites  relatively affluent knowledge or creative class workers  in alliance with predominantly nonwhite minority constituencies of the less well-off.

title: Gay Life in New York, Between Oppression and Freedom
description: Luis Carle sees himself, and his work, as a bridge  between the gay and straight communities, between the younger and older generations of the L.G.B.T. community, and between past and the present. The Puerto Rican photographer was 17 when came out in San Juan in 1980, and in subsequent years witnessed the AIDS crisis, the culture wars, and the march toward broader L.G.B.T. rights. All along, he made pictures of his community and the seismic waves that were reshaping it.

title: Washing Windows in the Sky
description: Watch a 360 video of window washers cleaning a skyscraper 900 feet above Midtown Manhattan.

title: Before Croissants, There Was Kubaneh, a Jewish Yemeni Delight
description: All day long Id been looking forward to going out with friends for dinner, but as we talked between gulps of wine, ripping up the kubaneh wed ordered and swiping it in grated tomato, I was distracted. The bread was excellent, and in ways that resisted comparison  tall and tan and sweet as brioche, but softer inside, more supple. It pulled apart easily, with the same satisfaction of Parker House rolls, but along more chaotic lines. Like a well-baked croissant, it was golden brown at the edges but impossibly buoyant with butter. We finished it quickly, as if it might unfasten itself from the plate at any second and float away.

title: Four Resorts for a Private Island Vacation
description: Shared lodging and communal spaces may be trending, but for those seeking more privacy than a Do Not Disturb sign offers, a spate of new private island resorts play to castaway-in-comfort fantasies.

title: The Ethereal Genius of Craig Taborn
description: The jazz pianist Craig Taborn often goes to museums for inspiration, carrying a notebook to record ideas for compositions and song titles. He also sometimes performs at museums, becoming a sort of art object himself. This is a complicated situation for Taborn, who is very private. His mother, Marjorie Taborn, remembers seeing him at the Rubin Museum of Art in New York, where he played a recital to a full house at the debut of his solo album Avenging Angel. After the show, she was chatting with his friend Tim Berne, a saxophonist, while her son signed copies of his album, smiling graciously and patiently fielding questions. She and Berne looked at each other, because they each knew how much effort this required from Taborn. Look at Craig, Taborns mother recalls telling Berne, hes getting everything he never wanted, all the attention hed never seek.

title: 36 Hours in Dubrovnik
description: This gorgeous, historic city on the Dalmatian Coast has recently become a feast for more than just the eyes.

title: How a Joke About Flying Squirrels Led to an Ailing Womans Cure
description: The wintry late-day sun flooded through the windows at South County Hospital in Wakefield, R.I., as the middle-aged man and his wife entered the room. The mans mother, a tiny 93-year-old woman, sat slumped amid a chaos of bedcovers. They had come from St. Louis after the youngest of the mans siblings called to let him know that their mother was deathly ill. Seeing her now, a pale, silent version of her energetic self, he feared he would have to wear the suit hed brought after all.

title: A Hemmed-In Cemetery Finds a Bit More Space
description: By New York City standards, it was a modest real estate transaction: not quite four-tenths of an acre for $500,000.

title: A House and a Backyard, Without Leaving the City
description: In 2010, Madison Wharton and Jason Marks rented a corner three-bedroom in Schaefer Landing, a high-rise condominium on the waterfront in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. They married soon afterward.

title: Review: In The Big Sick, Comedy Is Hard, Love Harder
description: Love means having to say youre sorry  early and often. Thats one of the truisms in The Big Sick, a joyous, generous-hearted romantic comedy that, even as it veers into difficult terrain, insists that we just need to keep on laughing. Outwardly, the story seems familiar: A really nice guy falls for a woman he may not be worthy of and nearly blows it. What gives the movie both fizz and sting  and shows that theres plenty of juice and possibility left in the American romantic comedy  are its particulars, especially the comic Kumail Nanjiani, who plays a fictionalized version of himself, a Pakistani-American struggling to make it in stand-up while fumbling through the rest of his life.

title: 95-Degree Days: How Extreme Heat Could Spread Across the World
description: Extremely hot days are expected to be much more frequent in the coming decades, potentially disrupting our everyday lives.

title: Emma Straub: By the Book
description: The author of Modern Lovers keeps her youth on a shelf: There are books I loved in my teens and 20s that I would not love now, but its still nice to see them there, as a reminder of a person I used to be.

title: The Hitter Can Hurl. The Hurler Can Hit. Can He Do Both in the Majors?
description: There was a curious notation next to the names of two of the top four players selected in the Major League Baseball draft this month. For Hunter Greene, selected No. 2 over all, it was RHP/SS, while for Brendan McKay, No. 4, it was LHP/1B.

title: Review: In Netflixs GLOW, Empowerment Comes Through Power Slams
description: In his 1957 book, Mythologies, the French literary critic Roland Barthes described wrestling as the spectacle of excess. Its not subtle. Its more storytelling than it is sport. Like ancient theater, he wrote, it presents mans suffering with all the amplification of tragic masks.

title: Canadas Trump Strategy: Go Around Him
description: TORONTO  As President Trump disrupts alliances across the map, nearly every level of government in Canada has taken on new duties in a quietly audacious campaign to cajole, contain and if necessary coerce the Americans.

title: Tough Task for Next Uber Leader: Mending Fences With Drivers
description: The huge, headline-grabbing news out of Uber this week was the resignation of its chief executive, Travis Kalanick, under pressure from the companys board, a stunning move that capped a monthslong crisis involving sexual harassment, executive misbehavior and Ubers hard-nosed culture.

title: Julia Serano, Transfeminist Thinker, Talks Trans-Misogyny
description: The biologist, performer and author Julia Serano is a leading transfeminist thinker and the author of Whipping Girl, which Jill Soloway, the creator of the Amazon series Transparent, cites as a major influence and the first book she gives to transgender friends, like Caitlyn Jenner.

title: The Rowdy World of Raps New Underground
description: SEATTLE  One night this spring, the rapper Lil Pump, 16, with braces on his teeth, was asleep  or something like it  on the couch in the upstairs green room at the Columbia City Theater here, his blond and pink dreads dangling in front of his face and a pair of Gucci high-tops slung around his neck.

title: Samantha Bee Mourns the Death of Language
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: Senate, Mosul, N.B.A. Draft: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Daily: Travis Kalanicks Final Hours With Uber
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Review: Jonas Kaufmann Sings an Otello for the Ages
description: LONDON  The peak of the mountain of tenor roles in Italian opera is the title character in Verdis Otello, driven by manufactured jealousy to murder his wife. It demands trumpeting high notes and snarled depths, civic dignity and lashes of madness, public pronouncements and private grief.

title: Dr. Andrew Weil Says Were Taking Too Many Medicines
description: Dr. Andrew Weil, still sporting his trademark white whiskers at age 75, says that we are taking too many medications. Dr. Weil is perhaps best known for popularizing the concept of integrative medicine, which melds traditional medicine with alternative healing techniques.

title: Antibiotic Eye Drops Often Unhelpful for Pinkeye
description: Doctors often prescribe antibiotic eye drops to people with conjunctivitis, or pinkeye, even though they are almost always ineffective, a new study found.

title: New York Today: Washing Windows, 900 Feet Up
description: Good morning on this radiant Thursday.

title: Morning Agenda: Inside Travis Kalanicks Resignation
description: The final hours of Travis Kalanicks tenure as Ubers longtime, aggressive chief executive came down to a Chicago hotel and an ultimatum by two investors.

title: After London Fire, 11 More High-Rises Found With Combustible Material
description: LONDON  At least 11 buildings in Britain are clad in combustible material of a kind similar to the cladding that was used on the exterior of Grenfell Tower, the apartment building destroyed in Londons deadliest fire in decades, officials said on Thursday, as they scrambled to conduct safety checks on at least 600 other high-rise buildings.

title: Inmates Come to Georgia Deputys Rescue After He Collapses
description: Johnny Moats, the sheriff of Polk County, Ga., received what can be a nightmarish call for a law enforcement officer on June 12 from one of his deputies.

title: Afghan Bombing Kills Dozens of Workers Lined Up for Pay
description: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan  A Taliban car bombing killed at least 34 people and wounded 60 others as they lined up at a bank to collect their pay on Thursday in Lashkar Gah, the capital of Helmand Province, in southern Afghanistan, according to Afghan officials.

title: Marvins Room Moves to Broadway With Women Front and Center
description: Awkward reunions and tentative introductions are recurring themes of Marvins Room, Scott McPhersons comedy-drama about two estranged sisters who are forced back into each others lives by a family health crisis. The play has been performed in many incarnations, including an Off Broadway run in 1991, a year before Mr. McPhersons death from complications of AIDS, and was adapted as a film in 1996, but it has not been presented on Broadway until now.

title: Welfare for Golfers
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: Issey Miyake: Spring 2018
description: This labels spring 2018 collection.

title: In Qatar Airways, American Airlines May Have an Unwanted Suitor
description: Akbar al-Baker, the chief executive of Qatar Airways, recently approached his counterpart at American Airlines, a bitter rival, with some news: His state-owned company wanted to buy a 10 percent stake in American.

title: Soccers Confounding Calculation: Whats a Player Worth?
description: For the better part of a decade, at least one leading Premier League team has devoted thousands of hours and kilowatts of brain power to answering what sounds, on the surface, like a simple question: How do you judge what any one player is actually worth?

title: California Today: The Extreme Heat to Come
description: Good morning.

title: Makram Ali Died of Injuries in Attack Near London Mosque, Police Say
description: LONDON  Makram Ali moved to Britain from Bangladesh when he was 10. He and his wife raised four daughters and two sons. He loved strolling in parks with his two grandchildren. His family was about to take a vacation in Canada.

title: Interrogation, Torture and Personal Responsibility
description: How much responsibility should an individual bear for questionable actions within a system that encourages them? Does a time of crisis call for departing from long-held values  or do codes of conduct and laws exist to help us navigate those very times?

title: Live Event: Everyday Informants
description: Welcome to Times Insider Events  live programming for Times Insiders and their guests. Times Insider offers behind-the-scenes insights into news, features and opinion at The New York Times.

title: Rick Owens: Spring 2018
description: The labels mens 2018 collection.

title: Art Installation Shares Sights and Sounds of the Border
description: Over the last decade, the American photographer Richard Misrach has turned his lens on the border between the United States and Mexico, capturing scarecrow-like figures made out of tattered clothing and dry agave stalks; personal artifacts left behind by migrants; and tire drags that monitor the surreptitious traffic through the sand.

title: Opus Cactus Returns, Care of Momix at the Joyce Theater
description: Deserts arent necessarily deserted  they can be crowded with fantastic flora and fauna. Moses Pendleton knows how to make theatrical deserts bloom in his Opus Cactus, which his company, Momix, is reviving at the Joyce Theater on Tuesday, June 27. With lights, shadows, props, puppetry and wondrously agile human dancers, Mr. Pendleton conjures the landscape of the American Southwest, filling the stage with images of desert storms, soaring birds, skittering insects, snakes and Gila monsters, tumbleweeds and giant cactuses.

title: Will Ferrell on Donald Trump, Michelle Obama and His New Movie
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif.  By the time Will Ferrell was in the sixth grade, he was almost six feet tall and owning it. I never felt gawky or like it was a disadvantage. I was kind of proud of being tall, said Mr. Ferrell, who grew up in Irvine, Calif., where he played baseball, basketball and soccer. Youre more looked up to. Literally. You are literally looking down on people.

title: Europe Dismantles Ukraines Paper Curtain
description: MOSCOW  Petro O. Poroshenko, the Ukrainian president, called it the collapse of the paper curtain.

title: Young Country Music Heretics Join Forces
description: Sam Hunt and Maren Morris may represent different permutations of the country music heretic, but the bottom line is the same for both: They are, without shame, huge pop stars in waiting. Currently on tour together as a peek at Nashvilles crossover future, the pair will play in Holmdel, N.J., on Sunday, June 25, as part of Mr. Hunts 15 in a 30 Tour, named for his current slick, soulful hit Body Like a Back Road. Though each singer has released only one album  Mr. Hunt played with rap and R&B influences on Montevallo in 2014, while Ms. Morris tweaked countrys gender dynamics on her debut, Hero, last year  their much-anticipated follow-ups could soon make a shared arena show seem quaint. (7 p.m., PNC Bank Arts Center.)

title: Cellist in an Echo Chamber, Echo Chamber
description: Echo chambers in which the same voices are multiplied over and over have gotten a bit of a bad rap in recent times. But when a musician engages in conversation with splintered figments of her sonic self, the result can be by turns beautiful, unsettling and exhilarating. On Sunday, June 25, the fiercely talented cellist Ashley Bathgate presents a solo recital at National Sawdust as part of the very approachable Kettle Corn New Music series, which explores the expressive potential of a single instrument electronically layered over recorded versions of itself.

title: A French Master Director, Getting His Due at the Quad Cinema
description: Though now into his fifth decade of filmmaking, Bertrand Tavernier has not attained the recognition in America that other great French directors enjoy. Even so, he has always examined French society, culture and morality with an elegant, inquisitive eye.

title: Alison Brie Talks Pro Wrestling and Inner Strength
description: At one point, Alison Brie was co-starring on two very different shows but playing somewhat similar characters: She was Trudy Campbell, the strait-laced but ambitious housewife on Mad Men, and Annie Edison, the strait-laced but ambitious student on Community. Now that those shows have ended, its time for Ms. Brie to stretch her legs and flex her muscles, quite literally.

title: Senate Health Care Bill Includes Deep Cuts to Medicaid
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republicans, who for seven years have promised a repeal of the Affordable Care Act, took a major step on Thursday toward that goal, unveiling a bill to make deep cuts in Medicaid and end the laws mandate that most Americans have health insurance.

title: Uncle Sam Wants Your Deep Neural Networks
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The Department of Homeland Security is turning to data scientists to improve screening techniques at airports.

title: An Index-Fund Evangelist Is Straying From His Gospel
description: In his classic 1973 book A Random Walk Down Wall Street, Burton Malkiel, a Princeton economics professor, made an assertion that was startling at the time: that a blindfolded monkey throwing darts at the stock listings could select a portfolio that would do just as well as one selected by the experts.

title: Ranked by Instagram: The Latest Mens Wear Shows
description: Not so long ago, the factors spelling success at fashion week for a label were threefold: who attended, what the critics said, and how the buyers responded.

title: Louis Vuitton: Spring 2018
description: This labels spring 2018 collection.

title: No Swimming! Rome Braces for Summer of Tourists at Its Fountains
description: ROME  On a sweltering Monday afternoon, a beautiful day for a swim, Mario Messina noticed some holidaymakers teetering dangerously close to the turquoise waters and sounded five short blasts of his whistle.

title: The Haggler Retires, but Customer Grumbling Continues
description: A few years ago, U.P.S. lost my passport. It was in an envelope that was sent from New York to California, and if Im honest about it, part of me was kind of excited it had vanished.

title: Afghan Peace Initiative
description: To the Editor:

title: What Are the Limits of Gay Pride?
description: June is Gay Pride month: four weekends of parades, pageantry, and partying all over the country, meant to celebrate the destigmatization of gay, trans, queer and nonbinary people and their open acceptance into American life. The parades are fun. Theyre moving. But now, a year after the Pulse nightclub shooting, people are asking whether theyre sufficiently black, political and confrontational. Since gay marriage, a kind of complacency has set in. Or has it?

title: Open for Comment Since 1851, and Still Going Hot and Heavy
description: Readers have been commenting to The New York Times since the day we were born. (Well, that would have been impossible.) Since the day after we were born.

title: 3 Books That Help Explain American-Cuban Relations
description: As President Trump prepares to fundamentally rethink the reconciliation with Cuba initiated by Barack Obama, here are a few books that shed light on the two countries historically fraught  yet intertwined  relationship:

title: From Cuba, a Stolen Myth
description: Late last week, the Trump administration announced that it would be re-abnormalizing the relationship between the United States and Cuba. A few days earlier, El Museo del Barrio in Manhattan opened NKame: A Retrospective of Cuban Printmaker Belkis Ayn, reminding us exactly how much we have to gain from a free exchange of cultural energy with our island neighbor.

title: Back Pain? Try Yoga
description: Yoga works as well as physical therapy for relieving back pain, a randomized trial found.

title: 8 Figures on Gun Ownership, and Attitudes, in America
description: With the United States buffeted in recent years by shootings at schools, churches and, this month, at a practice for a congressional baseball game, a small majority of Americans favors stricter gun laws  but the nation remains starkly divided on much else when it comes to guns, according to a Pew Research Center report released Thursday.

title: How Senate Republicans Plan to Dismantle Obamacare
description: A comparison of the Senate health care with the Affordable Care Act.

title: Queens Night Market
description: The bazaar is a surprising, thrilling and inspiring testament to the cultural riches of Queens.

title: Around the World in an Evening at the Queens Night Market
description: This is what you eat in La Paz at 4 a.m., said the man half-devoured by smoke as he stood at the grill, stroking oil over beef hearts with a brush of banana husks.

title: Review: The Beguiled, Sofia Coppolas Civil War Cocoon
description: The Beguiled, Sofia Coppolas new film, looks like a historical drama  its set in Virginia during the Civil War  but it often behaves more like a fairy tale. In the first scenes, a young girl ventures out into the woods to collect mushrooms and finds a strange man under a tree: a Union soldier with a badly wounded leg and a charming Irish brogue. Is he a prince or an ogre? (Hes Colin Farrell, which may or may not clarify the issue.)

title: BMW and Volkswagen Try to Beat Apple and Google at Their Own Game
description: FRANKFURT  Volkswagen is delving into quantum computing. BMW is building a giant new data center. And Bosch this week announced plans to construct a factory to build chips for self-driving cars.

title: Where Senators Stand on the Health Care Bill
description: A real-time count of every senators position.

title: A Cyberattack the World Isnt Ready For
description: NEWARK  There have been times over the last two months when Golan Ben-Oni has felt like a voice in the wilderness.

title: 2017 Toyota Prius Prime
description: Charge the battery and the Prime drives like an electric car. Once the battery is spent, after about 25 miles, the car drives like any other Prius.

title: Video Review: Doing the Math on Toyotas Prius Prime Hybrid
description: As otherworldly as the Prius Prime looks, its not the offspring of the Transformers leader Optimus. Its Toyotas plug-in hybrid variant.

title: Shares Plunge as China Voices Concern Over Systemic Risks
description: BEIJING  Some of Chinas largest companies may pose a systemic risk to the countrys banks, a senior banking official said on Thursday, in the latest signal that Beijing is ratcheting up scrutiny of a financial system plagued with hidden debt that poses a hazard to the health of the economy.

title: Trading in a Briefcase for a Drive in the Sky
description: Q. What is the replacement or workaround for Briefcase in Windows 10?

title: Daily Report: Lessons From the Tumult at Uber
description: Uber, Uber, Uber.

title: Mortgage Calculator
description: Calculate your mortgage payments

title: Dangerous Exploits: Otto Warmbier and the Risks of Travel to North Korea
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights from The New York Times. In this piece, Craig S. Smith a correspondent for The Times, who raised his family in Shanghai, Paris and Hong Kong, writes about an April 2015 trip he took to North Korea with his son, True.

title: Church of England Colluded With Bishop to Hide Sex Abuse, Report Says
description: LONDON  Senior people in the Church of England colluded over two decades with a bishop to help cover up his serial abuse of young men and boys, an independent review found on Thursday.

title: Review: Cant Stop Wont Stop Tells Sean Combss Bad Boy Story
description: Just try to keep up with the flurry of images in Daniel Kaufmans Cant Stop Wont Stop, a whirl through the history of Sean Combs and Bad Boy, the entertainment company he founded and that often dominated hip-hop and R&B in the 1990s and 2000s. Mr. Combs, who topped Forbess 2017 list of highest-paid celebrities, is a mogul in television, clothing, fragrances and spirits. Cant Stop sticks with the music, focusing on preparations for two Bad Boy reunion concerts in May 2016 at Barclays Center in Brooklyn.

title: Hate the Beach? These Getaway Options Are for You
description: Sick of the urban sprawl and unrealistic prices in the Hamptons? Dreading another disappointinglong weekendonthe Jersey Shore? Here are several getaway options for the beach-averse, from budget-friendly to deluxe. Most of the properties below offer special summer packages or weekly discounts,so dont be afraid to ask.

title: Review: In Pursuit of Silence, a Guide to Tuning Out the Racket
description: In Pursuit of Silence isnt what you would call a well-rounded or intellectually rigorous documentary  its too messianic for that  but it is an interesting one. Partly inspired by George Prochniks 2010 book of the same title, this elegant sermon by Patrick Shen on why we should dial down the racket of our daily lives will make you consider turning off and tuning out.

title: Joe Lhota Returns as M.T.A. Chairman to Fix Subway Mess
description: Joseph J. Lhota is perhaps best known for bringing the New York City subway back from one of its darkest moments after Hurricane Sandy flooded the system in 2012. Now, he faces another daunting task: rescuing it from a growing crisis that threatens to cripple the citys continued growth.

title: Trump Says He Did Not Tape Comey Conversations
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump cleared up one of the capitals least suspenseful mysteries on Thursday, acknowledging that he did not record conversations with James B. Comey, the F.B.I. director he fired in anger over an investigation into his campaigns possible ties to Russia.

title: Ron Howard Takes Over Han Solo Film
description: Ron Howard is stepping in to direct the coming stand-alone Han Solo film, two days after Philip Lord and Christopher Miller were ousted from the job. They had spent four and a half months on the as-yet-untitled space western.

title: The Making of Martin Shkreli as Pharma Bro
description: Martin Shkreli is not on trial for what made him, in the words of the BBC, the most hated man in America.

title: Martin Shkreli, Pharma Bro, Prepares for Trial: Im So Innocent
description: Martin Shkreli, former hedge fund manager, pharma bro and self-styled bad boy, sat in federal court for a hearing on Monday before his fraud trial begins next week.

title: N.B.A. Prospect Knows What Its Like to Be a Pro (but in Baseball)
description: Every year, N.B.A. teams make routine calls to check out the prospects in whom they might just possibly invest millions of dollars. They speak to high school coaches and principals and people in charge of A.A.U. teams, hoping to gather the information that is not apparent on film.

title: U.S. Cant Revoke Citizenship Over Minor Falsehoods, Supreme Court Rules
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Thursday made it harder to strip citizenship from naturalized Americans. It also refused to grant new trials to defendants in a notorious 1984 Washington murder case and to a Massachusetts man whose lawyer failed to object to closing the courtroom for part of his trial.

title: Yohji Yamamoto: Spring 2018
description: This labels spring 2018 collection.

title: Top 10 Comments That Have Nothing to Do With Politics
description: These are the top 10 comments of the week, from our digital platforms, that have nothing whatsoever to do with politics, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment. Some comments were edited for length and clarity.

title: Yellowstone Grizzly Bear to Lose Endangered Species Protection
description: HELENA, Mont.  After 42 years on the endangered species list, the Yellowstone grizzly bear  whose numbers have grown to more than 700 from fewer than 150  will lose its protected status, the Interior Department announced on Thursday.

title: Who Wants to Be King? No One, Prince Harry Says
description: Prince Harry, who is fifth in line to the British throne, has said that he does not think anyone in the royal family wants to be king or queen, but that the family of Queen Elizabeth II will carry on the succession out of a sense of duty.

title: If These Walls Could Talk? They Do
description: Staring at the wall might seem like the worst thing that could happen to a writer. But for the playwright Lynn Nottage, the walls of the Brooklyn house where she lives with her husband, Tony Gerber, their two children and her father are her muse.

title: Man Charged With Stabbing Officer at Airport Had Tried to Buy a Gun, F.B.I. Says
description: A Montreal man charged with stabbing a police officer in the neck at a Michigan airport on Wednesday tried to buy a gun before the attack but was denied, the authorities said on Thursday.

title: Why Do Bird Eggs Have Different Shapes? Look to the Wings
description: Owls are spherical, hummingbirds are elliptical and sandpipers are pointy.

title: Six Gongs and Two Woodblocks
description: From the album Bells For the South Side.

title: Heres What to Read About the Fargo Season 3 Finale
description: Three seasons into its run, the FX anthology series Fargo is still finding new ways to surprise. Along with the blood baths weve come to expect from the shows epic finales, Wednesdays episode culminated in an apparently open-ended l standoff between the righteous cop Gloria Burgle (Carrie Coon) and this seasons avatar for all things evil, V.M. Varga (David Thewlis, whom The Times interviewed here.). If that non-resolution left you searching for insight into the moral nature of the universe  or if you just want to read more about Mary Elizabeth Winsteads wonderful character, Nikki Swango  heres a selection of worthwhile recaps and interviews to help you work through it.

title: It Happens Every 12 Years: Long-Awaited Rugby Series Set to Begin
description: Most great sports events come around once each year; others, like the Olympics and World Cup, a bit less often.

title: A 12-Year-Old Came Out to Her Mormon Church. Then Her Mike Was Cut Off.
description: On the day in May that Savannah stood up to speak in front of her Mormon congregation, she did not get through everything she had wanted to say.

title: Tesla in Talks to Set Up Electric Car Factory in Shanghai
description: HONG KONG  Tesla Motors is in discussions to establish a factory in Shanghai, its first in China, a move that could bolster its efforts in one of its major markets even as it further lifts Chinas position as a builder of electric cars.

title: Brooklyn Diocese Seeks to Compensate Sex Abuse Victims
description: The Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn announced a program on Thursday that will seek to compensate hundreds of victims who were abused as children by its priests and deacons.

title: Why Migrants Keep Risking All on the Deadliest Route
description: TONGO, Senegal  Amadou Anne, the oldest son, tried first.

title: High Above Mars, a NASA Orbiter Spies the Curiosity Rover
description: The small blue dot is Curiosity.

title: Ten Years After Going Public, Blackstone Stock Hasnt Budged
description: In a sense, Blackstone is back where it started. On June 22, 2007, at what turned out to be a market peak, Steve Schwarzman and Pete Peterson took their private equity firm public in a ballyhooed transaction that inspired rivals to do the same. A decade on, the firms units are trading just above their $31 price ahead of their New York Stock Exchange debut. A better result over the next 10 years could require Blackstone to financially re-engineer itself.

title: Islanders Acquire Jordan Eberle From Oilers for Ryan Strome
description: Seeking offensive help for their superstar center John Tavares, the Islanders on Thursday acquired right wing Jordan Eberle from the Edmonton Oilers for Ryan Strome.

title: Just One Corn Dog for Me. Im Dieting.
description: Welcome to Weight Watchers. Today were going to talk about summer vacation planning: saying no to those sugar-laden frozen margaritas; pushing away potato salad slathered in real mayonnaise; sticking pins in your tongue if you forgetfully dipped your lobster into butter  or, as we like to call it, fun.

title: Democrats and the Losing Politics of Contempt
description: Aron Nimzowitsch, among the chess greats of his day, didnt take well to losing badly. Knowing that he was about to be beaten by an inferior opponent in a 1925 tournament, he jumped on the table and yelled, Against this idiot I have to lose?

title: 9 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: Ahoy! This weeks offerings include Philip Pullmans fantastical tale of a ghost ship from the 1920s (his first graphic novel) and an account of the real-life quest to capture the man known as Dread Pirate Roberts, founder of the $1.2 billion online drug bazaar called the Silk Road. A noir thriller by Colin Harrison delves into the world of obsessive map collectors, and The Invisible Mile follows a New Zealand cyclist through the 1928 Tour de France. Two books about China examine the world from the perspective of a rising superpower, while a new biography of Machiavelli investigates the superpowers of one very influential individual.

title: Dries Van Noten: Spring 2018
description: Mr. Van Noten presents his spring looks.

title: How Tinder Could Take Back the White House
description: By now, you may have heard that young voters were critical in the election in the United Kingdom earlier this month, helping deliver embarrassing losses to the Conservative Party. As politically active progressives in our 20s, we were eager to help mobilize the youth vote before the election. But we also knew that reaching out to people in our mostly left-wing social bubble would change nothing. Yaras matches on the dating app Tinder were surprisingly responsive when she suggested that they register to vote. So we decided to scale it up.

title: McConnells Calculation May Be That He Still Wins by Losing
description: WASHINGTON  When it comes to managing Republicans best interests, Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, the majority leader, rarely loses. So it is possible that Mr. McConnell views the potential failure of a hastily written health care bill as an eventual boon.

title: The Austin Artist Making Covetable Collages
description: On a hot and humid Monday morning in Austin, Tex., the artist Claire Oswalt is eager to give a tour of the Charles Moore Foundation, where she rents a studio. Unlike the riot of curiosities that is the late architects estate, her secluded space (a small building on the edge of the property) is a simplified oasis of calm and introspection. In jeans and vintage yellow cowboy boots, with her hair tucked away in a headwrap of her own creation, she moves serenely through the bright space. Her paintings line the walls, and ivy grows up through the floor toward the skylight.

title: N.B.A. Draft: Analysis of Every Pick and Trade in Round 1
description: The story of the 2017 N.B.A. draft was youth, with a record-setting 16 freshmen taken in the first 30 picks, compared with just two seniors.

title: Straight From the Runway: 6 Mens Short Shorts
description: Pradas recent mens wear show featured broad-shouldered jackets, jumpsuits  and really really short shorts. But you dont have to wait until next season to bravely sport a pair: Here are six other offerings you can wear this summer. Theyre colorful, theyre small  and theyd make Bjorn Borg proud.

title: An Exciting New Story for Hartford
description: To the Editor:

title: James Comey, Tesla, Qatar Airways: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Pop, Rock and Jazz in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to pop and rock shows and the best of live jazz.

title: Whats New in NYC Theater
description: Our guide to plays and musicals coming to New York stages  and a few last-chance picks of shows that are about to close. Our reviews of open shows are at nytimes.com/reviews/theater.

title: 5-Foot-3, but He Skates Above His Level
description: PLYMOUTH, Mich.  Sean Dhooghe was only 13 the first time Don Granato laid eyes on him and knew he was onto something special.

title: Review: Paulina Looks at the Dark Side of Idealism
description: As stinging as a slap in the face, Paulina feels as if its waking you from a stupor, then shaking you, demanding that you ask yourself some impossible questions about idealism and justice. Its a severe story, made more so by its powerhouse lead actress.

title: How a Golfers Wife Overcame Her Addiction to Alcohol
description: Billy Horschel was enjoying one last serene meal with his wife, Brittany, in New York on Wednesday before they returned home to Florida to rejoin their rambunctious 2-year-old daughter and her infant sister when Horschel received a pinging alert on his phone.

title: From Hungary, the Secret Language of a Silenced People
description: In 1972 the Hungarian artist Tamas Szentjoby placed a chair outside the Intercontinental Hotel in Budapest, bound his mouth with a leather belt, and took a seat. About 20 minutes later the police arrived, as was to be expected in this Eastern bloc country. Mr. Szentjoby called this brief performance piece Sit Out/Be Forbidden, in homage to the sit-ins being staged by protesters in the United States and, specifically, to Bobby Seale, the Black Panther who a few years earlier had been shackled and gagged after making comments to the judge during his trial on charges of inciting violence at the 1968 Democratic Convention.

title: Classical Music in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to the citys best classical music and opera.

title: On Gerrymandering
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: Prime Suspect After Helen Mirren. (Before, Actually.)
description: The British network ITV is, in addition to being the BBCs major rival, a factory for mainstream cop shows. Broadchurch, Foyles War, Midsomer Murders, Vera  if youre bingeing a British crime series, theres a good chance it originally ran there.

title: Review: Nowhere to Hide for an Iraqi Nurse Still Clinging to Hope
description: Maybe the most disturbing aspect of watching Nowhere to Hide, Zaradasht Ahmeds sickeningly gripping portrait of a male nurse in Iraq, is accepting how close we are to the point where empathy itself has become collateral damage.

title: Ghana Court Rejects Resettlement of Guantnamo Bay Detainees
description: ACCRA, Ghana  The Supreme Court of Ghana ruled Thursday that the governments decision to allow two former Guantnamo Bay detainees to live in the country was unconstitutional.

title: Comedy in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to stand-up, improv and variety shows.

title: Legionnaires Outbreak
description: To the Editor:

title: Warren E. Buffett Comes to the Aid of a Big Canadian Mortgage Lender
description: When big financial companies have needed a rescue over the years, one man has often stood at the ready: Warren E. Buffett.

title: In Memorys Last Breath, Remembering Life, Before Its Too Late
description: Just days before her 61st birthday, Gerda Saunders made a wretched discovery at the neurologists office: Dement is a verb. I dement, you dement, he/she/it dements, Saunders writes in Memorys Last Breath: Field Notes on My Dementia. Its an unlovely conjugation if ever there was one. Why is it that disorders of the body so often involve disfigurements of language as well?

title: Robert Muellers Inquiry Into Ties to Russia
description: To the Editor:

title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
description: No matter how much free time you have this weekend, we have TV recommendations for you. Come back every Friday for new suggestions from our TV critic on what to watch.

title: Dance in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to dance performances.

title: Review: In Food Evolution, Scientists Strike Back
description: The scientific method is under siege, and not just from naysayers who dismiss climate change or fear vaccines. G.M.O.s  genetically modified organisms  and the crops they enable have become another field of battle.

title: May Offers Plan for E.U. Citizens to Stay in U.K. After Brexit
description: BRUSSELS  Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain vowed on Thursday to protect the rights of millions of citizens of other European Union countries who are living in Britain after the country withdraws from the bloc.

title: Appeals Court Reinstates 40-Year Sentence for Brooklyn Mobster
description: A New York federal appeals court ruled Thursday that a lower court judge had overstepped his authority by shaving 10 years off the sentence of a Brooklyn mobster who, while imprisoned, helped the government find a cache of explosives left over from the Oklahoma City bombing.

title: Film Series in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to film series and special screenings. All our movie reviews are at nytimes.com/reviews/movies.

title: Feds 2017 Bank Stress Test
description: Americas biggest banks breezed through the first phase of the annual test. Next week, the Fed will decide whether to approve plans to pay dividends and repurchase shares.

title: Art and Museums in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to new art shows  and some that will be closing soon.

title: Review: In bwoy, Online Dating Gone Wrong. Very Wrong.
description: Toying with issues of sexuality, trauma and race, John G. Youngs romantic drama bwoy is another cautionary tale about meeting strangers online. Stuck in a bleak New York winter after the death of his son, a grieving man, Brad (Anthony Rapp), seeks solace by cruising a gay dating site. He falls into the virtual arms of Yenny (Jimmy Brooks), a charismatic young Jamaican, but their flirty and dirty texts and video calls soon morph into something devastating.

title: Events for Children in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to cultural events in New York City for families with children and teenagers.

title: Review: All the Rage Explores the Mind-Body Connection
description: Director, distance thyself.

title: Donald Trump Does His Best Joe McCarthy Impression
description: WHEELING, W.Va.  On Feb. 9, 1950, Senator Joseph McCarthy disembarked from his Capital Airlines plane at Stifel Field here, where he planned to speak at a Lincoln Day event hosted by the Ohio County Womens Republican Club.

title: Review: Nobody Speak, a Bombastic Look at Hulk Hogans Gawker Lawsuit
description: If freedom of the press includes the right to print all-caps headlines with exclamation points, it also includes the right to make a cinematic expos so bombastic that it poorly serves its own cause, however important.

title: How Do I Get Off the Mailing List ... of a Family Member?
description: I have a conservative 50-year-old niece who emails me pro-life articles that she has written and published. She sends them to everyone in the family. But I am pro-choice and a strong supporter of Planned Parenthood. I would like to ask her to remove me from her mailing list and tell her that my views are the opposite of hers. My husband says I should ignore the issue and just delete her emails. What is your advice?

title: A Weekend Wedding for Steven Mnuchin
description: WASHINGTON  Steven T. Mnuchin, the Treasury secretary, and his fiance, the Scottish actress Louise Linton, are a match made in Hollywood, and one that tends to cut a conspicuous presence through this strait-laced capital. But they managed to keep their wedding plans secret until a fellow cabinet secretary spoiled the surprise.

title: Big Banks Clear First Phase of Federal Reserve Stress Tests
description: Once universally dreaded by banks, the Federal Reserves annual stress tests are becoming less stressful.

title: Review: Those Movies, Himself  Bertrand Taverniers Tour of French Cinema
description: Bertrand Taverniers My Journey Through French Cinema delivers what it promises. Even so, its explanatory title doesnt begin to convey just how exhilarating or inspiring a documentary this truly is, and how excellent a trip this well-respected French director takes you on. Deep, thoughtful, immersive, specific yet also wide-reaching, it is an exploration of French cinema by one of its own, a cinephile whose formative movie love evolved into a directing career that includes titles like Coup de Torchon, Life and Nothing But and Captain Conan.

title: Review: In Transit, and Oh, the Tales These Travelers Tell
description: Traveling between Chicago and the Pacific Northwest by train may not save you money, and it certainly wont save you time. But In Transit, the last film from the great documentarian Albert Maysles (Salesman, Grey Gardens), a founding figure of the direct cinema movement, suggests that weve lost something in an era of easy flying and road trips.

title: What to See in New York Art Galleries This Week
description: Through July 14. Alexander Gray Associates, 510 West 26th Street, Manhattan; 212-399-2636, alexandergray.com.

title: The Unveiling of the Senate Health Bill
description: To the Editor:

title: Parks for Everyone
description: Galas were held last week for Caramoor, Storm King, Carnegie Hall and the New York Restoration Project.

title: Nobody Is Perfect: Some Uber Employees Balk at Travis Kalanicks Exit
description: Uber and its investors are facing a backlash over Travis Kalanicks departure as chief executive  particularly from employees.

title: Expo 2017: Utopia, Rebooted
description: MONTREAL  These days, when social media and smartphones help fuel polarization and populism, it can be hard to remember how technology once promised to assemble us all into a harmonious, diverse global village. But when Marshall McLuhan, the high priest of Canadian techno-utopianism, coined that term in the early 1960s, a world improved by new media really did seem in the offing. He could see it forming half a century ago in this city, where McLuhan beheld a huge mosaic of culture and media, a global rendezvous unlike any before. What is happening today around the world, McLuhan proclaimed, is what is happening at Expo.

title: Review: Cannibalism, Hallucinogens and Keanu: The Bad Batch Has It All
description: Future historians  assuming that any such creatures exist  will surely identify the present moment as a golden age of dystopia. They may argue about whether our ever-proliferating political, ecological, technological and zombie-infested nightmares offer caution or consolation. Think about how bad things could get! But then again: Look how much worse they could be. Reality, meanwhile, inspires these dire visions and competes with them for sheer relentless awfulness.

title: Parks for Everyone
description: The Caramoor Center for Music and the Arts held its opening night gala on June 17 at its home in Katonah, N.Y. The Storm King Art Center in New Windsor, N.Y., celebrated the summer solstice on June 17. Carnegie Hall raised $2 million at its medal of excellence gala on June 20 at the Plaza hotel. And the New York Restoration Projects picnic benefit was June 19 at Sherman Creek Park in Manhattan.

title: The Republicans Jekyll-and-Hyde Health Care Plan
description: The Senate Republicans health bill that was made public today is a Jekyll-and-Hyde plan: in some ways kinder than the House Republican plan, and in some ways meaner, to use President Donald Trumps yardstick. Overall the plan will benefit the wealthy and young adults, but hurt larger numbers of people who are old or poor.

title: Reader Center: Covering Studies That Were Not Peer Reviewed
description: Hello, everyone,

title: In One Rally, 12 Inaccurate Claims From Trump
description: President Trump returned to familiar rhetorical territory during a raucous campaign-style rally in Iowa on Wednesday night, repeating exaggerations and falsehoods about health care, jobs, taxes, foreign policy and his own record.

title: Bill Cosby, Fresh From Trial, Plans Talks on Avoiding Assault Accusations
description: Bill Cosby is planning a series of town hall meetings this summer to educate people, including young athletes and married men, on how to avoid accusations of sexual assault, two of his representatives said Wednesday.

title: New Iran Deals for Airbus Jets Increase Pressure on Trump
description: Two Iranian airlines made prospective deals with Airbus on Thursday to buy 73 jetliners, a signal that the global aerospace industry is betting such sales to Iran will prevail despite increased hostility by the Trump administration.

title: Senate, Medicaid, N.B.A. Draft: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: 14 Years Old. Losing Muscle Every Day.
description: Nicolas is 14 and has Duchenne muscular dystrophy, which is robbing him of his muscles  and his life. A new and expensive drug may help, but can he get it?

title: Stephon Marbury Stars as Himself in Chinese Hoops Biopic
description: The trailer begins with a basketball player in an empty locker room, head bowed in concentration. Portentous trailer music swells. Thats followed by exciting basketball footage, including an on-court scuffle. The star is shown to run the gamut of emotions, his face at times contorted.

title: How North Korea Deals With American Prisoners
description: At least 16 Americans have been arrested in North Korea since 1996. Each situation is unique, but there are common threads when it comes to how and when they take Americans into custody.

title: Hate Crime Charge for Man Accused in Texas Mosque Fire
description: A Texas man was indicted on federal hate crime charges on Thursday in connection with an act of arson that destroyed a mosque and Islamic community center in January.

title: An 11th-Hour Push to Rename the Tappan Zee Bridge After Mario Cuomo
description: It was another late-night surprise in Albany: a bill to rename the new Tappan Zee Bridge after Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos father.

title: Insurers Battle Families Over Costly Drug for Fatal Disease
description: Nolan and Jack Willis, twins from upstate New York, and just 10 other boys took part in a clinical trial that led to the approval last fall of the very first drug to treat their rare, deadly muscle disease.

title: Trudeau on Trump: He Actually Does Listen
description: TORONTO  Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada said Thursday that he had a productive relationship with President Trump despite their broad differences, but also warned that the United States might harm only itself if it reduced trade ties with Canada. He was speaking at an event organized by The New York Times and the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto. Here are highlights of the interview.

title: Bizarre and Unusual: Readers Respond to Helicopter Parenting
description: This week, The New York Times wrote about LaVar Ball, the father of the U.C.L.A. basketball star Lonzo Ball, who has played a central role in his sons dealings with professional teams and apparel companies and may epitomize a model that extends far beyond the basketball court: the helicopter parent of the workplace.

title: Federal Court Lifts Injunction on Mississippi Anti-Gay Law
description: A federal appeals court on Thursday lifted an injunction on a Mississippi law that grants private individuals and government workers far-reaching abilities to discriminate against lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people on religious grounds, though lawyers said the law was likely to remain blocked for the time being during the appeals process.

title: What We Are Teaching Black Children
description: Its O.K., Mommy. Im right here with you.

title: Bronx Man Accused of Trying to Join ISIS Is Arrested at J.F.K.
description: The Bronx man said he had quit his job and paid off his debts, all in preparation for flying to Europe and making his way to Syria to join the Islamic State, the authorities said on Thursday.

title: Former State Department Security Officer Accused of Spying for China
description: WASHINGTON  A former State Department diplomatic security officer and military contractor was charged with conducting espionage for China after F.B.I. agents found top-secret documents and apparently incriminating messages on a communications device he brought back from Shanghai, the Justice Department said on Thursday.

title: Another Victory for the Making a Murderer Subject Brendan Dassey
description: Brendan Dassey, a subject of the Netflix documentary series Making a Murderer, won a major court victory on Thursday, as a federal appeals court upheld an earlier ruling by a federal judge overturning his conviction. The ruling came 10 years after Mr. Dassey was convicted of sexually assaulting and killing a 25-year-old photographer.

title: 20 Ross Under $20
description: These savory ross add sophistication to any summer party.

title: 20 Wines Under $20: The Savory Side of Ros
description: If for no other reason than popular demand, summer is ros season.

title: Shifting Dollars From Poor to Rich Is a Key Part of the Senate Health Bill
description: The Affordable Care Act gave health insurance to millions of Americans by shifting resources from the wealthy to the poor and by moving oversight from states to the federal government. The Senate bill introduced Thursday pushes back forcefully on both dimensions.

title: Indecent to Remain Open on Broadway, Despite Closing Notice
description: Indecent is not closing on Broadway after all.

title: Whos That Cat?
description: Dear Diary:

title: Edit DeAk, a Champion of Outsider Artists, Dies at 68
description: Edit DeAk, a critic and downtown scenemaker who made it her mission in the 1970s and 80s to cover art and artists overlooked by the mainstream press through the journal Art-Rite, which she helped found, and in the pages of Artforum, died on June 9 in Manhattan. She was 68.

title: Critics Say U.S. Is Sleepwalking Into Wider Role in Syria
description: WASHINGTON  To hear the Pentagon tell it, the United States still has no intention of getting involved in Syrias six-year civil war; the American presence there is solely to help its allies defeat the Islamic State.

title: What Is Mitch McConnell Thinking on Health Care?
description: Washington  After weeks of speculation and secret meetings, on Thursday Senate Republican leaders unveiled their version of the plan to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. On the surface, this bill and its optics are unbelievably bad. It cuts health benefits for millions of poor and disabled Americans, increases costs for the elderly and others, and slaps a temporary Band-Aid on the Obamacare insurance markets. And it surely fails to deliver on President Donald Trumps promise to make insurance both better and more affordable. Oh, and fewer than one in five Americans support the bills close cousin that has already passed the House.

title: Paulus Berensohn, a Dancer Who Pivoted to Pottery, Dies at 84
description: Paulus Berensohn, a dancer, potter and teacher whose slower, quieter, more mindful approach to pottery influenced a generation of artists, died on June 15 in Asheville, N.C. He was 84.

title: Gunman in Pizzagate Shooting Is Sentenced to 4 Years in Prison
description: A 29-year-old North Carolina man who fired a military-style assault rifle inside a popular Washington pizzeria in December, wrongly believing he was saving children trapped in a sex-slave ring, was sentenced on Thursday to four years in prison.

title: Pete Flynn, Mets Groundskeeper for Almost 50 Years, Dies at 79
description: Pete Flynn was a New York Met longer than Ed Kranepool, Keith Hernandez and Bud Harrelson combined. He stayed with the team as it went from National League punch line to World Series champion, and as it moved from the Polo Grounds to Shea Stadium and then to Citi Field.

title: No Deal, Just Blame, on Mayoral Control of New York City Schools
description: ALBANY  If everything had gone according to plan, Thursday should have marked the beginning of a well-earned break for the states 213 lawmakers, as the 2017 legislative session drew to a close.

title: U.N. Asks International Court to Weigh In on Britain-Mauritius Dispute
description: UNITED NATIONS  Britain suffered a diplomatic blow on Thursday as the United Nations General Assembly voted to refer Londons territorial claim to one of its last colonial outposts to an international tribunal for its opinion on the dispute.

title: Subsidized Complex Turns Itself Into a Gated Community
description: The instinct to shun and exclude comes all too naturally in the human spirit  the boy bullied by his brother at home arrives at school ready to menace; the billionaire locks himself in his tower among his own tribe; one group, trounced by the ruling order, finds another on which to enact a misguided revenge. As Jacob Riis observed in How the Other Half Lives, his classic documentation of 19th-century slums on the Lower East Side of Manhattan: The once unwelcome Irishman has been followed in turn by the Italian, the Russian Jew and the Chinaman and has himself taken a hand at opposition, quite as bitter, against these later hordes.

title: U.S. Sends Civilian Team to Syria to Help the Displaced Return Home
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration is sending a civilian team into Syria to try to bring stability to areas that American-backed forces have retaken from the Islamic State and to avert a humanitarian crisis, according to United States officials.

title: Knicks Draft Frank Ntilikina of France, Avoiding a Dramatic Twist
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Frank Ntilikina was determined to get to New York for the N.B.A. draft. Even though Strasbourg, the team he plays for in the French Pro-A League, was in the midst of the championship round of the playoffs, he calculated that he could catch a train to Paris and a flight to New York, make a quick appearance at the draft and then hustle back in time to join Strasbourg for the decisive game of the finals.

title: New Yorks Great Scenic Ride
description: A guided tour to a 25-mile stretch that hugs green space and stunning coastline through south Brooklyn and eastern Queens.

title: Nancy Pelosi Tells Democratic Critics, I Think Im Worth the Trouble
description: WASHINGTON  The House Democratic leader, Nancy Pelosi, strolled before the cameras on Thursday with defeat at her back once more, projecting a well-worn swagger  brash, defiant, more than a little off key  as she insisted that her moment had not passed.

title: Wall Street Journal Scrutinizes Hundreds of Articles by Fired Reporter
description: The Wall Street Journal is conducting a review of hundreds of articles by Jay Solomon, who was the papers chief foreign affairs correspondent. He was fired on Wednesday after evidence emerged that he had possibly become entangled in the commercial dealings of an Iranian-born aviation titan who was a key source for some of his stories.

title: Marc-Andre Fleurys Second Act Is Illuminated by Las Vegas Lights
description: LAS VEGAS  With the postgame celebration in full swing after the Pittsburgh Penguins clinched their second consecutive Stanley Cup championship on June 11, Marc-Andre Fleury shared an emotional moment with his teammate and fellow goaltender Matt Murray. As Fleury passed the Stanley Cup to the 23-year-old Murray, the exchange symbolized a passing of the torch in the organization.

title: Quotation of the Day: Young American Draft Hopeful Is a Big Talent in a Small Package
description: The first thing they see is Wow  that kid is really small and its been the same my whole life.

title: A Homeless Safe Space Challenges Australias Power Brokers
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Some are clean-shaven 18-year-olds whose hairstyles command as much of their attention as their pursuit of a home. Others are immigrant women in their 60s, struggling to keep up with a mortgage and appreciative of a warm meal.

title: Review: In The Traveling Lady, Hope and Regret Run Neck and Neck
description: Even though shes just off the bus in Harrison, Tex., with no one to meet her and nowhere to sleep, the young woman will not answer a reasonable question from a man who might be able to help.

title: Review: Doubling Down on Doublespeak in 1984
description: In periods when the world and its inhabitants seem too vicious to bear, some people find themselves drawn magnetically to what might be called feel-bad entertainment. I mean the sort of book, song or show that massages your anxiety the way your tongue might insistently probe an abscessed tooth.

title: Like a Pact With the Devil
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  So here we are, fresh from the themed puzzles of the week, and were looking for some flash. Were looking for a challenge.

title: Mexican President Says Government Acquired Spyware but He Denies Misuse
description: MEXICO CITY  Even as Mexicos president, Enrique Pea Nieto, acknowledged for the first time on Thursday that his government had purchased sophisticated software that has been used to spy on its fiercest critics, he also threatened to investigate those who have raised false accusations against his administration.

title: With Paladinos Job at Stake, Right to Free Speech Is His Defense
description: ALBANY  Carl Paladino, a wealthy real estate developer who once made a bombastic bid for governor of New York, appeared at a hearing here Thursday that will determine whether he remains on the Buffalo Board of Education.

title: U.S. Suspends Beef Imports From Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The United States on Thursday suspended imports of fresh beef from Brazil because of safety concerns, dealing a blow to one of Brazils biggest industries just months after Brazilian investigators accused food inspectors of accepting bribes.

title: Video Refutes ISIS Claim That U.S. Blew Up Mosque
description: Al Nuri Grand Mosque, in Mosul, Iraq, was blown up on Wednesday. The Islamic State said a U.S. airstrike destroyed it. But surveillance footage shows that the building appeared to be packed with explosives and not hit by an airstrike.

title: Corrections: June 23, 2017
description: NATIONAL

title: To Stay in Love, Sign on the Dotted Line
description: A few months ago my boyfriend and I poured ourselves two beers and opened our laptops. It was time to review the terms of our relationship contract.

title: Xi Jinping Is Set for a Big Gamble With Chinas Carbon Trading Market
description: BEIJING  As other countries look to China to take the lead in fighting global warming after President Trumps rejection of the Paris climate agreement, President Xi Jinping is pushing ahead with an ambitious plan to build the worlds largest market for carbon emissions permits.

title: Summer Vacation, Minus the Traffic: 5 Alternatives to Popular Trips
description: Positano. Vail. St.-Tropez. Yellowstone. Theres one big problem with these vacation hot spots. Everyone knows about them. So dont be shocked when you turn up at your hard-won summer holiday, sun-screened and ready to de-stress, only to encounter fellow vacationers jostling for your place in the sun.

title: Brexit, Republican Party, Confederations Cup: Your Friday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Everything Falls Apart as the Yankees Resume Their Losing Ways
description: Over the course of a baseball season, about a half-dozen games will vie for the dubious honor of being a teams worst setback of the year.

title: Bulls and Timberwolves Upstage Draft With Jimmy Butler Trade
description: After a predictable N.B.A. playoffs, with Golden State smashing everyone to smithereens en route to its second championship in three years, the first few days of the off-season have been full of intrigue for the rest of the league: With the Warriors raising the bar to a preposterous level, it was time to let the building  and the rebuilding  begin.

title: Whats on TV Friday: GLOW and Earth, Wind & Fire on CMT Crossroads
description: Alison Brie plays a flailing actress turned professional wrestler in GLOW, with Jenji Kohan of Orange Is the New Black as an executive producer. And Earth, Wind & Fire adds a country twang in CMT Crossroads.

title: Found Poem Favorite | Nothing Less than Heroic
description: We are honoring the top winners of our Eighth Annual Found Poem Student Contest by publishing their work from June 13 to July 3. Youll be able to read the whole collection here as we go.

title: The Week in Pictures: June 23, 2017
description: Photos by The New York Times and by photographers from around the world.

title: The Week in Pictures: June 23, 2017
description: Photos by The New York Times and by photographers from around the world.

title: You Dont Want to Buy Groceries From a Robot
description: The next time you check out at Whole Foods, you might meet my friend Esther at the register. In a few years, you might meet a robot. Or no one at all.

title: Albany Turns Its Back on City Schools
description: For shooting themselves in the collective foot, Albanys leaders could not have chosen a more effective method than their failure Wednesday night to extend Mayor Bill de Blasios control over New York City schools for at least another year. The legislators wont be getting much sympathy from New Yorkers, since they have now put the citys 1.1 million schoolchildren in peril.

title: A Noose at the Smithsonian Brings History Back to Life
description: The person who recently left a noose at the National Museum of African American History and Culture clearly intended to intimidate, by deploying one of the most feared symbols in American racial history. Instead, the vandal unintentionally offered a contemporary reminder of one theme of the black experience in America: We continue to believe in the potential of a country that has not always believed in us, and we do this against incredible odds.

title: Mis-Educating the Young
description: A few months ago I had lunch with a former student named Lucy Fleming, one of the best writers Ive taught. I asked her what she had learned in her first year out of college. She said she had been forced to think differently.

title: Get Cancer Now, Before Congress Cuts Your Insurance
description: SEATTLE  Im 35 years old. I didnt go to college after high school. Instead I got a job in insurance, and Ive spent half my life on the business side of keeping people healthy. Only once have I felt that the industry took positive steps toward insuring America, and that was when Obamacare mandated it.

title: The Young and Brash Saudi Crown Prince
description: Long ruled by an ossified gerontocracy, Saudi Arabia could soon be in the hands of a 30-something who may be more in tune with the nations overwhelmingly young population but whose impetuousness and hard-line foreign policy have raised concerns about whether he is ready for the top leadership post.

title: The Senates Unaffordable Care Act
