description: It would be a big mistake to call the legislation Senate Republicans released on Thursday a health care bill. It is, plain and simple, a plan to cut taxes for the wealthy by destroying critical federal programs that help provide health care to tens of millions of people.

title: Our Fake Democracy
description: We tell ourselves stories in order to live, as Joan Didion said. We do this as a nation, as individuals, as families  even when that construct is demonstrably false. For the United States, the biggest institutional lie of the moment is that we have a government of the people, responding to majority will.

title: Pure Class Warfare, With Extra Contempt
description: The Senate version of Trumpcare  the Better Care Reconciliation Act  is out. The substance is terrible: tens of millions of people will experience financial distress if this passes, and tens if not hundreds of thousands will die premature deaths, all for the sake of tax cuts for a handful of wealthy people. Whats even more amazing is that Republicans are making almost no effort to justify this massive upward redistribution of income. Theyre doing it because they can, because they believe that the tribalism of their voters is strong enough that they will continue to support politicians who are ruining their lives.

title: In South Korea, Confidante of Ousted President Gets 3 Years in Prison
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A longtime friend of Park Geun-hye, the ousted president of South Korea, was sentenced to three years in prison on Friday on charges of abusing her influence to get her daughter illegally enrolled in a prestigious university.

title: Alan Gilbert to Lead NDR Elbphilharmonie Orchestra in Hamburg
description: He is leaving a fixer-upper on the Upper West Side of Manhattan for a sleek new home in Hamburg, Germany. Alan Gilbert, the departing music director of the New York Philharmonic, announced Friday that he would be the next chief conductor of the NDR Elbphilharmonie Orchestra, whose striking new $843 million concert hall overlooking Hamburgs harbor opened earlier this year.

title: Trump 2020 Is No Joke
description: President Trump is holding the first fundraiser of his 2020 re-election campaign later this month at the Trump International Hotel near the White House.

title: Mets Grimace Their Way Through Fourth Straight Loss to the Dodgers
description: LOS ANGELES  The story of the Mets 6-3 loss to the Los Angeles Dodgers on Thursday night can be told in the reactions alone. These moments, in fact, embodied the entire four-game series sweep, a thorough dismantling of the Mets by the Dodgers, and perhaps the entire Mets season, once filled with promise but now replaced by misery.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Unmasking Magic and Murder in the Best New Crime
description: Every 16th-century savant and scholar and crackpot aspired to study in Prague under great minds like the astronomer Johannes Kepler and the court mathematician, Tycho Brahe. As a novice in the occult arts, Christian Stern, the young narrator of Benjamin Blacks WOLF ON A STRING (Holt, $28), is desperate to extend his studies in that capital of magic. But no sooner does he arrive in the city, in the winter of 1599, than he comes upon the corpse of a well-dressed woman, savagely murdered and dumped in the snow. Her grieving father warns Christian to travel on to Dresden or some other center of learning. Prague is no place for you, hes told. Here everything is tainted and sick.

title: Judge John Hodgman on the Roommate Who Takes Phone Calls While on the Toilet
description: Tyler writes: My roommate takes long, casual phone calls while on the toilet. I have tried explaining why this behavior is creepy and rude to the person he is talking to, as they do not know they are talking to someone who is going to the bathroom. He thinks its actually rude when people dont answer phone calls simply because theyre in the bathroom.

title: Paperback Row
description: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.

title: In Miami, Working Fresh Local Ingredients Into Indian Dishes
description: To eat Latin American or Caribbean food in Miami feels utterly natural, not just because South Florida is so deeply infused with those cultures, but also because the flavors and ingredients in those cuisines are a perfect fit for the regions tropical environment.

title: The Afterlife
description: James Tate, who died in 2015, was one of our greatest contemporary poets. His first book, The Lost Pilot, was selected for the Yale Series for Younger Poets when he was still a student at the Iowa Writers Workshop, and he went on to publish 17 books of critically acclaimed poetry. I had the fortune to have Tate as my teacher, then mentor and friend. For me, and for so many other poets, he has been an example of dedication to the art. I am both sad and grateful to make this my final selection as the magazines annual poetry editor. Selected by Matthew Zapruder

title: How to Knot a Cherry Stem With Your Tongue
description: Pick a good stem, says Al Gliniecki, who currently holds three Guinness World Records for most cherry stems knotted using the tongue: 14 in one minute, 39 in three minutes and 911 in one hour. Look for longer stems between one and one and a half inches long. The thinner the better, Gliniecki says. At one point, a cherry growers association sponsored Gliniecki, a 58-year-old Navy veteran and former firefighter, sending him as many boxes of free cherries as he wanted, despite the fact that he prefers maraschino cherry stems over fresh ones  sugary syrup makes the woody stalks softer and more pliable. Keep them at room temperature. Gliniecki once bloodied his tongue by tying stiff, refrigerated stems.

title: The 6.11.17 Issue
description: RE: H.I.V.

title: Out of High School, Into Real Life
description: The high school gym swirled with blue-and-white graduation gowns and glittering dreams. Some seniors had won university scholarships. Others were counting on springboarding from community college to a four-year degree.

title: Eluding Death by Design in a Tokyo Loft
description: Step into lofts in a Tokyo suburb that were designed by the artists Arakawa and Gins. Their philosophy was to extend life by altering ones living space.

title: Behind the Cover: 6.25.17
description: Jake Silverstein, editor in chief: The identities of the boys in Sarah A. Topols article about child soldiers had to be kept secret, for fear of retaliation from Boko Haram or the Nigerian military. The photos were severely cropped to make the subjects unidentifiable. We thought there was something powerful about highlighting this limitation, which speaks volumes about the plight of these children, in the cover design. That small part of the face of this boy, who was kidnapped at 13 by Boko Haram, is all that is safe to show.

Whether at Giants Stadium or later at Red Bull Arena, it was always there, game after game, staring back at him when he looked up into the supporters section. Petke rocks, it read.

title: The Sleeping Beauty: Royalist Ballet or Harmonious Ideal?
description: Many American ballet companies dance The Sleeping Beauty. Three, including New York City Ballet, danced the complete ballet between February and April. But why? Isnt this the most royalist of all ballets? King Florestan XXIV and his queen have a daughter, you see, and the story hinges on her finding Prince Right. Dynastic succession is the name of the game. The ballet ends with the happy-ever-after wedding: On July 5 at the Metropolitan Opera House, American Ballet Theater presents Auroras Wedding, in a new arrangement by Alexei Ratmansky of this final act.

title: Canadas Edgy 150th Birthday Rebranding
How Bobby Friese, Rickshaw Driver, Spends His Sundays
description: For the past two years, Bobby Friese, 47, has been the solo weekend rickshaw driver at the Mark hotel on East 77th Street. Mr. Friese, who works for Citi Bike during the week, can be spotted on the Upper East Side hauling guests through the park and to various restaurants and stores every Saturday and Sunday. The rickshaw is a beast, he said. The hotel has the deluxe model, which weighs about 150 pounds. Everyone who gets in always asks, Isnt this heavy? Yes. Yes, its heavy. But people love it. He lives in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, with his wife, Stephanie, 46, a print producer, and their son, Henry, 8. ALIX STRAUSS

description: This interview with Joe Andrew, global chairman of Dentons, a law firm, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

Who said the theater is all anodyne, feel-good musicals?

description: LONDON  The actor Johnny Depp is the latest American entertainment figure to suggest  however jokingly, ironically or obliquely  the killing of President Trump.

I wasnt happy that she texted instead of asking in person or on the phone so that we could get more information. But that is the way she likes to communicate.

Comey was intended to influence the fired F.B.I. directors testimony before Congress. He was 93.

title: What Americans Get Wrong About Porn
description: For six years, I immersed myself in the workings of the adult industry. As editor of the porn blog Fleshbot, I spent hours combing the XXX side of the internet, acquainting myself with all manner of perversions and obscure sex acts. At this point in my career, its fairly safe to say that there is almost no pornographic image that would be capable of shocking me. What does shock me, on the other hand, is how ill-informed our public discourse around porn continues to be.

title: A Restructuring Deal That Helps Investors, Not Puerto Rico
description: While its not clear if there are sharks in the waters surrounding Puerto Rico, the island does have sharks of a different kind  ones that hail from mainland hedge funds, municipal bond funds and insurance companies that insure against bond defaults.

Warmbier, the captive college student, asserting he was given medical treatment and treated with respect even though he was a criminal of the enemy state.

title: North Korea Tour Options Dwindle for Americans. But Not by Much.

description: WASHINGTON  When the judgment of history comes, former President Barack Obama might have figured he would have plenty to talk about. Among other things, he assumed he could point to his health care program, his sweeping trade deal with Asia, his global climate change accord and his diplomatic opening to Cuba.

title: New Charges for Ex-Officer in Texas Accused of Murdering Black Teenager
description: HOUSTON  Roy D. Oliver II, the white police officer who was fired and charged with murder after killing an unarmed black teenager in April in a Dallas suburb, is facing a new round of legal problems after a complaint that he pulled his gun on a driver about two weeks before the shooting.

title: A Maverick Director, His Big Pig and the Small Screen
description: After Bong Joon Ho, the South Korean film director celebrated for his thrilling visuals and dark bite, debuted his new film at Cannes  Okja, about a steely girl and her imperiled giant pet pig  audience members leapt to their feet for a minutes-long ovation.

title: The Beguiled Test: Does the Directors Gender Matter?
description: An injured Yankee hiding in Confederate territory is found by a 12-year-old girl in the waning days of the Civil War. Brought to her boarding school nearby, the corporal has his wounds dressed as he mentally undresses the six students and two teachers in the all-female establishment.

title: The Art of Animated Reality: Walerian Borowczyk and Jacques Demy
description: Among the oldest dichotomies in movies is between those motion pictures that take the world as given (cinma vrit) and those that create their very own (animation). The boundary between these poles is not absolute. There are movies like Walerian Borowczyks Goto, Isle of Love that suggest animated cartoons made with physical sets and real actors.

title: 7 of Our Best Brexit Pieces, a Year After the Vote
description: LONDON  A year ago Friday, voters made the historic decision for Britain to leave the European Union, more than 40 years after it joined what was then known as the European Economic Community. And a year later, Britain is still debating what form of divorce it will be and how a future relationship with the bloc might look.

title: Alan Vega Ignored the Art World. It Wont Return the Favor.
description: There is art, there is anti-art  and there is Alan Vega. The front half of the proto-punk duo Suicide, an outfit so confrontational he once had to dodge a flying hatchet from the audience, Vega also spent nearly half a century stringing together light sculptures out of old neon tubing, junked electrical parts and bulbs he sometimes stole from the subway. Some he hung on the wall; others he scattered across the floor. On occasion he even made drawings and paintings  surreal at first, spidery and jittery later on. During this time he was treated to a single museum retrospective and fewer than a dozen gallery shows. Yet today, not quite a year after his death last July at 78, he looms over a scene he ignored almost as assiduously as it ignored him.

description: The financial shock of adding a teenager to a family auto insurance policy is getting less shocking  at least somewhat.

description: Next month, 50 years will have passed since a violent uprising erupted in Newark, fueled by the anger of many black residents over police brutality, racism and corruption, as well as a broader sense of disenfranchisement. Over several days in July 1967, more than 20 people were killed and hundreds were injured.

title: In Long Run, Theres No Such Thing as an Einstein Investor
description: There are no easy answers in investing. It is tempting to replicate a successful strategy  one created by an outstanding investor, like Warren Buffett, or through in-depth statistical analysis of the wisdom of crowds  and such approaches can actually work for long periods.

title: Documenta Kassel: Using Art as Their Witness
description: KASSEL, Germany  Given a choice between a well-ordered exhibition with a soft center, like this years Venice Biennale, or a messy one with some hard, fibrous edges, Ill go for edges any day, which is why, despite some gripes, I had a positive experience at Documenta 14, the immense international art blowout that happens every five years in this uncharismatic industrial city north of Frankfurt.

title: Daily Report: A Crusader Against a Severe, Previously Unseen Cyberattack
description: Just when you think that cybersecurity hacking cannot grow worse, it does.

title: 10 Things to Do in NYC Now
description: Soon an endearing furry creature, indigenous to Japan but rarely seen here, will briefly invade American shores: the totoro. Visible only to children, this catlike woodland spirit springs from the imagination of the great Japanese animator and auteur Hayao Miyazaki. In this 1988 Studio Ghibli film, totoros  from dustball size to as large as a bus  provide joy and solace to Satsuki and her younger sister, Mei, who have accompanied their father to a rural area far from home while their hospitalized mother recovers from a mysterious illness. Although the girls odyssey ends happily, the film never denies the omnipresent specter of mortality or the power of childrens fears. GKids and Fathom Events will present the movie, accompanied by international shorts, in select theaters on Sunday at 12:55 p.m. (in English) and on Monday at 7 p.m. (in Japanese with English subtitles) as the opening event in Studio Ghibli Fest 2017, a six-film monthly Miyazaki series. Lovely and lyrical, it will make adults wish that Totoro were their neighbor, too. LAUREL GRAEBER

title: The Better Angels of Our Nature
The Secret to a Great Potluck? Its Not the Food
description: The most elaborate potluck I ever went to was my own wedding, to which each guest brought a dish in lieu of gifts. We feasted on truffled pea soup and caviar tea sandwiches.

title: Outside Collectors for I.R.S. Are Accused of Illegal Practices
description: Raid your 401(k). Ask your boss for a loan, load up on your credit cards, or put up your house as collateral by taking out a second mortgage.

title: Ayaan Hirsi Ali and Asra Q. Nomani Respond to Readers
description: Last week, Ayaan Hirsi Ali and Asra Q. Nomani testified before the Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. During the hearing, they werent asked any questions about political Islam by the Democratic women on the panel  an experience they argue is emblematic of a troubling trend among progressives to overlook the brutal reality of Islamist extremism. In They Brushed Off Kamala Harris. Then She Brushed Us Off, they write: When it comes to the pay gap, abortion access and workplace discrimination, progressives have much to say. But were still waiting for a march against honor killings, child marriages, polygamy, sex slavery or female genital mutilation.

title: Justices Side With Immigrant Who Got Bad Legal Advice
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Friday ruled in favor of an immigrant whose lawyer falsely told him that pleading guilty to a drug charge would not lead to his deportation. When the immigrant, Jae Lee, learned the truth, he sought to go to trial after all.

title: E.C.B. Seeks Control Over London Trading After Brexit
description: FRANKFURT  The European Central Bank took steps Friday to ensure it can oversee trillions of euros in London trading of derivatives and other risky securities even after Britain leaves the European Union.

title: Class Ed.
description: On the evening of Nov. 8, the feminist legal scholar Joan C. Williams made an early exit from an election night party once she realized it was over: Donald J. Trump was going to win. Her editor at Harvard Business Review had been asking her to write something about gender and the election, but Williams found the subject to be so obvious it wasnt interesting, she recalled in a phone interview. That night she was moved to write about something else, and the resulting article  viewed more than 3.5 million times  has been expanded into a new book, White Working Class: Overcoming Class Cluelessness in America.

title: Europe and Japan Near Trade Deal as U.S. Takes Protectionist Path
description: The European Union and Japan are close to sealing one of the largest trade agreements ever, a deal that could further isolate the United States as President Trump forges a protectionist path.

title: The Incredible Shrinking White House Briefing
description: The White House news briefing, after emerging as a cant-miss ritual of the early days of the Trump administration, has in recent weeks become shorter, less informative and less accessible, with some of the briefings declared off-limits to live broadcasting.

title: Turkey Drops Evolution From Curriculum, Angering Secularists
description: ISTANBUL  Turkey has removed the concept of evolution from its high school curriculum, in what critics fear is the latest attempt by President Recep Tayyip Erdogans government to erode the countrys secular character.

description: The 26-year-old French designer, a Balmain alum, will show a 10-piece offering during Paris Mens Fashion Week.

title: Brand to Know: A Subversive Line Inspired by Mapplethorpe
description: Growing up, the 26-year-old French designer Ludovic de Saint Sernin felt like he never quite fit in. Born in Brussels to a French mother and Portuguese diplomat father, de Saint Sernin lived with his family in the Ivory Coast until he was 8, when civil war forced them to relocate to France. De Saint Sernin recalls his childhood in Africa as a period of intense freedom. I was always playing around with materials, making something from nothing, he says. I didnt realize how amazing it was until I left. It felt like a dream. When he moved to Pariss 16th Arrondissement, which he felt was stuffy by comparison, he retreated into a world of drawing and watching old fashion shows on television.

title: Coney Islands Coaster King Takes Another Spin
description: The king of the coasters stepped onto the boarding platform of the Cyclone roller coaster in Coney Island on Thursday, and seemed almost drawn to Seat 6.

title: For These Collaborators, Theres No I in Best Seller
description: TEAM TIME: If you co-write a book about magic, is that crowd-sorcery? The science-fiction writer Neal Stephenson and the historical novelist Nicole Galland have teamed up to produce a fat marshmallow of a fantasy novel, The Rise and Fall of D.O.D.O.  new on the hardcover fiction list at No. 11  about a time-traveling intelligence officer and a Harvard linguist who discover that magic was once commonplace. On the back cover of early promotional copies, the authors explained their process. Nicki made a first pass over the opening phase, Stephenson said, while I ran tech support, tracking the timeline on a spreadsheet and spewing out gobs of techno-gibberish when that was needed. Galland added: This collaboration was great fun, in part because I got to witness Neal spew out gobs of techno-gibberish, which he does very elegantly.

title: C.I.A. Set Up Secret Back Channel With Syria to Try to Free U.S. Hostage
description: WASHINGTON  In the early days of the Trump administration, national security officials began exploring ways to free Austin Tice, an American journalist and a former Marine officer believed to be held by the Syrian government. His case has frustrated investigators and diplomats since he disappeared while on assignment nearly five years ago.

title: N.B.A. Drafts Come and Go, but Carmelo Anthony Always Remains
description: Everyone has a favorite prodigy on N.B.A. draft night, an evaluative insight to share in 140 characters or more.

title: Before and After OK Computer
description: Listen to the sound of rock being deprogrammed.

title: Mistrial in Cincinnati Shooting as Officer Is Latest Not to Be Convicted
description: CINCINNATI  The encounters with the police officers turned deadly within seconds. Each time, a black man was fatally shot, and each time, it was captured on video. And three times in the span of a week, the officers trials have ended without a conviction.

title: Review: Harbored Spins Immigrants Tales, With Liberty in View
description: Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning  to make sense of a confusing show. A theatergoers mind wanders to kooky places while trying to make sense of Harbored, a jumbled production about immigration.

title: Planned Parenthood Battle Could Sway Fortunes of G.O.P. Health Bill
description: WASHINGTON  As the Senate barrels toward a vote next week to sever all federal support for Planned Parenthood, the 100-year-old organization is mobilizing furiously to bring down the Republicans broader legislation to repeal the Affordable Care Act before it reaches President Trumps desk.

title: Do You Earn Enough to Buy a Home?
description: How much do you need to earn to buy a home in the big city? HSN.com recently calculated the salary required to afford a median-price home in 27 of the largest metropolitan areas in the United States.

title: Texas Nurse Suspected of Killing Up to 60 Children Is Charged With Murder
description: A 66-year-old nurse in Texas who is suspected of killing up to 60 children has been indicted on murder charges in the deaths of two of them in 1981, prosecutors said.

title: Is the Russia Inquiry Overblown? Readers Doubt It
description: To the Editor:

title: The Playlist: Drake Shows Off His Latest Obsessions
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos  and anything else that strikes them as intriguing. You can listen to this playlist on Spotify here. Like this Playlist? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com, and sign up for our Louder newsletter here.

title: Would You Trust Tom Selleck With Your Life Savings?
description: Hes the man with the answers. Alex Trebek is someone I trust.

title: How to Turn Challenges Like Deafness Into Gifts
description: Lauren Mackiewicz, 32, is a job coach at Easterseals in East Brunswick, N.J.

title: No Death Knell for ISIS
description: To the Editor:

title: Lessons From the Collapse of Banco Popular
description: Banco Popular, Spains fifth-largest bank, with over $100 billion in loans, collapsed earlier this month, forcing it into the arms of its rival, Banco Santander. The latter, Spains largest bank, bought the failing institution for the nominal sum of one euro after depositors withdrew money en masse and the companys stock price plunged.

title: The Business Downstairs: Plus or Minus?
description: For two decades, Marie Sacco has run her psychology practice out of a shared office in a prewar co-op on the Upper West Side. Over the years, shes made friends with residents, striking up conversations in the lobby and the courtyard. The community, she said, has always been warm and friendly.

title: Torture and Nuremberg
description: To the Editor:

title: Bombings in Pakistan Kill Dozens, Putting Country on Edge
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistan on Friday suffered its deadliest day in weeks of violence as terrorist bombings killed at least 53 people and wounded over 200. The attacks raised concerns about the growing challenges facing the countrys security forces.

title: Take Naps at Work. Apologize to No One.
description: Sign up here to get the Smarter Living newsletter, a weekly roundup of the best advice from The Times on living a better, smarter, more fulfilling life.

title: Canada Doesnt Know How to Party
description: TORONTO  July 1 is Canadas 150th anniversary, but nobody seems particularly eager to join the party. The muted attempts at celebration have so far produced either awkwardness or embarrassment. A giant rubber duck, six stories tall, is supposed to arrive in Toronto Harbor on Canada Day, but its imminent appearance has been greeted by outrage over costs and suspicions of plagiarism. In March, the CBC, Canadas national broadcaster, began televising a documentary series called The Story of Us to the almost instantaneous howling of Quebec and Nova Scotia politicians at what they regarded as significant omissions in our supposedly collective narrative. Resistance 150, an indigenous political movement, is planning to disrupt the anniversary itself.

title: Monicas 3 Movies to Stream or Rent This Weekend
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation newsletter and website.

title: Baby in Coma for 5 Days Dies in Brooklyn; Father Remains Jailed
description: A 16-month-old baby who has been in a coma since Fathers Day, when she was reported to have been beaten by her 18-year-old father, died Friday, according to officials at Maimonides Medical Center in Brooklyn.

title: The Slants on the Power of Repurposing a Slur
description: My first real lesson on the power of language was at the age of 11.

title: YouTube Star Randy Rainbow Brings Sass to His Trump Bashing
description: The YouTube personality Randy Rainbow was so embarrassed about asking his cabdriver to take him to the Trump Hotel in SoHo on Tuesday that he pretended he was a tourist.

title: Republican Senator Vital to Health Bills Passage Wont Support It
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Dean Heller of Nevada, perhaps the most vulnerable Republican facing re-election in 2018, said Friday that he would not support the Senate health care overhaul as written, dealing a serious blow to his partys attempt to repeal the Affordable Care Act just days before a showdown vote.

title: From 9/11 to Orlando, Ken Feinbergs Alter Ego in Compensating Victims
description: When the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn unveiled a program on Thursday to compensate victims of sexual abuse by its clergy, it chose a familiar name to oversee it: Kenneth R. Feinberg.

title: Rangers Trade Derek Stepan to Coyotes Ahead of N.H.L. Draft
description: CHICAGO  The Rangers traded center Derek Stepan and goaltender Antti Raanta to the Arizona Coyotes on Friday, continuing to aggressively restructure their roster and clear salary cap space only hours before the N.H.L. draft.

title: This Was the Second Time the Subject of a Story Died in Front of Me.
description: I came to know the Anne Family through Ousmane Thiam. Dionne Searcey, The Timess bureau chief for West and Central Africa, had asked me to do research for a story about why so many people, particularly West Africans, continue to risk everything to get to Europe along what is now the worlds deadliest migrant route. I set out to find West African families who had lost more than one member during the migrant crisis within the last two years.

title: Guilty Plea by Ulster Loyalist May Shed Light on Police Collusion
description: DUBLIN  A Protestant paramilitary leader and police informant from Belfast pleaded guilty to more than 200 terrorist crimes on Friday, including five murders. The plea was the first step in a legal process that could expose past collusion between the police and loyalist terrorists in Northern Ireland during the years of sectarian conflict known as the Troubles.

title: A.P.C. et Louis W.: Spring 2018
description: The labels Mens 2018 collection.

title: Courtney Kemp of Power on Shakespeare and Ghosts Evolution
description: Redemption.

title: The Joys of a Classic Ice Cream Sandwich
description: Summer is all about dashing through sprinklers, hiking into forests, and charging toward waves. Therefore the best summer foods  like fried chicken, hamburgers and corn on the cob  are all portable, hand-held and free from fuss. We want to munch while experiencing the joys of the season.

title: Germany Wipes Slate Clean for 50,000 Men Convicted Under Anti-Gay Law
description: BERLIN  In what the justice minister, Heiko Maas, called a belated act of justice, the German Parliament has voted unanimously to void the convictions of roughly 50,000 men prosecuted for homosexual acts since World War II.

title: Preaching the Value of Social Studies, in a Second Career
description: The children crowded around, looking intently at the objects sitting on the rug before them: a handful of spice containers from the supermarket and a wooden mortar and pestle.

title: Kamala Harris: A Fierce Fighter on Behalf of Women
description: To the Editor:

title: Things T Editors Are Really Into Right Now
description: This summer, three new titles bring Maines best recipes into the home  and there isnt a lobster roll in sight.

title: As de Blasio Urges Emissions Cuts, Key Climate Posts Sit Empty
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio has sought to position New York City as a leader in the fight against climate change, excoriating President Trump for pulling the United States out of the Paris climate accord, and joining a coalition of cities and states  that pledged to adhere to the agreements goals.

title: Berluti: Spring 2018
description: This labels spring 2018 collection.

title: Review: Miami City Ballet Brings Its Own Sunshine to Jacobs Pillow
description: BECKET, Mass.  Pamela Tatge took over as artistic director of Jacobs Pillow Dance Festival last year; this is the first year that all the artistic plans are hers. Its also the 85th anniversary of what dance folks refer to as the Pillow.

title: Review: A 20th-Century Sequel to Barber of Seville and Figaro
description: Darius Milhaud was an assiduous composer, at times perhaps too assiduous for his own good. He could achieve delightful simplicities, as in his jazz-tinged ballet score La Cration du Monde (1923). Then again, there were complex tangles, like his late opera La Mre Coupable (The Guilty Mother, 1965), a work chock-full of musical busyness, with the instruments often going one way and the singers another. And On Site Opera was up for the challenge as it presented the work at the Garage in West Midtown, in what it calls the United States premiere.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: Fulton Mall, Amid Change
description: There are at leasttwo ways to look at the velocity of change inDowntown Brooklyn: through thebuildings rising ever higher into the sky or through the people enlivening the sidewalks downbelow. Up top, another three-story mom-and-pop shop has given way to a gleaming residentialtower, changing the skyline into something closer toMidtown Manhattan. But on the sidewalks,street life remains as it has for decades: teenagers filling the Fulton Mall after school, barkerscalling pedestrians into their stores, bow-tied gentlemen selling The Final Call. Whichis the realDowntown Brooklyn?

title: Waves Above the Earth May Have Once Caused a Nocturnal Sun
description: It was night, but people could see, almost as if it was day. There were no streetlamps, no flood lights, no candles, sun or moon. But they could read documents, make out pebbles on the ground and spot details of landscapes hundreds of yards away. Distant mountains were illuminated. Some called it the nocturnal sun.

title: What I Love | Margaret Colin
description: The Veep actresss penthouse is a mix of souvenirs and furniture from the house where she and her husband, actor Justin Deas, raised their children.

title: A Brooklyn-Born Actress Rediscovers New York
description: For years, the Brooklyn-born actress Margaret Colin described herself as a dyed-in-the-wool Woody Allen sort of New Yorker, one of those people who firmly believed that only cousins live in New Jersey.

title: As U.S. Kills ISIS Leaders, a Notorious One Remains Elusive
description: WASHINGTON  On the same day the Pentagon announced it had killed yet another Islamic State leader that few Americans have heard of, Fawaz Muhammad Jubayr Al-Rawi, American officials also said they do not know if the Islamic States most well-known name, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, is still alive.

title: Professors Call Health Bills a Giant Step Backward
description: To the Editor:

title: Solving the Scorching Mystery of the Suns Erupting Plasma Jets
description: Spiky bursts of plasma called spicules swirl around the surface of the sun. Millions erupt every moment, spurting solar material some 6,000 miles high at speeds of about 60 miles per second.

title: Open Thread: This Week in Style News
description: Each week, the Open Thread newsletter will offer a look from across The New York Times at the forces that shape the dress codes we share, with Vanessa Friedman as your personal shopper. The latest newsletter appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Let the Waiting Begin: Calling Pitches, Slowly, in College Baseball
description: OMAHA, Neb.  The shadows stretched from the first-base stands toward the mound late Sunday as Texas Christian took on Florida at the College World Series. As each batter stepped in for the Horned Frogs, Gators catcher Mike Rivera settled into his crouch and glanced left, toward the third base dugout. There, Florida Coach Kevin OSullivan studied the laminated chart in his hands while Rivera waited.

title: U.N. to Investigate Reports of Government-Backed Slaughter in Congo
description: GENEVA  The United Nations will send international experts to investigate reports that civilians are being butchered by pro-government forces and insurgents in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

title: Bridging the Racial Divide, One Joke at a Time
description: LOS ANGELES  Late in the debut episode of his new Comedy Central show, Hood Adjacent With James Davis, the host breaks into a monologue about a recent infamous car chase. Two black men, misidentified as perpetrators of a burglary, led the police on a wild ride here through the city that involved their taunting law enforcement by performing doughnuts with their convertible on Sunset Boulevard.

title: On Younger, a Liar Debates Coming Clean
description: Last season, Younger left Liza (Sutton Foster) dangling off a precipice in the Hamptons with treacherous shoals below: an inopportune kiss with her boss, Charles (Peter Hermann), that derailed a marriage proposal from her boyfriend, Josh (Nico Tortorella); a book deal made with a fledgling writer under threat of blackmail; and  the coup de grce  her confession to her colleague Kelsey (Hilary Duff) that no, she was not a 26-year-old navigating the publishing world with fresh aplomb but rather a 40-ish divorced mother masquerading as a millennial because it was the only way she could get hired. Circle the sharks.

title: Galactic Pulses: The Best Moments of Make Music New York
description: Every year on the summer solstice, some 1,000 free events, most inviting audience participation, sprawl through the city, from dawn to night, under the auspices of Make Music New York. During the 2017 installment, on Wednesday, our critics experienced a few of the offerings.

title: The Health Debate Shows What Both Parties Care About Most
description: Economists believe what people do more than what they say. Its called revealed preference: Peoples actions are the best indication of what they actually want, not their words.

title: Hip-Hops Punk Moment Has Arrived
description: The Popcast is hosted by Jon Caramanica, a pop music critic for The New York Times. It covers the latest in pop music criticism, trends and news.

title: James Comey, North Korea, U.S. Senate: Your Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Because of an Earlier Incident, This Column May Infuriate You
description: One of the great villains of life in New York is Earlier Incident.

title: Saudi Security Forces Intercept Militants Plotting Mecca Attack
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Security forces in Saudi Arabia thwarted a militant plot to carry out an attack near the Grand Mosque in the holy city of Mecca on Friday, according to the Saudi-owned Al Arabiya television, citing a statement by a spokesman for the Saudi Interior Ministry.

title: 20 Years of L.G.B.T.Q. Lit: A Timeline
description: Once you have read James Baldwins Giovannis Room and Larry Kramers Faggots, both classic gay novels, here are 25 recent works that have shaped the L.G.B.T.Q. literary genre over the last two decades.

title: When Shots Ring Out From One Ball Field, a Reporter Practicing on Another Races to Cover Them
description: In this diary, Emmarie Huetteman, who covers Congress for The Times, shares her own window onto the shooting of Representative Steve Scalise  as a reporter, a spectator and finally a participant in a similar charity softball game.

title: What to Cook, Watch, Listen To and More This Weekend
description: As Pride Month enters its last week,

title: How Medicaid Works, and Who It Covers
description: One of the biggest flash points in the debate over Republican legislation to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act is the future of Medicaid. Here are some basic facts about the 52-year-old program.

title: A.T.F. Memo Indicates Agents Off-the-Books Account Was Against the Rules
description: WASHINGTON  Agents from the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives were running a multimillion-dollar, off-the-books bank account in Virginia to fund undercover operations at a time when the bureau had imposed strict rules about the use of such accounts.

title: Does It Matter Who Runs New York Citys Schools?
description: The State Legislatures failure to pass a bill extending mayoral control of New York Citys schools before the end of the term on Wednesday had no immediate effect on the citys 1.1 million schoolchildren: Mayor Bill de Blasios hold on education policy in the city continues through June 30. After that, Mr. de Blasio has warned of chaos and corruption that could return if control reverts to the Board of Education.

title: Google Will No Longer Scan Gmail for Ad Targeting
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Google plans to abandon its longstanding practice of scanning user email in its Gmail service to serve targeted advertising.

title: Maritime Mystery: Why a U.S. Destroyer Failed to Dodge a Cargo Ship
description: There should have been lookouts on watch on the port, starboard and stern of the destroyer Fitzgerald  sailors scanning the horizon with binoculars and reporting by headsets to the destroyers bridge. At 1:30 a.m. last Saturday, off the coast of Japan south of Tokyo, they could hardly have failed to see the 730-foot freighter ACX Crystal, stacked with more than 1,000 containers, as it closed in.

title: Frank Kush, Hall of Fame Coach of Arizona State, Dies at 88
description: Frank Kush, the college Hall of Fame coach who took Arizona State University to national football prominence, but who was fired midway through his 22nd season when he was accused of trying to impede an investigation into an assault allegation lodged by a player, died on Thursday in the Phoenix area. He was 88.

title: OSHA to Roll Back Rules on Toxic Mineral at Construction Sites
description: The Occupational Safety and Health Administration proposed on Friday a rollback of some Obama-era rules to protect workers in the maritime and construction industries from beryllium, a potentially deadly mineral.

title: Trump Signs Bill Meant to Restore Trust in V.A.
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump signed a bill into law on Friday that will make it easier for the Department of Veterans Affairs to remove bad employees and promote whistle-blowing.

title: Knicks Sign Canyon Barry, a Student of Triangles
description: In the days leading up to his workout with the Knicks last month, Canyon Barry put together a quick cram session. He watched a few Knicks games from last season and studied their triangle offense, hoping to analyze the cuts and movements he would make in it. To test himself, he then explained its intricacies to his agent.

title: The Timess Resident Expert for a World on Fire
description: The email landed almost as soon as I woke up on Fathers Day in Phoenix, where I work as bureau chief. Bryant Rousseau, an editor on the International desk, asked if I could help out on a story about the wildfire that killed at least 64 people in Portugal, including many who were trapped inside their cars.

title: State Dept. Moves to Shut Office Planning Afghanistan Strategy
description: WASHINGTON  The State Department is winding down an Obama-era office responsible for developing long-range strategy in Afghanistan and Pakistan  just as the Trump administration conducts a major review of the future of Americas longest war.

title: Hans Breder, Who Broke Artistic Boundaries, Dies at 81
description: Hans Breder, a German-born artist whose interest in straddling the boundaries between disciplines led him to create the Intermedia Program, the first of its kind, at the University of Iowa in 1968, died on June 18 in Iowa City. He was 81.

title: Senate Health Plan Falls Short of Promise for Cheaper Care, Experts Say
description: President Trump and the Republicans have promised that their plan to overhaul the federal health care law will make medical coverage much more affordable.

title: Melania Trump Hires White House Chief Usher From the Family Business
description: WASHINGTON  In the past, White House chief ushers have largely been public servants, military personnel or career staff members who worked their way up the usher ladder over several administrations. But in naming a new chief usher on Friday, Melania Trump elevated someone from within a close network of family employees to be her in-house right hand.

title: I Picked Prison Over Fighting in Vietnam
description: Growing up in Fresno, Calif., I believed in my country, right or wrong, just like everyone I knew. I could not have anticipated that when I came of age I would realize that my country was wrong and that I would have to do something about it. When I did, everything changed for me.

title: Easiest Path to Riches on the Web? An Initial Coin Offering
description: A new crop of technology entrepreneurs is forgoing the usual routes to raising money. The entrepreneurs are not pitching venture capitalists, selling stock in an initial public offering or using crowdfunding sites like Kickstarter.

title: How Twitter Pornified Politics
description: This is the column in which I formally forswear Twitter for good. Ill keep my Twitter handle, and hopefully my followers, but an editorial assistant will manage the account from now on. Ill intercede only to say nice things about the writing I admire, the people I like and the music I love.

title: Big Little League
description: Keeping score is ingrained in my soul. Baseball is a game driven by outcomes  results interlocked in a quantifiable puzzle to predict the future, assess the past, even value the present  and I intimately lived that world professionally for almost 15 years. Yet now, having just coached another year of Little League, I question the conclusions we often make when coloring by numbers, especially when dealing with kids so young that unpredictable growth is inevitable.

title: Taking On the Frat Boys
description: Everybody seems to hate the Senate health care bill, which was created by 13 Republican men meeting behind closed doors.

title: Quotation of the Day: Mystery: Why Agile Destroyer Failed to Dodge a Cargo Ship
description: It looks very much like the computer was driving.

title: In Defense of the One-and-Done
description: A benefit of living in a small college town with a big-time college basketball team is that in the course of grocery shopping, changing your cars oil or donating blood, theres a not-insignificant chance that youll meet in real life the hoops stars you watch on TV. That happened last summer: My daughter Georgia and I were running an errand on the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill campus when we bumped into Tony Bradley.

title: The Torturers Speak
description: Its hard to watch the videotaped depositions of the two former military psychologists who, working as independent contractors, designed, oversaw and helped carry out the enhanced interrogation of detainees held at C.I.A. black sites in the months after the Sept. 11 terror attacks.

title: New M.T.A. Chairman Is the Right Choice for a Tough Job
description: Gov. Andrew Cuomo made the right call this week when he named  Joseph Lhota, a capable administrator, as chairman of the beleaguered Metropolitan Transportation Authority, which has been without a permanent leader since January. Mr. Lhota and Mr. Cuomo now need to come up with a credible plan to fix the M.T.A., especially the subway.

title: The Democrats Religion Problem
description: Carrollton, Ga.  Jon Ossoffs defeat in Georgias Sixth Congressional District election on Tuesday wasnt just a sign that Democrats may have a harder time winning in the Trump era than they had hoped. It is a symptom of a larger problem for the party  a generational and racial divide between a largely secular group of young, white party activists and an older electorate that is more religious and more socially conservative.

title: Philando Castile, Diamond Reynolds and a Nightmare Caught on Video
description: When Philando Castile was fatally shot by a police officer, the traumatic events were captured by police and security cameras, and his girlfriend's smartphone.

title: Canada Letter: Trudeau Talks to Us, and a New Name
description: Yes, youve come to the right place. As we showcase The New York Timess expanded coverage of the country over this week and the next, Canada Today has become Canada Letter to reflect a freshened approach.

title: End With Speed
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  If youre gobsmacked by this meaty Saturday puzzle, come sit right here by me. Stu Ockman isnt wildly prolific (not that theres anything wrong with that), but his history indicates a leaning toward grids for the end of the week, and a deviousness in cluing and expansive vocabulary to go with it. In other words, a tough little nut to crack, but worth it.

title: Saudis, at War in Yemen, Give Country $66.7 Million in Cholera Relief
description: The newly elevated crown prince of Saudi Arabia, who as defense minister has led the countrys bombing and blockades of Yemen, showed his charitable side on Friday with a $66.7 million donation to fight the cholera outbreak in that country.

title: European Central Bank Moves to Wind Down Two Italian Banks
description: The European Central Bank effectively euthanized two small Italian banks late Friday, in another sign that the eurozone financial system remains vulnerable even as the economy improves.

title: Devils Take Nico Hischier No. 1, Defying N.H.L. Draft Predictions
description: CHICAGO  Nico Hischier was only 10 the first time he slipped a Devils sweater over his head during a youth hockey tournament in his native Switzerland.

title: Dr. John Sarno, 93, Dies; Best-Selling Author Tied Pain to Anxieties
description: John E. Sarno, a doctor at New York University whose controversial books on the psychological origins of chronic pain sold over a million copies, even while he was largely ignored or maligned by many of his medical peers, died Thursday in Danbury, Conn. He was 93.

title: Corrections: June 24, 2017
description: NATIONAL

title: Asked to Switch Positions, Asdrubal Cabrera Asks to Switch Teams
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In many ways, Asdrubal Cabrera represented the Mets 2016 season. He gutted his way through knee pain, providing sure-handed defense at shortstop and stout offense at the plate, and came to be seen as the teams heart and soul. Behind his play, and, leadership, the Mets rallied to earn a National League wild-card berth.

title: Landslide in China Is Feared to Have Buried Over 140 People
description: BEIJING  More than 140 people in southwestern China are feared to have been buried under an avalanche of mud and rocks when a hillside collapsed on Saturday, Chinese news media reported.

title: Marion Goldin, Award-Winning 60 Minutes Producer, Dies at 76
description: Marion Goldin, one of the most respected and prolific producers at CBSs flagship newsmagazine, 60 Minutes, died on June 15 at her home in Palm Springs, Calif. She was 76.

title: Third Former Vanderbilt Football Player Convicted of Rape
description: Four years to the day after prosecutors say a 21-year-old neuroscience major at Vanderbilt University was sexually assaulted by a group of college football players while she was unconscious inside a dorm room, a jury on Friday convicted the third of four defendants in the attack.

title: Escaping the Inferno
description: Britains deadliest fire in more than a century raced from floor to floor, forcing residents to decide: Wait for rescuers or try to escape?

title: Yankees Masahiro Tanaka Prevails in a Duel With a Japanese Flavor
description: Waking up on Saturday morning, baseball fans in Japan were able to watch two homegrown pitching idols duel for the first time since 2011, when they still competed in the Nippon Professional Baseball league.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: The Birth of a Nation and the Americas Cup
description: The Birth of a Nation, Nate Parkers directing debut, comes to HBO. And Oracle Team USA defends its title in the 35th Americas Cup.

title: Humbled by a Rough Season, the Mets Let Their Bats Boast
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Even before Asdrubal Cabrera requested a trade on Friday afternoon, the Mets were already weighing the future of their roster. They arrived here on Friday reeling after a humbling week against the Washington Nationals and the Los Angeles Dodgers, two of the best teams in the National League.

title: A Key Challenge for Americas Cup Crews: Dont Fall Overboard
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda  Sailors have been falling off boats for as long as there have been boats. Even the worlds best are not immune.

title: Immigration Moves Front and Center in Italys Local Elections
description: COMO, Italy  The center-right candidate for mayor of Como, Mario Landriscina, a doctor who once did United Nations relief work, says that Italy is second to none in rescuing migrants and that rejecting refugees or minors is out of the question.

title: This Is an Intentional Slap in the Face to All Women
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment. Some comments were edited for length and clarity.

title: That Ball Was Hit a Country Mile, or 495 Feet if Youre Into Hard Data
description: Spoiler alert: If you wish to continue enjoying gargantuan home runs in the future with unspoiled pleasure, free of all polynomial equations, read no further. If you persist, however, then there is much math to consider.

title: A Street Fight Among Grocers to Deliver Your Milk, Eggs, Bananas
description: Every couple of days, Sinclair Browne fights through traffic in Times Square, squeezes his delivery truck into a parking spot, walks up four flights of stairs and delivers groceries to a guy whose order he knows by heart.

title: Why Grenfell Tower Burned: Regulators Put Cost Before Safety
description: LONDON  The doorbell woke Yassin Adam just before 1 a.m. A neighbor was frantically alerting others on the fourth floor of Grenfell Tower about a fire in his apartment. My fridge blew up, the man shouted.

title: On Campus, Failure Is on the Syllabus
description: NORTHAMPTON, Mass.  Last year, during fall orientation at Smith College, and then again recently at final-exam time, students who wandered into the campus hub were faced with an unfamiliar situation: the worst failures of their peers projected onto a large screen.

title: How Gay Should a Gay Bar Be?
description: The website for the Abbey touts its role as a two-time winner of Logos Best Gay Bar in the World award. But how gay is it? Some of the regulars believe the increasing number of straight people who go there has diluted its reason for being.

title: Young Socialites Conjure the Ghost of Leonard Bernstein at the Dakota
description: It was a spring Saturday in March, but winter lingered in Manhattan, glowering and unwelcome, like a lookout at a street corner.

title: Trumps Washington News of the Week: Health Care Bill, Karen Handel and James Comey
description: Worried that you missed an important political story this week? Youre not alone. Catch up on a busy week of news from the Trump administration.

title: Writers Across the Ideological Spectrum Agree: They Dont Like the Senate Health Bill
description: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. Thats why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.

title: A Self-Proclaimed Tough Cop Wants a New Title: Mayor
description: When Stephen K. Bannon got into a dispute with an ex-wife who accused him of domestic violence, he hired a private investigator with a history of digging up embarrassing information about people claiming to have been wronged.

title: South Korea Leader Hopes for Unified Olympic Team With the North
description: SEOUL, South Korea  President Moon Jae-in of South Korea proposed on Saturday that his country and North Korea form a unified team to compete in the 2018 Winter Olympics, to be held in the city of Pyeongchang in the South.

title: Farhads and Mikes Week in Tech: Uber Isnt Everything
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: SSS World Corp: Spring 2018
description: This labels spring 2018 collection.

title: Love Is Love Is Love Is  Cut the Mike
description: This week, a video of a 12-year-old girl coming out as gay to her Mormon congregation in Eagle Mountain, Utah, went viral  and its easy to understand why. Savannah is adorable. She wears a red tie, which is already a statement, since wearing pants to church as a woman can be controversial. She stands in front of a room of adults delivering her testimony about how her Heavenly Parents did not mess up when they gave me freckles. Or when they made me gay. God loves me just this way because I believe that he loves all of his creations.

title: Addison Schultz and Tal Hirshberg: A Coffee Scion, and a Grande Love Story
description: Addison Schultz, the daughter of Sheri K. Schultz and Howard D. Schultz of Seattle, was married June 24 to Tal Hirshberg, a son of Nurit Hirshberg and Boaz Hirshberg of North Woodmere, N.Y. Rabbi Daniel Geffen officiated at the summer home of the brides family in East Hampton, N.Y.

title: A Crying Baby Next Door
description: Q. I moved into a rental in Murray Hill last November. Unbeknown to me, there is a baby next door who shares a wall with my apartment. I understand that new parents deal with crying babies, but it seems like these parents have decided to let the baby cry it out, and dont try to make the baby stop. The baby cries a lot in the morning and at night when Im trying to sleep. If I had known about this, I would never have rented the apartment. Is there any action I can take?

title: Medicaid Cuts May Force Retirees Out of Nursing Homes
description: ORANGE, Va.  Alice Jacobs, 90, once owned a factory and horses. She has raised four children and buried two husbands.

title: 52 Places to Go: Sikkim, India
description: In the far reaches of northeastern India, Buddhist monks chant and pace through rare funeral customs for a revered teacher.

title: Dior Homme: Spring 2018
description: This labels spring 2018 collection.

title: This Is Appalling: Evacuated London Residents Try to Cope
description: LONDON  Addise Mekonen was working a night shift on Friday when he learned from television news that his apartment was one of 650 London flats being evacuated in the middle of the night amid fears that it might be as dangerous as Grenfell Tower, which had been incinerated in the  deadliest blaze in Britain in more than a century.

title: Israeli Competitor Is a First for Nascars Top Cup Series
description: Avi Day plans to hand an Israeli flag to his 25-year-old son, Alon, to carry to the podium where he will be introduced on Sunday as a competitor in a stock car race in Sonoma, Calif. The flag handoff has become a race-day ritual for the Days, but Sundays version will be anything but routine.

title: Hopes Fade After Landslide Destroys Chinese Village
description: BEIJING  Hundreds of rescue workers tapped, poked and dug through the earth and rubble left by a landslide that smothered a village in southwestern China on Saturday, looking for signs of survivors among the 100 or more people who were missing. But as night fell and the search continued under lights, hopes of pulling many alive from the rocks and earth dimmed.

title: Health Law Repeal Leaves Nevada Republican Torn Between Lawmakers
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Dean Heller, Republican of Nevada, is the man everyone wants. This has not been a good thing for him.

title: For the Kiwis, a Win Could Mean Rewriting Rules for the Next Americas Cup
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda  New Zealand is one victory away from repossessing the Americas Cup, which is minimal assurance for Kiwi fans who watched through their fingers as Oracle Team USA put a fist through the top of its own coffin and came from very far down to win in 2013.

title: Flowers, Flowers and More Flowers: How a Star Ballerina Says Goodbye
description: A ballerinas farewell  especially at American Ballet Theater  is a time-honored drama. Rose petals fall like rain from the rafters, fellow dancers parade out to deliver bouquets, and audience members crowd the aisles, roaring as if at a rock concert.

title: To Make Sense of American Politics, Immigrants Find Clues From Lands They Left
description: HOUSTON  Raji Alatassi watched a video clip of that recent cabinet meeting in Washington, in which the top officials in President Trumps administration took turns heaping worshipful praise upon their leader. He felt he had seen it before.

title: Philadelphia Phillies Rebuild Is a Slow Process
description: On Thursday, for the second year in a row, the Philadelphia 76ers chose first over all in the N.B.A. draft. Their fans have endured years of failure but seem convinced that the teams highly promoted Process  capital P  will work. The 76ers have already set a franchise record for season-ticket sales, and they expect to sell out all their games.

title: Yankees Youth Movement Suffers a Big Loss to Texas
description: In the 72nd game of their season, the Yankees fielded a starting lineup that would have seemed perfectly reasonable in spring training.

title: For W.N.B.A.s Oldest Rookie, a Lot of Persistence Goes a Long Way
description: Hours before her W.N.B.A. debut last month, Yvonne Turner joined her fellow rookies in an elaborate game of fetch.

title: Angolas Corrupt Building Boom: Like Opening a Window and Throwing Out Money
description: LUANDA, Angola  An ambitious reconstruction plan after Angolas civil war was meant to reach even the countrys most faraway corner, a region known as the Land at the End of the World.

title: Variety Puzzle: Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Upon solving this acrostic I became acutely aware of how very many Brit-centric clues we had to figure, which is an endearing and enduring sign of Emily Coxs and Henry Rathvons craftsmanship. The quotation is from Rob Temple, an English social (media) commentator, sort of a 21st century Thackeray, I suppose, who began compiling awkward items about his pasty people using the hashtag #VeryBritishProblems under the Twitter handle @SoVeryBritish way back in 2012. His efforts rapidly took off, garnering a legion of followers, and spawning a cottage industry of anachronisms: T-shirts, greeting cards, a board game, books and a television show. How so last era, innit.

title: British Parliament Hit by Cyberattack, Affecting Email Access
description: LONDON  The British Parliament was the target of a cyberattack that left many legislators unable to connect to their email on Saturday as remote access to accounts was disabled as a security measure.

title: Nabra Hassanen and the Lost Innocence of Ramadan IHOP Nights
description: I cant recall a Ramadan in America during my teens and 20s when I didnt meet my Muslims friends at IHOP at 3 a.m.

title: Men Dont Want to Be Nurses. Their Wives Agree.
description: It seems like an easy fix. Traditionally male factory work is drying up. The fastest-growing jobs in the American economy are those that are often held by women. Why not get men to do them?

title: The Real Threat of Artificial Intelligence
description: BEIJING  What worries you about the coming world of artificial intelligence?

title: Sacrificing Black Lives for the American Lie
description: Why are police officers rarely charged for taking black lives, and when they are, why do juries rarely convict?

title: From Worse to Bad on Health Care
description: THE Obamacare replacement that the House sent to the Senate might as well have had a note scrawled across its pages: Save us from ourselves.

title: I Am Not a Paki, Not a Terrorist. I Am Nobody but Myself.
description: TORONTO  In the summer of 2007, I was 17 and suppressing all thoughts of the future. I was facing my last year of high school and had no prospects. College might have been the logical next step, but I had always been a lousy student. Earlier that year, my father had taken a black marker to my report card, circled all the poor grades and written, WHY?

title: President Trump, Meet This 2-Year-Old
description: RIVERCESS COUNTY, Liberia  Hes a 2-year-old boy named Sunday Dahn, lying in a coma in a rural health center with cerebral malaria. Even if Sunday survives, he may suffer permanent brain damage.

title: Men Can Be So Hormonal
description: Does being over 40 make you feel like half the man you used to be?

title: Islanders, in Revamp Mode, Send Travis Hamonic to the Flames
description: CHICAGO  The Islanders continued to overhaul their roster on Saturday, trading defenseman Travis Hamonic to the Calgary Flames for three high draft picks.

title: Balmain: Spring 2018
description: Olivier Rousteing shows his latest collection.

title: How Many Dishes Can There Be To Wash?
description: When Ammar is late coming home, Raghida can't stop thinking about his arrest in Syria.

title: If We Lose Our Health Care ...
description: Republicans have demonized the Affordable Care Act for so long that people may have forgotten that nearly one in five nonelderly Americans lacked health insurance before the law was passed. Many of them didnt get the care they needed because they feared it would bankrupt their families. The A.C.A., or Obamacare, has not solved those problems completely, but it has extended health care coverage to 20 million people.

title: Red Auerbach Told Bill Russell, Im the Coach and Youll Fit
description: There are decorated athletes, and then there is Bill Russell.

title: Donald Skunks the Democrats
description: WASHINGTON  YOU know who is really sick and tired of Donald Trump winning, to the point where they beg, Please, Mr. President, sir, its too much?

title: She Was Named Worlds Ugliest Dog, but Shes Just Darling
description: Jessica Burkard of Penngrove, Calif., saw a beautiful companion for her St. Bernard when she found Martha, a 125-pound Neapolitan mastiff.

title: Oracle Team USA Finally Breaks Through at the Americas Cup
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda  Jimmy Spithill was back in his element on Saturday: sailing hurt in a rejiggered Americas Cup yacht, with a big deficit to overcome.

title: Herms: Spring 2018
description: This labels spring 2018 collection.

title: N.H.L.s Connor McDavid, M.V.P. at 20, Is Still Pursuing His Idol
description: LAS VEGAS  The image marks a single moment in hockeys long history. A smiling and shaggy-haired Connor McDavid, six weeks removed from his 16th birthday, posing for a photo while standing between the Pittsburgh Penguins star Sidney Crosby and the team owner and Hall of Famer Mario Lemieux.

title: Cropped
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  In college I spent a weekend picking cucumbers at a farm in Massachusetts, crawling on all fours as fast as I could as someone much more agile than I ran backward in front of me, holding a milk crate that I was supposed to fill with cukes at a rapid clip. Notice that I specify a weekend because I didnt last, but the dream is still alive somewhere in this lily-white corpus officium. Which reminds me of a conversation with a friend, held earlier this week, about her dogs mood disorder diagnosis and subsequent prescription. I guess I shouldnt be surprised that shes depressed, my friend said with a sigh. Shes inside 20 of 24 hours. Its so unnatural for living things.

title: Bruce Davis, a Charles Manson Follower, Has Parole Blocked for Fifth Time
description: A prison inmate who was a member of the Manson family has had his parole blocked by the governor of California for the fifth time.

title: Red Bulls Herald Robust Rivalry, Then Cower Before N.Y.C.F.C.
description: HARRISON, N.J.  The invasions were successful on all fronts.

title: A Buddhist Leader on Chinas Spiritual Needs
description: YIXING, China  During a visit last fall to the Temple of Great Awakening, the sprawling complex built by the Buddhist organization Fo Guang Shan in Yixing, we were greeted by an unexpected host: the Venerable Master Hsing Yun, the groups founder and one of modern Chinas most prominent religious figures.

title: Is a Buddhist Group Changing China? Or Is China Changing It?
description: YIXING, China  For most of her life, Shen Ying was disappointed by the world she saw around her. She watched Chinas economic rise in this small city in the Yangtze River Valley, and she found a foothold in the new middle class, running a convenience store in a strip mall. Yet prosperity felt hollow.

title: Quotation of the Day: Accident Waiting to Happen: Blame in a Deadly London Fire
description: Anyone who listened to the fire brigade and stayed where they are, they lost their lives.

title: Artists Cultural Borrowing
description: To the Editor:

title: DeGrom, a Constant in the Mets Rotation, Stymies the Giants
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Despite all that has happened to the Mets starting rotation this season, Jacob deGrom has always been there when called upon. While he has endured some inconsistencies that have contributed to the Mets disappointing position in the standings, he has not missed a start. And on this team, that is an achievement.

description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: In Pakistan, a Fuel Tanker Fire Leaves at Least 150 Dead
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  When a tanker truck overturned on a road in eastern Pakistan on Sunday, hundreds of people rushed toward the vehicle to collect the spilled and leaking fuel.

description: The labels mens collection

title: In Pursuit of Millennials, More Fun in Sports. But Still No Twerking.
description: Millennials are forcing us to change the way we think about sports. And its a good thing, because the grown-ups have gone plum nuts.

title: In Towns Already Hit by Steel Mill Closings, a New Casualty: Retail Jobs
description: JOHNSTOWN, Pa.  Dawn Nasewicz comes from a family of steelworkers, with jobs that once dominated the local economy. She found her niche in retail.

title: Rare G.O.P. Species Runs for New Jersey Governor: A Moderate
description: HACKETTSTOWN, N.J.  The Republican candidate for governor of New Jersey sat on a plush beige couch in the Republican mayors condo, surrounded by Republican county officials and politicians, and offered up her plan to stem what is perhaps the states most daunting challenge  its deepening property tax crisis.

title: Global News Quiz: King Salman Shocker, Roman Misbehavior and Indian Sedition
description: Did you stay on top of the most important stories last week from around the world? Test your knowledge of international events with our quick quiz, recapping major news headlines from across the globe. To take the quiz, click on an answer, and the correct response will be revealed after you choose.

title: Revered and Feared in the Book Review
description: On a recent morning, Marilyn Stasios Upper West Side living room contained at least two dozen piles of books  arranged on shelves, peeking from bags and boxes, heaped in precarious leaning towers. Books to the right of me, books to the left of me, books in front of me, books behind me, she declared. Its terrible!

title: L.G.B.T.Q. Pride Around the World
description: Join the celebrations  and reflect on the range of rights  in Dublin, Shanghai, Kiev and other cities during June Pride festivities.

title: For Grieving Parents, Trump Is Speaking for the Dead on Immigration
description: The families could reel off all the times they had called the media and written to Washington, but after all that trying, they had never heard anyone who mattered say anything like it: Most Mexican immigrants, Donald J. Trump declared in his first campaign speech, were rapists who were bringing drugs, bringing crime across the border.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Sale of Edward Albees Art Collection Will Benefit His Foundation
description: Edward Albee is, of course, best known for his plays (the most famous: Whos Afraid of Virginia Woolf?). But he was also a collector, and visitors to his TriBeCa loft were often struck by the museumlike array of tribal sculptures and contemporary paintings.

title: Bloombergs Next Anti-Washington Move: $200 Million Program for Mayors
description: Michael R. Bloomberg will throw his financial might into helping beleaguered American mayors, creating a $200 million philanthropic program aimed at backing inventive policies at the city level and giving mayors a stronger hand in national politics.

title: The Time to Retrieve Times Time Capsule Is at Hand
description: Moving day was on the calendar back in 2015, and in the executive suite in the Time & Life Building, someone said: Oh, theres a time capsule. We have to figure out at some point what to do with it.

title: A Winning Design for a New York Monument to Gay and Transgender People
description: Just as NYC Pride festivities got underway, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had some timely news on Sunday: The artist Anthony Goicolea had been chosen to design the first official monument to lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people commissioned by the State of New York.

title: Senate Leaders Try to Appease Members as Support for Health Bill Slips
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republican leaders scrambled Sunday to rally support for their health care bill as opposition continued to build inside and outside Congress, and as several Republican senators questioned whether it would be approved this week.

title: White House Pushes Military Might Over Humanitarian Aid in Africa
description: MUA MISSION, Malawi  If ever there was an example of American and African military bonhomie, it was at a recent summit meeting here over glasses of South African Pinotage and expectations of Pentagon largess.

title: 50 Years After War, East Jerusalem Palestinians Confront a Life Divided
description: JERUSALEM  The smoky alternative music club in downtown West Jerusalem was packed at 12:45 a.m. when a Palestinian hip-hop duo from East Jerusalem took the stage, rapping about the occupation, the police and love, among other things, mostly in Arabic.

title: Corruption Crackdown Intensifies in Tunisia, and the People Cheer
description: TUNIS  The Tunisian prime minister has embarked on a sweeping crackdown against organized crime, arresting nearly a dozen mafia bosses and smuggling barons in recent weeks in an effort to stamp out what has become a nearly existential threat to the young democracy.

title: Transformers: The Last Knight Is a Box Office Clunker
description: Even star vehicles run out of gas eventually. Transformers: The Last Knight, the fifth installment of Michael Bays maximalist action series, landed with a thud at the North American box office this weekend, taking in just $45.3 million. However, its disappointing showing  easily the lowest of the franchise  was somewhat salvaged by robust business overseas.

title: A Battle Over Prayer in Schools Tests Canadas Multiculturalism
description: MISSISSAUGA, Ontario  The troubles began over sermons.

title: Where Trump Zigs, Tillerson Zags, Putting Him at Odds With White House
description: WASHINGTON  When Rex W. Tillerson, the former chief executive of Exxon Mobil, arrived in Washington five months ago to become the secretary of state, his boosters said he brought two valuable assets to a job that had usually gone to someone steeped in government and diplomacy: a long history managing a global company, and deep relationships from the Middle East to Russia that enabled him to close deals.

title: Hard Life Among the Dead in the Philippines
description: MANILA  Manila North Cemetery, opened in 1904, is one of the oldest and largest in the Philippines. Its elaborate mausoleums and endless rows of humble, stacked tombs are home to an estimated one million of the dead  and a few thousand of the living.

title: 7 Die in India After Falling Tree Sends Gondola Cars Plummeting
description: NEW DELHI  A tree lashed by strong wind crashed onto a gondola cable in northern India on Sunday, sending two cars plunging to the rugged terrain below, the police said. Seven passengers were thrown from the cars and died, and two others were injured.

title: Los Angeles Collective Honors Plays by Women of Color
description: Since 2014, the independent Los Angeles-based collective the Kilroys has sought to increase representation for female playwrights by publishing a list of new plays by women deemed worthy of production. This year, the groups list has a more specific focus: female and transgender writers of color.

title: Narendra Modi, Eid al-Fitr, China: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Thom Browne: Spring 2018
description: The labels mens 2018 collection.

title: Next Stop for Preet Bharara, Fired Prosecutor? His Brothers Media Firm
description: Since Preet Bharara, the former United States attorney in Manhattan, was abruptly fired in March by President Trump, speculation has swirled about what he would do next. Would he join a white-shoe law firm, as many former prosecutors do? Would he run for office?

title: How Putin Seduced Oliver Stone  and Trump
description: Watching four hours of Oliver Stone interviewing President Vladimir Putin of Russia is not a lesson in journalism. Mr. Stone is an inept interviewer, and he does not get Mr. Putin to say anything the world hasnt heard from him before. Watching the interviews for entertainment is a questionable proposition, too: The four-part series contains many dull exchanges and even more filler, like footage of the two men watching Dr. Strangelove together.

title: Trumps Deflections and Denials on Russia Frustrate Even His Allies
description: In the span of 72 hours, President Trump described the email hacking that roiled the 2016 campaign as a Democratic hoax and as clear aggression by Russia that his predecessor, President Barack Obama, failed to address.

title: Alexander McQueen: Spring 2018
description: The labels spring collection.

title: Financially Ailing CUNY Spent Over $1 Million a Year on Parades and Charities
description: When marchers streamed through Greenwich Village in the NYC Pride parade on Sunday, they did not see the usual rainbow-bedecked float with a banner of the City University of New York. But CUNY, which faces severe financial constraints and state and federal investigations into its spending practices, still paid $27,000 to be a parade sponsor  enough to cover a years tuition for four students.
