description: A spike in temperature across the Southwest has left many in Arizona gasping for breath.

title: Art Gallery Closures Grow for Small and Midsize Dealers
description: The Lower East Side gallery On Stellar Rays announced in April 2016 that it was expanding into 4,500 square feet, to allow for a more ambitious exhibition program as well as performances in its basement space.

title: Disputes Over Princes Estate Throw the Future of His Vault Into Question
description: Will fans ever get to hear the full depths of Princes storied recording vault?

title: At K-Pop Festival, Korean Stars Align With Their Superfans
description: NEWARK  That K-pop  the pop music scene that dominates South Korea and, increasingly, the rest of the world  has not yet had a chart-topping, cross-cultural Despacito moment in this country is vexing. The affinities are natural  the music is thick with references to American pop, hip-hop and R&B. And its both decadently visual and relentlessly energetic, in a way that needs no translation.

title: After Puerto Ricos Debt Crisis, Worries Shift to Virgin Islands
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V.I.  The United States Virgin Islands is best known for its powdery beaches and turquoise bays, a constant draw for the tourists who frequent this tiny American territory.

title: Review: In Onegin, Two Star Ballerinas on Contrasting Arcs
description: One definition of a balletomane is someone who cares more about dancers than about choreography, to or beyond the point of madness. John Crankos Onegin (1965)  something of a nightmare for connoisseurs of choreography  is balletomane heaven. Last week, American Ballet Theater played it with four casts at the Metropolitan Opera House. New Yorks balletomanes were duly clamorous.

title: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: The Mind of God
description: In the ever-raging battle between faith and science, the neurologist Jay Lombard is one of those rare emissaries who communicate in the language of both camps. In his new book, The Mind of God, he uses his experience studying the brain to ask some of the largest philosophical questions: Does God exist? Does life have meaning? Are we free? Lombard writes that he is interested in a large faith, rather than a specific religion  a faith invigorated and enlightened by science rather than being at odds with it. Below he discusses the debates over brain and mind, his editors unpromising reaction to an early manuscript, his appreciation for Jerry Garcia and more.

title: Alchemists Quest
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Twenty years ago, the Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry entered our collective consciousness when HARRY POTTER and THE PHILOSOPHERS STONE, the author J. K. ROWLINGs first novel, was published in Britain by Bloomsbury Publishing on June 26, 1997. American audiences might know the book as Harry Potter and the Sorcerers Stone, however, because the publishers originally worried that Americans might not be familiar with the term Philosophers Stone.

title: Mets Promote Tim Tebow to a Higher Class A League
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Before the Mets game against the San Francisco Giants on Sunday, General Manager Sandy Alderson convened reporters outside the visitors clubhouse at AT&T Park to make an announcement.

title: Indian Technology Workers Worry About a Job Threat: Technology
description: PUNE, India  Last month, Sudhakar Choudhari took the company bus as usual from his one-bedroom apartment to the suburban offices of Tech Mahindra, a major employer of workers in India that powers the global technology machine behind the scenes. Then a manager took him into a conference room and asked him to resign.

title: Is Washingtons Metro Improving? After $150 Million, Maybe
description: WASHINGTON  The installation of thousands of new electrical insulators has helped reduced track fires and smoke. Tens of thousands of new railroad ties are making for a smoother ride. Deep-cleaning crews have visited many of the grimiest concrete subterranean stations  in some cases, for the first time in years.

title: Kenzo: Spring 2018
description: The labels mens 2018 collection.

title: Israel Suspends Plan for Egalitarian Prayer Area at Western Wall
description: JERUSALEM  Yielding to pressure from his ultra-Orthodox coalition partners, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel on Sunday backtracked on a decision to create a space at the Western Wall in Jerusalem where men and women can pray together and non-Orthodox rituals can be practiced.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of June 26
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Jurors Find Video Isnt Providing 20/20 Vision in Police Shootings
description: The body-cam video suddenly turns shaky as an Ohio police officer fires his gun into a car, leaving an unarmed black motorist dead, shot in the head. In Wisconsin, slow-motion images show an armed man lobbing his gun over a fence, then falling backward, before a police officer fires a fatal shot into his chest. And in Minnesota, a police dashboard camera captures an officer abruptly firing seven shots at the driver of a car he has stopped, as the mans girlfriend and her young daughter watch from inside the car.

title: Ailments and the Rangers Home Runs Leave the Yankees Reeling
description: Before Sundays game at Yankee Stadium, a parade of pinstriped alumni took the field for Old-Timers Day. By the end of the game, Yankees Manager Joe Girardi might have thought about recruiting a few of the retirees to bolster his drained team, which lost to the Texas Rangers, 7-6, for its 10th defeat in 12 games.

title: E.U. Commission Approves Billions in Aid for 2 Italian Banks
description: The sometimes creaky machinery of the European Union moved swiftly on Sunday to keep the struggles of two small Italian banks from undercutting confidence in the countrys fragile banking system.

title: Third Point, a Hedge Fund, Sets Its Activist Sights on Nestl
description: LONDON  Over the past two decades, the hedge fund mogul Daniel S. Loeb has established himself as one of the biggest activist investors around. Now, he has set his sights on one of Europes largest corporate citizens: Nestl, the global food giant.

title: Elias Burstein, Pioneer in Semiconductors, Dies at 99
description: Elias Burstein, a pioneering physicist whose research helped pave the way for the development of silicon semiconductors, died on June 17 at his home in Bryn Mawr, Pa. He was 99.

title: Above It All, Riverside Church
description: Dear Diary:

title: Which Is the Real Confederate Flag?
description: How did the Confederacy come to be symbolized in the flag that roils American politics to this day?

title: Takata, Unable to Overcome Airbag Crisis, Files for Bankruptcy Protection
description: TOKYO  Takata, the Japanese auto parts maker crippled by vast airbag recalls, filed for bankruptcy protection in the United States and Japan and said it would sell its surviving operations to a Chinese-owned American rival, Key Safety Systems.

title: Team New Zealand, Rising Power, Closes In on the Americas Cup
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda  Four years later, with Emirates Team New Zealand back at match point against Oracle Team USA, this edition of the Americas Cup is certainly about the bikes. But it is also about gambling on youth and daring design.

title: In Advertising Paradise, Reality Is Just a Conversation Away
description: CANNES, France  The top hitters in media and advertising descended on the beaches of southern France last week, lounging on yachts and sipping wine and frozen ros slushies as the sun sparkled on the cerulean water of the French Riviera. They networked and cut deals at parties in chic hotels  the type where rooms cost $500 a night.

title: With Trump Set to Meet Narendra Modi, Many U.S. Indians Are Hopeful
description: JERSEY CITY  With Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India set to meet President Trump on Monday for the first time, many Indians in communities like this one have had high hopes for the relationship between the two leaders  both of whom swept to power as media-savvy political outsiders pledging to revive their national economies.

title: Quotation of the Day: From Deep Grief, a Solid Bond With Trump on Border Policy
description: It was almost an out-of-body experience after being so deeply hurt and nobody listening and nobody wanting to talk to you about this.

title: European Forum Looks at Productivity, and Britain Rules on Foxs Sky Bid
description: Heres a look at whats coming up this week.

title: Italian Runoff Elections Boost Center-Right Parties
description: ROME  Center-right parties scored victories Sunday evening in runoff elections in more than 100 Italian towns and cities, a result that emboldened right-wing parties, raised the prospect of shifting coalitions and took the political temperature of Italy ahead of national elections expected within the next year.

title: Political, Provocative and Always a Party: New York Citys Pride March
description: New York Citys annual Pride March was founded as a civil rights demonstration and a remembrance for those lost to illness and violence. This years march included a protest against gun violence. But the event is also known as the citys biggest early-summer party, and Sundays march was no exception. Thousands lined the streets of Manhattan waving rainbow flags, and costumes were ever colorful (albeit, sometimes barely there).

title: At the Pride Parade, the N.B.A. Embraces Hard-Won Victories
description: Rick Welts, the president of the Golden State Warriors, arrived at New Yorks Pride March on Sunday with his partner, Todd Gage, wearing a T-shirt that read, Proud Champions. While the shirt commemorated the Warriors recent romp through the N.B.A. playoffs, its graphics were not confined to the teams blue and gold but shaded in the colors of the rainbow.

title: At Cannes, the Great Gusher of Content Comes With Warning Signs
description: CANNES, France  I imagine that covering the annual Cannes Lions advertising festival here is a little bit like covering the great Texas oil boom a century ago  only with better food, cocktails and scenery.

title: Review: In Measure for Measure, Desperately Seeking Solutions in a Problem Play
description: Its hard to know what to do about Measure for Measure, the kind of play for which Shakespeares problem plays were named. It includes some of the finest moral argumentation in the canon: thrilling back-and-forths between well-matched antagonists with a great deal on the line.

title: Progress in a Sweep for the Mets, and in a Win for a Shaky Pitcher
description: SAN FRANCISCO  When Rafael Montero first reached the major leagues with the Mets in the spring of 2014, he was regarded as a better pitching prospect than Jacob deGrom.

title: No Corrections: June 26, 2017
description: No corrections appeared in print.

title: Is a Facial Worth the Fuss?
description: For the beauty do-it-yourselfer, we live in boom times. Between masks and eye strips and deep-cleaning products and YouTube videos on face massage, you can do a pretty good approximation of a spa facial in the confines of your home for a fraction of the price.

title: Cuomos Use of Troopers in New York City Frustrates Police Leaders
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has embarked on an unprecedented campaign to put the stamp of the State Police on New York City, rerouting troopers to city airports and toll plazas from upstate areas that rely on them and bewildering some of the officials charged with carrying out his orders.

title: No Frills, No Crowds, No Money: The Lonely Road to Tennis Glory
description: Less than a half-hour after a crushing defeat in front of two spectators, Aleksandra Wozniak paced the hallways of the municipal tennis center in Dothan, Ala., pleading on the phone with an airline representative.

description: A few years ago, as the Yogurt Wars were heating up and Greek invaders were storming the grocery aisles, executives at Yoplait, one of the nations largest yogurt companies, began arguing among themselves.

title: Capturing Inner Light in Photos of Yoga Masters
description: Francesco Mastalia set out to photograph 108 leading yoga practitioners for whom the practice is not an exercise regimen, but a spiritual journey.

title: A Utopia for a Dystopian Age
description: The term utopia was coined 500 years ago. By conjoining the Greek adverb ou (not) and the noun topos (place) the English humanist and politician Thomas More conceived of a place that is not  literally a nowhere or noplace. Mores learned readers would also have recognized another pun. The pronunciation of utopia can just as well be associated with eu-topia, which in Greek means happy place. Happiness, More might have suggested, is something we can only imagine. And yet imagining it, as philosophers, artists and politicians have done ever since, is far from pointless.

title: Progress on Gay Rights in Serbia, With a Catch
description: Serbia hardly has a progressive track record on gay rights. So when President Aleksandar Vucic announced this month that he was nominating Ana Brnabic, a 41-year-old, openly lesbian, woman as prime minister, he stunned Serbians and outside observers alike.

title: Where the Senate Health Care Bill Fails
description: Speaking at a rally for his wifes presidential campaign last year, Bill Clinton called Obamacare the craziest thing in the world. As he put it, The people who are out there busting it, sometimes 60 hours a week, wind up with their premiums doubled and their coverage cut in half.

title: College Students Want to Talk About Sex. They Just Dont Know How.
description: Fear of sexual assault on college campuses is twofold: Many students are afraid of being victims of assault, while others are terrified of being accused of it.

title: The Iran Puzzle
description: One of the Obama administrations biggest diplomatic ambitions was to establish better relations with Iran, a nation with which the United States has been at odds since the fall of the shah and the rise of a powerful theocratic government in Tehran in 1979. The most important manifestation of that effort was a deal negotiated by the administration and its allies under which Iran agreed to curb its nuclear program in exchange for the lifting of economic sanctions.

title: Socialisms Future May Be Its Past
description: One hundred years after Lenins sealed train arrived at Finland Station and set into motion the events that led to Stalins gulags, the idea that we should return to this history for inspiration might sound absurd. But there was good reason that the Bolsheviks once called themselves social democrats. They were part of a broad movement of growing parties that aimed to fight for greater political democracy and, using the wealth and the new working class created by capitalism, extend democratic rights into the social and economic spheres, which no capitalist would permit.

title: School Districts Fight Segregation on Their Own
description: The Trump administration made a terrible decision this spring when it killed a modest grant program that was intended to promote integration in this countrys profoundly segregated public schools.

title: Historians Shouldnt Be Pundits
description: Donald Trump might be disastrous for most Americans and a danger to the world, but he has been a boon to historians. The more grotesque his presidency appears, the more historians are called on to make sense of it, often in 30-second blasts on cable news or in quick-take quotes in a news article.

title: Capturing Inner Light in Photos of Yoga Masters
description: When did yoga get so big? For the third International Yoga Day  yes, the United Nations has given it a day, June 21  India, where the ancient discipline originated, organized classes all over the country, and public yoga events were held across the globe, from South Africa to South Philadelphia.

title: Liu Xiaobo, Chinese Nobel Laureate, Leaves Prison for Cancer Care

title: Your Credit Score May Soon Look Better
description: About 12 million people will get a lift in their credit scores next month as the national credit reporting agencies wipe from their records two major sources of negative information about borrowers: tax liens and civil judgments.

title: Schumer Avoids the Limelight on Russia, Leaving Trump in the Dark
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Chuck Schumer is not known for easily yielding credit for popular and successful ideas. Yet he was more than willing to excise his name from a recent piece of legislation if it meant bipartisan Senate approval of new sanctions on Russia  and a squeeze on President Trump.

description: HOUSTON  Of all the industries thrown into question by President Trumps promise to upend free trade with Mexico, natural gas is easily one of the most important.

title: Golden Summer: Montauk in 1972
description: Jonas Mekas captured the time he spent teaching Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis children photography and filmmaking in Montauk at the Warhol estate.

title: A 70s Summer With Warhol and the Kennedys
description: In 1972, the legendary filmmaker, poet and artist Jonas Mekas captured a golden summer in Montauk at the Warhol estate, which Lee Radziwill rented for the season. He was employed by Radziwills sister, Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis, to teach her children, John F. Kennedy Jr. and Caroline Kennedy, photography and filmmaking. What resulted are dozens of images of languid summer days in the Hamptons, which are now on view in a photographic exhibition.

title: Why a Babys Connection With a Parent Matters
description: In pediatrics, attachment is the emotional connection that develops between a young child and a parent or other caregiver.

title: When Anxiety or Depression Masks a Medical Problem
description: Its perfectly normal for someone to feel anxious or depressed after receiving a diagnosis of a serious illness. But what if the reverse occurs and symptoms of anxiety or depression masquerade as an as-yet undiagnosed physical disorder?

title: Morning Agenda: Third Point Sets Sights on Nestl

title: The ABCs and Ds of Whether to Get Prostate Cancer Screening
description: It can be hard for physicians to follow current thinking of experts on medical care. It must be exponentially harder for the public to make sense of it. Recently, the United States Preventive Services Task Force changed its recommendation on prostate cancer screening from a D (that is, dont do it) to a C (discuss it with your doctor).

title: Twin Peaks Season 3, Episode 8: White Light White Heat
description: Theres nothing to point to in the history of television that helps describe exactly what this episode attempts. Not even the jarring nightmare sequences from the original series were anything like this hour, which jumps around in time and space in ways that at times seem almost like free association.

description: The health care bill unveiled Thursday by Senate Republicans has been out in the open for less than a week, and there are many obstacles to clear before it can become law: an uncertain Senate vote, a return to the House for final approval, a presidential signature.

title: Theresa May Reaches Deal for Backing of Northern Ireland Party
description: LONDON  Britains Conservatives signed a deal on Monday with Northern Irelands Democratic Unionist Party that will allow Prime Minister Theresa May to govern after losing her majority in a general election this month.

title: South Korea Voices Support for U.S. Antimissile System
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Koreas foreign minister indicated strongly on Monday that her government would honor an agreement to deploy an American missile-defense system despite protests and economic retaliation from China.

description: Three years ago, Seattle became one of the first jurisdictions in the nation to embrace a $15-an-hour minimum wage, to be phased in over several years.

But last week, the tables were turned, and men suddenly found themselves in what they deemed a discriminatory situation.

title: A Matter of Considerable Gravity
description: Q. I read somewhere that the gravitational force exerted by Jupiter is so great that it makes the sun move in its direction. Is this true?

title: Justices to Hear Case on Religious Objections to Same-Sex Marriage
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court agreed on Monday to hear an appeal from a Colorado baker with religious objections to same-sex marriage who had lost a discrimination case for refusing to create a cake to celebrate such a union.

title: Supreme Court Takes Up Travel Ban Case, and Allows Parts to Go Ahead
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court cleared the way on Monday for President Trump to prohibit the entry of some people into the United States from countries he deems dangerous, but the justices imposed strict limits on Mr. Trumps travel ban while they examine the scope of presidential power over the border.

title: Philando Castile Family Reaches $3 Million Settlement
description: The mother of Philando Castile, the black motorist killed last summer by a police officer from St. Anthony, Minn., reached a nearly $3 million settlement on Monday with that city.

title: Gay Couples Entitled to Equal Treatment on Birth Certificates, Justices Rule
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday reaffirmed its 2015 decision recognizing a constitutional right to same-sex marriage, ruling that states may not treat married same-sex couples differently from others in issuing birth certificates.

title: Carbon in Atmosphere Is Rising, Even as Emissions Stabilize
description: CAPE GRIM, Tasmania  On the best days, the wind howling across this rugged promontory has not touched land for thousands of miles, and the arriving air seems as if it should be the cleanest in the world.

title: 8 Reasons the Big3 Might Succeed, and 6 Reasons It Might Fail
description: When a new league starts up, its natural for the first question to be: How long will it last? Retired N.B.A. greats in their late 30s and 40s squared off in Brooklyn on Sunday in three-on-three basketball in the first of 10 events in the new Big3. There were good signs, and ominous ones.

title: Pakistans Leader Orders Inquiry as Fuel Tanker Death Toll Reaches 157
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The death toll from a fireball that consumed an overturned fuel truck in eastern Pakistan has reached 157, and Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif ordered a high-level inquiry on Monday into what caused such a devastating loss of life.

title: States Must Aid Some Church Programs, Justices Rule
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court ruled on Monday that states must sometimes provide aid to religious groups even when their state constitutions call for a strict separation of church and state. The decision concerned a state program to make playgrounds safer that excluded those affiliated with churches, and it had implications for all kinds of government aid to religious institutions.

title: Your New Favorite Bread
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

description: HAMILTON, Bermuda  Many a well-financed maritime expedition has come to grief through the centuries in the treacherous and deep blue water off Bermuda.

title: Grab Your Picnic Baskets: The Partys Moving Outside
description: A picnic may sound like an old-fashioned pursuit, best suited for the romantically tangled characters of a 19th-century novel. But on a recent Sunday in a park in Red Hook, Brooklyn, a dozen families unpacked platters of food for the kind of generous, unfussy picnics you may actually want to join.

title: A Proposed Bankruptcy for Banks That Will Lead to Bailouts
description: At a time when news about Russia, health care, terrorist attacks and horrific fires dominates the headlines, it can be easy to forget that Congress continues to try to undo the regulatory reforms enacted in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis.

title: Questions and Answers About the Travel Ban Case
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court  upheld some portions of President Trumps revised travel ban on Monday, setting the stage for arguments on the case in October.

title: The Solution for Skin Ailments Could Be Right Under Your Nose
description: Your skin is a tapestry of ecosystems roughly the size of three bath towels. Complex societies of bacteria, viruses and fungi live in these diverse habitats  from the oil fields of the face and back, to the damp caverns of the nose, to the parched and hairless palms.

title: 7 Tips for a Better Picnic
description: Marnie Hanel, Andrea Slonecker and Jen Stevenson are the authors of The Picnic: Recipes and Inspiration From Basket to Blanket, and members of the Portland Picnic Society in Oregon, which meets about once a month to dine together outdoors. Here are a few of their tips for a less hectic, more delicious outing:

title: Trump, on Twitter, Targets Obama and Russia
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump sought to deflect questions about Russian meddling in the 2016 election onto Barack Obama on Monday while his spokesman again refused to say whether Mr. Trump accepted intelligence findings that Moscow had worked secretly to get him elected president.

title: Creative Music Studio Changes Hands at a Critical Moment for Jazz
description: BIG INDIAN, N.Y.  Across four days at the Creative Music Studios workshop here this month, roughly two dozen musicians of widely varied ages and skill levels spent hours sitting in a circle in the large barn at the Full Moon Resort.

title: Corporate Governance Looms as an Issue for Nestl
description: Nestls biggest issue is its governance.

title: He Wanted to Give Massages, but the Movies Called Him Back
description: PARIS  Until recently, Arnaud Valois was a masseur with a small studio here. Years before, he had been an actor, with minor success, but he had given up in favor of Thai massage and the yogalike relaxation technique called sophrology.

title: The Wacky Hats of Ascot
description: Wearing a hat is a tradition kept by many, and the wackier, the better. Here are some of our favorite looks from this years Royal Ascot race meeting.

title: The Wacky Hats of Ascot
description: Since 1711, the five-day Royal Ascot race meeting has taken place at the Berkshire course, a sprawling horse track west of London. Wearing a hat is a tradition kept by many, and the wackier, the better. Here are some of our favorite looks from this years event.

title: Mishandle a Fraud Search, and All That Fine Evidence Could Be for Nothing
description: A search conducted at a home or business can feel like a terrible violation of privacy. When a score of agents tramp through the premises taking just about everything that isnt nailed down, the question is whether that comports with the Fourth Amendments protection against unreasonable searches and seizures.

title: Australia Through American Eyes
description: WHEN Bobby Salee looked for work in the Australian town of Cairns, his job prospects would end as quickly as potential employers would ask: Have you ever been to prison?

title: Senate Health Bill in Peril as C.B.O. Predicts 22 Million More Uninsured
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate bill to repeal the Affordable Care Act was edging toward collapse on Monday after the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office said it would increase the number of people without health insurance by 22 million by 2026.

title: Democrats Turnout in Georgia Blew Past Typical Off-Year Levels
description: The special election in Georgias Sixth Congressional District was the most expensive House race in history. In the end, it produced probably the strongest Democratic turnout in an off-year election in at least a decade, according to newly released voter turnout records.

title: Upscale Food and Gear Bring Campsite Cooking Out of the Wild
description: Barbara Hodgin, who was once president of the Pacific Crest Trail Association, is old enough to remember a time when, if you asked a backpacker what was for dinner, the standard answer was either brown in a cup or green in a cup. A clever hack for trail pad thai was an envelope of unsweetened lime Kool-Aid.

title: White Police Officer in St. Louis Shoots Off-Duty Black Colleague
description: A white police officer shot and wounded an off-duty black officer who had been trying to help with an arrest in St. Louis last week, a friendly fire shooting that again drew national attention to the role race plays in decisions by law enforcement officials to open fire.

title: Exhumation of Salvador Dals Body Ordered in Paternity Case
description: MADRID  A Spanish court ordered the exhumation of the corpse of Salvador Dal in order to settle a womans claim to be recognized as the daughter of the Surrealist painter.

title: Hate the Individual Health Mandate? The G.O.P. Tries a Lockout
description: Senate Republicans made only one big change in a new version of their Senate health bill released Monday: They added a penalty for Americans who let their insurance lapse for 63 days or more.

title: A Surprise Collection, From Stefano Pilati, Revealed on Instagram
description: PARIS  The designer Stefano Pilati, revered in certain fashion circles both for his designs (for Yves Saint Laurent and Ermenegildo Zegna Couture) and for the raffish elegance of his own personal style, is currently professionally unattached and living, somewhat east of any fashion world surveillance, in Germany. Yet there he was one afternoon, in Florence, Italy, during the Pitti Uomo mens wear fair, taking in the J. W. Anderson fashion show as guests goggled over his cloven-hoofed Margiela boots; there he was again a week later, watching Kim Joness Louis Vuitton show; and yet again, this time as an unannounced model for the upstart line GmbH, which, like Mr. Pilati, is based in Berlin.

title: Staten Island Yankees Battle Dropping Attendance
description: Vincent Winter sat a few rows behind first base with his mother and his aunt. Wearing a Fire Department of New York hat and a matching yellow T-shirt, the 7-year-old Vincent giddily awaited the moment when he could go on the field.

title: Street Style: Paris Mens Fashion Week
description: The last stop in Europe for the mens spring 2018 fashion season brings a final flash of stylish men to Paris.

title: Street Style: Paris Mens Fashion Week
description: The mens shows have come to a close in Paris, but the street style lives on in photos. Next stop: New York.

title: Teaching and Learning About Harry Potter With The New York Times
description: Are you still waiting for your letter from Hogwarts?

title: The Lab Says Its Cancer. But Sometimes the Lab Is Wrong.
description: It was the sort of bad news every patient fears. Merlin Erickson, a 69-year-old retired engineer in Abingdon, Md., was told last year that a biopsy of his prostate was positive for cancer.

title: As if He Isnt Busy Enough: Met Museum Head to Write Book
description: Daniel H. Weiss, who this month became the top official at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, has sold a book about Americas experience in the Vietnam era to PublicAffairs, Mr. Weiss confirmed on Monday.

title: Narendra Modi, Travel Ban, Liu Xiaobo: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Samuel V. Wilson, Ex-Director of Defense Intelligence Agency, Dies at 93
description: Samuel V. Wilson, a former Army lieutenant general and director of the Defense Intelligence Agency who developed counterinsurgency practices that became widely used during the Vietnam War as part of an American effort to win the hearts and minds of the Vietnamese, died June 10 at his home in Rice, Va. He was 93.

title: President Erdogan of Turkey Recovers From Minor Health Scare
description: ISTANBUL  President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey appeared to faint on Sunday because of what he said were complications with his blood-sugar level and blood pressure.

title: Where to Stream the Best Movies of the 21st Century (So Far)
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation newsletter and website.

title: Chefs Join the Swing Dancers at Damrosch Park
description: Dancing, dining and drinking are the summer outdoor attractions at Lincoln Center. This year, some well-known chefs will add their specialties to the food stands that have been on hand for many seasons. picerie Boulud will be up first on Tuesday and Wednesday with madeleines and canels. Michael White of Altamarea Group is next with bacon palmiers. Motorinos meatballs, financiers from Maison Kayser, David Burkes cheesecake lollipops, Franois Payards macarons and David Changs Fuku chicken sandwiches will join the rotating menu served from 5 to 10 p.m. through Aug. 13 during Midsummer Night Swing and Out of Doors events: Damrosch Park, Lincoln Center.

title: Dainty Invader: the Deptford Pink
description: It is hard to call a flower as dainty and attractive as the Deptford pink invasive. It seems incapable of threatening anything, but it is a plant originally native to Europe now growing with ease throughout most of North America, and it fits the definition. The plant has roots that lead back to the English town of Deptford.

title: The Detective Was a Performance Artist. The Evidence Is Now a Show.
description: Aware of the artist Alison S. M. Kobayashis interest in lost, discarded and donated objects, as she put it, friends of friends of hers passed along a wire recorder  a clunky predecessor to the tape recorder  that came with two reels worth of chitchat. Nobody had any idea of where or when these recordings had been made, or by whom. Slowly she started identifying distinct speakers and figured out they were related.

title: For the Griller Who Really Does Have Everything
description: A perfect burger is a work of culinary art. And to honor it, the German cutlery company Wsthof has introduced a knife engineered to enhance the burger experience. Before you dismiss it as an expensive toy less useful than an asparagus peeler or avocado slicer, consider how well the generous rounded tip of the stainless-steel blade scoops and spreads condiments, how the fine serrations near the comfortable handle can cut through the bun without tearing, and how well the sharper edge slices neatly through the juicy meat: Wsthof Gourmet Burger Knives, $99.95 for four, Williams-Sonoma stores, 877-812-6235, williams-sonoma.com.

title: Jury Selection in Martin Shkreli Trial Begins With Name Calling
description: More than 120 potential jurors in the fraud trial of Martin Shkreli were dismissed Monday, with some calling him a snake, the most hated man in America and the face of corporate greed.

title: Edwidge Danticat Wrestles With Death, in Life and in Art
description: Death and grief haunt Edwidge Danticats fiction and nonfiction  ghosts from her own familys losses, and the sufferings of Haiti (where she was born and spent the first 12 years of her life) over the decades from poverty, murderous paramilitary thugs and a devastating 2010 earthquake that left an estimated 220,000 to 316,000 dead.

title: Crossing the Line Festival Includes a Dancers Mini-Residency
description: A dozen premieres, including four new commissioned works, are on tap for this years Crossing the Line Festival, the French Institute Alliance Franaises annual event for innovative art from a variety of disciplines.

title: Review: LoftOpera Stages a Rarity, With Lingerie
description: The pocket opera companies that have sprung up around New York in recent years fulfill a great service in exploring unusual material. But that is not to say that they are necessarily expanding the active repertory.

title: Paris Mens Fashion: Balenciaga, Comme des Garons and More
description: A photo diary of the mens spring/summer 2018 collections.

title: The Best of Paris Mens Fashion Week
description: How best to sum up the Paris spring/summer 2018 mens wear shows? Long days, short shorts and designers vying to up the ante and push fashion toward the monumental and long-lasting. The shows, which concluded Sunday, didnt just feature great collections  it was filled with shows that well certainly remember for a long time to come. With a schedule swelled by newcomers, Paris Fashion Week was  once again  in a league of its own.

title: BET Awards 2017: Red Carpet Looks
description: Yara Shahidi, Jada Pinkett Smith and Future were among those who attended the BET Awards on June 25.

title: Review: In BETs Tales, Rap Lyrics Get Lost in Translation
description: Years ago, Chuck D of the group Public Enemy called rap the black CNN. Now Tales, an anthology series beginning Tuesday on BET, asks if rap can also be HBO  a font of stories instead of headlines.

title: Sick and Afraid, Some Immigrants Forgo Medical Care
description: DURHAM, N.C.  Dr. Luke Smith drove slowly through the unlit streets of a neighborhood filled with immigrants, searching for an address among small houses with windows ribbed by iron bars. Pharmacy bags lay at his feet.

title: Iced Tea Is the Focus at This New Store
description: The citys latest branded tea store is to open on Wednesday, this one from Pure Leaf, a company that sells teas meant to be served with ice. Gabriel Dela Vega, the stores mixologist, will prepare an array of iced teas at a long bar in a soothing setting with lots of greenery. Golden chai, apple-flavored tea with a matcha float, green mojito tea with lime and mint, peach tea and rare Kenyan purple tea with berries are among the drinks sold in house or to take out ($5 to $8). Each will be finished with a splash of liquid tea essence pressed from fresh leaves to amplify the flavor: Pure Leaf Tea House, 79 Greene Street (Spring Street), pureleaf.com.

title: Firefighters Battle Blazes in California and Utah
description: Firefighters are battling strong winds and the potential for triple-digit temperatures as they try to contain separate wildfires in Utah and California. In Utah, more than a thousand firefighters are still struggling to contain a huge fire that started on June 17 near Brian Head, a ski town. In Santa Clarita, Calif., north of Los Angeles, those who had been evacuated are now being allowed to return to their homes, and an official said on Monday that the fire was almost under control.

title: 200 Years Ago, Erie Canal Got Its Start as Just a Ditch
description: On July 4, 1817, Judge John Richardson, who was also a local contractor, officially broke ground with a ceremonial spade, then unleashed the team of oxen he had hitched to his plow in a nondescript field in upstate Rome, N.Y., to begin construction of what eight years later would become the Erie Canal.

title: Work Less. Youll Get So Much More Done.
description: Welcome to the Smarter Living newsletter. Editor Tim Herrera emails readers once a week with tips and advice on living a better, more fulfilling life. Sign up here to get it in your inbox every Monday morning.

title: Steak Sampler Ready for Summer Grilling
description: When it comes to steak on the grill, one way to answer the question Which steak is best? is a side-by-side comparison. A new boneless strip loin sampler from New York Prime Beef makes that easy. Dry-aged American Wagyu, Japanese Kobe and dry-aged prime New York strip are included in this two-and-a-half-pound package, enough to serve four to six people. My crowd voted for the American Wagyu. The fresh steaks are shipped overnight: Strip Sampler Collection, $250 including shipping, 800-783-2569, newyorkprimebeef.com.

title: Amtrak Picks Deltas Former Chief to Lead It Through Challenging Time
description: Amtrak, the national passenger railroad that has been struggling to maintain its tracks in New York City, said Monday that it had chosen an airline industry veteran to be its next chief executive.

title: Red Carpet: BET Awards 2017
description: Chance the Rapper, Solange, Migos, Bruno Mars and Beyonc were among the artists honored onstage at the 2017 BET Awards. But who won the red carpet?

title: Theater Jobs Skew White and Male, Study Finds
description: Women and minority actors and stage managers are getting fewer jobs and often wind up in lower-paying shows than white male theater artists, according to a new study by Actors Equity.

title: Review: Chasing The Rivals on a Summer Evening
description: Quickly, quickly, now, a servant in breeches and waistcoat urged, shooing the audience down a slope of lawn and onto a curving lamplit path to the duel. Who lives, who dies  well all find out!

title: Review: A Bawdy Bastard Jones, Dancing With a Peg Leg
description: Bastard Jones opens with our hero, Tom Jones, in a close encounter of the sexual kind with a randy maid. When they emerge from behind a sheet, happily sated, she helps him screw his peg back onto his stump.

title: Airlines Redesigning Uniforms Find Out How Complicated It Is
description: Long ago, airline uniforms reflected the glamour of flight. Now, they have to serve more utilitarian needs. Do they reflect the airlines image? Will they look good on most everyone? And, perhaps most important, are they comfortable?

title: Review: A Father Consumed by Grief in My Eyes Went Dark
description: On July 2, 2002, a passenger jet collided in midair with a cargo plane over Germany, killing 71 people. It was a mistake caused by technical issues and a slow response from the sole air traffic controller. Stricken by grief, Vitaly Kaloyev, a Russian architect who lost his family in the crash, sought revenge and ultimately got it.

title: Guantnamo Detainee May Get Military Trial Over Bombings in Indonesia
description: WASHINGTON  Military commission prosecutors at the Guantnamo Bay wartime prison have charged a high-profile detainee with two deadly terrorist bombings in Indonesia, setting in motion what could become the first new tribunals case of the Trump era.

title: Grayson Perry on Divided Britain and His New Art Exhibition
description: LONDON  The artist and media personality Grayson Perry has made himself a household name in Britain by sculpting flamboyant engraved pots, stitching bold tapestries that grapple with modern social issues, and dressing, for some public appearances, as his female alter ego, Claire.

title: By Criticizing Obama, Trump Contradicts His Own Comments on Russian Meddling
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has accused his predecessor of doing nothing in response to Russias interference in the 2016 election  a misleading statement that contradicts his previous comments.

title: New Gin Conjures the Flavors of the Forest
description: Terra Botanical Gin is the latest spirit to tempt your tonic and lime. Made by Cardinal Spirits, of Indiana, Terra Botanical is decidedly herbal, more reminiscent of pine woods with notes of mint and earth than the more typical juniper-forward London dry style. I wanted this gin to have complexity, be smooth and to be good for sipping plain, not just in a cocktail, said Lior Lev Sercarz, the spice blender who created the gins flavor profile. At 84 proof, this grape-based spirit shines through when combined with tonic or other mixers: Terra Botanical Gin, $33.99 at Mashbill Wine & Spirits, 24 Avenue C (Third Street), $34.99 online; 212-228-7510, mashandgrape.com.

title: Supreme Court, Senate, Narendra Modi: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The C.B.O. Did the Math. These Are the Key Takeaways From the Senate Health Care Bill.
description: A look at four big numbers in the C.B.O. report.

title: Waymo and Avis Reach Deal Over Self-Driving Cars Maintenance
description: Waymo, the self-driving-car unit spun off by Googles parent company, outfits its autonomous vehicles with sophisticated sensors and other digital technology. But its fleet has decidedly low-tech needs too.

title: Why Grown-Up Muggles Should Read Harry Potter
description: I started reading the Harry Potter series, which turns 20 today, in a dormitory in Hod HaSharon, Israel, alongside about two dozen other teenage muggles who had flown (by plane) from the United States. Id completely succumbed to Potter hysteria at a friends urging even before Id read the books, so the night before I left, I hadnt hesitated to make room for the first four of them, all in hardback, by tossing out an extra pair of pants. Who needed pants? I wanted a good story.

title: To Photograph a Galpagos Tortoise, Get Out of the Race
description: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. In this piece, the photographer Federico Rios Escobar explains how he drew a particularly large subject out of her proverbial shell at a recent (and spontaneous) shoot for a Travel section cover story on the Galpagos Islands.

title: Senator Puts Hold on Arms Sales to Persian Gulf Nations Over Qatar Feud
description: WASHINGTON  The Republican chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee said on Monday that he was putting a hold on any future American arms sales to a group of Persian Gulf nations in an apparent move to help resolve a bitter dispute between one of those countries, Qatar, and several of its Arab neighbors.

title: Mayors, Sidestepping Trump, Vow to Fill Void on Climate Change
description: MIAMI BEACH  Meeting in a city confronted daily with the issues of rising seas and climate change, the United States Conference of Mayors approved resolutions on Monday to urge the federal government to rejoin the Paris climate agreement and to redouble their own efforts to combat climate change and commit to renewable energy.

title: The Travel Ban at the Supreme Court
description: President Trump cares a lot about winning, or at least the appearance of it. So he was predictably quick to sound off in triumph after the Supreme Court announced on Monday morning that in October it would consider the legality of his revised travel ban and will allow the ban to take partial effect in the meantime. The justices decision, he said, was a clear victory for our national security.

title: Delivery for Edward Albee
description: Dear Diary:

title: Shareholders Demand More Drastic Shifts at Nestl
description: Nestl, the Swiss food giant that helps bring the world Stouffers frozen dinners, Kit Kat candy bars and even LOral hair coloring, is feeling pressure to change its corporate recipe.

title: Few Overseas Have Faith in Trumps Leadership, Survey Finds
description: WASHINGTON  Faith in American leadership has plunged in many nations around the world in the months since President Trump took office, according to a new survey, underscoring the challenges facing the new president as he prepares to make his second overseas trip next week.

title: E.P.A. Official Pressured Scientist on Congressional Testimony, Emails Show
description: WASHINGTON  The Environmental Protection Agencys chief of staff pressured the top scientist on the agencys scientific review board to alter her congressional testimony and play down the dismissal of expert advisers, his emails show.

title: Kushner Adds Prominent Lawyer Abbe Lowell to Defense Team
description: WASHINGTON  Jared Kushner, President Trumps son-in-law and adviser, has added to his legal team one of the nations most prominent trial lawyers, Abbe D. Lowell, his lawyers said on Monday.

title: Street Sign Honoring Jimmy Breslin Is Gone Too Soon, Family Says
description: From the start, there appeared to be something slightly off about the street sign unveiled by Mayor Bill de Blasio in late May in honor of Jimmy Breslin, the muckraking journalist and Queens-born columnist for The Daily News.

title: Pearl Automation, Founded by Apple Veterans, Shuts Down
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Pearl Automation, a Silicon Valley start-up founded by former Apple employees who tried to combine Apples dedication to quality with a more open corporate culture, has gone out of business.

title: A 20-Pound Lobster Impresses Airport Security, but Its No Record Breaker
description: On a conveyor belt of bags, purses and laptops at Boston Logan International Airport on Sunday, one meaty package was clamoring for an additional security screening. Next to the rest of the luggage that morning, it was a fish out of water and appeared overstuffed, perhaps too big to fit under an airplane seat.

title: With Crowding in U.S. Market, Activist Investors Look to Europe
description: Activist investors  money managers who seek to shake up a companys strategy in search of huge paydays  have been growing in size and power in the United States, bending the knees of even the biggest corporate titans.

title: Can Good Corporate Citizenship Be Measured?
description: If you spend time around corporate boardrooms these days, youll hear the abbreviation E.S.G. thrown around with such frequency it is almost a trope.

title: For Dodgers Cody Bellinger, the Skys Not Only the Limit, Its a Target
description: LOS ANGELES  Clay Bellinger played high school baseball in Oneonta, N.Y., in the shadow of Cooperstown. He hit .193 over four major league seasons, but collected more championship rings than many members of the hallowed institution near his hometown: the National Baseball Hall of Fame. Bellinger played for four teams, and each one reached the World Series.

title: Trump Meets Indias Leader, a Fellow Nationalist Battling China for His Favor
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump and Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India, two nationalist leaders with a shared passion for social media, met on Monday as India sought to vie with China for Mr. Trumps favor in the region.

title: DAngelo Russell, Happy for a Fresh Start, Is Ready to Lead the Nets His Way
description: DAngelo Russell did not behave like a 21-year-old who had been slighted when he took part in his introductory Nets news conference on Monday.

title: For Men Cleared in Jogger Case, Belated Pomp and Circumstance
description: The auditorium in the northwest Bronx was speckled with balloons. Balloons that said, Congrats Grad! and Youre so special! Balloons arranged on stage in columns of white, blue and yellow. Balloons in the shape of champagne bottles. And a parade of shiny floating letters that spelled out Graduate of 2017.

title: Yankees Jacoby Ellsbury, Back From Concussion, Swiftly Finds His Role
description: CHICAGO  Jacoby Ellsbury seemed to have a strong sense of opening day expectation as he spoke before the Yankees began a four-game series against the Chicago White Sox on Monday night.

title: President Michel Temer of Brazil Is Charged With Corruption
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  President Michel Temer was charged with corruption by Brazils prosecutor general late Monday. He was accused of taking a $152,000 bribe via an intermediary, an act that, according to the prosecutor general, Rodrigo Janot, helped to compromise the image of the Federal Republic of Brazil.

title: U.N. Brought Cholera to Haiti. Now It Is Fumbling Its Effort to Atone.
description: Even as the United Nations expresses growing alarm over a cholera outbreak in war-ravaged Yemen, the organization is increasingly worried about the fallout from a stubborn cholera scourge in Haiti that was caused by its own peacekeepers more than six years ago.

title: Hope Ryden, Wildlife Protector and Photographer, Dies at 87
description: Hope Ryden, whose lifelike photographs of North American beavers, coyotes, mustangs and other wildlife helped elevate them into poster animals for conservation campaigns, died on June 18 in Hyannis, Mass. She was 87.

title: Quotation of the Day: When the Lab Gets It Wrong
description: Obviously, I felt great for me but sad for that other gentleman.

title: 3 CNN Journalists Resign After Retracted Story on Trump Ally
description: Three prominent journalists at CNN resigned on Monday after the cable news network was forced to retract and apologize for a story on its website involving a close ally of President Trump.

title: Fight to the Bitter End
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  A short one today, and I hope to be back in full force for the Thursday puzzle.

title: BurgerFi Tests the Popularity of the Plant-Based Beyond Burger
description: BurgerFi is going flexitarian.

title: A Few Bright Spots for Republicans. The Rest Can Be Scored as Grim.
description: In dry, stark language, the Congressional Budget Office on Monday punctured many of the stated goals for the Republican health care bill.

title: Pharmacist Gets 9-Year Prison Term in Deadly Meningitis Outbreak
description: BOSTON  The tainted injection left Rachelle Shuff with pain that requires 15 medications to manage and, she said, perhaps only two years to live.

title: Andrew Cuomo to Call Special Session to Extend Mayoral Control of Schools
description: ALBANY  Acting to avert a leadership crisis in New York Citys schools amid a legislative stall in the Capitol, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo intends to call a special session of the State Legislature as early as Wednesday and introduce a bill that would extend mayoral control of the citys educational system for one year.

title: The Senates Secretly Bipartisan Health Bill
description: In 2010, when Democrats passed the Affordable Care Act, Republicans complained that they did so with no Republican support. Democrats responded by pointing out that the centerpiece of their plan  tax credits to buy private insurance  came from a Republican governor, Mitt Romney of Massachusetts.

title: Australia, Diverse and Graying. Also: Johnny Depp, and a Controversial Push to Decrypt
description: The Breakdown puts a selection of Australias daily news into context. Todays picks:

title: Fact Check: The Senate Health Care Plan
description: Does the health care bill in the Senate live up to Republicans' promises? We checked the facts.

title: Syria Will Pay a Heavy Price for Another Chemical Attack, White House Says
description: WASHINGTON  The White House said late Monday that President Bashar al-Assad of Syria appeared to be preparing another chemical weapons attack, and warned that he would pay a heavy price if one took place.

title: Corrections: June 27, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Shopping Without Instagram: Its Full of Surprises
description: Juoksentelisinkohan is a Finnish word that translates to I wonder if I should run around aimlessly. Retail is increasingly a space for brand experience more than actual commerce. But brand-as-destination requires established familiarity, a digital history. Foot traffic in successful stores is rarely aimless.

title: An Untamed Island Meets Its Match
description: As I stood on the splintered boat dock with John Anderson looking south across Mississippi Sound to Horn Island, his lions mane of hair blew straight back, as if we were already bumping across the water, underway for the island. But the Gulf of Mexico was especially choppy, and the boat I hired was heeding small-craft warnings. Horn lay eight miles offshore, a hyphen on the horizons hazy line. Still, it felt within our grasp. The fact that I cant always go makes me value the island even more, he said.

title: A Welcome Payday for Obscure Teams in the Champions League
description: As they wrapped up the final days of training and preparation at their camp in Slovenia, the players and coaches of Trepca 89 still had no idea how they would get to the biggest match of their lives.

title: The Weird, Mystic Pull of Southwest England
description: Go ahead, say their names: Avalon and Tintagel. Believe deeply enough, and they might emerge from the mouth as through an enchantment-induced vapor, as though borne on the breath of a dragon. (Especially after at least four people have corrected your pronunciation of Tintagel: Be gentle with that g, its tin-TAJ-l.) And, indeed, these two sites in the southwest of England are epic and romantic, the stuff of myth and mystery.

title: The Weird, Mystic Pull of Southwest England
description: The area is a place of pilgrimage for late-model would-be knights of the Round Table, as well as mystical seekers of many stripes.

title: Donald Trump, Theresa May, Angela Merkel: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Tycoons Claims Reverberate in China Despite Censorship and Thin Evidence
description: BEIJING  Officially, no one in China can watch when the exiled tycoon Guo Wengui appears on banned websites to cheerfully lob incendiary allegations of corruption and skulduggery at the top ranks of the Communist Party. Unofficially, though, many people here in Beijing are riveted.

title: Found Poem Favorite | the words will find you
description: We are honoring the top winners of our Eighth Annual Found Poem Student Contest by publishing their work from June 13 to July 3. Youll be able to read the whole collection here as we go.

title: Canadas Secret to Resisting the Wests Populist Wave
description: TORONTO  As right-wing populism has roiled elections and upended politics across the West, there is one country where populists have largely failed to break through: Canada.

title: After a Century, Syrian Refugees Return to Armenia
description: A century ago their ancestors sought shelter in Syria after escaping the genocide perpetrated by the Ottoman Turks. Now Syrian Armenians reverse the trek.

title: A Childrens Health Crisis Officials Overlook: Shootings
description: Two decades have passed since Congress enacted a budget amendment forbidding federal money to be used to advocate or promote gun control. This prohibition, a bow to the National Rifle Association, has had the effect of suppressing essential research by government agencies into how firearm violence affects public health. Its as if lawmakers fear that knowledge and the Second Amendment are somehow incompatible.

title: The G.O.P. Rejects Conservatism
description: ASPEN, COLO.  There is a structural flaw in modern capitalism. Tremendous income gains are going to those in the top 20 percent, but prospects are diminishing for those in the middle and working classes. This gigantic trend widens inequality, exacerbates social segmentation, fuels distrust and led to Donald Trump.

title: What Do We Have a Government For?
description: Gail Collins: Bret, lets talk about rules. President Trump, like virtually all Republicans, thinks we have too many. Getting rid of government regulations is one of the cornerstones of his administration  if you can imagine anything as shaky as this administration having cornerstones.

title: Tweeting, Not Leading, the Response to Russian Hacking
description: In a comprehensive report late last week, The Washington Post described how narrow-minded politics and dithering by the Obama administration and congressional Republicans allowed Moscow to go largely unpunished for an assault on the American electoral process.

title: A Vote of Conscience and Courage
description: Forget for a minute about partisan labels and listen to members of the United States Senate talk about why they work in politics.

title: Facebook, Free Expression and the Power of a Leak
description: The First Amendment protects our right to use social networks like Facebook and Twitter, the Supreme Court declared last week. That decision, which overturned a North Carolina law barring sex offenders from social networks, called social media the modern public square and one of the most important places for the exchange of views. The holding is a reminder of the enormous role such networks play in our speech, our access to information and, consequently, our democracy. But while the government cannot block people from social media, these private platforms can.

title: Stopping Pandemics Before They Start
description: Imagine that enemies possessed a class of weapons with which they attacked your people from time to time. Decades could go by with no attack, but eventually one would come. Imagine also that these weapons were growing more potent, and the attacks were becoming more frequent.

title: Chinas Premier, Li Keqiang, Praises Free Trade, in Contrast to Trump
description: DALIAN, China  Premier Li Keqiang of China reaffirmed on Tuesday his countrys desire to be seen as the worlds new leader in globalization and free trade, but he offered no specifics on how China might lower its own trade barriers, which are among the steepest of any large country.

title: After a Century, Syrian Refugees Return to Armenia
description: Armenia is a small and largely homogenous country of just three million people, so when thousands of refugees fleeing Syrias conflict began arriving a few years ago, their presence was impossible to ignore. According to Armenian officials, more than 22,000 Syrians have come to the former Soviet republic since the start of the conflict in 2011. By 2015, the United Nations refugee agency said Syrian refugees accounted for six of every 1,000 people in Armenia.

title: American Chic on the Runways of Paris
description: PARIS  Nothing says Parisian chic like a tractor jacket.

title: New Sentences: From Supercut, by Lorde
description: People have used the modern English language incessantly, all day and every day, for centuries, and yet we are still constantly assembling sentences that are completely new to the world. This is true even in pop music: It may fixate on a very short list of teenage feelings, well-worn images and obvious rhymes, but its forever wrapping them in fresh gestures, finding new facets of the same old emotions, until one generations love songs seem bizarre to the next.

title: Big Music in Small Rooms: Fado
description: Every Tuesday, people gather at the Adega Rio Douro in Porto to sing a form of traditional Portuguese music. The restaurant welcomes retired professional singers and amateurs, accompanied by classical and Portuguese guitar.

title: Why the Far Right Wants to Be the New Alternative Culture
description: An always-useful thought experiment is to imagine seeing all the media around you for the first time  consciously, like a teenager freshly awakened to the existence of politics or an artificial intelligence that has just blinked across some humanoid threshold. This is especially handy lately, in our strange moment of flux. A wide-eyed observer of todays political media wouldnt just see different voices and outlets with contrasting tendencies. It would see a disorienting game of rhetorical appropriation, in which it is constantly unclear who stands for which principles and why.

title: Dear Match Book: What Books Best Capture Science and Nature?
description: Dear Match Book,

title: Why You Dont Want to Have a Baby in a Car
description: I hoisted myself up out of the passenger seat of our Toyota Prius, pressed my forehead against the window glass and yowled. My husband, Bryan, and I were on the way to the hospital to have our second baby, inching along Beverly Boulevard in rush hour traffic in Los Angeles. As he was extolling the virtues of a taqueria we were passing, I was seized by the urge to push. I couldnt resist. I felt a big whoosh  then a strange absence of pain.

title: How to Plan an African Safari
description: An African safari is a trip that should be on every travelers bucket list, according to Melissa Biggs Bradley, the founder of the luxury travel company Indagare and a 15-time safari veteran. A safari taps into the primitive ways of humankind because youre living in the wild and tracking animals the way hunters and gatherers once did, she said. Its a transformative experience.

title: Choosing a Baseball Team for My Baby Daughter
description: In January, my wife gave birth to a fat baby girl, and once the initial panic subsided and I stopped gasping at the sight of any suffocation hazard, I started the earnest yet ultimately doomed process of picking a sports team for the two of us to root for. New fatherhood had triggered a variety of symptoms in me, but none quite as unexpected as a rising thirst for some tradition to share. Because Im an immigrant short on hallowed rituals, I decided that fandom would be our foundational bond, the thing we could talk about in the idle or tense times to come. This might sound a bit cavemannish, sure, but I was raised in a house with a jock sister who wore gym shorts year round and was better than me at everything. Our father had been an accomplished rock climber back in Korea, and after my sister took to it at a young age, they shared in the enthusiastic technical lingo of pitches, falls and gear that makes climbers such tedious company. Sports talk is the only father-daughter bonding technique I know.

title: How Donald Trump Misunderstood the F.B.I.
description: John Mindermann is part of an unusual fraternity. A former agent with the Federal Bureau of Investigation, now 80 and retired in his hometown, San Francisco, he is among the relative handful of law-enforcement officials who have investigated a sitting president of the United States. In June, when it was reported that the former F.B.I. director Robert Mueller would investigate whether President Trump had obstructed the federal inquiry into Russias meddling in the 2016 presidential election, I called Mindermann, who told me he was feeling a strong sense of dj vu.

title: A Cautious Supreme Court Sets a Modern Record for Consensus
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court was short-handed for most of the term that ended Monday, and it responded with caution, setting a modern record for consensus.

title: Four Timely Memoirs from the Halls of Medicine
description: HUNDREDS OF INTERLACED FINGERS A Kidney Doctors Search for the Perfect Match By Vanessa Grubbs 261 pp. Amistad, $25.99

title: Can a Tech Start-Up Successfully Educate Children in the Developing World?
description: Last fall, when I visited Kawangware, a densely populated slum outside Nairobi, Kenya, the morning was bright, and a breeze provided a welcome respite from the smell of the open sewers that run like septic capillaries through the back streets and alleys. Extreme poverty makes life difficult here, and H.I.V. and waterborne illness are rife. Most homes are one-room corrugated-metal shacks that lack electricity, running water or indoor plumbing. It was an unlikely place to open a for-profit private school. But there, along a pitted road, stood an outpost of Bridge International Academies, an ambitious experiment in bringing market-based education to communities like this around the world.

title: With 3 Words, Supreme Court Opens a World of Uncertainty for Refugees
description: LOS ANGELES  Fouad Dagoum fled Sudan after his village was ransacked by militia members who captured, detained and tortured him until his body was limp.

title: How Silicon Valley Pushed Coding Into American Classrooms
description: At a White House gathering of tech titans last week, Timothy D. Cook, the chief executive of Apple, delivered a blunt message to President Trump on how public schools could better serve the nations needs. To help solve a huge deficit in the skills that we need today, Mr. Cook said, the government should do its part to make sure students learn computer programming.

title: A Life of Toscanini, Maestro With Passion and Principles
description: TOSCANINI Musician of Conscience By Harvey Sachs Illustrated. 923 pp. Liveright Publishing. $39.95.

title: Panic Killed Those People: Portugal Buries Wildfire Victims
description: Mr. Hicks, a photographer for The New York Times, visited the scarred countryside in central Portugal to document the aftermath of the countrys worst wildfires in decades.

title: Stephen Colbert Is Not Asking the Russians to Help Him Become President
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: Republican Party, India, Russell Westbrook: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Google Fined Record $2.7 Billion in E.U. Antitrust Ruling
description: Google suffered a major blow on Tuesday after European antitrust officials fined the search giant a record $2.7 billion for unfairly favoring some of its own services over those of rivals.

title: The Daily: Trumps Travel Ban Goes to the Top
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Morning Agenda: Charter, Comcast and Sprint?
description: Breaking: The European Commission has hit Google with a record fine of $2.7 billion for unfairly favoring some of its search services over those of rivals.

title: New York Today: Celebrating the Strand
description: Updated 10:46 a.m.

title: Sarah Jessica Parker Reveals First Book Acquisition, and Her A.L.A. Book Club Pick
description: If you are curious about Sarah Jessica Parkers literary diet, you might look more closely at her onscreen surroundings for clues. The actress tends to hide the books shes reading on set: in the bag her character is holding or under a couch cushion in her fictional home. That quirk is now reflected in her new job: editorial director of her own imprint, SJP for Hogarth.

title: Liu Xiaobo Embodied Hope for Chinas Democracy. Now Hes Sick.
description: BEIJING  In the fall of 2008, dozens of activists secretly worked to produce a political manifesto. It was only 3,554 Chinese characters long, but it listed a series of demands on Chinas leaders to make the country a liberal democracy.

title: U.S. Has Seen Chemical Weapons Activity in Syria, Pentagon Says
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has drawn a new red line for President Bashar al-Assad of Syria, with American officials describing preparations at a Syrian air base for a chemical weapons assault as they sought Tuesday to bolster Mr. Trumps threat to deter an attack.

title: I Aint Got No Quarrel With Them Vietcong
description: On June 22, 1967, I picked up a copy of the Pacific Stars and Stripes  the official military newspaper  in Saigon to find, there on Page 1, a story about Muhammad Ali, whom a judge had just sentenced to up to five years in prison. He was, at the time, the greatest boxer in the world, even if hed been stripped of his world heavyweight title months before. His crime? Refusing the draft.

title: On the Travel Ban
description: The Supreme Court announced that it would consider the legality of President Trumps revised travel ban and will allow the ban to take partial effect in the meantime.

title: How a Joke Becomes a Meme: The Birth of Milkshake Duck
description: Ben Ward, an Australian cartoonist who tweets absurdist gags from the handle @pixelatedboat, posted the above joke on June 12, 2016.

title: U.K. Orders Inquiry Into Cladding After Grenfell Tower Fire
description: LONDON  Britains prime minister on Tuesday ordered an investigation into cladding and insulation on high-rise towers across the country, as the authorities struggled to contain the risk from construction materials that leave tall structures vulnerable to catastrophic fires.

title: California Today: Surf, Sun and Bacteria
description: Good morning.

title: Vote Delayed as G.O.P. Struggles to Marshal Support for Health Care Bill
description: WASHINGTON  Facing intransigent Republican opposition, the Senate majority leader, Mitch McConnell, on Tuesday delayed a vote on legislation to repeal the Affordable Care Act, dealing another setback to Republicans seven-year effort to dismantle the health law and setting up a long, heated summer of health care battles.

title: Copy Edit This! Quiz No. 7
description: The Timess standards editor, Philip B. Corbett, invites readers to correct grammatical errors in recent New York Times articles.

title: Patient Voices: Thyroid Disease
description: A tiny gland that can cause a host of problems. Four men and women speak about living with thyroid disease.

title: Justin Trudeaus Sock Diplomacy
description: The first time could have been chalked up to charming idiosyncrasy. The second seemed like an effort to bring some levity to a complicated situation. But the third and fourth (and fifth and so on) times that Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada wore themed socks on a public occasion, it seemed clear that something more calculated was going on.

title: When Cutting Access to Health Care, Theres a Price to Pay
description: Senators, the United States is a sick country.

title: My Mom Said I Had to Keep Going
description: Aneri Pattani,a freshly minted graduate of Northeastern University,is the winner of Nicholas Kristofsannual win-a-trip contest. She previously wrote abouta hospital with few resourcesand the seven most inspiring people she met in Liberia.

title: Turmoil Continues at Pandora Media as Its Chief Executive Resigns
description: A year ago, Pandora Media was full of ambition.

title: Your Travel Ban Isnt Safe Yet, Mr. Trump
description: Yesterday President Trump tweeted that he was grateful for the Supreme Courts unanimous opinion on his travel ban, which allowed some of it to stand pending the courts review this fall. But he shouldnt celebrate just yet: The decision is a loss, not a win, a distinction totally lost on our rapid-fire media.

title: Cyberattack Hits Ukraine Then Spreads Internationally
description: Computer systems from Ukraine to the United States were struck on Tuesday in an international cyberattack that was similar to a recent assault that crippled tens of thousands of machines worldwide.

title: Picnic Ideas From the Fortnum & Mason Cookbook
description: A fine English picnic, perhaps? Let the world-famous English grocer Fortnum & Mason, founded in 1707, be your guide. The company, now housed in a massive food hall on Piccadilly in London, has a new, official cookbook. The handsome tome includes recipes for quiches, Scotch eggs, salads, tea sandwiches, meat pies and sweet pastries, all suitable to enjoy alfresco. Tom Parker Bowles, the author, posits that a picnic is no place for food thats a fiddle to eat. And there are other recipes for lunches, dinners, teatime and supper, including suave creamed leeks and rich lobster Benedict. Color photos and charming illustrations from the companys archive of catalogs enliven its pages: The Cook Book: Fortnum & Mason, by Tom Parker Bowles (HarperCollins, $35).

title: China Is Among Worst Human Trafficking Offenders, State Dept. Says
description: WASHINGTON  China is among the worlds worst offenders for allowing modern slavery to thrive within its borders, according to a strongly worded State Department report released Tuesday.

title: Subway Derailment in Manhattan Injures Dozens
description: For months, the citys aging transportation infrastructure has served New Yorkers one fresh outrage after another.

title: Who Needs The Tonight Show? Jay Leno Still Cares About Tonights Show
description: When youre one of a few people in television history to have hosted your own late-night show for more than 20 years and then stepped away from it, what do you do now? If youre Jay Leno, you hit the road.

title: Angela Merkel Eases Resistance to Same-Sex Marriage in Germany
description: BERLIN  The emotional issue of same-sex marriage moved swiftly to the center of Germanys national election campaign on Tuesday after Chancellor Angela Merkel softened her resistance, saying for the first time that she would allow members of her party to vote as they saw fit on the issue.

title: FIFAs World Cup Garcia Report
description: The report on the bidding for the 2018 and 2022 World Cups, compiled by Michael J. Garcia, a former United States attorney who had served as FIFAs chief ethics investigator.

title: In Long-Secret FIFA Report, More Details but No Smoking Gun
description: Over the course of 430 pages, the secret report provides provocative glimpses of unmistakably questionable behavior by some of world soccers top officials, as well as others eager to meet their every demand. Huge amounts of money ending up in strange places. High-ranking executives behaving shadily, petulantly and, at times, perhaps illegally. Rules broken, slyly circumvented or simply bent beyond their intent.

title: Yankees Charity Neglects Stadiums Neighbors
description: In the summer of 2006, when the Yankees broke ground on a gleaming new stadium in the South Bronx, they offered an olive branch to a community furious that more than 25 acres of treasured public parkland had been seized for the project. The Yankees created a charity, called the New Yankee Stadium Community Benefits Fund, which it intended to distribute almost $40 million in cash grants and sports equipment, along with 600,000 baseball tickets, to community organizations in the borough over four decades.

title: Empelln
description: The chef Alex Stupaks latest restaurant provides the fullest expression of his dreamscape vision of Mexican food.

title: A Chefs Mexican Fantasia at Empelln in Midtown
description: To begin at the end, the desserts at the new Empelln in Midtown are some of the most exciting New York has seen in a long time.

title: Netherlands Partly Liable for 1995 Massacre of Bosnian Muslim Men, Court Rules
description: A Dutch court ruled on Tuesday that the government was partly liable for the deaths of about 350 Muslim men in 1995 in the Bosnian town of Srebrenica, the site of Europes worst mass murder since World War II.

title: Keeping Your iPhone Out of the Drop Zone
description: Q. I was adding a photo to a note on my iPhone while I was on the train and noticed I could see the names of other iPhone users listed on the screen. I assume these were people nearby. So, can they see me and isnt this a security risk?

title: With Obamacare, More Breast Cancers Diagnosed at Earlier Stages
description: More breast cancers have been found at earlier  and potentially more treatable  stages since the implementation of the Affordable Care Act.

title: Nestl, Under Pressure, Plans Buyback and Perhaps Acquisitions
description: LONDON  In revealing his investment position in Nestl on Sunday, the hedge fund manager Daniel S. Loeb urged the company to consider slimming down, as well as buying back its stock.

title: 6 Good Movies (and 1 TV Show) Expiring From Netflix July 1
description: Theres more to watch than ever before and more streaming services on which to watch it. Here at Watching, a film and TV recommendation website from The New York Times, we direct you toward whats new and whats good.

title: Global Ransomware Attack: What We Know and Dont Know
description: A quickly spreading ransomware attack is hitting countries across the world including France, Russia, Spain, Ukraine and the United States, just weeks after a ransomware attack known as WannaCry.

title: Health Bill Does Not Cut Medicaid Spending, Republicans Argue
description: WASHINGTON  Republicans, under fire for proposing health care legislation that would reduce Medicaid funding by hundreds of billions of dollars, have embraced an old argument that taking money from a program is not a cut.

title: How Nestl Expanded Beyond the Kitchen
description: The story of Nestl, the maker of Butterfinger candy bars and Purina pet food, starts with the coming together of bitter rivals in the late 1800s in Switzerland.

title: Daily Report: New Chapter in Europe vs. American Tech Behemoths
description: Europe has long been tough on American tech companies. From Facebook to Google to Amazon and Apple, few have escaped the glare. European regulators have dinged the behemoths on antitrust, privacy and tax issues.
